Ez5-ddb1XEHaFBQMv1jQIA.text: Amazing!! The place is a hidden gem. It was my first time and it definitely won't be my last. My favorite was the perfect combination. The portion are huge I couldn't even finish it because I was so perfectly full. Anyways Tasty Crepes gets 2 thumbs up. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect combination YUMMY!!!

LQg8-5xcIM-gc0aGofEKjQ.text: If I could give them more than 5 stars I would. My husband ordered The Pirate which has tuna and pickles, I wasn't so sure but I was glad I tried it! It had great flavor!! I ordered The Monterey, I also was not disappointed. We both inhaled our crepes and couldn't wait for dessert! This place is trendy in general, infused water, hand salt scrub in the bathroom for example.  Can't beat the price for such deliciousness.  Also; they have a camera over the kitchen for customers to watch the magic happening and I think that is pretty neat!!  The perfect combination- amazing! Not too sweet. Very fresh. The chocolate isn't overpowering and they give you a generous mound of whipped cream.   If we lived in LV, we would be regulars here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Worth every penny.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the perfect combination. Heaven!

hdL7E_AljmWTav8exR4UTw.text: Excellent customer service, great food and a fun atmosphere. The gentleman who gets you your seat is really friendly as is the rest of the staff. This is a favorite of my wife and I. If you enjoy crepes at all you owe it to yourself to make it down here!

u1JOe5u9_CR7UR_nS1-aKA.text: Bun and I were never able to make it here before closing.. but last week we were!  We stopped by around 1pm and it was a full house. There's a couple tables outside for outdoor dining available but since it was windy we decided to stick with sitting in the inside.   This place is a fast casual type of restaurant - no waiter service and you pay when you order and then servers bring you the food. Self-serve iced cucumber water and lemon water are available too.    Bun got the La Jolla (popular among Yelpers) and I got the Caprese. Total was about $14-$15, per crepe is at least $7.50. Both crepes were good but nothing outstanding or extraordinary. The La Jolla comes with the chipotle sauce while the Caprese comes with a Pesto. It's a light breakfast where it'll fill you up if it's the first thing you eat. Unfortunately though, I think all the ingredients for the crepe are all easy ingredients you could probably make it yourself at home - tomato, lettuce, mozzarella cheese. The presentation was pretty basic too - folding it in half then the corners in (I assume having corners faced on the plate would look better but that's just my opinion)  The soup that comes with the crepe, what I think it taste like - top ramen soup powder mixed with water. that's not to say it taste bad because it didn't, but that's just what I can compare its taste to. While sitting at the bar, Bun and I got to see crepes being made - I understand it's delicate and it was weird because there was one employee who tore every other crepe she was making haha  I know 3 stars seem really low but I guess with all 5 star ratings, I expected more. But don't get me wrong, I will be back.

jPck6cPTXSxAMAbQ3XvE2Q.text: Close friend/family member recommended that we hit it up...and omg...great food and even better service  ..................................

klThOms4G-O9ivYsCU2Plg.text: Best crepes ever!! Great customer service and love the mimosa sampler!!  I make sure to go back there every time I'm in Vegas.

VKE9iMSYFpeLt4WwMLwhxw.text: I'm not going to go into too much detail. As far as crepe places go, this is really good. Am I as enthusiastic as others seem to be...no. But, the service was attentive and friendly, and the sweet sausage in my crepe was excellent. As far as Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, I've visited many. This place being on the show is a bit of a head scratcher. Nothing really noteworthy. BUT, I seriously cannot see how anyone can go here and be upset.

_bW3nENJx8HX3LFwrXwffQ.text: We arrived this place around 2:30 pm for dessert after lunch. However, their staffs were mean. We felt we were rushed and treated not fairly.  I guess we will not come back!! Service is more important than food for me!!!

PtaOQfQqHoytx_mcjVgBWQ.text: I have been coming to this place for years, and the quality of great food has never ever changed. The what I am assuming is the manager, an older man with awesome tattoos- guides you to your tables, shows you how to order, asks you how you're doing. Totally sets the vibe up for a great experience, which it always is!  It sometimes is very very crowded, so you will most likely be sitting close to another party. Which I don't really mind, because the food is just so good.  They have all different types of crepes, savory, sweet, veggie. Which for me is so important because I am vegetarian and my options are very limited at times. But with this place I can literally order half of the menu if I wanted.   Definitely give them a try, they are such an awesome place for brunch! :)

kIBAsIeYTq6qd4jIYBpJPA.text: Deliciousness on a plate.  Marco Polo, La Jolla, Sonora, William Tell, Monkey, Tuxedo Cheesecake, Elvis are fantastic.  If u can get here on a weekday, do that.  Weekends will have u waiting, but worth the wait.  Ambiance is chill.  Relax with a mimosa... or three or four or five.

vACJhl_5SjvPVveB-VjwLw.text: Amazing place. My brother saw a news story yesterday and had to try it. Was very impressed. Food was awesome and pricing was great. Very friendly service and the owner even stopped by tables asking how everything was. Will definitely be back

XM2cNzHmWxwhDCQNrdtqAQ.text: These people are one of the nicest and most courteous of the food industry. I go there twice a month. They're open till 3. The owner lady is a wonderful person and the ambiance of the restaurant males your whole day. The waitress Lola is a sweetheart indeed. Their crepes are to die for. I usually get the Marco Polo. They have both breakfast items and sweet crepes along with mimosas and other good stuff. Quite a chic place to take your date or loved ones to.

G8So7Yk4evbIlWm_2UfCmA.text: Serving their crepe specialties with everything from savory beef to sweet caramel apples.  Crepe Expectations was aired in an episode on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives on the Food Network on 07/17/2015. The episode was: A Bowlful of Soul.   The staff here is great. Come by and enjoy the great food!

EMIufHTQqxrDu3ep_iNYbw.text: I am SO HAPPY I found a legit crepe spot in Vegas. Literally have been here every week because I'm forever craving it lol The Monkey with strawberries is the bestttt!

mtDaxSIY-oue2QGVjYLavw.text: Worst service ever. I can't even go into detail about how bad it is, because it's so upsetting. They wouldn't give me my money back, because I got tired of waiting over 45 mins.

6wtqk7d7MAElAj7Wl9bLeg.text: Today my husband and I plus our dog, Roxy went for the first time and it was so good. The food was amazing especially the Rozortio and the White Mocha. My husband doesn't drink coffee but he kept asking me for some sips of my white Mocha so that's saying something to me! Mike was our server and he was excellent! He was so friendly and welcoming especially with Roxy! Mike brought out a water bowl and treats for her which she loved! I get nervous bringing her places because I feel a lot of places really aren't welcoming but Crepe Expectations made me feel so comfortable! Will definitely be coming back!

NikphsTUO30bdkXmdTz_Hg.text: Great crepe place... kinda small but great food..They have a good selection of sweet and savory crepes would come back for sure..

KKXxZ5IentPtcixgE-Ft6A.text: I saw a clip of Guy Fieri visiting this place on Food Network and decided to give it a try.  We loved it, we ordered the Sonora Crepe it's a savory flavorful carne asada crepe with a spicy kick.  My son ordered the Monkey, can't go wrong with Nutella, and my daughter the Banana Foster which was delicious.  Highly recommend it!

-xo1cFdJ0wlJJjTp-8aC-Q.text: This place is amazing!!! I am celiac and it's really hard to find places that work well for everyone's palates but this place was a home run for all. Tons of gluten free options as well as regular. The chef/owner was extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Very friendly staff and awesome Mimosa's. We got 2 of the mimosa flights for the group, highly recommend the white peach, strawberry and mango flavors. Lots of options for customizing your crepe as well. You've got to check this place out. Will definitely be returning when back in town!

7AJ5WrB3Uq9DX4mXWuJxdQ.text: First and foremost I like the decor. The restaurant is beautiful and charming. The cashier is really nice and helpful on helping me pick a crepe. When the cook the crepe you can watch the cook on a TV screen. I thought that was cool. And my crepe only took 3 minutes to get to my table. I got the goat cheese and pear crepe and it was interesting with the cheese but I did like it after all. Over all this place was fabulous! If you like crepes then you must visit. Nothing bad to say about this place.

Ggcoi3TYYTS7L6cOSN0niQ.text: I love the Sonora for lunch followed up with a delicious sweet crepe to split for dessert!

OTX_8fzb1jdESCbRj-La8Q.text: #changed seating system  #owners please read  This review 6 months ago would have been 5 stars. The food is fantastic! I have been coming here with my girlfriends every weekend or every other since it opened and I have to write a review in hopes that the owners read this about how horrible their customer service has gone down. I only took away 2 STARS for the service/atmosphere.  The porters/servers are still wonderful and hustle to make sure everyone is happy and has hot food, but the standing in line to give your name and be crammed in a hallway to sit is horrible. The owner who runs the register is yelling out names and barking orders to the staff in every direction it's hard to enjoy the atmosphere. Let's no reinvent the wheel here let's get a host stand and a server to take the orders and call it a day. The Panera bread table number system clearly is not working any longer since the popularity boom, so I hope this review is taken as constructive, because I want to enjoy my Crepe place again!

LuwgyzL6AtvqrPArD58xOw.text: Just go.  It's busy but well worth the usual short wait- especially considering how friendly and personable the staff is.  Oh also; it's delicious and the prices are super reasonable.  Just go.

eTjS-4M2WR35bMmGHKkh1w.text: Not all crepes are created equal. This place does them right. The staff is happy & helpful, the food is ridiculously yummy, and the atmosphere is clean & classy. I waited to review until my second visit & it was even better than my first. The complimentary self serve cucumber water.. What a refreshing touch! The birds eye view camera allows you to see even further into their open kitchen. Great modern place to east any time of day. Check em out!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Note the birds eye view TV!!

rxEZQ8ZRUnxxKBEkBiGKpA.text: Really, really good, The Sonora it's really good the carne asada was tender, the william tell was good, the monkey was good, basically the sweet crepes are solid good and the meaty ones are excellent, owner and employees very cool and friendly, will definitely be back, keep an open tab, keeping coming...

1_HyAMFE5_EDWEjoqRvrAQ.text: The best crepe in Vegas.  I often come here to eat crepes on Sunday.  Everytime I go, It's always crowded and so popular.  If you want to try savory crepe, here is the right place to pick!

4iDftyerRSTcmX1ARZkfWg.text: Great little place in a little strip mall! Came here after lunch looking for something sweet... And wow did they deliver! My favorite is the Elvis; peanut butter, caramel, bacon topped with fresh whipped cream and powdered sugar. Would like to come back and try their savory items too. Definitely worth a try!

Utzin9gvH8mcOMpM2wqYNw.text: Great food. Whether you're in the mood for something exotic, sweet, or just an old fashioned breakfast crepe, Crepe Expectations exceeded my own. Reasonably priced, and with a great Java selection, prepare for a great dining experience. Expect a small wait for your food. If you are in a hurry this may not be the place for you, but well worth the wait!

zDTHDM7pBDAHZciPDxscmg.text: I love this place.  It is hard to find a good crepe in Las Vegas!  Lou's recipes are really creative, and there is something for everyone.  He runs weekly/monthly specials that are excellent.  Everything is made to order in a kitchen that is mostly visible from the dining room.  Arrive with about 20 minutes to spare, and watch your whole order get made in front of you.  Even if you get it to go, it stays really nice and hot for about 20 minutes to bring it home.  If you plan on going during the busy hours, you might prefer takeout to make sure you've got a spot to sit.  The staff does a great job of remembering their clientele, so make sure to introduce yourself by name.  They're only open for breakfast and lunch, so get out of the house early.

zH0Js3YasGcVM12J-RelKA.text: Well, well, well. Who knew how delicious thin pancakes could be? Wow! I had The Monterey, as did the wife, while the kids split The Monkey. The workers were amazingly and genuinely friendly. The only negative is I live in Phoenix so I won't visit often.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey plus my monkey! Delicious.

khzUtzd8e_dAAR2rizcc1A.text: Delightfully buttery crepes are had with a well selected combination of sweet or savory options. I have to give praise for a good menu which is often difficult for a crepe place. The usual sin is to offer so many choices it takes ten minutes to file through the selections, some times you even find burgers and sandwiches interlaced among the crepes. No burgers here thankfully, just about ten options for both sweet and savory crepes each ingredient combination well selected.   There is the elephant in the room, that is the room itself. While not wholly untasteful it will make most heterosexual males squirm. Man up though because this has the potential to be the best date spot for a budding relationship. Show her you can embrace feminity for a tasty crepe!

vG6ETro39_JVtDwqnC_trQ.text: I had heard such great things about Crepe Expectations and was disappointed with our experience.  We went for brunch on Sunday which might have been the first mistake. It was packed, and there is no place to stand during your wait except outside in the heat. It didn't take too long to get seated, but then we had to share one table with 2 other parties which wasn't ideal and kind of awkward.  After we had ordered, it took about 15 minutes for them to bring my husband's diet coke to the table. And you have to go get the water yourself with paper cups. On top of that, it is so full in the tiny location that you bump into a few people just to get to the water.  The worst part is how terribly hot the location is in the summer. People were fanning themselves waiting for food and we were sweating. The staff said that the grills are so hot and the door keeps opening and closing because of the patio that they cannot keep it cool even after having someone check the AC a few times. I guess there is nothing that can be done about it in this location, but it's kind of miserable.  Overall, the food was really good and reasonably priced. But we were so hot, we couldn't even sit there and enjoy it because we just wanted to get to the air conditioning. I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon. I can find good food somewhere where there is air conditioning and we have our own table.

qjeQ4Q6zYJ26Qdry27_KdQ.text: A fantastic breakfast/brunch with a great assortment of crepes and unlimited options to make the crepes your own. Limited seating inside, and some available outdoors too. Excellent coffee with an assortment and mimosas and wine.  We came

W3nOvwi9-fILWc-Lep7kiQ.text: Not a long wait at all.  This place is really busy, though. Great food. We had the Sonora and the Pirate.  Both were excellent.  The Sonora has heat, but not too much. The Pirate was not fishy. For our happy ending, we ordered the Avalon. Wonderful combination of flavors.  It is way off the strip, but so worth the trip. Give this place a try

sTSR_tPzAKzv4x52Api7hA.text: Items Selected:  The Elvis - Caramel, Banana, Peanut Butter, Bacon The Avalon - Buttered Pears, Goat Cheese, Candied Walnuts, Honey The Greek - Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Feta, Tzatziki Yogurt, Red Onion, Tomato  Already planning to be in the area early Saturday morning, finding a breakfast buddy would prove an easy task and trusting the Henderson local despite the truly lame "Yum" menu and "Have a crepe day" voicemail I walked into Crepe Expectations with an open mind; the result an hour of gregarious service, great conversation, and some truly Parisian quality crepes.  A bit of an odd space, dim lighting and dark wood beneath big screen televisions orders are placed at the counter and arriving just as the restaurant opened our order of three thin pancakes was expedited on the open kitchen's three stones with each arriving soft on the interior with the slightest browning adding textbook chew enveloping bold, balanced ingredients.  With prices a bit higher than the majority of creperies Stateside or abroad but service and ingredient quality equally elevated it was with a sweet, a savory, and a special that our morning passed and although my tastes veered toward the complexity of the Avalon it would be hard to argue against the Elvis or the Greek, the former pure decadence with added whipped cream and the later finding balance for the slightly oversalted chicken in the punchy yogurt.

uwJMb-FTmyHKdWQYop03Xw.text: Yum of course. Amazing crepes especially the ingredients.  Whether it was chorizo, steak, bacon, lettuce, chipotle, mayo. As well as the specials including the Elvis. Delicious. We walked in and noticed the decor was friendly. Nice environment although in a busy street mall. Great value. Loved the community center table and refreshing water both lemon and cucumber. Definitely a must to visit. We'll be there before we fly out.

KWGMZsKeuGUdof4ixB7fkw.text: Great crepes. Love the mimosas! Great place to go if you want something a little different for breakfast!  The owner is very personable and remembers us every time we come in!    I wish this place a was a tad bigger though but usually, even though it is busy , we manage not to have to wait long.  Fresh cucumber water is refreshing!

rbOU-XCwx-J31qBA1NlKTQ.text: This was my first time here. We walked in and it was packed! A worker promptly greeted us and told us to head to the back and wait for a table. He told us it would be a 10-15 minute wait. It was an accurate timeframe. We sat down and waited for about 5 minutes. Then a couple next to us who had never been there before either let us know we had to go to the counter to order. That and the fact that it was uncomfortably cozy are the reason for the 4 stars. We could here the whole conversation of the table next to us which wasn't pleasant. But, all of the food was fantastic!! I ordered the Sonora and it was yummy! My dad ordered the la jolla and enjoyed it as well. And we shared the Frisco and added strawberries for something sweet!! It was all delicious! The crepes are thin and eggy as they should be! We will be back! Hopefully when it's nice weather to sit outside.

7aUxV_ZFH5yEAie_hOHkqg.text: The crepes were freshly prepared perfectly. I highly recommend getting there early on the weekends or plan to wait a few minutes for a table. Indoor and outdoor seating available. Located in a strip mall so parking is easy.   PROS: The variety of savory and sweet crepes.              The service - the owner is available and working there               The Berry Delight crepe  CONS: Gets super busy on the weekends so prepare to wait if you arrive at prime time.

XEr_KXdmuDQRNyGoK7sQXQ.text: Charming little place with character and fun ambiance. Can sit outside which can be nice since they are only open till 3 pm. Staff was friendly. You can watch the crepes being made. I had strawberry, blue and raspberry crepe. Fresh berry lemonade. Very reasonable prices. Look forward to coming again.

f6O3ZhxXgtlyNopMd7HEsw.text: Worth the 5-10 minute drive from the Strip.  Owner/chef learned his craft in Paris.  Great selection of tasty crepes.  Small place so go at off hours if you don't want to wait.  Very fairly priced!

McWuyy8WlH65cVKjU8UD7g.text: Excellent from the minute we walked in. We explained at the counter that it was our first time and the owner (Lou) took the time to explain everything to us in a very friendly, take your time sorta way.  We were going to order 4 crepes, but Lou warned us that it would probably be too much food. We ended up ordering 3 different crepes, and Lou was right, we still ended up taking 1 for the road because we could only each 1 each.  The crepes were all delicious and well worth the price. We found the entire staff to be very friendly and accommodating. We choose to sit at the counter right next to the cooking station and it was interesting to watch them being made. They had a constant flow of customers, but never a wait. The place is run like a finely tuned machine. We travel to Vegas often and will definitely make this a regular stop on our trip.

G4bdUpSjbJRO6mavAM26kQ.text: Excellent crepes for breakfast, lunch, or whatever. The owners actually run the place and take great pride to make their guests feel welcome. There is an excellent variety of crepes. We were there for breakfast. I had the scrambled egg, ham, and swiss cheese crepe; my wife had a simple crepe with lemon sugar. Both were very satisfying. The crepe was made perfectly and my egg/ham/cheese was amply filled. I would definitely go back.

OgV0CEYq58jhj2aABsBu_w.text: This was awesome.  I had the William Tell sans powdered sugar and the homemade hot chocolate.  My wife had the Monterrey (subbed ham instead of bacon).  And you can't go wrong with the Mimosa Sampler, especially since there are 13 flavors to choose from.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Far right:  Rosarito, far left: Sunday Morning, middle: William Tell, mimosa sampler, hot chocolate.  YUM!

Yg0FWTKo5En0ejKpD1p5mQ.text: A welcome surprise so close to home Crepes are deliciously different an add an exceptional twist to breakfast or lunch the variety in the flavors are all unique and very fresh made to order each crepe is quite large and filling. The service is top notch attentive and warm.  Will definetly make tis  regular in the rotation of local hang outs.

TW1Gjg8uKkQSIK_3Tt1LOg.text: Such an incredible place!!  From the service to the food... impeccable!!!  It's hard to find a place that gives you great quality prices & service in one!  Bravo!

HmARTF0qrFODwk9E21PU0g.text: Wow! This place was delicious! The owner was very passionate about his business and the quality of the food.  I had the BBQ special with coleslaw. I hate coleslaw BUT I was willing to try it and it was DELICIOUS! The pulled pork was cooked to perfection and I liked the fact that it wasn't drowning in BBQ sauce.  I can't wait to go back and try their breakfast. I would recommend this place to everyone!

JOWw-LJXNfY20W5xzshbOQ.text: It's ok. Saccarine crepe..the colors are garish..what lakers colors? Really? Staff is ok. Its just ok.

gGBfcTGj09qPV6HSWL6wPw.text: They are the best.  I was skeptical at first (almost 10 miles off the strip)  It took a long time to get our order, they were all very busy in that little place.  I had a pirate, my wife had the Monterey ( someone said those take a long time to make).  Both crepes were out of this world with flavor.  My side salad came with a cumin, garlic, olive oil and lemon dressing that was great!  We go to lots of crepe places, this one is something very special.  The guy about my age there is very friendly, although he is very busy, he takes the time to explain your order and give you options.  I would hit this place up once per week if I lived in Vegas.

aRjO6-hvDqr4-9NgM5Uu1w.text: We went there because we read that they had gluten-free crepes.   Wow!  They were awesome!  This will be on our must-visit list every time we go to Vegas.  Owner is super-friendly as well.

NwLhHo4Ogk3_idNNbpxWiw.text: This crepes are wonderful and  delicious.   We had The Rosarito,  The Monterey and a side of bacon.   The service was good... Pretty cool thing you can do is  watch them prepare you crepes on a tv screen mounted above the griddle... If time permits I'm sure the wife will be dragging me back here everytime were in town..

aNyNNnBs5ZEYaa-mS8KJYg.text: This place is definitely a regular spot for me. The mimosa trio never disappoints and the crepes are usually amazing. Check for the bbq crepe specials. The Avalon and the Monterey are good choices. The only reason I wouldn't give this place five stars is because of the lack of space & limited capacity. If you visit during the weekend, go after they first open or right before they close. Otherwise, you might literally be fighting other people over tables. I've had people steal tables right from under me several times during busier visits.

yW1179ULm6_IBdbqxRXLYw.text: Food is amazing try the grand turk and the greek crepes.  Mike is the greatest and the owners are so sweet.  You have to eat here if your in Henderson.

q_XmPYJgFBbd_-AHTUTVnA.text: This place is awesome! I had the gluten free Little Italy and it was very yummy. I cannot wait to bring my GF kids as well. I lived in Germany for years, and these crepes are just like the crepes I would get at the fests. Further, the prices are very good, the water is complimentary and the atmosphere is cozy. I would recommend to anyone, especially if you are gluten free and have been craving items of a gluteny nature!

gk8UKW7xAubSLAAIgTOq7w.text: Overhyped....by a ton. Ordered to go because there was no seating available. Got the Italian crepe with pepperoni. Just a soggy mess. Never had crepes before so if a soggy bland roll with soggy pepperoni is top notch crepes this is the place.

Rf_J5CfuZ6DjW973E94I2A.text: I wish they had a bigger venue! Love their crepes, especially the avalon and i always get a mimosa trio sampler when i go for Sunday brunch.

ydXq8g4oi90vIa4ssjNnvQ.text: Came in today and wow, it was amazing.  Very, very good.  Had mine w/ bannana, strawberry and nutella w/ whip cream.  Need I type more lol?  It was just as good as it reads.  I strongly recommend it.

NSL3z9W9WOi6iYOatCXHCQ.text: Literally the best Crepe place in town. The people are very nice and always go out of their way to help you. They have sweet, savory, and breakfast crepes. I always bring my out of town guests here.

h7bIoIyqgrW7C-OE7Np1Lw.text: Wow...  Found this little gem on yelp. Fresh ingredients and a great price for a spectacular breakfast...

dg7b5MbU8WoxwbHR17PwXQ.text: My absolute favorite place to eat breakfast. I love the rosarito with fideo soup and if I'm sharing a must have is the banana fosters. Jen and Lou are so friendly, they always greet me and whomever I'm with. Everyone I've brought in to have breakfast or brunch love the food here. Stop in and try the mimosas too.

rMxPzTf_0cV2oFZF8v2jDg.text: Come early or come patient- even on a weekday, this spot is packed shortly after opening. You've been warned. Personally, I think the savory options are a bit better than the sweet ones, but the menu is large enough to find something for everyone.   The Frisco (blueberries, lemon curd, whipped cream, powdered sugar) was better than expected, particularly the lemon curd, but the whipped cream didn't seem particularly fresh and didn't have much flavor. The Sonora is one of the most-recommended options here, and it's easily one of the best crepes I've had, with carne asada, guac, cheese, and just a touch of salsa- it also comes with a tasty little bowl of soup.   I'm not a fan of the tall high-top style tables or the large community-style table hogging the majority of the floor space, but the crepe bar seating is fun and there's even a camera above the griddle to watch how they are made. If you're a mimosa fan, they have a flight with three fruit-flavored options that are all exceptionally good.

9cy-sLPwXI5lJXkUD1kkEA.text: Sorry.. the reviews were better than they should be.  The service was nice and they were super sweet but the food was not good at all. We ordered the Greek, the Sonora, and the grand Turk.  Grand Turk was ok.. nothing special  The Greek was disgusting, soggy and the chicken was undercooked and no seasoning at all The Sonora was decent, not great but ok.  We were eager to get a sweet crepe but after the disappointment we didn't get dessert we went next door to get something else.

TQqjHm2PICDQaijkSNA1xA.text: My family and I were in Las Vegas and decided to find this restaurant.  The downside:  It's about a twenty minute cab ride from the strip.  The upside:  It's worth a twenty minute cab ride from the strip.  Located in a strip mall, we were a little wary when we arrived but we left full and happy.   We were seated outside on a beautiful day after we placed our order at the register.  They offer free lemon and cucumber water inside the restaurant.  Our waiter was very attentive and kept checking on us to see if we needed anything.   The food is delicious and cooked to order.  I had The Sonora which was Carne Asada steak roasted tomato salsa, guacamole and jack cheese with a salad.  The crepe was pretty big and filled with steak that was nicely cooked (not chewy) and well seasoned.  I was stuffed by the end of my meal.  The crepe and an ice tea set me back by $12.50 - a bargain for such deliciousness.  If I was staying longer I would have gone back to try one of their other crepes as I'm sure they were just as good.   If you're in the Las Vegas area - jump in a cab and check out this restaurant.  You won't be disappointed.

zz1UAKHJ7p8YDPxNhAZ7kw.text: I had a chance to try out this place while visiting Las Vegas and we ordered savory veggie crepe and sweet combo crepe with two mimosas. I'd give it a five stars but the waiting time was ridiculously long that I almost forget why I was there. We waited 30 minutes for our mimosas and about another 15 minutes before the crepes came out. dVFlhUNb-l-_K9qkp14o_A.text: If you're decided on this place, make sure you're okay with sitting very closely with other patrons. Their setup is way too cramped for me even with the outside seating. It's kind of weird how you have to order your food and pay first before you're even guaranteed that tables are available for you right away.  I've gone here a few times and I have always loved how my crepes came out. I usually get a breakfast crepe as they are more filling to me, with The Monterey being my favorite minus the bacon but add mushrooms to give it more flavor. I've also tried The Ana Banana Foster and it was pretty good to me; it was a little too sweet, but it was good nonetheless. Next time I visit, I will have to try new things on their menu and see what else they have to offer.  While I've always had a pretty good experience here, my last visit was a little less than stellar. There was a miscommunication with my sister and their cashier, and my sister was pretty much accused of lying. When my brother and my sister explained to me what happened, I feel like the manager could've handled the situation much better. I will still be coming back to this place when I'm craving crepes, however, my sister made up her mind to never return before we even finished eating our food.

1DMGg6VXL4akje_TfZTCxg.text: Mike was so amazing! He was kind and helpful. Great place. HIGHLY recommend  I got the rosarito crepe that had the best chorizo!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7laRwD5WvVfQ1loPb-OYxA.text: $10 mimosa 3 sample flight.  Chicken Chile Verdes Crepe- today's Special.  Strawberry  & chocolate crepe.  Definitely will be back!

tr5HjRlPVlcA5-zgTSBpJQ.text: 2.5 stars  I had Crepe Expectations for this place! As for the actual experience? Not so great.  Now that I've gotten my bad pun out of the way, I want to talk about the food. Specifically, the sweet crepes we ordered, The Berry Delight and The Perfect Combination.  Both crepes left something more to be desired. The crepe batter texture was too eggy for my taste and didn't have any flavor probably so it could be used to make sweet and savory. Plus, both crepes were torn. RIP. As for the toppings, it couldn't salvage our meal either. The whipped cream was nothing notable, but the berries were sour. And since it was loaded up, it made the crepe soggy and limp. Two words you never want to describe your food with. Plus, the excessive amount of chocolate drizzle on The Perfect Combination only drowned it further.  I mean, maybe the girl working was still learning, and we were unlucky in choosing less than ideal meals, but that doesn't change that the crepe itself didn't have the right texture or flavor. For me, anyways, I'm obviously in the minority. The price is decent, the portions are good, and the food is edible but that's not enough when I've had way better for the same price elsewhere.   Overall, I left unsatisfied and disappointed, and I probably won't be coming back anytime soon. If you come to Crepe Expectations, keep your expectations low and avoid the sweets menu.

hlcqk2aNESdNRUlY6TQQXg.text: We were in town for a race and wanted to find a great brunch location. This is it, folks!  I was amazed by not only the variety of sweet and savory crepe creations, but also the owner/chef.  He was so accommodating and inviting. He truly wants his customers to have an incredible culinary experience. My wife and i will go back here every time I travel to Vegas. Try the Mixed berry crepe and also the Monterey!

NwtDC0-q67yn5wbJEaL3cg.text: On our way back home, we heard of this place and wanted to see what all the hype was about. There were quite a few people waiting outside even at 11am. The tables outside were all filled up as well.  The wait actually wasn't that long so we ordered at the counter and sat down. I enjoyed being able to see how the crepe was made on the t.v. We ordered the perfect combination and banana foster with white mochas.  I saw a lot of people order the mimosa sampler. I'm definitely going to try those next time. The perfect combination came with strawberries and chocolate to fill my sweet tooth. It was a thin crepe with copious amount of strawberries..delicious!  The white mocha was a bit sweet for my liking.   I think I would come back and try the carne asada crepe for brunch.

BsChptVEfEVn-g1opLWvmQ.text: BEST crepes ever! A gem! Gluten free options, delicious flavored mimosas, and a wonderful personable owner who makes you feel like his favorite customer every time. Intimate atmosphere with lots of entertainment, everyone's friendly, smiling, and excited to be here. Perfect morning date, girls afternoon, or hangover recovery location. Outdoor seating available and they allow well behaved dogs on the patio, all sizes. I adore this place. FYI they are moving a couple of doors down soon but it's in the same shopping center so no worries. Also, extra parking is behind the building.

FEGlHDSE-wp5nqd4xqDZ6g.text: Awesome service and the food is sooo good! Owner is super friendly. It's very busy but they are moving to a bigger spot soon!!! This is good news :)

h8wA7z0RVBqF-adVMduiGQ.text: We had breakfast on a Wednesday at Crepe Expectations.  We arrived around 8:55 and waited outside for a few minutes before they opened.  The wife went with the Monterey, which has bacon, egg, peppers, tomato, cheese and onions.  I had the Sunday Morning (eggs, potatoes, cheese) and added bacon.  I'll be honest, I had no idea how big these things were, and I was worried we wouldn't have enough food.  So, we decided to get a William Tell to split.  Plus, we wanted to try one of the sweet ones.  Well, I couldn't have been more wrong.  These things are HUGE, such a good value for what you get.  We brought nearly half of the wife's home, and that was with me eating some of it.  These come out very hot, which is appreciated.  No sitting around for these crepes, you get them fresh.  I loved mine with hot sauce.  Lots of cheese and crispy bacon.  I probably liked the wife's a little more, the veggies mixed with the eggs became basically like a salsa.  Again, there was a lot of cheese, which is a fantastic thing.  I think in the future I'll get the Monterey and add potatoes, that will probably be the perfect crepe.  The William Tell was fantastic, basically a nice apple pie crepe.  Again, it was enormous, so we didn't finish it.  I loved the caramel and powdered sugar on top.    After we arrived and ordered, the place got crowded.  Every seat taken and a line out the door.  But, they seemed to get through the people pretty quickly.  This is a simple menu, but it's excellent.  I can't wait to return for lunch and try a few of the savory choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hours and notice about golf. Very cool.

hdVfM7zRo2sZq4hKWSDjjQ.text: This place is really cool. The food is great, and the service is fantastic! The owner seems bad ass and all of the staff even the host are always super friendly and helpful. Love coming here definitely recommend highly.

_qbgtApjS_Y4Ov2JKKxzAg.text: This place is adorable. It's a little small, but it wasn't too hard to find somewhere to sit on a Saturday morning. The line was a little long, luckily it was warm enough to sit outside so it wasn't crowded inside.  Since it was morning, I decided it was necessary to get a breakfast crepe and chose the Rosarita  The crepe: nice presentation, looked pretty full. I took my first bite and I thought I was in heaven, it was absolutely amazing. But the more I ate the crepe, I just got tired of it. The ingredients weren't distributed really well so the meat was just getting salty as the guacamole disappeared. I ended up not finishing my crepe because I just got really tired of the taste.   It came with a side of bananas though, so it helped when the crepe got to be too much. I know everyone talks about the goat cheese, but I just couldn't bring myself to get it. Maybe I'll try it next time!  The waitresses were pretty nice. The coffee is self-serve and it was out when I got it, but there was another waiting to be put out when I asked the waitress. That was a plus for me, considering no coffee would have just made me crankier.   I enjoyed my experience, but it's not a place I think "omg I need that now"

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the atmosphere

VGRAk3o86tL-gLHFl4ZHyg.text: Had just flown into town for work and a coworker and I were hungry so stopped by here before meeting a client. My wife is from Montreal so I'm sort of a crepe snob but this place was actually very good. Service was a bit slow and not overly friendly but at least the crepe was decent. Would definitely recommend it to others.

F7bU-3jYfaAeLYksNCIsiA.text: I decided to come here with a friend for breakfast since we were in the area running errands. In case you get lost, it's in the area between Einstein Bagels and Taj Palace.  There was a line when we arrived, but it moved quickly. The inside is small, dark, but quaint. I ordered the La Jolla with soup as my side while my friend ordered the Berry Delight. We took our number stand to a table outside. A waiter came out to give us our drinks and it didn't take long for our food to arrive to our table.  The food (and drinks) are a little pricey, but Crepe Expectations makes up for it by how huge the crepes are. I was pretty much full for most of the day off my La Jolla and soup. Not to mention both my La Jolla and my friend's Berry Delight were delicious. I ordered the La Jolla on a whim and it was a good, yummy choice.  Once we had finished our plates, a waiter came outside to take our empty plates which was a pleasant surprised. These people are definitely on the ball.  I'd definitely come back to Crepe Expectations to eat again. There's plenty of other choices on the menu that I want to try. Also, for those who cannot have gluten, all the crepes on the menu except the Sonara can be made with rice flour. All you have to do is ask when you order. Since I know someone who needs to eat gluten-free, that's pretty amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La Jolla with a side of soup.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5frZicz4zfM-XyLEPsCHOQ.text: I've had this place bookmarked since the first week I lived here and finally gave it a try.  Why I didn't try it sooner is beyond me!     Went on a late Sunday morning for brunch and I was bracing myself for a very long wait to get a table.  I'd read how busy this place gets, especially on the weekends, so I was prepared.  The inside of the restaurant is tight and it was already packed when we got there, so if we wanted to eat inside we would have had to wait.  We were in luck, though, because we were able to get a high top table outside right away, and it was a PERFECT Vegas morning.    The owner took our order and was so friendly and welcoming.  I could tell he takes great pride in this restaurant and his food.  He made some great suggestions, we placed our order, and were shown to our table with a number.   While in line, I loved watching the crepes being made in the kitchen and there was also a TV you could watch the crepe-making event from LOL.    The mimosas (we tried pomegranate, raspberry, and orange) were the perfect start to our Sunday.  The Berry Delight and the Sunday Morning crepes were delicious!  The berries were fresh and ripe, and the whipped cream made the ENTIRE meal.  I loved that the Sunday Morning (scrambled eggs, jack cheese, and potatoes) came with a side of sliced bananas (you could opt for cottage cheese instead).  They had so many flavored lemonades that I want to try, and I liked the cucumber and lemon infused waters that are available if you don't want to order a drink.    What a great brunch experience - I can't wait to go back and try more crepes, lemonades and mimosas.

CWv8Jg05TtOnow_XSAYgKg.text: Best Crepe ever tasted! My favorite is The Monkey & The Marco Polo, but everything looks delicious! Tea & coffee is perfect. Their freshly squeezed juice is good. Busy place, atmosphere is quaint, friendly staff, excellent service! Our new favorite spot.

rIy6cAvCxFlXyAMr1QEjtA.text: We really enjoyed eating here.  The customer service was top notch and the food was excellent.  From the menu there are many choices and they are made fresh on the spot.  The dining room is a little small and ordering can be confusing when it is busy.  I wish they were open later rather than being a breakfast and lunch spot.   I love a good crepe as a dessert!

lh_5N1Rf0SQp9nVQhQj64g.text: Im so glad I finally made it here! My friend has been raving about this place forever! We got there around 1pm an had no line, but almost all the tables were full. After carefully reviewing the menu, we decided on one sweet and one savory crepe and opted for the mimosa samplers.  The food: we got to watch it being made ( there is a camera above the crepe stations ). I opted for the savory crepe and got the little italy, which is basically a pizza crepe. It was sooo good, the cheese was melted perfectly and the sauce was really flavorful. My friend got the William Tell which was like an apple pie crepe. Very good and the apples inside were delicious :)  The drinks: i highly recommend the mimosa sampler. We both got different flavors so we could try them out, our favorites were watermelon, pineapple, and passion fruit, but they were all good.   Will definitely be back. I want to try the whole menu!

yhY1-5iJtcJTz7Y38kipow.text: First time here.  The food is great, people are nice.  The ordering process sucks.  We stood in line for 20 minutes to place our order, the line snaked around and people kept having to move for other patrons to walk by.  Maybe if we were told what the process was before sitting down it would have been a better experience. Giving it 4 stars because the food was delicious.

Z5TF4PLavDRJOjQDiibzdw.text: Hands down the BEST crape I've ever had! So light and crispy around the edges.  Really sets it apart from the rest. Plus the people who work here are super nice! Customer service was great too! Highly recommend this place!

ebvE28UStAvwMX1h4EUu6w.text: Good food, but their customer service is less than professional.  I walked in with a friend for brunch.  I stood in line to order and she went to sit at a table.  There was a guy "policing" the seating and told her that she couldn't sit down until we had ordered our food.  There were 3 parties in front of me, so he made her stand to the side of the counter in the hallway leading to the bathrooms.  Seriously???  So we turned around and left.  So we gave the business a second chance since, like I said, their food is good.  We arrived at the restaurant at 2:45p.  When we got to the counter, the lady/owner said they close at 3:00p, so we would have to eat outside while they close up the restaurant.  I reminded her that it was only 2:45p and she said they start closing at 2:45p so they can be out of the restaurant by 3:00p.  Again, seriously???  (Mind you, under normal circumstances, I wouldn't mind eating outside, but in Vegas in July/August, no one wants to be outside more than they have to be).  We will no longer be going back to give our business, based solely on their lack of customer service.  I can honestly say that I've never come across a small business that cares so little about  customer business/service.

wiFzO7dcFYYZwugawEyV1A.text: This place is a hidden gem. Great price with big portion, fresh ingredients, my family loved it! Highly recommended!!!

sXE5u0HQYuL12WPTHDBRAw.text: All I have to say is THE BEST CREPES in Vegas!!! The owners are super cool and the guy is funny. The wife makes the crepes and she even let me take a picture. I got the monkey and added strawberries. I CANT wait to go back !!! The hubby and I loooooved it!!  I'd give this place a 10 stars vs 5 : ) Everything on the menu is deeee-lish!

XXwwbHv7yfrMZiEPi5dRAQ.text: We were out and about Yelping on Sunday morning for a good breakfast spot and Crepe Expectations came up.  Neither of us were very familiar with crepes but thought that we would give it a try based on the great reviews.  We were so glad that we stopped in.  This place was incredible.  I ordered the Monterey and he ordered the Clucker.  Both were great but the Clucker was the favorite.  Everything was incredibly fresh.  The owner was really sweet and made suggestions of what we should order based on our preferences. For the price, service and quality, this will be hard to beat.  We will definitely be back.

ztXFhTRxoolHN5oHwISkIA.text: So delicious! The food is always amazing, just wish it was a little bigger.  The wait can be a bit much at times.

6eHSQjnkUTRGUTVD0axNRg.text: We love this place and go when ever we can I cant say enough about how much we are in love with the food drinks and more I walk in and all ways get a warm smile and full tummy Jenn makes me my crepe she is the best too bad she dose not have the chocolate pizza she made us when we where little thank you Jenn and Luie for making us yummy food when we come in Elijah

n0FEd5uG-0jSuasSvBJc-A.text: I went to Crepe Expectations for brunch and really enjoyed it. My husband and I wanted a breakfast crepe, sweet crepe and mimosas to start off our afternoon. We had a great experience. The  restaurant is beautifully decorated, the service was great, and the crepes were wonderful.    I started off with the mimosa trio. It is comprised of three small glasses of any kinds you choose. I had the orange, blood orange, and passion fruit. The passion fruit was definitely my favorite.  My husband had a glass of the white peach mimosa which was also very tasty.  We ordered the "Sunday Morning" breakfast crepe and added mushrooms to it.  It was a good size and delicious.  For our savory crepe, we had "The Avalon," which was filled with pears, goat cheese, candied walnuts and honey.  It was also delicious.   Our experience at Crepe Expectations was great.  It is a great place to have a nice, relaxing breakfast, brunch or lunch.  It is also a plus that they serve wine, beer and mimosas, which makes it perfect for brunch!  The prices are very reasonable and the quality of the food is great.  The next time we go we are going to try a savory crepe and another sweet crepe. I can't wait!

lJNYk-OG76JHW0rmhTs1Mg.text: i have eaten here one time, and while i am sure the food was great, i forget because i was so consumed with mortification at the owner loudly making fun of my new york accent! okay yeah once that's fine but he kept going with it, mocking me as i was trying to order, and got others in line to laugh at me as well. not a very good memory of the place. seriously felt like some high school ish. i had just moved to vegas and loudly and crassly being mocked in front of other customers by a stranger wasn't exactly the sort of welcome a patron would hope for.

MWsZoDs4DDK4T-smt5jo6A.text: Great ambience, food and people! If you love crepes, this is a place to be - they have the savory, sweet, and breakfast side with mimosa! ;) oh and beer for the boys. The owner is super nice! He literally walks out and greets every customer and asks how everyone is doing and even cleans up when you finish! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The William Tell Crepe

Uj0-9zby6VJuGOvMBpmU0Q.text: Tried the vegetable, caprese crepe.  Good.  Like the vegetable more...caprese could have used more substances.  Others had the pepperoni which he said was food, like a pizza/calzone.  Did not get to try the mimosa...would have probably made the experience nicer.  Will come back w friends perhaps next time to try mimosas too.  Overall, good service.  But it just lacked a je me sais quoi.

Wg9ylynDtgR8iv61s9dUng.text: We've been wanting to try out this place for weeks and have delayed going several times because it's always so busy when we drive by. Got in today for breakfast and was totally disappointed. While the people working there are super friendly, and really behind two stars, and the actual restaurant is cute and clean, we found the main attraction--the crepes--uninspired and clumsy. No balsamic reduction on the caprese? Huge tomato chunks? Brown, wilted lettuce with some dressing for "salads?" Slightly overcooked, pancake-like crepes? This place just doesn't compare to our all-time favorite place on Oahu, No Ka Oi. Now that place knows how to do crepes. We won't be returning here.

6FD26mYA4Jpu0_2ILYWuww.text: Best quality ingredients! This is not just dessert crepes. You can order all different types of meal crepes as well. The service is the best. This is a family run business so you should certainly try it! Try the watermelon juice it's GOOD! Also bring your appetite because u will be full!

oPi3PUHAUJAyTnw9tGleZg.text: Okay hands down favorite food place in the entire world!  It is more than heaven in your mouth! So many different flavors! I go to school right by it and go there everyday during my lunch break and is the best ! I recommend everyone to try and and they fall in love !

Ani53PX375_dU_c3pzpdSQ.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch. Reasonable prices. Good food. Friendly staff. Perfect alternative to chain restaurant.

nKdLZeHCbmILh_sGUZyZ9g.text: Man this place is amazing. Upon walking in, the decor is inviting and the staff is incredibly kind; they go out of your way to make you feel like a rock star. Sweet, savory...it doesn't matter your preference. There is truly not a bad offering on the menu. And if you like mimosas, they have them made with every type of fruit under the sun! I prefer the watermelon in the summertime but the possibilities are endless. No matter where you're staying in Las Vegas, this place is worth the trip...a knockout in the breakfast field. Looking forward to many returns!

2DEkcOTvqqhElCmu0dgpPQ.text: This place is amazing!  The food is always great and the owner is always  so pleasant.  Try the different flavored mimosas...we love the blood orange.  If you like crepes, this place is a must!

e0Qt3g771r7N7ShsQfByGQ.text: Amazing food and very personable service!!! They definitely get busy on the weekends but it's totally worth it even with a wait.  The berry delight is unbelievable...fresh berries and homemade whipped cream.  Their homemade salsa is excellent as well.

hstGEI3aNKDYa3Ju4Ga63g.text: The wait on the weekends can be a bit longer, but the crepes are worth it!  I highly recommend the Sunday Morning and the Monkey.

z7bByjr2KEWAkk6JGEXHpA.text: It's tough for me to give a place five stars. And I won't do it after one visit. Though I will be back to this place soon and decide then if it is deserved. This is a cute little place out in Henderson on Eastern where so many delicious restaurants reside... Went on a Sunday afternoon and this place was full.. luckily just one table left inside for my party of 5. Came just for something sweet.. got the Monkey (nutella, banana, etc) and the blueberry lemon one... forgot what it was called. Both were very different and delicous, though both dessert crepes. Owner and workers were very nice. Clean place. Will be back soon! Love crepes :) Oh did I mention they have a mimosa menu? yup.

1FSzoxkfSIoB6QBX-4Mn0w.text: So good! Great service, great food, great patio seating. I had the Sonora crepe and loved it! Also, the Ana bananas foster was awesome.

ag78piFiVMhQWIOfXgbFAA.text: Just the most amazing customer service. I believe the owner works the cash register on weekends and he's so personable, uses pet names for everyone and if it's packed (which it always is because the food is beyond delicious) then he will also keep an eye out for your party to seat you! I couldn't come up with a bad comment if I tried, thanks for the awesome meal and service guys :)

Y7zvCGRo9TyVql8UjjQ1IQ.text: This place is amazing. I've lived around the corner for years and I wish I had seen it sooner. I love the bananas foster crepe. So yummy.

lEg7ixd5YPW5fsOIPdTS-g.text: I went to Crepe Expectations last week for a coworker outing for lunch. I had heard about this place, but I wasn't thrilled about the idea of a savory crepe. I was tempted to take the easy route, and go for something with bananas and nutella. I finally opted for The Grand Turk, which had turkey, cheese, guac, olives and tomatoes. I'm trying to think of a word to describe my experience with The Grand Turk, but I can't. I'll settle for incredible. The crepe was light, and almost melted in my mouth. The ingredients were fresh. It was probably one of the best crepes I have ever had, even without the nutella.  The staff is friendly, the ambiance is great, and the prices are reasonable. There's really no reason why you shouldn't be eating here. Just sayin!

mEeV0DdN3Zpxl1bCTOmxew.text: Thank you to Lisa L. for inviting me to brunch here so I could check this place off my bookmark list ! :)  This place is awesome!! A fantasic lineup of savory and sweet crepes, and a very cool mimosa menu to boot. The perfect place for an affordable brunch. The decor is cute, and the owners are so nice and gracious.  My crepe with pears, goat cheese, toasted walnuts, and honey was to die for and I can't wait to go back to try the savory options !

NpVPMJjbCm6zyEOmWwVVNQ.text: i caught myself scraping my plate    the berry delight: strawberries, blueberries and blackberries with whipped cream & powdered sugar wasn't as sweet as i thought it'd be; perfect brunch meal; the Marco Polo: Italian sausage, eggs & jack cheese w/ cottage cheese on the side was sooooo good; the Monterey: bacon, eggs, tomatoes, red onions, jack cheese & peppers was very yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. top left=the Marco Polo, top right=the Monterey, bottom=the Berry Delight

N_2ACweYwSJTKiB3eRJHBQ.text: After hearing much about this establishment I rolled in with my son and GF to give it a shot.  Initially when comforted with so so many tasty looking choices the mind will often vapor look.  I calmed the nerves by grabbing a menu I could read in my hand. Then I went about picking something tasty to eat.  I settled on the The Rosarito which consisted of chorizo, egg, guacamole and jack cheese.  It was filling in a very light way.  Ingredients were fresh and complimented each other well.  There was also a delicious side of bite size watermelon to compliment the meal.  The GF had The Del Mar.  A crepe filled with sauteed shrimp and zucchini in a lemon butter sauce.  It was fantastic.   The libations for our meal minus the boy, unless he snuck a sip on me somewhere was the Mimosa Trio Sampler.  The three we picked were white peach (Yum), Lychee (My fave) and regular OJ which after the first two never tasted so boring,  The piece de resistance was The Sticky-Sticky. Peanut butter, chocolate and carmel..Ohhh My!  Truly a delicious way to finishing off the meal.  The staff was happy and seemed to enjoy what they were preparing and serving.  BTW..You can watch your crepe being made via CCTV that is hanging over the kitchen area.  We all look forward to making our return to continue to explore all CE has to offer.

ypHCWl2H6QcSw3A6m9qekQ.text: I'm 38 weeks pregnant and I wish I would have found this place 38 weeks ago. Savoury crepes are so hard to come by here and when I saw that today's special was a Reuben crepe (I love Reubens!) I was sold. My companion had the Avalon and we split The Frisco. Every thing we had was absolutely delicious. The Avalon had a creamy goat cheese that went so well with how crisp the pears and crunchy the walnuts were! You could distinguish the goat cheese flavour which for me is a huge plus. The Frisco was a treat! The blueberries being just sweet enough to balance out the fantastic lemon curd that was almost cheesecake ish in its flavour.   Along with the food being amazing the staff was very attentive and sweet. They really care about the product and the quality shows that.    I will definitely be back!

XeORMyIZWMS1xbcQmofyaw.text: We went to this place last week and the crepes are delish! We had the Sonora and the William Tell for dessert. The Sonora was so filling and flavorful we don't think we had room for dessert but were so happy we ordered one to share. The owner took our order and chatted with us for a bit and it's nice to see such passion for a craft reflected in the product, more places need to be like this! If we lived closer we would go here a lot, but since it takes about 45 to get here this will be a special occasion place:)

veqjSnL08sO_3piZ6oApGA.text: The crepes were great. Workers were very friendly and welcoming they were kind enough to explain the ordering process and the specials of the day. the restaurant was very clean and well decorated. I would eat here again and recommend people who love crepes that are visiting vegas. they also have dessert type, lunch type and breakfast type of crepes so the selection in satisfactory.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Clucker. this was a day special not on the menu.

foTmw_QUS0Sieuw2Sn_ohw.text: The mimosas are amazing, excellent customer service,  and the crepes are delicious. Def will be coming bk when I visit Vegas.

XaUsNHjTKNAJVV2bM9qwzg.text: It was delicious. The variety of sweet and savory crepes was a great size and the selection of mimosas was even better. I went for brunch with my family and all ordered different things. I ordered the crapese which was fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and pesto with the option to add chicken (I didn't). It was the perfect size and so fresh and delicious. The pomegranate mimosa was also perfection. I wish I had realized that they offered a trio mimosa sampler for about the same price so could of tried some of the other flavors. Overall my family and I where really blown away by how delicious everything was. We also happened to meet the owner who really seemed to love what he was doing. I expect in a couple of months they will probably have to move to a bigger location because of how busy it seemed. Cannot wait to go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranate mimosa

lkoC5Rk07NA5lwNr94yBxA.text: I am in LOVE with this place. I've probably been here around 4-5 times within the past 5 weeks. I try not to go out to eat often but Crepe Expectations is definitely with it. Their mimosa samplers are great! Plenty of flavors and always leave me with a decent buzz at the end :) The crepes come in a wide variety! I never know what to choose. On top of that, their staff is wonderful, so friendly! I'm from the south so I definitely miss that hospitality. This place is amazing, I'm constantly recommending it to my friends.

1cIRJj188PatJ8KkTtLvVg.text: When I first moved here a friend took me to this little crepe place and my stomach wishes we would come back more often!   When you walk in you are greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere of a clean and contemporary decor. The people who work here are always incredibly friendly and willing to offer suggestions on the pinnacle items on their menu.  Everything that I have tried here was been superb! That includes:  The Berry Delight--a delicious crepe filled with fresh berries. The Monkey -- bananas, nutella, and we added strawberries...need I say more? The Monterey--a savory crepe with a bit of a zing (by far my favorite!) The Veggie Patch--veggies and hummus. Pretty standard.  And my all time favorite afternoon treat: the mimosa sampler! If you haven't tried it, I highly recommend the blood orange mimosa.  This restaurant is one of the reasons why I love company coming into town.

1Q3jQp2VjXXIKhhIFype4g.text: Love their Rosarito (Chorrizo,Guacamole,Pepper Jack Cheese). Their Pumpkin Spice Latte is even better then Starbucks, in fact all their Java's are AMAZING. You definitely can't go wrong with their Mimosa's too. Great friendly atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Del Mar w/ a side of soup and a peach mimosa.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito w/ side of Banana&#39;s &amp; Pumpkin Spice Latte. Heavenly.

B0DF4zom7x5jWnqd9s9i9g.text: I love crepes. And surprisingly, this city is lacking in the crepe department. The only place I knew of was the little window in the Paris hotel. I am glad to see a few more crepe establishments open up, and I am even more glad to give them a try.  One of those new places is Crepe Expectations. I had great expectations for Crepe Expectations (ha-ha). And overall, I'd say they met most of them. The decor of the restaurant is nice and modern and the outdoor furniture is pretty comfy. There is even a flat screen above the counter that displays an overhead view of your crepe being made!  I hit up this place with a friend. Here's what we had:  -the Greek - a crepe filled with the typical greek items such as feta cheese and olives. The grilled chicken was a little dry and tough, but other than that, the rest of the crepe was delicious. -the Caprese - the classic salad wrapped in a crepe. The pesto sauce on top was a nice touch. -the Mimosa Trio Sampler- you get to choose from 5 flavors: classic orange, lychee, passion fruit, pomegranate and white peach. The lychee and the white peach were my favorites.  Today, the special was a chocolate covered strawberry with the mimosa trio sampler for $2 more. The one crepe and the mimosa sampler brought my total to a little over $20, which I thought was pretty pricy. I guess that's what happens when you add a little bubbly. But if you go and get just a crepe, they are reasonalbly priced anywhere from $5-$10, depending on how fancy you wanna get.  Crepe Expectations has a large variety of breakfast, savory and sweet crepes in addition to beer, wine, bubbly, coffee and tea. I can't wait to go back and try some more, especially the banana nutella crepe I was eying this morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special: Mimosa sampler trio with chocolate covered strawberry
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek

It455nY9W9QSU1rk_DT4_Q.text: Went here with my girlfriend during a trip to Vegas. Unfathomably, somehow we struggled to find good restaurants in Vegas......yeah, didn't make sense to use either. I guess all the good restaurants are actually inside the casinos, idk.  Anyway, on the last day we finally found this Gem.  Their selection was great; everything looked delicious, we couldn't decide. We decided to add strawberries to the Monkey crepe, and leave out the Chicken in a different crepe. When we asked the waitress/clerk if these alterations were possible, she laughed it off and said Of Course! She immediately offered to substitute two other ingredients into the crepe because we took out the chicken. Let me say that again; in exchange for removing an ingredient, she offered completely on her own (as if it was a no-brainer) to add TWO additional ingredients to make up for the loss. I guess with these people, take away one, add two, for free. Sweet!!!!  The crepes were fabulous. Delicioso! The cooked them from scratch, and it was quick.  We dearly wish this place was near our house!!!

K0XYdHzpZs0t9KAubonvPQ.text: This place is great!!! The service, inckuding the owners are very friendly. Oh and the food is amazing!!

Yzqi8s1Hs0v5QN6TDBysKw.text: Lackluster crepe and not worth the wait. Bad idea to come here on Sunday during brunch ON Mothers Day but when I called on Sat the owner said to come by, he'd make it work.  I got there early, at 11, so I could reserve a table, group meeting was at 11:15 and we knew there'd be a wait. I walked around the parking lot at the "farmers market" to kill some time. By 11:30, everyone was hungry and the owner said he just didn't know when he'd be able to serve us. If one table of 2 opens, they dont hold it for my waiting group, they give it away. We need all 3 tables that are next to each other to miraculously get up and leave at the exact same time. I wish he would have told me this when I called. I had reservations for Paymons but ditched them for this. Urgh!  I had the plain crepe with cinnamon sugar and whipped cream. It was OK. I wanted my crepe nicely browned on both sides but one side was more done than the other. I dont like a crepe unless it's "well". It was OK. For the wait and the price, it was eh, I've had better.

SqtX6Yy246HIAU5Yvccd0g.text: I love this place! The owners are always in there working hard and amazing people and so are their employees. They always have great service and delicious food!My personal favorite is their 'perfect combination' with their soup.. yum! I wish they would get a bigger location because it's always packed but other than that everything is amazing.

Ra14wKu1GRqMs6groXgKJA.text: Delish food. I ordered the crepe that had chorizo, egg and potato in it.  It was served with sliced bananas on the side.  Everything was amazing!  Portion size is great too! One crepe is definitely enough food for two people.  :)  Definitely will be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo, egg and potato crepe with bananas on the side

d48Oz7BsuTM6QuncM95S3g.text: This place does it all right. It has the feel of a quality independently owned, great food, great chef restaurant.  Their crepes are amazing. No matter which category you go with you can't go wrong, as long as the fillings are what you're craving. The savory, the sweet and the breakfast items are all soooo good.  My favorite is The Rosarito. The chorizo has such a fantastic flavor. Mix that with fresh avocado and eggs, I want one right now.   The monkey and the nutty classic are also very good for you nutella fans.   I love their specialty sodas and their flavored mimosas. I strongly recommend their flight of mimosa sampler. You get a healthy serving of each flavor and their all good!  The service is excellent. The staff is very friendly even when the place is super busy.

UcDKqCOFHphNyFYWLeO7_A.text: By far my favorite crepe spot! The Avalon is insanely delicious. I can't help but order that one every time I go.  But i've also had the Monterey & the Nutty Classic...noms! I don't think it's possible to have a bad crepe here. The employees are so nice & personable. They really treat you like family.   It's really nice sitting out on the patio (weather permitting).

UGd8zrufPmTxOmR7rcsEbw.text: Wow is this place impressive and fast. They have a nice variety of crepes including a Ruben. So many options to choose from. The Frisco was finished lemon curd that made your tastebuds dance. Let's talk about the homemade fabulous whipped cream  YUM YUM, and YUM. The Chile Verde was absolutely amazing. Lou is the king of Crepes. We will return tomorrow!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their most famous crepe...the Chile Verde. It comes with a side of fideo.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Frisco Crepe.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What better way to serve Mimosas than in a flight option of 3. What a great way to have breakfast.

cPTFHUGUwEQ6AWoqCsjXsw.text: Fairly close to my house and I had this restaurant bookmarked for a while. The restaurant is not that big, but weather-permitting, there are some outdoor seats as well. I was lucky and did not have to wait for a seat, but at times you may have a wait.  There is a mix of savory and sweet crepes. I ordered one of each. While I enjoyed my savory tuna crepe, the interior was a bit lukewarm and I was hoping for it to be evenly hot all the way through. My sweet crepe was just alright.  Service was okay. You order at the register, pay, and get a number, and then take a seat. Your food is then brought out to you when it is ready. There are a few seats right up against the kitchen if you want to watch crepes being made.  Prices are reasonable and the crepes a good size. Overall, a solid crepe establishment. I was not wowed by my two flavor choices, but am more than willing to return and try other kinds.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Exterior.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Pirate

ZRp-q_vpek7SzuycldIUvA.text: Was fast friendly and taste awesome. Sat outside being the weather was nice and not too hot. Will come back to try others.

liROY2AIyKA4kNF3c2_Naw.text: Years later, still the same cheese and lame sides (cottage cheese or banana) to complete your crepe menu choice, and some things in life need to update with competition and health trends.  Why not try cheddar, gouda or another blend of cheese within the crepes? Or a veggie friendly combo? They don't offer nut milk or alternative milk options for the coffees/lattes. And, bringing out a cloudy bucket water to refill the "fresh water" dispenser isn't exactly what I imagined seeing. Or the lipstick-stained coffee cup in the stack of clean cups...

_6ZDQ2pPPqrZFnz1UMZUAA.text: So yummy! The portions are really big and they stuff the crepes with a lot of filling (whichever type you get). The coffee cups are huge too!   I've had more expensive crepes before and those crepes did not have as much filling as these crepes and weren't as tasty either.   The service is amazing! The owner is really nice and the servers are nice too.  Lastly, the patio is right next to the restaurant and has partial roofing over it, so it's like an inside-outside feel. It also has netting on top of the wooden slabs so nothing will fall from above.   A BIG plus, it's pet friendly/dog friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor patio as of Nov 2018 (with shade and pet-friendly!!)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor patio of Nov 2018 (w/shade!)

tU7r3yOaWoLpyVipFv9jrQ.text: Seems like a decent place if they are not busy. For a party of 3 on a Saturday they just had a very hard time keeping people happy.  Several customers interrupted people in-line giving orders to complain that they hadn't received their food or drink orders in a timely manner. The food is above average and great deal for the price.  However they only had 1 guy busing tables and also serving the drinks and didn't stop to wash his hands between those duties.  We witnessed lots of dirty dishes being picked up tossed into a large bin of trash then he made your coffee and other beverages and proceeded to deliver to your table. While they had several cooks and another guy serving the food they seemed overwhelmed when the seating area was only half full.   Prices are beyond reasonable. My suggestion would be to add more staff on weekends or busy times and even if that meant raising the price a dollar per order = totally worth it.

BcMcy83V8h-CbZobfFHLlw.text: the best crepe place I have ever eaten at! wonderful food with several crepe options! there are also great mimosa options! definitely recommend this place! the staff was extremely friendly and so helpful! service was quick! definitely somewhere I'd keep coming back to!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio! Mango, Strawberry, and White Peach.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutty Classic Crepe

JRTMLswGJ-DwXbJmsnZ4Hw.text: we went here on Monday morning on way home from Convention in Vegas. Got there right at opening because I've tried to go here in past and I'm not real good at waiting and I've heard they're always busy. two savory breakfast crepes and a bananas foster. Have to say, I understand why they are really busy, really really good. The Owner's attitude is fantastic, really seems to appreciate his customers, and I would probably return every time I came to Vegas. Only downside is they don't have fountain soda. I just don't understand the canned soda at a place like this, the food was so good though and owner was really cool that I won't hold it against them, but I would suggest to call Coke and get a system

Em7dy9I3OYEewr1kJwjgxQ.text: Feels like I am in a Crepe world. I would definitely return when I am in town. I like both the sweet and meaty crepes. The food was made and ready pretty fast.

omAyxiKgwtmjH3x5EP6cBw.text: We so enjoyed these crepes. We went on a Monday at 1:30. Service was fast and food was delicious. We enjoyed sitting on the outside patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy crepes savory and sweet

bT1z1bIHiiQAxUGwu6tXpw.text: SLOOOOOOOOOOOOOOW service. Two creeps, 45+ minutes. Another party behind us walked out. Small little drinks in plastic cups and overpriced.  Wanted the coleslaw but not available. Substitute salad had no dressing, just greens.  Server came and apologized for 50 minute wait but didn't offer any remedy.. a coupon for next time or coffee? Perhaps they could have brought us a drink refill since after 40 minutes we were dry, or some chips?  Server said 30 minutes is normal (!). This was not our first visit and we knew they were always busy and a little slow, little being the operative word. But the food was delicious. Not delicious enough to come back from Centennial Hills 30 miles away.

W7xoECN-tYCLM_IIzjWcOw.text: This place is awesome. Yummy crepes, huge portions, great for groups, great for kids, plenty of seating inside and outside. The owner is really friendly and is always around.

W_--vow1Ie-oX_Wm0D7TGw.text: Great place for crepes! Everyone is friendly and great service. You must come and enjoy the food!

7yaQVew4NrjSShX1DoEl1w.text: I love the chorizo crepe! So bomb! It's a pretty big size. Also I love the different flavor mimosas they have

bGKx7Gqq5tEv0ClEQwU4hw.text: This place is amazing!!! The service is wonderful and food is exceptional. I got the white chocolate iced coffee and it was one of the best Iv ever had. We got the William Tell, banana foster, chicken chili verde, and lemon berry dream. We LOVED every single one of them. The lemon berry tasted like the berries in it were a little out of season, but the William tell is definitely the favorite sweet crepe all around! The chicken chili verde was a great savory one too!!!

HDwqY0e7hv6nXwfkSTQWGA.text: Good crepes. Recommended. I will come here if I visit Las Vegas again for sure !!!!! Why cant I just write a short review, Yelp?! Google review doesnot care about the length of my review. My review needed to be longer in order to post, so here I am, keep writing. Anyway, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zTIU0arqxeDswu2aNIa-ww.text: One of our favorite places.  The crepes, coffee, mimosa's.  Literally everything is delicious!!

OPKx3AKMQxrUqgUx5I6vkw.text: The staff, the staff, the staff!!!!! From the minute we walked in we were treated like family, the girls at the register laughing and joking with us, what a great feeling! I ordered some nutella crepes to go, as it was close to closing and I didn't want to be "that person". My kids liked watching them being made, nice touch. To be honest the crepes were way too sweet for us, but I'll definitely be back to try different flavors.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-fYRHIuWG_efN1THe8eJeg.text: Really good friendly service and food here. Featured on Food networks "Triple D" otherwise we would have never known about it as thier business seems to be word of mouth. The menu is divided into 2 categories with regards to Crepes, savory & sweet. My S.O. opted for the savory and i went for the sweet. The staff here was wonderful and the wait was not bad at all for a sunday albeit we arrived before 9 a.m.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ibPzDfR4N_kSX-8InaA4IQ.text: First time having a crepe, and I was not disappointed. The crepe is good on it's own, but my Rosarito crepe came filled with chorizo, egg, and guacamole. I got soup as a side, which was just tomatoes and spaghetti in chicken broth. You can also have bananas, cottage cheese, or upgrade to mixed berries for 50 cents more. They serve cappuccinos and champagne, and have complimentary lemon/cucumber water. Staff was extremely friendly. Bathrooms needed cleaning, and I was there right at open. Toilet paper was matted to the floor around the toilet... By the time we left, a huge line had formed and the patio was full. Probably gets pretty busy on weekends.
