MpQOnl2bkDWXiXKGziA0zQ.text: Crepe Expectations is THE place to go to for crepes!  Location - not so great only because I live on the NW side and I only came here when I visited my sister. There's additional seating arrangements outside of the restaurant and the   Service - awesome! the owner and staff are very welcoming and checked on us regularly to make sure everything was good.  Food - my sister ordered The Greek and I ordered The Marco Polo with spinach and mushrooms added. The crepes are served in large portions (I was able to eat half of my order) and I loved how crispy the edges were. The only thing I wish they'd be able to accommodate are milk alternatives for the coffee drinks. I had asked for almond or soy milk for my coffee but they only have one type available.  I highly recommend this place for any crepe cravings you may have!

nSTPxVmsnOZYCpDt73_J9g.text: We happened upon this place looking for a dog-friendly place for a quick lunch. Crepe Expectations exceeded our expectations in every way. The food was delicious-both the sweet and savory options we ordered. So many "quick service " style places forget that being fast doesn't mean you can't be great, too. Crepe Expectations gets it. The service was exceptional: fast, friendly, and attentive throughout.

DXqKDjR1xlK5drkmFXJrdg.text: We've been here many times and the service and food are fantastic without fail. You'll get a warm greeting at the counter when you order and it's never a problem to add or sub out items for your crepe. We love the sweet yums especially The Perfect Combination with Nutella and the bananas foster crepes. Once you order, they'll find you a table and bring your food and drinks to you. If you need anything, just ask. Every member of the team is friendly and offers a genuine smile. Can not recommend this place highly enough!

-x137ycPmWpdYFiMH2a99A.text: I've been here a few tomes and was only disappointed once - when I found out they had sold out of the chicken verde. The flight of mimosas is a fun way to try different flavors and enjoy the patio

pWdQq1Z4cvlUlvhyi-0uNQ.text: Best experience each time we go. You can never go wrong with the savory crepes. I love the chili verde and Sonora crepes. My son loves the little Italy says it tastes just like a pizza. Love that coffee and water are self serve. Also love the bigger location. It is two doors down from the original location. Outdoor seating is amazing and shaded. A lot of room to spread out

ZkwNnTzcfGI1O3RDbtp4Kg.text: Pros: Inexpensive, very very very friendly service, DELICIOUS! Cons: SMALL restaurant!!! It's worth the wait in my opinion but during peak times (brunch) it can be 1hr+... They do pay very close attention to who will be seated next so you don't have to worry, though.   I recommend: My favorite is the Grand Turk! So good. Get the soup with it, too. The mimosas are hit or miss (they all taste good, but might not taste like their flavor, ie watermelon just tastes like alcohol to me while peach tastes like peaches)- go for the "classic" flavors and you'll be all good.  I always imagined crepes as being sweet so I was very excited to try a savory crepe! I tried the Grand Turk the first time I visited... and that's what I get every time now :). I've sneaked a taste of The Sonora and The Monkey from friends, though, and those were also very, very good. It might not sound filling, but a crepe and a side soup (if you choose a savory one) is actually quite filling! So for around $7-$9, you can have a very happy tummy.   For busy times where there is a wait, they have a little area in the back with chairs. The host was very conscious to who is next to be seated so you don't have to worry about someone "stealing" your spot. Service is always very friendly and attentive. Because the restaurant is quite small, it can get super crowded during peak times. But don't let that deter you from these tasty, tasty crepes! Bon Appetit!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler trio! Peach is the best.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grand Turk with side soup- my favorite!

VEj-hl7pIoN2sRfGul1m6A.text: Outstanding brunch for the whole family.  We sampled and shared a number of items from the menu.  The Monterey, Senora, and Italian were great savories.  The southern comfort special (peach) and fresco were superb sweets.  Would certainly return if we ever make it back to Vegas.

2mLfnRCaJYJ_zGnhXZbwSQ.text: Great food... good counter service.... a little weirded out by how aggressively they point out the time they close and you gotta leave immediately at the time... that's something that stops me from going back anytime in the afternoon ever.

iWUjJeTazfFgG-1DeEkKWw.text: My boyfriend took me here for breakfast on my birthday last year, and now we can't get enough! He usually orders a savory crepe and the cinnamon sweet crepe. I get the nutty monkey with strawberries! The crepes are huge and 1 is very filling for the average person. The service is always 10/10, they treat you like family. Also, the mimosa flight is only $10! Can't beat that.

zDnjRxYAK_E4l44DUIJ18Q.text: Literally the best breakfast and brunch you could ask for, and the prices are so reasonable it feels like a steal.  Love the food and the staff.

__1ScpLlN9f5u3w1Jq3SGA.text: I've been excited to try Crepe Expectations since moving to Vegas a few months ago. I had seen Guy Fieri visit on DDD, and was surprised to find that I live so close. SCORE! I've visited a couple times now, each time being better then the last. The crepes are phenomenal and the service as well, lots of friendly faces!  I've tried both sweet and savory crepes including The Chicken Chili Verde, The Sonoran and The Berry Delight. The savory crepes are served with your choice of a side salad or Fideo soup (Mexican noodle soup) TRY THE FIDEO... it's great! I'll have to admit I favor CE Fideo to my favorite Mexican restaurants. The chicken chili verde crepe was delicious and very filling. Authentic chili verde sauce (green chili pepper/tomatillo think green salsa but cozier... if possible? Mexican Comfort food) typically served with pork I enjoyed the chicken and found it to be not as heavy. Now the Sonoran was DELICIOUS a simple blend of flavors that play so well together. Carne asada(steak), salsa, guacamole and cheese yum! I will definitely order The Sonoran again. It may be my favorite crepe yet!  Next crepe on my personal must try: The Rosario, love me some chorizo! I'll update after I am able to try.  I usually order coffee, but another popular choice is the mimosa sampler... which I have also tried. Who doesn't love mimosas?! Is that a trick question? Crepe Expectations goes above and beyond champagne and Oj. They have so many flavors! TRY THEM! My personal favorite is watermelon. But I have yet to try them all so it could change. You get 3 generous sized "sampler" mimosas for $10... deal of the century.  Now with all this great stuff being said, it is usually busy. I've only ever gone on the weekend. But the wait is well worth it. Also, not sure if it is every Sunday or just a particular Sunday of every month but, the plaza (in which Crepe Expectations resides) hosts a farmers market market making choices for parking slim. I was still able to find parking it just took a couple minutes longer and a few more steps to get there.  I've always enjoyed sitting out on the patio(larger seating area then inside)especially when the weather is nice.  I'm excited to go again soon and take all of my friends that visit from out of town.. particularly from LA (where the crepes are tiny and over priced) can't believe I forgot to mention the crepes are very fairly priced. And well worth every penny!  See you soon Crepe Expectations!

XHGSYqgOE6TYKS0FaD6FWA.text: Oh lord! Just go here and enjoy the beautiful vibe and delicious everything!! LOVE this place. The chorizo with banana on the side was bomb dot com!

PuShVkdyO1Bqr5ZCHKioDQ.text: Great service, great food, highly recommend!  They offer breakfast, savoury, and sweet crepes, mimosas, wine, beer, coffee, juices. Their food is amazing and their prices are well worth it. Huge portions! Mimosa sampler (3) for $10!   Can't get enough of this place.   UPDATE: Still great food. Will not be back because of whatever jerk was working the floor on 4/29/17 10am. At a seat yourself place, he rudely told us multiple times where we may and may not sit even after letting him know I had someone else coming. He then told me that I never mentioned that and was aggravated. Ended up leaving before my friend arrived because I didn't feel welcome. Called my friend and took our business next door. Horrible attitude especially for someone in customer service. Sorry to inconvenience you, won't be back again.   Everyone else (busser, cooks, & cashier were nice). Still love Jenn from last time! She's great.

lYz-5L3TFmmr0XWUvzAHWA.text: Stellar, amazing, spectacular, fantastic, wonderful establishment!!!! Always a wonderful meal here. Everything is delicious here, I mean it too! every G.D. thing is delicious here. We come every Wednesday to this restaurant, between the hordes of people I bring here I have tried EVERY crepe on this restaurant menu! Yes you can go to the strip and get your high-priced fancy pants crepes, and they too will be good but none as delicious, as interesting, intricate & well-planned as these tasty bad boys. No I was not paid for this review, I'm just a super fan. Please come here and enjoy a wonderful brunch

wK-dIeTja3K8Ovl4DR6xpA.text: I like the people who work there they're friendly and cool. Im just not sold on what the hype is about. Yet.

xtTMX_CxJpFTyTUjyCXQ0g.text: This place has amazing people working there! Always happy and helpful! 4 stars because I wish the servings were larger. I come hungry and always leave happy, just not full enough.

ef--PlKvTqgrSZAkPxFi4g.text: This place needs to expand already. I have been at this place for a few years and now they are continually busy.  Some things you need to know:  -You pay the cashier and then sit where you want with your number. Sometimes they get so busy they will seat you based on inside/outside preference.  -Breakfast usually comes with a side of bananas or cottage cheese Lunch savory crepes come with salad or soup.  -Free cucumber or lemon water  -Fun little origami collection you can add to on register -They advertise specials on the side. Make sure you try them.   Everything that I have tried has been very good. Sometimes I don't like the guac inside so I will ask for just sliced avocados.  The staff is always very friendly. I think people just get confused with tipping cause its not a full waiter service restaurant. They should consider expanding soon and being a full on restaurant instead of ordering in the front. Decor and style is cutesy and people love their mimosas.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory crepe. This one is the Sonora but too hard to tell here.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chocolate goodness!

r7_NolyNgogxEmHnICEbsQ.text: I looooove French crepes ! First visit was piccobello. We ordered 3 mimosa's (10 dollar - loved the blood orange one). I had the simple delights (5.75 dollar) with banana (1 dollar). My hubby had the Perfect Combination (7.75 dollar) and a cappuccino (3.25 dollar).  No 5 stars because the 2nd time we went there, the crepes were not good at all. I got the wrong mimosa (but was replaced with the correct one) and I became very sick from the hot chocolate (toooooooooooooo sweet, it was almost pure sugar!).

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Perfect Combination
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. view inside
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 mimosa&#39;s

x-xA3eZPQ6IvO95Fc8AdWg.text: Came here cause my cousins house was closed by.. not cause it was on triple ds.. pretty disappointed with my breakfast crepe.. eggs. Bacon, swish cheese,mushroom.. pretty dried with with no sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eh

6N1U80nteCiBINkm_3KlTQ.text: So I really wasn't sure on what to expect here. I took my family for a quick weekend breakfast, and was pleasantly surprised!  We ordered the Avalon, the Nutty Classic, the Monterey, the Perfect Combination, and the William Tell.  The Avalon was so satisfying! It was probably my favorite of the bunch. The goat cheese provided a level of complex flavors that I thoroughly enjoyed. The William Tell was definitely good, but I did not enjoy the apples as much as the pears in the Avalon. The perfect combination was just that - strawberries and chocolate. The Nutty Classic was overwhelming with all of the Nutella, but it was good for the kids. The Monterey was delicious! I usually don't like savory crepes but I made an exception with this one.  The service was delightful and the atmosphere was loud, but cheerful. I will definitely be back!!

w-wqBbDAN7Rl4-ebopKlzw.text: My crepe expectations are very high, considering all of the crepe competition in town. I can honestly say that this place exceeded them all!  This cute restaurant is adorned in purple, so how could I not love this place? They offer savory, sweet or breakfast crepes. I have never tried a savory crepe because my sweet tooth always wins the battle but this time, I was determined to try something different.  The cashier recommended The Sonora (Carne Asada Steak, Roasted Tomato Salsa, Guacamole and Jack Cheese) for $9. I love how they have TV screens where you can watch your crepe masterpiece come to life! My crepe was so tasty. The meat was flavorful and there was the right amount of heat. I was so full that my friend and I couldn't order a sweet crepe for dessert like we originally had planned.  They have an amazing beverage selection including champagne, wine and mimosas. I opted for water, and they offer free cucumber or lemon infused water. Perfect touch!  I got The Nutty Classic (Nutella, Fresh Chopped Hazelnuts, Fresh Whipped Cream and Powdered Sugar) to take home to my husband. He LOVED it, especially the fresh chopped hazelnuts. It is definitely a different take than other crepe places that offer the same ol' ingredients.  From reading other reviews, I'm glad I went on a Monday morning. They were still pretty busy considering it was still early and it was a weekday. I can't wait to come back!

8IBmuTuGyMnm01o2JjAY5w.text: Definite diamond in the rough.  The crepes are fantastic, the manager/owner and staff was very friendly and attentive.  The atmosphere is nice and there is outdoor seating should weather permit.  Great place to grab lunch (highly recommend The Grand Turk) or to grab dessert.  We were too full from our savory crepes to try a sweet one, but we'll surely be back to try one.  We watched a few get made and they looked amazing.

N-quxby8OBL5KVoulJiqXw.text: Both savory and sweet types work for me. I could do without so much banana as a side dish (maybe half a banana instead of a full one), but the crepes make up for it.

lej1bJ1NiHSs064dPU3ITQ.text: I have been going here with my family for about a year and a half now. I decided it was time to leave a well deserved review. This place is the best.... The food, the people, and the service. Love, love, love. Some of our family favorites are the fruity mimosa flight, Nutella crepe, the Monterey and the Marco Polo, and the best coffee in town.

uVWynrUbbBOc9KM1NAVljg.text: Love, love, LOVE Crepe Expectations. My first visit was with BFF Lily in the Summer of 2011 and we fell in love. The space is adorable and owners Ana and Larry are amazing (Edit: found out that there are new owners)! Ana was super friendly and I knew immediately that I was coming back. I had the GRAND TURK (sauteed turkey, tomato, guacamole, black olives, and jack cheese) and it was phenomenal. Lily tried another savory crepe and we shared a dessert one (William Tell + candied walnuts). We enjoyed the mimosa trio and overall, everything was deliciously delicious. Also, servings are generous.  Because I loved it so much, I contacted Larry and asked if they would host a birthday party for 40+ people (joint for me and Ruben). They said yes and we were able to close the restaurant for our private event for the evening! And it went wonderfully. Everyone ordered whatever they pleased and I got to try crepes along the way. I also enjoyed a bottle of Cupcake Moscato purchased as a gift by one of my dear friends. Everyone loved the crepes and most importantly, the staff! It was so much fun. The best part was that only 1-2 guests had actually heard of this place and no one had tried it previously, so it created lots of new fans.

9P7RQzE4mIsuvZA2pMVLXA.text: Yay! I'm a fan.  Me, hubby and our crepe loving friend went on a BUSY morning around 11am.  The place is realllly small and the line was to the door :)   We rarely head to this area to dine but our friend swore by it and I was down to get my crepe on!  We ordered at the counter and the owner, he was very nice and cheery.  Finally after about 20-30 minutes a table opened up and we grabbed it. They do have outside heated seating but it was CHILLY that day so we said NOPE.  I ordered the Berry and it was sooooooo yummy!!!!!!   Hubby ordered the daily special some kind of chicken thingy lol.  And our crepe friend ordered...I can't remember...but he said he recently went back again and ordered the same thing :) must have been good :)  I would go back again if in the area or for those yummmmy looking mimosa's!

Cefj_uC7walcf0Ei0rp2sQ.text: This place is amazing.  Had the pirate and shared a mimosa trio with my gf while her daughter had the monkey.  Great food, wonderful staff, and awesome environment.    I love this place.

obk9436ao4jsm4DkDGq_lw.text: I love crepes but I also love families. This place is a family run business start to finish--I got to meet the chef's lil one while waiting for my crepe!  I had one with blueberry and lemon curd. It was delicious and I want it right now. I also ordered the lemonade of the day--strawberry with actual berries inside. The whole meal was a perfect sweet treat, perfect for a spring day.   My friend got the one with chicken and homemade salsa. I would drink that salsa if I could. I'm not usually one for savory crepes but this one made me a convert. I can't wait to go back and try them again!  The outdoor patio is really nice, though it is shaded: perfect for summer, but a little chilly in the spring.

FxkKjSQCDsZGiwf0VOYpXg.text: Always come here with my fiance or friend. Crepes & staff always on point. Lemon water/cucumber water self serving area, ah perf!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The William Tell crepe.

loNpTmXJmqDt_4-7fs-ljg.text: When we arrived to eat breakfast last weekend around 9:30am, they were already pretty busy. The inside of the shop is small, and there are only a few tables outside, so I wasn't especially surprised when the host/waiter turned our party of 7 away. Luckily, the guy behind the counter (seemed like the owner) wouldn't take no for an answer. He found us a table outside with a bunch of little mini tables, pushed them all together for us, and remembered what kind of drink I casually mentioned. Great service! Plus points for being in my neighborhood and locally-owned (I'm guessing). The crepes were all good; caprese, ham & egg, pear & goat cheese were the ones I sampled. Only complaint: I wish there was more cheese in the caprese instead of so much pesto sauce. In addition, they have a wide selection of mimosas and even offer a little flight so you can try different juices. I had the blood orange and it was excellent. Prices are just ok.

fD4bWbomEmc7eXyssdAtGg.text: The Crepes are delicious.  But the wait is horrible. On a Saturday or Sunday expect to wait an hour to get a table, even if you are told it's "about a 15 minute wait".  After you get seated expect to wait another 30-45 minutes for your food to arrive.  The crepes are great, but waiting for an hour and half for your food to arrive from start to finish is incomparable.

5rmJ17yE7hPoMVY1h1wR8w.text: Thee best crepes I've ever had. I'm having dreams about the triple berry crepe and their amazing whip cream. The breakfast yum crepe is super delicious too. I will be back!

JXLV7yoB-0J04HuZ5f0gug.text: Ate here today for lunch around 1 pm. Place was packed inside and out. Crazy hours as they close at 3 everyday. I was told not to go near the place on Sunday as its a mad house. Great wait person outside who told us to go in and place our order and they bring it to your table. Service and food could not have been any better. We can't wait to go back. Next time we will split an entree crepe so we can get a desert crepe.

VnytDqvRTo0WNrPsY01c8Q.text: It was simply the best crepe ever and great customer service, we all had sweet/savory crepes all were wonderful. Amazing have to try this wonderful food.

YKJdOcbYwmqFySKO6jmGBA.text: Easily one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, you have to check them out!  Their crepes are extraordinarily crafted and delicious.  My favorite choices are the Sonora and the Monkey, but you really can't go wrong with any of their options!  They can be a little crowded on the weekends around brunch time (11-1), so plan for a little bit of a wait or come before or after that time.  I don't think I've ever had to wait for a table during the week.  Crepe Expectations is one of my favorite places to show off to family and friends who come visit Vegas.  Try it out for yourself, you won't be disappointed!

CRgz_Pwp7dPUhb_9NsLsWw.text: So we drove across town to try this place out. We had 2 crepes a fresh squeezed OJ and a hot chocolate.  The decor is nice and you can even watch them create your tasty creation of batter and sugary sweets on the monitor above the crepe station!  First the hot chocolate came out. Soooo goood!!! Amazing and tasty!  Then the OJ came out. It was definitely not fresh squeezed. Maybe due to the fact they were closing they would just rush the order and give me the juice from the jug. The lady at the register mentioned that they have fresh squeezed OJ or some from the jug so this lead me to believe they gave me juggy OJ. Not cool. I wasn't in the mood to create a hassle about it though.  Then the crepes came out. The clucker was ok. It was good, but it didn't make me believe I was eating a crepe. It was bulky and the egg and meat just overpowered the actual crepe. You couldn't really enjoy it as a crepe. It was more of a a standard breakfast plate.   The Elvis though! Oh man this was excellent! I added Nutella to it which made it even more epic!! If we just had this if give the place 4 stars! The bacon and banana and peanut butter and Nutella was just great! To top it off it was smothered in caramel! Sooooo gooood!! A must try!   I'm giving this place 3 stars. The fresh squeezed orange juice wasn't great and the clucker wasn't our idea if a crepe. The hot chocolate and Elvis was great though. 2 out of 4. Not bad, not great. Everything was a bit pricey for what you got. But not gouging.

8x9Ab6O0m6hMBrpTRzUKcw.text: Crepe Expectations made a believer out of me.  crepes were never very important to me until i had the savory carne asada...omg!!! Tender strips of perfectly seasoned meat but the winner of the plate was this delicate, moist, light and delicious crepe that enveloped the meat.  Yum

Kv1uLN9UmWUyCAY3pnlBFw.text: The food was so amazing! If your in Las Vegas definitely make the trip to go eat here!!

kZrVB9ZJ29rQzY_0N6FSsw.text: The food was ok.all I can say is hire some servers. No one likes to get up and get up and order, and get your own coffee

2GdDf8bQ56AgGqxJEOHlTQ.text: Delicious!!!! Tasty!!! Excellent!!! A must try. Small place. Customer service is friendly & the guy recommended an excellent vegetarian crepe.

YRA8vD0iBC-8GOKs88hoFQ.text: Thanks to Crepe Expectations, I think that I've developed an obsession over crepes. With their extensive crepe menu ranging from the savory, to the wide array of crepes to satisfy any sweet tooth, this place has you covered. They even have some breakfast crepes available all day for those breakfast lovers out there.   Walking in, I could immediately tell that there was a lavender theme going on with this place. While being surrounded by these colors was a bit threatening to my masculinity, I was happy to see that they had ESPN playing on the TVs to compensate while I devoured my crepe.  For a light dinner, I went with The Razorback: a savory crepe filled with pork tenderloin, spices, potato, tomato and red onions. It reminded me of a pork tamale, just with a very light and fluffy exterior. The side of ripe diced watermelon that came with the crepe was also a nice touch to complement the meal. I was pleasantly surprised. Everything was artfully prepared, with even a hovering camera above the crepe station so that you can see it all in action.  Their drink menu is just as extensive as their crepes; with wines, spirits and beer to fulfill the alcohol needs; to juices, coffees and teas fit enough to cater to the coffeehouse connoisseur. They also offer some complementary cucumber water, which was very refreshing. Be sure to check out their imported premium soda chalkboard to see what they have. It's bound to cycle through some changes from time to time, but their choices of soda are always delicious.  Throughout the entire visit, I was able to tell that the owners of this establishment run it with a passion. From the moment I set foot in the door, they made sure I had a good experience, from choosing the food, all the way to the end of the meal. Friendly, personable service is often hard to come by in Vegas. I'm glad to see that they offer it in leaps in bound here.

pZxnMhHE4g_97hGbzBo4_A.text: I went two days in a row for a delish breakfast under $10. two qualms. The soup was a lil salty and seemed like it came out of a can. The Rosarito (?) which was chorizo, scrambled egg, jack cheese and avocado was too heavy on the chorizo for me and it was hard to even see that there was any egg in it.   Now The Caprese which was tomato's, mozzarella, pesto, and I added grilled chicken was AMAZING. Everything tasted nice and fresh and ti was sooo damn good. nom nom.  The Berry Delight was fine. I wasn't so wow'd.   The staff was ace, Larry was so friendly and funny. I guess my experience was a bit hit or miss when it came to the crepe's but stuff is fresh and loads of choice, worth the lil drive and easy to find  :D.  And loved the decor!

mRiOnNZyi2jku3hz9C5efA.text: Crepe Expectations is a stylish little corporate European style cafe serving up a wide variety of crepes.  Now I'm not the biggest crepe fan in the world (usually a little too sweet for me), but this place has plenty of tasty options, with a wide variety of coffees, beers, and wines.    It's a solid place for a coffee date with some inventive food options.  The decor is stylish stone and slightly darkened.  I was there for breakfast, but it seemed like a decent, slightly quirky choice for a first date.  The crepes themselves are light and airy pancakes made mostly from eggs.  They're a classic option in French and Swiss breakfasts, but Crepe Expectations has taken the classic crepe and fused in a colorful variety of filling options.    While I was there, I started off with the Sonora.  We're in the SW and I wanted to know what the French crepe filled with filled with flank steak, fresh avocado and cheese would taste like.  The steak was properly cooked and still tender but I'm not sure if the Sonora is a great dish overall.  The steak is heavy and I appreciate a filling meal, but the crepe made the dish feel more like a wet burrito.  I loved the contents, just wasn't won over by the combination of crepe and burrito filling.  I also had the Avalon--a crepe filled with goat cheese, honeyed pear and walnuts.  Dear god that is sweet.  A little too sweet.  I loved the consistency of the walnuts and the softened pears, but the honeyed pear completely overwhelmed the tartness in the goat cheese.  That said, I want to love this crepe.  Even sitting here, I want to reach back into the past and dial back the honey on the crepe.  When I took matters into my own hands, controlled what was on my fork, and made sure there was plenty of goat cheese, it was a really wonderful flavor combination.    The coffee was well-roasted and rich.  And they had nice little touches, like offering cucumber water and lemon water with the meal.  The beer and wine menu had some nice small brewery/small winery options and I'm a big fan of this place.  All in all, Crepe Expectations has earned a firm spot in my brunch rotation.  Based on the food, this place gets a solid 3.5 stars.  Inventive menu--that's pretty close to delicious even if the flavors were a little too sweet for me or a little off in my opinion.  The food was still prepared expertly and I do like imagination in a menu.  I threw in the extra .5 star because the staff is very welcoming and helpful.  And the people we met there on Sunday morning were very nice.  Good atmosphere and good people takes Crepe Expectations up to 4 stars.

ZIN6r1Xqu1rwxXliKLquGQ.text: I am so giddy because I luv crepes! I found out about the opening in the zip code magazine I get in the mail, and bookmarked it forthwith.  I knew that this creperie served crepes on a plate, not hand-held style, but so what?  They serve up YUM! Even though it was a late lunch for me, I opted for a sweet crepe.  I will definitely need to get back here to try savory and breakfast crepes, but The Avalon called out to me: buttered pears, goat cheese, candied walnuts.... it was amazing!  So was the service.  I was the only one inside (a few brave souls were eating outside) and I had a nice chat with the two ladies working.  I am intrigued by the flavored mimosas and will come back for those (they have a 3 mimosa sampler for $10 or one for $6) - white peach, passion fruit, lychee, traditional, pomegranate.  This would be a really fun place for me to get the yelpettes of Vegas for a crepe and mimosa brunch before my wedding (so keep your eyes open for that, belles!) Yes, I will be back...they have guacamole for savory crepes and lemon curd for sweet ones so I have to come back for those options! The interior is swanky, purple hues, fun art and mirrors on the walls, nice tables (I sat at the one by the crepe-making station), flat screen TVs, and even really nice flatware! Crepely speaking, you cannot go wrong here.

oUN7qNHKVQGlu0qOpVb5QA.text: I had to write another review....I LOVE THIS PLACE!   I return on a regular basis and now have been trying their specials.   The point is you can not go wrong with anything you order in this restaurant.   The mimosa's  are amazing especially  the white peach!  We loved the Elvis and added chocolate.   The nice thing here is you can create your own crepe or add more to the crepe your ordering and its always perfect. Their Chorizo is quality sausage with just enough spice to make it a great addition to any crepe.   If you like crepes this is the place to go!   With a flight of Mimosa's!  :)

ZobwXeF0ikt_yVM3eRk1Kw.text: Rolled in at 11am on a Wednesday morning and was HUNGRY. I had just come in from a late night flight the day before and was ready to take a bite out of my bff's arm, who joined me this morning at Crepe Expectations (shh don't tell her).   We were greeted by the NICEST smile from Ana, who turned out to be a sweetheart. She is one of the owners and puts so much care into everything she does -- as it would become evident later. My friend and I each ordered a savory crepe - I had the Marco Polo (italian sausage, egg, jack cheese) while my friend ordered the Turk (turkey, jack, guacamole). We shared the mimosa trio made from fresh fruit puree (guava, passion fruit, and white peach). I opted for a coffee (illy espressemente coffee...amazing)! The mimosas came out quick and we absolutely loved the passion fruit and white peach ones - so delicious!  When we got the plates, I was shocked. The crepes, aside from being beautifully presented, came with a side of fruit (cantaloupe), and were generously portioned. I was expecting the usual crepes-that-would-barely-qualify-as-a-snack size crepes, and had mentally prepared myself to be hungry after. NOT THE CASE. I was stuffed and the fruit was a perfect way to top things off. My friend and I were SOLD!  Then, we remembered we had ordered a dessert crepe (once again, my above frame of mind of expecting tiny portions) -- the William Tell, which has sauteed apples, caramel, whipped cream. We were craving nuts and Ana suggested throwing in some caramelized walnuts. AMAZING. TRUST THIS WOMAN WHEN SHE GIVES YOU SUGGESTIONS!!  All in all, we were gushing to Ana about how we loved everything, and she let us in on a few secrets. My friend and I dislike overly-sweet desserts, and this was perfectly done. Ana mentioned that the crepe batter doesn't have any sugar -- no wonder!   Also, we watched her make a customer the Veggie crepe. It was filled with sauteed veggies and hummus. She told us that it was 150 calories! For such a generous portion, I'd definitely come back just to try it. What a total win-win, when you can eat something hearty (and a crepe at that) and have it just be 150 calories!   Great food, great staff, well priced items for generous portions... I will definitely be back soon!

sHEvNeXSL8NyI86fpFe6aw.text: Another place that focuses on one thing (crepes) and does it very well. Watching the make the crepes adds to the anticipation.  The prep area is clean and organized and the employees are cheerful, creating a good atmosphere.  You can have an elite breakfast for $10, if you like crepes and don't add alcohol. The flavors are inventive. I have yet to try all the types but I am working on it. For the really cost conscious, they have lemon or cucumber flavored ice water available.

FFvICQNhP3X4t6aN6cvVrw.text: The wait was LONG, but I wasn't in a big hurry so it wasn't a big deal. Got the Rosarita, which is chorizo egg guacamole and jack cheese and it was delicious. Great selection of drinks including many different flavor mimosas, wines, beers. I went with the fresh berry lemonade and was very happy with it. If you've got time to wait during brunch hours on the weekend, it's a great place to eat. Definitely would recommend to others.

EfUUSTHa9I7R51WiG3krSQ.text: So, I'm biased because I already know I love crepes.  That is more than I can say for the boy who, after being served, asked why there was a pancake on his food.  I love the modernly styled atmosphere, and the novelty of the "crepe cam" (it is exactly as it sounds, camera feeding to a TV so you can watch your crepes being made).  And, as everyone said, the staff were incredibly friendly, that will keep me coming back.  Crepe Expectations does a great job with having a diverse menu of savory and sweet "dishes".  Additionally, they have fantastic prices on beer for a boutique cafe!  Most of the standard beers were only $3, and they have a pretty extensive wine and specialty drinks menu for a creperie.  They also offer the treat of all-you-can-drink serve-yourself water infused with lemon or cucumber.  Yum.  If you want "plain water" I think you might have to request that specially.  Bother the flavors were subtle enough I think even finicky folks can handle it.  Warning: one crepe per person is sufficient.  I expected street food style where we may want a couple each.  Bad move.   We discovered that three crepes for two people was far too much food.    I tried the Sunday Morning - which was just what I was hoping for on a Sunday morning, egg, seasoned potatoes, and cheese wrapped in a crepe.  It was a yummy savory breakfast, but honestly, with such a hearty filling, the crepe itself kind of fades into the background.  That said, I much prefer it to a standard omelet, primarily for the side bites of mostly crepe.  I do love eggy crepes...  I also tried The Avalon - pears, goat cheese, walnuts, and honey.  The flavors of pear, goat cheese, and walnut were rich and delicious.  However, the honey was a bit overwhelmingly sweet.  I guess eating three bites instead of 30 at a time is better for me anyway.  More for later!  Summary: great variety of food, friendly staff, ample creativity in dishes, good prices, I just wish the crepe to food ratio was a little higher.  That's not enough of a deterrent to keep me away, though.

AlZJvTsasdoUP5BAZyL8JQ.text: This is going to be quick. Everything on the menu that I have tried is delicious, and Ive been down half of it so far. You can choose between a dessert crepe, breakfast style, or go with an entree/special crepe. The staff is fantastic, and friendly, and the prices....your getting a lot of good food for a great price. Feel free to enjoy the spa water they have available. Choices of both Lemon and cucumber infused water available to sample. Oh, I almost forgot! If you want a soda, they have a list of tasty fizzy drinks too! I personally go with the ginger beer. It gets busy here, but even with a long line the food still comes out quickly, so don't let the line fool you.

_AamX6CinIZe65gJLiwzAw.text: So many types of crepes, so little time!  My buddy April F. and I went to visit Crepe Expectations on a recent beautiful morning. The staff is very friendly and go above and beyond to make sure your needs are met.  I love that they serve a wide variety of alcohol (beer, wine and bubbly!). It was great to have 5 different flavors of mimosas to choose from (regular orange juice, lychee, passionfruit, white peach, and pomegranate). I highly recommend ordering the sampler ($10) in which you can choose 3 different mimosas.  Now on to the crepes! There were so many varieties of savory, sweet and breakfast crepes. I opted for the Caprese which was tomato, basil, pesto, and mozzarella cheese. It was SUPER YUMMY. I am a savory crepe type of girl and am always disappointed when normal run of the mill crepe places only have 2 or 3 types to choose from. There are over 10 savory types to choose from here! Can't wait to try the Pirate! The crepes run between $5-$10.   The only downfall is it is far from my side of town. I guess my waistline will thank me for that.   Thanks Crepe Expectations for going beyond my great expectations for a yummy crepe!

j8EFMNqLBHnzPcdwsoC64A.text: They are always busy, and it's definitely worth the wait if you have to wait. I've eaten here several times. They are very friendly, any substitution will be accommodated, and down to the free water infused with cucumber or lemon, they serve exceptionally high quality food and drink.

OHbEWQbjKSHgMvQvE6FlrQ.text: Wow! Way tasty! So good I had a second one! The pirate crepe (like tuna melt) then a bananas fosters crepe! I'm goin back!!

mzwkAe5Ja8Jr5TYAOE-G2A.text: Had the Sanora twice, come here every time we are in Las Vegas. Food and staff are always great. Extremely busy the last two time we came, but well worth the wait

VP39SXuLiDStXZVs8DlyhQ.text: So many choices of mimosas to choose from! Passion fruit and strawberry was yummy! Tuna crepe was delicious. Service was excellent.

x29nNECF1EMj0oUL2UdNHA.text: OMG, best crepes in Las Vegas! The atmosphere, service and food is truly phenomenal! Prices are great too! Do your palette a favor and make this place a regular stop!

fPt0DfEqCFrgnV3emuQmbg.text: Great service, Good food Cheap even can't get better than that wife found this place she had a crepe craze craving and no shes not pregnant so we drove here from the hotel went inside greeted by a great guy (sorry forgot his name) and tells us how long it will be to wait about 15 - 20 so no problem we really wanted to try it so we waited then called us after 15 or so mins. and gave us an option either table or booth since i had kids with me might as well get table the 5 (kids 6,11 wife, mother in law and me) of us ordered we got little italy, the caprese with grilled chicken, the sonora, the crepelet, the perfect combination (for dessert after we were done) good portions i guess we were hungry because after we were done with our initial crepes i just started to attack the dessert crepe then everybody else went for it,  it was hilarious everybody just got like a quarter of the crepe from all sides there was nothing left after that i wanted to get 1 more then my wife said we should save space for lunch. aww gees :( nough said definitely coming back word of advice please open in los angeles at least.

5k-YBsiYstNJZ5xlmeqegA.text: Best crepes in town!  Maybe even better vanilla lattes.  My girlfriend and I have had both the savory options and the sweet options (my favorite is the Monkey).  Haven't disliked a single one yet.  We did the memosa sampler when we had family in town and all of the flavors were very refreshing.  It is a small space, and it gets relatively warm inside pretty quickly, but it seems the food lives up to the packed house there usually is around the place.  There are a lot of options on Eastern and this is one we repeatedly visit each month.

U-wMU1YwoYiNv3heiVNJaQ.text: Their crepes are amazeballs! Sweet or savory, you can't go wrong. My favorite sweet crepe is the one with sauteed pears & goat cheese and my favorite savory crepe is the one with egg & chorizo. Yummo!! The place is quite small so get there early, it fills up fast.

GqQVUouy7B66WYia4A6qlQ.text: Small, cafeteria style atmosphere. You order up front, get a number, line up in a hallway and wait for a table smashed against your neighbor. Very busy on the weekends, so it's hard to sit and enjoy with all the hustle and bustle. Very friendly staff helps their case. Lots of menu items to choose from. Portion size is decent. Somewhat pricey for brunch and no refill options for sodas (you get a can). Check it out if you're stopping by for a quick bite. Find another place if you're catching up with girlfriends on the weekend.

8tkah4eAyHch--zDYO-uZA.text: Delicious food and wonderful service. Enjoyed the Greek crepe as well as the Berry one. Awesome how their menu is not limited to sweet crepes. The mimosa sampler was delicious. Enjoyed being able to sample their top 3 (peach, blood orange, and guava - LOVED the peach one!!). Service was wonderful and they offer outdoor seating which is awesome as long as the weather is right. Will definitely be returning to Crepe Expectations!!!

DNr32YcycFVoOIQLNvQtGQ.text: We tried the Rosarito, Monterey and the Berry Delight. All were very good, perfect portion size and delicious. I had a blood orange mimosa which was more champagne then juice, which is fine by me. Not sure I'd order it again with the blood orange.  The staff was friendly and efficient. We will be back!

bBo5BpHoOUj9UPIOrJ3K-g.text: One of the best creperies I've ever been to.  Went straight for the sweet crepes as I always do, brother also went for the sweet crepes. I can't remember the exact name of the dishes we got, but his was filled with mixed berries and mine was filled with apples with a bit of ice cream on top.  Oh man... Fantastic. Nothing short of fantastic either I mean it was just that damn good. I've ate the best crepes Los Angeles has to offer and let me tell ya, this is right up there on par. I don't think I could go back to Vegas and not visit this place at least once from now on. The options were just huge, and I love having extra options other then the typical strawberry, banana, and nutella or chocolate sauce.  Very friendly people here as well. Found out this place only recently opened as well, and hell all the reviews don't lie, this place is just that good. If you're in Vegas, treat yourself to the best crepes you'll have in a long time.

Qo_AVvHHnxN8FTk_p6pDjg.text: Celiac friendly!!! Went to lunch with my mom who has celiacs and is extremely gluten sensitive... Their gluten free batter taste good and is not dry. The only item not gluten free, is the Sonora because of the seasoning on the carne asada. Speaking of the Sonora, my personal favorite!! It is one item that I actually get cravings for which drives me to come back. All in all, through and through, this place rocks!!!

oNkxy7U8AlLMJAXjQO4rgA.text: Had the berry crepe. Weird aftertaste and dry. should add a compote or whipped cream inside the crepe instead of lukewarm berries with nothing else inside.  Mimosas where decent. Overall, disappointing experience with average food and service.

0B_SGN3VJczZ1oRy2lv_pQ.text: Lou is larger than life whose crepes equal the  creperie in paris. Dickens would approve

lI3CFIsz5uehcGcS98emTA.text: I'm a fan.  I've been here 3 times since they opened their store location, after being introduced to them when they were operating the mobile unit.  The food is AMAZING.  I love the Rosarito, which has delicious chorizo and homemade guacamole.  I'm also a fan of the Grand Turk, which also incorporates the guac.  Most recently I tried the Bomber, and was impressed with the flavor of the meatball.  It's got some good kick!  Ana has some serious culinary talent!  I recommend going with a friend, as I can't eat a whole savory crepe and have a dessert crepe too, and it is a shame to miss out on the dessert crepes.  When I went with a friend we shared the Frisco, and it was out of this world!  The lemon curd is perfection.  I can tell the ingredients are quality, it really makes for an amazing product.   I should also mention, the staff is very friendly.  They truly appreciate your business.  The decor is beautiful (check out the bathrooms, very pretty) and I enjoy lingering after my meal with a nice cup of coffee.   There's a nice patio seating area, which is great for people watching on the weekends.  You get a very nice dining experience, and the price is not hard on your wallet either.  Enjoy!

PdpxZLWEO4Yug00WG3TZIg.text: I was so happy when this place opened up. I love crepes but out here so many people mess them up. This place, however, has it down. My friend and I made it a point to go for breakfast and was happy to see so many selections. We wanted to try a savory one but I was hesitant since I've always had sweet crepes so I picked The Frisco (blueberry & lemon curd) and my friend picked The William Tell(apples & caramel) and we both had the berry lemonade.          Mine was good they didn't cook the blueberries, which is always nice, instead they just barely warmed up in the beautifully folded crepe. They could have tossed the berries in a lil more lemon curd but the crepe itself was tender and slightly sweet cooked just perfectly and the whipped cream, which they put on the side of crepe how I like instead of on top, was fresh which in my book is always a good thing. My friend's was also very good not too much caramel and her apples cooked perfectly.          The staff  is great. The owners are very nice welcoming people with a very spunky attitude and are willing to answer any questions and make numerous suggestions. The decor is awesome I love any place that uses a lot of purple and modern touches in their decor and it's nice that they have a few tables outside so you can sit and relax in the nice weather. I would definitely keep going here even if it's so far away from my house and next time I will definitely try a savory one.

I3yLCuIdVRtLvtE2m1DCig.text: Best crepes on this side of the pond. The fiance is gluten intolerant and their gluten-free crepes are phenomenal. We were staying on the strip and had to take a cab to get here (based on Yelp reviews) on our latest trip to Las Vegas. Worth every penny and will definitely be back. Great service by the owner and his wife and even gave us tips on how to improve our crepe recipes.   We had two savory crepes (the Rosarito and the Salmon special) and a sweet (the Avalon). All were fantastic. I swear by crepes with Nutella but the Avalon may have turned me - buttered pears, goat cheese and candied walnuts!  The mimosa trio sampler is great and don't leave without trying the white peach mimosa.

hn79Zs0ni88Zqm4LHxLtRA.text: Great food. Can't go wrong with any of the choices. Mimosa sampler perfect for 1 or to share. Nice shaded patio. We always bring our dog.

0O0rFYAL-t9sx9PyhXITIQ.text: The best crepes in town!! Try the strawberry or cherry mimosa. The service is excellent and you can have just about any type of crepe possible. Get off the strip and eat here!!

YQmOKz1q1vkxKtJiE-pBHw.text: Nice purple decor.  Very cool place and we were lucky to get a table on such a nice day.    Ordered Bananas Foster crepe and the Frisco (blueberry and lemon).  Light and deliciously sweet. Crepes look great, coffee was fine, mixed berry lemonade was great.    Second order - Perfect Combination (chocolate and strawberry) and a Little Italy (pepperoni and mozzarella).  Little Italy came with soup, but I didn't pay it much attention.  Second set of crepes were delicious as well.    Extra points for customer service. The ladies at "crepe bar" noticed me commenting on how awesome the crepes looked as they cooked it and humored me. Guy at front also offered a lemonade refill to go.

0ybbFYZVuRWgy4nNItjECg.text: Lazy Sunday afternoon eating crepes on a patio...bomb day.    Staff was so friendly.  I love going to a place where people enjoy their jobs.  I had the William Tell - caramel apple crapes with whipped cream.  Very sweet, like dessert for breakfast.  My husband had the Sonora - steak quac salsa and cheese.  I had some, it was medium spicy, the steak was tender, juicy and easy to eat in crepe form.  I will be back.  Next time I'm getting a Nutella crepe.

7xJLlR9HFHgtuB5EJStgPw.text: By far one of my favorite places for breakfast. You may have to wait awhile for your food as it's a small restaurant and a small kitchen. However, I would wait a whole day if that's what it takes. Amazing Crepes... Wait no, phenomenal Crepes!! I met the owner Lou, who is a very cool guy. He's there daily and runs the place from open to close. I can't think of a better place when it comes to Crepes Expectations!!

u06PdP-q5BBziKQt4ZSTCw.text: I'm not a huge fan of crepes and this place didn't turn me into a crepe lover, but it was still good enough for me to come back if anyone wants crepes. The prices are decent, the service is okay, and the selection is vast. We had the Rosarito - good chorizo, a nice blend of salty and slighty spicy - and the Monkey one - nothing can go wrong with nutella!! The crepes were soft and spongy and best of all, didn't taste like flour! We also had the mimosas, one raspberry and one blood orange - the raspberry wasn't bad, the blood orange didn't really taste like blood orange, just cough syrupy champagne. Not too bad, not too bad at all!

ONlZJPpESOaQhuD3OH8RYA.text: They do put the YUM in crepes!  So looking forward to going back and trying something new!  Sweet or savory, they have the crepe for you!   If you like a little kick, try the Monterey.. bacon, egg that's nice and spicy.. with a side of sliced bananas, its the perfect compliment.   Another one of my favorites is the Greek.. chicken, feta cheese, spinach and more YUM.  ,  My daughter loves the William Tell..apples & caramel!  It's nice that they have water flavored with lemon or cucumber. They also have an endless $3 cup of coffee..   I made the mistake of ordering tea, which is served in a small teapot, but at $4, its a bit pricey...  A venti tea at the corner coffee stop cost less and you get more..   Can't wait to go back for more crepes.. next time I'll stick to water...

nzj8c5jubcndm-ZRA9BRLQ.text: I looooove crepes and i love crepe expectations' crepes! They had a great selection of sweet and savory crepes! I got the Monkey one for the sweet and the Sonora for the savory. Both were delicious! I also love all the mimosa choices! Raspberry and Guava were really good. The ambiance of the place is fancier than what I expected but that's not a bad thing. The service was also great! Staff was super friendly. If I lived in Vegas, I would totally come more often!

mMOJvqpteW09E15sKWHDfQ.text: My husband found Crepe Expectations on Yelp when planning a surprise Vegas trip for my birthday. We were only in town for two days, and ended up there both days! Delicious food, super friendly and hard working staff. I'm usually a die hard for visiting Bouchon when we are in town for breakfast, and CE didn't make me miss it at all. The Monkey with added strawberries was outrageous and worth every calorie. We will definitely be back every time we visit. Thanks for quickly making us feel like part of the family!

dguEjLCaiMzIK9URfnpTQg.text: Not only is the food FABULOUS, but the people who work here are extremely friendly. Possibly some of the best service I've ever had.

hGJnzzHh7hh654lJMneFNQ.text: Absolutely the best crepes I have ever had! There's always a wait, which can be a little frustrating, but the staff & owners always go the extra mile to take care of everyone really well. And did I mention that their crepes are amazing?!

ng19YWdUoLTZqkeGUkqSFg.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. I always get top notch service & the food is insanely good. If you've never had savory crepes before I'd suggest one of those & if you're feeling extra hungry, a sweet crepe to share between you & your company. Don't forget the micheladas && the flavored (yaaas, flavored! mango, strawberry, blood orange, watermelon, the list goes on) mimosa trio sampler. There's literally only 1 complaint I have & I will still give them 5 stars cause it's simply not their fault...the restaurant is teeny tiny so expect a wait, especially on a Friday, Saturday &/or Sunday.

VJ3cEEQPd1cNrQ_osI1nPQ.text: OEmGee. Delicious! Great atmosphere! Delicious food! Mimosas are magical. Service is phenomenal. Had the Sonora and an a peach mimosa. Yummo!  Lemon and cucumber Water for free. Fidel soup. Yes please!  Can't wait to eat there next weekend!

YKVsEGPo4XVwlAA5CYGymA.text: Long wait but worth it. Staff was very attentive and very friendly. Food was great, if you sit in front of the cooking station be prepared to change your mind; everything looks great.

HHGMSTN8VdhMUcOclN9Blw.text: I love love love love crepes! But this place is amazing!! The owner is so friendly! Me being extremely pregnant came in here with my husband we both got the little Italy crepe but as suggested by the owner added ground Italian sausage to it, my husband got salad and it tasted so amazing the dressing the put on it is delicious reminded me of a lemony chili powder so amazing! I had soup as well it was a tomato chicken broth with noodles! I wish I didn't live in California because I would come here every weekend if I could!!!

3ifzpP_ivMqjQ6Sbh0R-gA.text: I was visiting for a company awards gala couple of months ago, and this was one of the places my partner and I went for brunch. The staff there were super friendly and hospitable! I love how you can watch them make your crepe!  It was so hard to choose what we wanted because everything looked and sounded so good! Their endless list of mimosas and bellinis were ridiculous! Too bad I'm not much of a drinker. Their decor and decorations are so cute. The owners obviously put in a lot of heart and soul into this neighborhood gem!  Their presentation is spot on, their portions are most definitely overly generous, and totally worth the value! I recommend Crepe Expectations to visitors or people that lives in the area! I wish they would open a place in Chicago!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hK_huSutvvzFNMXadaE0Jg.text: I found this restaurant on TripAdvisor and I forgot that I wanted to try this place until my husband asked me about it. On our last day in Las Vegas, we decided to venture out here instead of eating at the hotel. I had the crepe file with chorizo and avocado. It was a lot more food that it looks, but it was delicious. The crepe itself was very good too. My husband also enjoyed his crepe and gladly ate what I couldn't finish. We arrived as soon as they opened so we were served and got our food quickly.

ECOUiOcKWRhjCMUIyAnnRw.text: My absolute favorite Sunday brunch spot! The mimosas are killer!  The owner is spectacular. Aside from the crepes, he's the best thing about this place. One of the best people I have met in Vegas so far.

Kc0jBf_qBpAbMvq4OlMjxQ.text: By recommendation of Triple D, we gave this place a try.  I imagine coming here during the week is better than the weekend, for a party of two on a Sunday was 20 minutes.  The food was very good, but we waited longer for the food than we did a table.  The menu has a variety to please anyone.  The ambiance was super noisy, and I'm not a fan of tight seating.  Overall I'd return to try another flavor but during the week.

0Q2vOaztN02OOOLXUCTp7g.text: This is a great weekend brunch spot. It's a cute little hole in the wall. The downside is that there is not a lot of seating and so your wait may be a little long because it's always packed but well worth it. The service is amazing and the owners are super cool. The sweet and savory crepes are fantastic!

L3QSy7YiPKaTzo8p4yjuBQ.text: Crepe Expectations. Ahhh restaurant name very similar to the 'Great Expectations' classic novel that I skimmed and did NOT read in high school. Found this on Yelp and had to try it.  We found the place pretty quickly and stepped right in. Very little and cozy restaurant and was super busy. It was so busy I was easily turned off and wanted to head to another restaurant instead but my husband convinced me to stay. We told one of the staff our names and I think they somehow jotted it down either on a piece of scrap paper in someones pocket or they have the memories of an elephant. We waited in a back hallway and tried to figure out what we would eat.  They yelled my name out and we were up and pretty much ran to the cashier to place our order. I ordered The Monkey crepe with nutella, banana, chocolate, and whipped cream and my husband ordered The Monterey with bacon, eggs, tomato, onion, peppers, and cheese. I also ordered the Passion Fruit Mimosa that I read tasted amazing. We were brought to a high table in the corner and they put a number on the table. Nice! I was served the amazing and tasty mimosa that I wanted to gulp down but it tasted so good I wanted to savor each sip (first time I drank alcohol that slowly). While we were waiting I was able to see the television that had live video of them making our crepes. You could also watch them through the glass but there is a table right there and it would seem like you were trying to eat with those people. Finally got our crepes. So nicely presented and so tasty. I love, love, loved it! We were so satisfied and so impressed that the owner/chef came by our table and actually stopped by everyone's table to make sure everything was good.   I will return to Crepe Expectations when I visit again. Such a nice and welcoming atmosphere and a restaurant that seems like they care about your food quality. Prices were good too. Place for amazing crepes and service.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monterey Crepe.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey Crepe with nutella, banana, chocolate drizzle, and whipped cream.

EfvMvts4FUx5fx77QQJmhg.text: Excellent food and courteous staff. A little tough to get in which only proves how good it is!

iI-KnMShGs8cQ7gM9Z_94g.text: I came here for my girl friends birthday who knows nothing about archery. The staff was really friendly and they have been there for 35 years. This is a great place to take a date or practice your skills. Super laid back and enjoyable. I'll be there again sometime soon

1jYSPBb1joSw-Cr57DnL9w.text: Super good portions are bigger then expected. Love this place.  I love the outside seating area

u6qUPOvbmkEdwazNtxhz7A.text: The crepes here are amazing. That's all you need to know. Try not to come on a Saturday or Sunday because it gets really packed and there's limited seats available.

cG_R5JxySeAZLyAggcKKfQ.text: This place is a rare find. Amazing service, great food and atmosphere. My favorites are the Sunday Morning and the Monkey plus strawberries. It's worth the drive the wait and any other excuse you might have.

nGmTzqZ227OzLRCGdh-Sfg.text: Great crepes, and atmosphere everything was fresh I had the Marco Polo and my sister has the berry delight very tasty, portions were pretty big both of us didn't finish. Will be back!!

m1GDHqPqYKlWA6Wcl03FbA.text: We brought some guests here from Switzerland and one of them said it was the best crepe she ever had. I'm inclined to agree.   I'm working my way through the entire menu and I've loved them all. Go with something sweet or savory; you won't be disappointed.

T9NtW3Sixzw_oICpZvF7SQ.text: This place beats all the crepe resturants in San Jose. The make each one fresh in fornt of you.  The others can learn from them how to serve good food.

q6iSDvsrLML4sJP-aQZrag.text: Looked good, 20 minute wait to get in was not too bad because we were told the wait time from the kind gentlemen in the front. The 45 minute wait post order forced us to leave. When we told the cashier we were in a hurry and had to go, he did apologize however still charged for the latte n kept his tip. I'm sure this is not the normal case scenario. They did look very busy. I do think however that if a Crepe will ever take longer then 20 minutes the establishment should give customers a heads up

dXpuT2mgRUdMuLL7N_hDng.text: I do not know why this is so highly rated. It was just ok. The staff was really nice but the crepes were just ok. Too much filling and it wasn't that great. They need a yummy sauces and better sides then cottage cheese.

j1Qf_AumIA2tyjZG5eFX-g.text: Crepe Expectations is simply AMAZING! Light and fluffy crepes that always hit the spot. And now..... AN EVEN BIGGER LOCATION! No more hoping and waiting for a table. The staff is awesome. They constantly make sure you are having the best experience possible. They will talk with you and just are genuinely nice people. If you are ever in Las Vegas/ Henderson you need to check out this place.

AvlFZgZ4n-ANzvsKnAicmQ.text: We made a quick stop in Vegas and decided to try this place for breakfast with all of the great yelp reviews. It was SO YUMMY! I not only recommend it because of the amazing crepes, which they are all so delicious, the people that work there are incredible and take pride in their work and in their service. If in Vegas I wouldn't hesitate and I would go! So yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

htvcJgvlmrwdmU6RHsw1pQ.text: Very tasty,nice place  No wonder why is always full Friendly people Good service I'm in love with rosarita crepe  And my son with the monkey

aO33I4M8XSGbYF42v-t0rw.text: I love it when a restaurant is consistent.  Every time I come here and no matter what I order,  the food is always great.  Don't you hate it when you return to a place and the food is disappointing on the 2nd visit ?  Never the case here. Always fantastic food.  And so reasonable.   Love the new location too !

Wv3kHo1XS4Oc4AmfQsBWSg.text: Drove a little over 30 mins from Summerlin to give this place a try. Waited about 20 minutes to be seated (outside) as it was very busy on a Saturday morning. After being assigned a seating area, you immediately order your food at the cashier front. (So I suggest asking for a menu as soon as you get in)  Quality: The portion of the Sunday Morning Crepe's was the right amount for 1 serving. It is stuffed with Eggs, Cheese, Bacon and you can also add many other meats to fill up your Crepe the way you like it. The taste was great if your looking for quality.  Service: I can say service was pretty quick if your walking in for a party of 2. The front cashier was very helpful in recommending what to try. Don't be afraid to ask if your not sure what's on their menu.  Price: Per meal they ranged about $6.95-$10. Adding extras such as Bacon was .75 cents more. Comparing to IHOP or Dennys, you'll get your money's worth here with quality.   *Military Discount: Yes  Overall it was worth the drive to try something new if you don't mind driving the distance, If your looking for Crepes (Mild, Spicy or Sweet) to satisfy your hunger for breakfast/lunch. This is the place to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sunday Morning

7V95v0AauhJatUskLOZ8KA.text: Quick, cheap, and delicious crepes! We ordered the savory La Jolla for $7.50 which had bacon, romaine lettuce, tomatoes, guacamole, and chipotle mayo sauce. If you want a crepe that's loaded with meat, you should choose a different one. There were very minimal pieces of bacon. (That's the only reason I am not giving five stars.) The crepe comes with a choice of soup or salad.   The wait time was very quick and staff was friendly. We ate about 9:00am and by 9:30am, tables were all filled. Luckily we didn't have to wait for a table when we arrived.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The La Jolla. Bacon, romaine lettuce, tomato, guacamole, chipotle mayo spread.

W6_TSeZHnAkCUtd524ieOQ.text: Oh my goodness, this is Dickens good!!!  Wow!!! The Avalon was one of the best things I ever eaten -and the monkey a hit for my son. Superb place, very generous with the whipped cream!

VwAIMOTB6X6SWeDbDsJS2A.text: The best crepe we had so far. Service and food are really the best. Not a typical restaurant where you're gonna seat and they'll give you a menu and give the order. This is a kinda self service when you get in there is a line to put your order in find a seat and they'll serve it to you. Mimosas are really good and affordable

1BLoSbUVBLtmzZ00VL2g9w.text: Food and customer service was great!  There was a long wait after we got seated, but I it takes time to make delicious food.  We ordered the Sonora crepe, soup de jour (soup of the day), and the Monterey.  All choices were very tasty.  Guava juice and fresh squeezed OJ ate great drinks to go along with the meal.  We got to sit in front of the kitchen, where all the crepe making happens.  I enjoyed this place and I would highly recommend.  Just be prepared to wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe making station.

nzBQnpZsMImfZcN8nxie-Q.text: Got the perfect combination. Crepe filled with strawberries, chocolate drizzle and powder sugar sprinkled on top. Was so very excited to eat but I think my crepe sat too long to be brought out. Crepe was a bit soggy. Strawberries didn't taste fresh, but as they were a day old sitting in the juice too long. Was on the side of bacon and cottage cheese. Loved the trio of mimosas. Loved all three I got. Guava, blood orange and tangerine. Tried the raspberry and that was delicious. Would come back and try again because I'm a huge fan of crepes.   Environment and staff- so very friendly. Greeted at the door immediately.  Cute place and nice atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect combination. Guava, tangerine, blood orange, and peach mimosas.

ISeCwU-T10FTcVYh-Z1WNg.text: Ate here for the first time on Monday with a few friends. It was already packed at 11am. We asked about a table and the guy said we could wait inside down the hall or outside. I thought that was funny because a previous person reviewed here and said they were told about waiting in the hall. No thank you "The Hall" is crowded with customers at tables and right next to the bathrooms. The place is really small. Not much seating inside for how busy they were. It gets very crowded with tight tables/seating and standing in line to place your order. We ate outside, so that was a lot cooler and quieter.  Service was very good. We placed our orders and had them in a few minutes. One of us had the Rosarita, Chicken Greek, and Sonora. The crepes were very light and full of meat/veggie whatever we had ordered. We also had "salad" aka greens and bananas. We all liked ours, but agreed that my Sonora (Carne Asada, guacamole, and smoky salsa was the favorite. We wanted to try a dessert crepe, but were too full. I can't wait to go back with my husband and try a different one or I might just get the Sonora again! Do prepare to wait some, sit outside, and bring your appetite!

9SBOxlSDGy46BRLUwib5tQ.text: I was really impressed with this place! We were quoted a 30 minute wait, but actually got seated in about 10. My boyfriend and I ordered the Sonora and the Avalon crepes.  The Avalon was my personal favorite. I felt that it was a great blend of sweet and slightly tangy with the pear, walnut, and goat cheese combo.    I expected the crepes to be small, but they were actually very filling! I think the part of the dining experience that impressed me the most was when we left the restaurant. The host actually remembered our names after only meeting us once! Made it feel like we'd been there forever even though it was only our first time.   As a slightly claustrophobic person, I'd have to say that the seating in this place was less than ideal. But don't let that deter you! The food is great, and worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lbkSHpfH1brgmPRjzvAssw.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I come offten with my best friend because I can't get enough of it. Before coming here I had never tried anything outside of a breakfast crepe and have been in love ever since.

F_1fCWYwhhUztWrFWHaYpA.text: Let me start by saying My Fiance and I absolutely love this place. It's beginning to become a favorite Sunday Ritual. We've been coming every Sunday for last 3 weeks and DO NOT plan on changing this anytime soon. There are a couple favorites we have separately and together of course.  Recommend: The Reuben Louis BBQ The Monterey The Sonora  Sweet Crepes: The William tell Simple Delight  All are exceptionally wonderful but so far these are our picks and we haven't been let down yet! The staff is extremely friendly and I must say this establishment is very homely. 5 star every day of the week!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monterey. It&#39;s so delicious.

iKBEmjKEqrbxrQUqMZJklg.text: It's really good food problem is it's always busy so you can get right in to get breakfast other than that it's a great place

dr-_OJ8xx39-NbfNt5uOog.text: All I can say is AMAZING! I have gone a few times but this time had the chorizo and it was the most flavorful chorizo I have ever eaten. Then I find out from the awesome owner that he makes it himself!! The staff is so great and makes you very welcome and attends to you like you are in their home. I will eat here every time I am in Vegas!!

KgfmVlTHzGjfPhBN9iD2SQ.text: Terrible experience. Waited an hour for our food and he left one of our crepes off the order. We had to run out and make it to go because it took so long so one of us went hungry. Someone else needs to work the register and they need a larger cooking staff as they cant handle the business they have.

3JOIsrq_VDVAT1ZNbtBelQ.text: The Sonora crepe is a must try! The service is always amazing the staff is always friendly. I only wish they would bring back the Black bean soup, however the salad and the dressing they put on it is to die for!! Writing this review has my taste buds watering for some crepes! I would give it four stars because I want them to bring back the Black bean soup but this place really is amazing and they deserve the 5!

tHHGFwyvDxavnfyhsA5U6w.text: Great place great food great service, thee best crepes I've had so far in Vegas definitely will come back

YHGYI79gN-xzLctHsUSF1g.text: The food is great but..... the rude man who sat us wouldn't let us sit at a "4 too" because  "Uys busy on Saturday." The only 2 top tables were staring directly into the very bright morning Las Vegas sun.  Very unaccomidati g and the rude man also said: "I guess you will sit where you want , whatever people!"  B Very, very rude.

fPV-18nKlJKbtTx2D4yFCA.text: Very yummy and large crepes! I had the Lemon Berry Crepe, which was tart and sweet, my boyfriend had the Elvis, which had too much peanut butter, but he still enjoyed it for the most part. The mimosa sample had full sized mimosa's which was awesome for only $10 for 3. It was made with champagne and basic syrup flavoring. We got our food and drinks pretty fast for it being busy. Other than the long line and limited seating it was awesome, service good and food excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Lemon Berry Dream, mimosa sampler.

HbeorjF8PsfqwLMaANCabg.text: When I was at my favorite breakfast place, The Original Sunrise Cafe I was talking with the owner and he suggested that I try Crepe Expectations.  He also suggested I go early to beat the rush because the place is kind of small.   I arrived right at 8am and was greeted by the friendly owner who ushered me to a table and I stood in line to order.  The menu looked delicious and most of the crepes looked more like lunch fare than breakfast.   I ordered a basic ham and egg breakfast crepe.   I was a little disappointed that while the crepes were excellent they were not too original and they didn't offer any sauces.   I have a favorite crepe place in Saint Louis with all sorts of great sauces.   Even just a Bechamel sauce would have been a nice add-on.  As described the restaurant was kind of tiny and filled up quickly but I understand they will be moving to a larger place next door so that should no longer be an issue.  Perhaps they will open a little earlier as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Crepelet ham egg and swiss

HP2FqPtnjksqBgH67qdoyw.text: Had breakfast here on Saturday morning. Customer service was good and really friendly. You order, pay and then sit. Next time I'd probably go for something sweet.

Zyqz8CsNM1O4XAOArGsxMQ.text: This place has way too many stars than it should have.  I was looking for a place with something more 'breakfast' than what I ordered off the breakfast menu.  The interior is ridiculously dark, putting you in a quiet romantic mood, but we craved for light. Some sort of brightness. Sunlight. Anything.  We ordered two savory crepes.  My savory crepe was from the breakfast side.  I was hoping it'd taste like breakfast, but instead I felt as if I was eating a folded up pizza. I didn't get a hint of breakfast or eggs in my crepe.  The mimosa flight was awesome tho, I must say.  But for sure, next time, I'll get something from the sweet side.

KBQSw6XyA8oyGb3m7IDQUw.text: this place hits the spot! it's definitely worth the wait (if there is a line) -- the service is phenomenal. it was so hot outside and I wanted an inside table, but there wasn't any tables available at the time. while I was in line ordering, a kind man came up to me and told me her bussed a table for us inside so we didn't have to sit outside. i ordered the chicken chile verde crepe and the nutty classic! they were both delicious. my chicken crepe came with a side salad with some amaaaazing cilantro lime cumin type dressing that they make in house. to die for. I also asked for guava juice (that's not on their menu) because I don't drink alcohol, but they had a guava mimosa. I work right beside this place and i'm definitely going to be stoping by more often.

nfBaJgHvkeK_2x4QbPSFhg.text: I'll start saying I'm not a huge crepe fan... this place is not like the rest! Great location and awesome people working there. Long line is probable but don't let it intimidate you as it moves fast and the food is 1000 percent worth the wait. Lemon berry cheesecake crepe- sweettooth delight! Not too much food but just enough! Prices are about the best you can get in Vegas for what it is. Will go back.

IS7h7bAYle-OaqJX250fJA.text: No matter what I choose, I always end up leaving full and happy.   I may not be a frequent customer, but when I crave something fast and fresh, this is one of the places I go to.   The Rosarito Plain no frills needed. Chorizo that has a nice spice to it and definitely not OILY at all! Guacamole and pepperjack cheese compliments this dish very well.  The Sonora In place is chorizo, it is their carne asada steak with roasted tomato salsa.  The Monkey Banana, nutella, chocolate drizzle, whipped cream and powdered sugar. Can't go wrong with this combination. Don't let it fool you! Definitely needs to be shared with a friend, especially if you had their savory crepes.  The Elvis One of their special dessert crepes not listed on the menu but is written on the board next to the cash register.   Definitely can't forget their trio of mimosas for $10! Plenty of flavors to choose from.

fdUnf1JQe0sy22Tvip75-Q.text: Best crepes in town.  Breakfast, lunch or brunch, they have a  repe for you.  Yum, yum.
