9Sc7y8LOaay-FUeNBd2KgA.text: Like many other reviews, this place was OUTSTANDING!! One simple word can define it all:  Yummilicious!!  We had six crepes between the four of us and they were so good we ordered one more for dessert!  Everything was outstanding:  the service, the people, the patio, the crepes, the flavor explosions, the mimosas, the ambience and the prices!   Can't wait to be back.   Our yummicious crepes included the Elvis, Greek, Chicken Chili Verde (2), Frisco and Bananas Foster (with strawberries)!

qLQ9SIZnQv2LWU_CrqMWgA.text: The Owner is Very Nice, and place is very good for groups. Out Side Seating is excellent. You order at the front and get a number then they bring out the food. Its kind of a mix fast food / sit down restaurant. Everything is self server including the waters. Overall the Prices are below $10 a person per plate and would be great for gathering and parties. Tons of Patio Room and Overall Good Food - You Must like Crepe's if you don't this is not the restaurant for you. Everything here is a Crepe don't expect anything else.

lplTIMrDo9lrRzOa_MBJfA.text: Came here for brunch, and happy to say that they moved to a bigger location! Some of these reviews confuse me. A high wait time shouldn't be a reason to give 1 or 2 stars especially when the food is delicious! The staff is super friendly and courteous! The owner is a very down to earth guy, and you can tell based on his interactions that he cares for his customers! We ordered the Sonora, Berry Delight and the Ana Bananas Foster.   The wait for the food wasn't very long though the place was packed! We sat on the patio for the nice weather. The busser was walking around wiping tables for people after the previous nights dust storm, and I thought that was very nice of him to make sure the guests had clean tables!   We received our food and it was delicious! The crepes were cooked perfectly, the fruit was fresh, and the steak was also nice and tender!   Loved this place, will return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (bottom to top) Berry Delight, Ana Bananas Foster, and the Sonora!

M6SkzjMKpDBqCjvnfszO4w.text: This was my second time here and I decided it was time I review .. We arrived shortly after 9am on a Sunday so we had a brief wait to be seated and be warned it tends to get busy and on mornings like today you may wait a bit for seating indoors .  They do take names and get you set up with seats.. once our table opened up we ended up at the cash register being helped by Lou. Not only was he friendly and informative .. before us he was on a phone call with a difficult customer and handled it like a pro concerning who pours their O.J lol ..   After we   ordered and then took our seat in front of where they make the crepes .. Where I got to watch Melissa rocking it out making crepes   As far as our order we opted for the Mimosa Sampler for $10..it's a great deal below are the flavors   Watermelon, Rasberry and Blood orange were the flavors we went with .. I legit can't wait to go back and drink lots of the watermelon ones lol but they use fresh fruit ..  I've had the fresh squeezed lemonades as well and they rock !!  As far as crepes we got one savory and one sweet   Marco Polo with added cooked onions was one savory and the sausage is so freaking good and the balance was perfect ...  We opted for the seasonal pumpkin spice cheesecake one which is good if that's your thing but it was almost too much cheesecake not enough spice which i can't believe I'm saying cause I don't like pumpkin spice stuff typically but it's tasty however my favorite sweet one is the Elvis but if you check out the menu or specials at the register ..  Better yet feel free to ask Lou he will hook ya up with good ideas . Plus I guess this is a DDD location cause I just saw a preview for next weeks guys next big project and one of the contestants is at this location ..  As long as you are open to waiting for a seat this is a super affordable place to enjoy a delicious breakfast or brunch .. check it out !!! Come hungry and I'm pretty sure you will leave Happy!!!

3GWdeMITKEYf6KV7bTR79Q.text: This place is delicious! Everyone is so nice and sweet! I got The veggie patch and a pomegranate mimosa! They have seating inside and out. They are always busy but it's worth the wait!

40W9638k3dyL8EeOnbZU6Q.text: Crepe's & Mimosas were both amazing.. The sampler gets you three Mimosas with many flavors to choose from.. The white peach Mimosa was thr best so far & The Monkey Crepe was perfect for my sweet tooth cravings!

yP-xEHDlbzA38OeZCGibyw.text: Friendly serving. Order at counter and sit.  Huge patio.  Monkey Crepe was delish! Side of bacon and eggs were a 10!

eWbEmVBtYe_5Ka52P9askQ.text: Not near the strip but definitely worth the drive (even if you are "Ubering")! The crepes are huge, the staff is awesome, and you can even sit outside. The crepes were amazing. I had the BBQ style ones and the Elvis. Had to take some to go. Just WOW!

HgdTEWU1MbZqUAIcAiN1rA.text: Just like many of the reviews have stated...this place gets packed! Knowing this, I visited on a Friday a bit earlier than the typicalI lunch hour. I visited around 11:30 and there was only space to be seated outside (the space inside is quite small). I did not mind this at all since the weather was really nice.   I ordered "The Pirate" which has a tasty tuna salad inside the crepe with swiss cheese. I thought the bite was very tasty and the portion perfect. I was looking to eat something that would not make me super full because I had a holiday even to go to later in the day. Each crepe comes with a side of soup or salad. I chose the second option which was a Mexican noodle soup. I thought this was tasty, but not amazing.   Overall, I would def be back to this place! I saw on the menu a sweet crepe "The Avalon" which was buttered pears, goat cheese, walnuts and honey that I have a feeling I am really going to like.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tPKmlii9e5n6V167W-8uYQ.text: I really wanted to enjoy this restaurant because there are so many great reviews!  We got to Crepe Expectations on Saturday morning, so of course we were expecting it to be busy! There was a line out of the door. The restaurant is set up where you order your food, then (if available) find a seat. There were no open seats, however we didn't want to place an order to go. There was a waiter going through the line asking who was placing to go orders and who was wanting to eat there. I informed him we wanted to eat there, so he told us to get out of the line and wait. We waited for around ten minutes, then he came back and told us to get back in line? It was very confusing. I noticed he had done this with a couple other people as well. After we ordered we were told to wait again for an open table. Unfortunately it was cold outside so we didn't want to take an open table outside. After fifteen minutes we got seated, and we were seated right by the kitchen. Right next to our table was a drip coffee section, people who ordered drip were advised to come ask for a cup and get their own coffee. I noticed everyone who was trying to get their coffee were very confused as to what they need to be doing. They would try to get someone from the kitchen's attention, but everyone in the kitchen were so busy that no one was available to get the customer's cups.   We got our food, and it was great! I do understand why everyone raves about the food. We got a couple crepes that looked great and were enjoyable to eat. It was also neat to see the chefs making your crepes! However, it was not worth the unorganized trouble that we went through.   This restaurant would benefit from changes that need to be made! It looks like they recently changed locations, so maybe what they were doing worked for them at their previous location, but with the current location and set up of the building what they are doing definitely doesn't work. The main suggestion I have is setting the drip coffee station at the front and the person taking their order gives them a mug and directs them to the drip station right next to them. Another suggestion I have is to possibly allow people to sit down before taking orders, if they are staying and not placing an order to go. The order process was very confusing and even the waiter trying to keep it organized was all over the place! With a few adjustments, I could definitely see myself enjoying my experience here more.

3RrrZX9oedibVBXhFol54Q.text: This was a by chance find. We headed to the Hoover Dam and we're hungry. He zipped off the highway so I could find a spot. What a GREAT FIND! Gluten feee and so good!  Everything is made fresh and to order. I was incredibly happy to have fresh Berrys and not canned or frozen. Bananas cut right there as they went.  Order as you walk in. Everything is brought to the table. Staff is quick and friendly. Small staff doing a lot of different things. If you get regular coffee, they will hand you a cup and you can serve yourself. All over drinks are brought to the table.  Hubby was happy to see fresh watermelon juice, it is his favorite.  Lots of fun and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-kI-dmIPSAZ8ojHxXN5-Hg.text: Horrible horrible horrible, that's all I have too say. Will not return & will not recommend to others. overpriced and not worth it. Crepes were gross , should've just got some from ihop.   & the owner Louis r. Is very rude.

Vx5yIc4uNyPUFLjTcZzRYg.text: Amazing crepes!!! I was not a huge crepe fan until I have eaten here. The crepes here are so soft and fluffy and the fillings are just impeccably put together. I love the Ruben crepe. Taste even better than some of the Ruben in New York. Thank you for making such delectable food!

JrZ2ESFzVRYH94LKghv2qg.text: Chaos. This place is disorganized. Seating process and wait time provokes frustration. The same guy who busses the tables is running food out ...pretty gross. Won't be back here.

7pLxQXHwke6v5BYrXg8N-g.text: We love this place i had granny apple and husband had the elvis, there mimosa sampler was fun and delish, they have fresh yummy coffee and outdoor seating is where its at!! With a cute local pet goods store next door,  alot of action on the weekends! such a fun outing and very friendly staff. We will back often, thanks lou and jen!

F0gkOKr3DDp_VJ32abxmAA.text: This place was pretty decent.  We waitied for some friends to arrive so it gave us some time to go over the menu.  I got a crepe with bananas, nutella, whipped cream, chocolate sauce, and added strawberries.  It was good other then the chocolate really over powering the flavors.  I would get the chocolate sauce on the side.  The boyfriend got the crepe with apples and a caramel sauce and it was good.  My friend got the one with carne asada, it was good.  I work in restaurants, and its nice to see when places get busy.  One of the girls was walking around asking all the tables how everything was, cleaning tables, and it seemed like she paid attention to her guest.  I over heard her talking to the table infront of us and remember they came in for the last few days, wished them safe travels and said hope to see you guys when you come back.    What was cool was there was cameras right above the crepe stations so you can see the whole process.    Coffee wasnt great, strawberry lemonade was super sweet, and it was a bit warm inside.    Seemed like there was a lot of locals that dine in.   I will come back if im back in Nevada.

RPxv2bIaqI-ymEwXfVvKEQ.text: When coming here make sure YOU HAVE TIME. There will always be a wait, no matter what, I promise you! I enjoy crepes with berries and some sort of fruit sauce on top with powdered sugar. This place, however, does not have a specific fruit sauce except for the banana creme de something. It's a light thin creme sauce that comes on their Ana Banana Crepe BUT you can add that creme sauce on any of the crepes which is nice. They have a variety of crepes here, fruit stuffed crepes to protein stuffed crepes. I like their batter they use for the crepes, it's the right amount of rubbery texture where it doesnt just taste like a thin pancake. Now, do I think that the crepes are worth the almost hour wait? Not really....but their crepes are better than most places I have tried here in Vegas / Henderson.

RKNt2LA1CG-NE4-YBuiB9w.text: Best Crepes and Coffee on the planet!!! The white mochas and any type of fruit crepe is amazing!!! If only they had one in Ohio!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6eTQhm7FkiVV3jFLEz8t8g.text: Lazy Sunday morning and my refrigerator had nothing I could or would eat... so I called Mom and asked her if she'd like to join me for lunch. I said I wanted to check this place out after my friends raved about it. We made a date and, voila, dejeuner!  Straight to the good stuff: Crepes!  As it says on my profile... I don't eat much, but I eat well. That's also the best excuse *ever* to order too much and, if needed, send it home with Mom. ;)  Savory: The Caprese (extra pesto, please!). The mozzarella was fresh and creamy, the tomatoes firm and bright and sweetly tangy, the basil was sweet and fragrant, and the pesto was...   . . .  ... oh, uh, my apologies... I was daydreaming about the pesto. Thicker than some pestos, the flavors were deep - nutty, cheesy, garlicky, basily (are these words?!) - *without* being heavy or oily. Absolutely on my faves list now.  Savory: The Grand Turk. Tender, tender turkey makes this crepe fantastic. The other ingredients: guacamole, olives, cheese, are great accompaniments, yes, but the Grand Turk is not just named for it's protein base, but truly because the turkey shines. Sauteed, it has a smokey roasted/grilled taste that really makes it stand out.  Sweet: The Avalon. Sauteed, buttered pears, walnuts, honey, and goat cheese. An amazing combination that ends up just sweet enough. The nuts and cheese keep the honey and pears perfectly balanced. I had only one wish, and I expressed this to Ana when she stopped over to chat, was that it had more of the goat cheese and the creamy tang that it imparts into the dish.  Sweet: The Frisco. Blueberries and lemon curd. One bite and Mom just smiled with that "oh, yes, my mouth is happy" look that she gets over good food. I loved the freshness of the berries, that ripeness that brings a perfectly sweet/tart juicy bite. Add the zest of an amazing lemon curd? Fab, fab dish! Ana even took the time to talk to us about how she worked through the dish to perfect it, and shared some ideas on lemon curd outside of the crepes!   I mention a lot that I don't eat bread, rice, potatoes or pastas but for a small bite here and there. So, I can admit to leaving way more crepe behind on the plate than should be legal. That said, I *do* taste things, and I had quite a few tastes of the crepes themselves, not just the amazing filling. Light batter that packs a great flavor, perfectly griddled, and even consistency are important in a crepe. Crepe Expectations has got this hands down and, dare I say it, easily rivaling my favorite little spot in Seattle's Pike Market.  Add to all of this the lemon and cucumber waters (cool, tasty without being overpowering, and oh-so-refreshing!), the large menu of libations (coffees, teas, juices, wines... so many options!), there is something for every person (and to complement every crepe!).  The service is phenomenal. Larry and Ana know what customer service means. They will chat you up if you want to chat, share their experiences, and truly try to get to know you. Much like I try to never meet a stranger, they easily make friends of their customers. The rest of the staff is friendly, fast-moving but laid back, and the whole of the experience is inviting.  Something else I noticed: From posted signs (no smoking! wash your hands!) to the artwork, to the light switches to the bathroom lighting: everything is coordinated, put together with purpose, and cohesive.   With that kind of attention to detail, plus the amazing food and the stellar service, this is easily on my Must Go Often And Bring Everyone Here list.

TUCE-74JFSpg5hG5qyzYGA.text: This place is amazing! Usually long lines for food, especially on weekends but worth the wait. The food is top notch and made to order. Sometimes it takes a while. I suggest trying the flight of mimosas. They have like 12 different flavors. The Blood Orange and White Peach are my favs. I've tried sweet and savory crepes and have never been disappointed. The staff are super friendly and ready with suggestions if you can't make up your mind. We usually go with a couple people and share so we can taste everything. Don't pass this place by!

5QvDQOEO7vWE05hvF6cvvg.text: This place is the best! Great atmosphere. Food is always delish and made fresh. Friendly staff and always greeted with a smiling face when you walk into the door. If your looking for a great place to try you should really consider this place.

pI-L2oyMY9Ocu7TzGszhNg.text: Love love love love love this place!! Today was my first visit and I am so glad I listened to my friend and opted for breakfast here. This little gem is located inside of the big plaza next to BJs on Eastern and very close to my house. Initially I thought they only featured sweet/fruit crepes but was pleasantly surprised to discover a crepe menu with endless options sweet and non sweet!  We opted for the La Jolla with the Mimosa trio sample of Passion Fruit, Mango and Lychee.....Superb on all counts! The staff is friendly, decor and color scheme very much to my liking, and as I already stated, the food is DELICIOUS. I will be returning ...very soon ;)

tr5Z6nVtKzObnYidCUPxZQ.text: The owner is a doll. She remembered my boyfriend and I when we came back a few months later on vacation.   They have cool cameras set up above the crepe station so you can watch them being made.  Everything on this menu is way better than all the other crepes I've tasted before. The savory ones are my favorite.  Get the Avalon. The goat cheese on top of the sweet apples and candies walnuts was amazing. 5 stars.   Also, get the raspberry drink. I forget what they call it, but it's SOOOO refreshing. Delish!

dWkAgu5cjMH8FkzRz5e6EA.text: A family of pessimistic picky eaters walked in to Crepe Expectations very hungry.  All walked out full and very satisfied. Expectations running high for next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cleaned the plate.

btl3D3gUc5uKX8nC2DML1g.text: Only been once but it was great! Super friendly host and staff. In addition to a wide variety of crepes  (a flavor for most desires), they have awesome mimosas. For sure a place to go for brunch and they have a small patio are if it isn't too hot out.

eK4UYrGTFckSu4LpBcTQRg.text: I always get their caprese crepe! Nothing beats tomato, mozzarella, and basil, and you can't really mess this combo up either. The cashier is always kind. Even though you only are with him for ten seconds, he is willing to comfortably start a conversation and make things fun! Service was fast, and the food is always consistent!

0UE9Xv9cgj1mI56ZdTI0Lg.text: Food is amazing! Staff is super friendly !! Highly recommend! Pretty kickass place!!!

EN_UX7DneRJrNr6ASAe5rQ.text: I have a special place in my heart for their whole staff. They really get it. They really treat every single person that walks in like it is their family. They are warm, attentive, the food is amazing, they play the food network on tv's, or you can watch them make the crepes a screen they have set up. The place is beautifully decorated and the coffee is awesome. I can't say enough good things.   There is normally a line unless you get there early. It is a wonderful place and it's so nice to see such a fantastic family/ group of people being awesome and successful. A must visit.

AkeVZ_0rKH7_LvXsf9tp3Q.text: Oh my gosh! Can you say excellent excellent crepes all the time!!!! My brother normally calls every morning and orders himself a breakfast crepe And then he'll go his way to pick it up... I see him eating them all the time and never thought anything of it. But then a client said to me that we should go to lunch one day at crepe expectations. Okay, so we went! I had to Sonora crepe which was absolutely amazing. And a seasonal pumpkin cream cheese crepe with candied walnuts!!!!! Holy cow! This is my new favorite place!  The flavor combinations are amazing the crepes are made absolutely perfectly the staff is friendly and the restaurant is always clean. On top of that they have a dog friendly patio. I'm in heaven!  I gave this restaurant a four out of five strictly because of flavor consistency. I ordered a cream cheese pumpkin crap that had candied walnuts which was amazing. The next day I ordered the same thing from my mother and there was no candied walnuts. I had a Sonora crepe which was amazing and then wanted one to go which was four times as spicy.  Other than that absolute perfection. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends family coworkers and clients! It's got a small cozy atmosphere. Definitely try this place!

V6uzNZkif4iMC4EwGqe0ww.text: Very good food. Quick service. Would def recommend. The owners of the restaurant were very welcoming.

d976-Fh3BqEhPBSeMcPdow.text: Best crepes I've ever had :D  I'm not a big crepe eater but I always seem to love them. I am especially fond of sweet crepes with fresh fruits inside and whip-cream on top.  Visited this place on a whim since I was staying close by in Henderson at the Green Valley Ranch.    Ordered a lunch crepe with turkey and avocado and a dessert crepe with lots of berries and an extra side of bananas.    Everything was delicious and I will definitely come here again! I'm giving them five stars because BOTH of the crepes were outstanding and that usually doesn't happen.  Usually one crepe is better than the other but both of these crepes were delicious and fulfilling!  They had some outdoor seating and I heard good things about the mimosas but didn't try one, sadly.

w3-hGdZ1HjhftpRlBJ5VJQ.text: Holy crepe! I can't say enough about how amazing this place is. I'm vegetarian, so I often make adjustments to their set items.  there have never been any mistakes and everyone of the staff members make you feel welcome and at home. Awesome service. Awesome food. I have my whole family and all of my co-workers hooked!  The venue is on the small side, but it adds to the homey charm and atmosphere.

trTKI1jqvrkssbjTKcjXNw.text: If you are looking for the freshest YUM in the world, you have found it here!  Everything is made to order, using nothing but the best ingredients.  Our teenage boys, who eat nothing, would live at Crepe Expectations and eat crepes all day if I'd let them.  The dessert crepes are to die for!!  I dare you to eat just one!!  Keep up the good work!

oIs-tyBWjFBJTDANoYBStA.text: Started our experience of visiting DDD locations here in Vegas. We visited for lunch and were very surprised at the small size of the place. Size doesn't matter in this case! We tried the Sonora (carne asada) and the Marco Polo (Italian sausage & egg). Started all with a Habanero laced Michilada.  The carne asada in the Sonora wasn't your usual burrito stand asada.  It was very tender,  nicely marinated and finished perfectly with guacamole. The side salad was just a tiny treat in itself. A small portion of spinach laced with a sneaky taco flavored dressing. Quite a treat in itself. The Marco Polo is a breakfast dish.  Sausage,  egg & light cheese. I added mushrooms.  This was good with a dash of tapatio but I think I'm a Sonora fan.  You shouldn't be disappointed here.  The folks from the show are the folks making your food,  taking your order and visiting you at your table. Great, real people and a fun visit.  My only regrets.... Not trying something from the Mimosa selection and leaving room for a dessert! We'll be back for the William Tell dessert.  Beware!  They close at 3pm. So plan accordingly to not be disappointed.  Thanks Guy for another nugget in Vegas!

7Xk37MBr8k2Rk_IGSqsGiA.text: What a delightful little cafe!  My sweet husband knows that I really enjoy good crepes and in his search for a place to go while in Vegas, he found Crepe Expectations.  It's located in an unassuming, newer shopping center with an eclectic mix of restaurants, offices and stores. There are some tables out front of what looks like a small cafe, but once inside, the space seems quite large. The decor is tasteful and cohesive. The staff we encountered all provided prompt an friendly service.   Now for the crepes...  In theory I like savory crepes, but I never seem to be able to pass up the sweet ones, so I ordered The Frisco with flavorful blueberries, lemon curd, fresh whipped cream (NOT from a can) and powdered sugar. The crepe itself was light, thin & perfectly cooked. The lemon curd & plump blueberries were divine!   My 'savory' husband ordered The Little Italy with pepperoni, mozzarella & a tomato-basil sauce. It also came with choice of soup or mixed greens salad. He went with the soup and it was all very tasty. For drinks we just opted for the complimentary cucumber and lemon waters which were very refreshing , especially when mixed together. However they do have an extensive beverage menu including fresh juices, coffee, tea, premium sodas (Bundaberg Ginger Beer!!),  wine and  beer.  Overall, we had an excellent experience and have added Crepe Expectations to our list of favorite must-eats while in Vegas!

t9U7yOkRtxZG9hJBS-ESyg.text: The wait on weekends is worth it! You can always get a 30 min foot massage near by or check out the Made in USA store before your brunch! ;)

r3cBavMd_tEI1yrAv9PY7w.text: If I could select more stars I would! Fantastic food and even better service. There was a wait when we arrived so we sat in the hallway, which was very cold, and looked over the menu. When it was our time to order the awesome cashier offered his suggestions along the way. I went with the Sonora and added mushrooms, while my sister went with the Greek. We shared both and decided the Sonora was better simply because the feta cheese in the Greek wasn't the best. The crepe itself though was phenomenal!! For Desert we had the Nutty Classic with Strawberries added. It was perfect and you should really try it! We also had the mimosa flights. My favorite flavor was the blood orange. If you're in Vegas this place is a must!

XZ0G9vV7K1RMfTdqhc-2IA.text: Amazing atmosphere. Delicious  food. Fabulous service. Located in a nice area. Reasonable prices. Short wait time. What more do you want?

CaSF-0ltad_6SczMX50NGg.text: I've been kicked out of this place at 2:45 now about 3 or 4 times.   Th r y close at 3, but everyone is rushing out of the door at 2:45.   If your open till 3pm, serve till 3pm.   Your plans after work are not your customers concerns.   Also the AC has been broken all summer there.   So if you like sweating into your breakfast and being asked to leave while they are open, this is your spot.

oqDJ-5KL3a4LXzRKzfLWDg.text: I love this place! Dog friendly! Amazing staff, so friendly! Food is fantastic! This is a must go to!

cL14qWgbt7Cqvbvnwhga9A.text: The chef/ owner is awesome, super friendly, try mixing their cucumber water w/ lemon water -its freaking refreshing! I ordered the mimosa sampler, the crepelette and the Ana banana's foster and it's under $30?!?!  I'm so happy this new year day! Crepe Expectations started my new year right, thanks for the great food n service ;)

IhAUZg0hVOWDhlIJQMfC5A.text: I've been here dozens of times.  Really good food.  It's never dissapointed.  Owner mentioned that they were recently on diners, drivers, and dives.  If you live in Vegas you better check this place out soon before the episode airs.  There's always a wait on the weekends, good sign of good food.

DL8FDNtPFDSVtTBinquGQA.text: This place is incredible. Different than the standard bacon and egg breakfast joint. We haven't had anything bad. Don't forget to get a sampler of mimosas. They have so many flavors, it's hard to choose just three. It's always pretty crowded so go early or go with patience. Enjoy!

7iyL1IuHpFtwi0A8gk6dHQ.text: Creative concept, fantastic food, incredibly friendly service, and a great, clean atmosphere.  My wife and I came two days in a row.  Had the Sonora and the Del Mar yesterday, the Reuben (a special) and Berry Delight today.  Everything was excellent, will definitely come back here for our next trip to Vegas!

vkPub5UESfXrjnWpRoeEZg.text: Very busy and fun, but that ended up creating slower service. I'm sure it would be five stars if it was slower and the staff could pay more attention to each table. Great service and prices, the menu had a lot of choices! Very delicious!

gYWGC5UO-O6evZi5EWOxOw.text: This is a great little cafe - cute setting with indoor and outdoor seating, friendly staff, and amazing crepes. I especially like the La Jolla (savory) and The Monkey (sweet and so good!). This is a must-visit if you're in the area!

nmsFBBxtrfjqMxp-_Menzw.text: This place is funky and yummy.  I go there often and have fully enjoyed every item I have ordered.  The staff is gracious and efficient.  I would give 5 stars except for the fact that the last 2 times I have been there for lunch, we were bum-rushed out of our seats by waiting customers (not staff).  The rude customers just pretty much come and stand by your table as they see you are getting close to finishing and state that they are waiting for the table..  Management should maybe ask for waiting people to not stand right to seated customers trying enjoy the fabulous crepes.

OXooe-tI6IdKxBaag_AT7A.text: Simply amazing does not even begin to describe the food / drinks / service! This place is unique and a beautiful hidden little secret....

RHmtlDTgStcRv97KPr22zw.text: We do not live in the area or even the state, but every time we are in Vegas we make it a point to eat at Crepe Expectations. The owners and staff are always friendly and the crepes are consistently good. Our favorite has to be the Sunday Morning with chorizo! Yum!

jPyhGo1glZeU9TsCMcIF3g.text: Great service great food. Finally a crepe that can rival even the French!

NfOSPq_QvYxh9_0Cc_PMXw.text: this place is awesome when i think of crepes i think of dessert but these crepes are a meal, and a delicious one at that. I wish they had a location in the northwest where I live!

YUauHUjkFdXrjjM8a8bztQ.text: We're from SF, where there are at least a dozen great creperies.  Here in Vegas, it's been hard to find just that one... But now I know, Crepe Expectations is it! The only downfall is they close early now and I usually want my savory crepes at night for dessert.  To be honest, we've only been here once.  We got a couple strawberry and nutella crepes, the usual.  The crepe was perfect and the customer service was superb. They were really friendly and checked in on us quite a few times to ensure we were satisfied. Will def be back!

EMuQ8enhIgEh0JqLeNqpLA.text: Nothing bad to say about Crepe Expectations.  The only notable happening is that it took 10 minutes to get an outdoor table, which is very manageable for a noon, Sunday seating.    The waitstaff was awesome and gave great recommendations on food and mimosa.  The food came out quick, the mimosas fresh, and the the portions more than expected.  The prices are also very reasonable ($8/meal, $10/3 mimosa sampler), especially given the same type of cuisine and quality on the strip would be 2.5x the price.  The restaurant is located inside a shopping center in Henderson but has a  nice outdoor patio for sitting that is very cozy.  You order at the counter and the food is prepared right in front of you.  I will definitely be back for a great breakfast/brunch in the future.

g451yWrAyQnHe9RgLDKF4w.text: Great little place for breakfast. Come early, otherwise you might encounter a little bit of a wait.   If you're coming with a partner for breakfast, I suggest ordering one sweet crepe and one savory crepe! Promotes sharing and you get to expand your choices.   I normally would chose to recommend a few dishes over others, but everything here is pretty good.  However, I am not a fan of all of there mimosas. Their traditional mimosas are good, but I tried their sampler with strawberry, mango, and one other flavour which I cannot remember. The mango was okay, the strawberry was not good, and the other one must not have been bad or good, because it definitely wasn't memorable.  Would I recommend this place to others? You bet.  Would I come back here myself? In a heartbeat.

MjUv-LIwYHFYCXitIEbl_g.text: Great place for crepes in Henderson! Usually, when I'm in town I visit the place in the Bellagio that serves crepes. It's my go-to breakfast spot. This time I was staying in Henderson and before heading back to LA needed to get a full belly for the drive. Found Crepe Expectations online and checked it out. I had the Frisco Crepe- blueberries, lemon curd & fresh whip cream. O-M-G...yummy! My husband had the Sonoma savory crepe, which had carne asada, salsa, guac, and cheese. He said it was good and filling. Nice decor, outside seating avail. Great bearded character taking the orders...he was fun. Oh, and a celebrity chef, Guy Ferri, ate there. I will def go back!

QTCOLw95aZ_Fh8odcI_bug.text: Been here a few times, this was our first visit to new/bigger location. Still same great quality and service. Favorites definitely include the Reuben and the lemon blueberry one. Mimosa trio sampler is great, try the blood orange one or in summer tru watermelon when they have it with fresh watermelon juice. Import beers for only $3.50, winning.

pvbovzy02LjhrGhQWUjNPw.text: Nice change of pace for lunch.  The place is pure chaos and a bit disorganized but it is understandable.  The business has just exploded since the Triple D visit.   Sometimes I wonder if a visit from Guy is more curse than blessing.     The food is pretty damn good.  Sure you can find a better crepe if you consider a single type.  But all of the different savory, sweet, breakfast crepes cannot be found as a collection anywhere else.    A group of 7 of us went there for lunch and had a great time.  The servers really tried and the place was hopping.  I ordered the Greek with soup and it was delicious.  The portion was just enough for lunch and I left satisfied.  We will be back for sure!

KPXeoWJ24vZix_9eNXS2XA.text: This is my 3rd time coming here. I usually get The Rosarito and it's super awesome and delicious but today I decided to try the Veggie Patch. The cook (he mentioned it was his first day on the job) brought us the dish he made- it didn't look like it was made correctly. In fact, kind of sloppy. Then when I tasted it, I could taste the mushy uncooked batter. It sucks because I heard so many good things about the Veggie Patch.   I will definitely come back. Hopefully the cook will improve!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WyRJPc-1bpFnS20ORlg2dg.text: While the food is good, the service is terrible!!   Lou, the owner was rude when I came over a year and a half ago and I refused to return. Fast forward Till today and he hasn't changed at all!   Just go to Griddle Cakes next door, who wants a rude person and bad service on a Sunday morning, not me!!

ryT6VdDiYpVtheysdd9K2Q.text: My son love Crepe, first time we ate here was just okay the food n the service but besides our table a couple was complaining n do not pay attention.  Second time we visit here I also brought my older son.  We sat inside because it was too windy out the patio.  I have noticed the kitchen is very small, quiet dirty looking yet we finished n enjoyed their foods.  Third time we came here was yesterday because it was my sons birthday so I brought all my 4 kids.  I ordered Monterey, after serving this to me I cut one slice and I saw a strand of hair, I lost my appetite n I felt that my this place is really dirty.  While reading some reviews here, I read the same issue about hair strands on their foods.  How come this management is not paying attention with the correct handling n cleanliness of foods and place.  I will not come back here anymore.  Disgusting place to eat.

6HncCMXPwcRkrYIj76DsbQ.text: Ok, the food came amazingly quick. The service was outstanding! The cashier was so chipper, sweet and helpful. Such a unique place too! Just crepes of all kinds for all people with all sorts of tastes and flavors from savory to sweet to spicy to light to hardy! I first started going here at their first location and it was crowded and there was a wait but no one cared and no one left because everyone knew it was worth the wait but, I was pleased to see that they moved and upgraded! Staying close to home (about two doors down from their original place) they remodeled and now have a huge gorgeous outside dining eating area. There is ALWAYS COMPLIMENTARY cucumber and lemon water set up and readily available for whenever you need a refill. You can watch the cook making the delicate crepe through the glass or on screen from the camera pointed directly on to the special round griddle. It's so interesting and pretty entertaining and such a relief to see that your food is handled properly and made with fresh food and produce. My husband is a picky eater and he said he'd DEFINITELY be back and my 12 year old wants to go there for every birthday breakfast! We love it!

Zhn5maIXyUYieYBnuWDalg.text: Small place, very crowded, expect to wait for a table.   Highly recommend the Chorizo and the Banana crepe   Parking is always an issue in this parking lot

sLlM_ihm6KOus4HXVYS3tA.text: I wish I could live here. So cute. Good food. Lots of mimosas.  In fact, I almost fell asleep after all the mimosas I had here.  Came here one morning and was quite surprised at how cute and quaint this place was.   Kind of dark inside with frames and curtains on the wall. Decorated like you were in a country home versus a strip mall in Las Vegas.  The man who took my order was very friendly and recommended various items as it was all our 1st times there.  Funny thing is the 1st thing we ordered were the mimosa samplers. 3 samplers for each of us: guava, blood orange, watermelon, strawberry, grapefruit, coconut, pineapple, and 2 other flavors I can't recall.  Each flavor was pretty good and infused well with the champagne. Problem was it was giving me the burps before I even got my meal.   I'm more of into savory crepes kinda gal and the guy recommended the Sonora (asada steak) or the Pirate (albacore tuna) but, I was intrigued by their special of the day, Reuben crepe with the roast beef, sauerkraut, etc... UGH, it was like a sandwich...so. good!!!!! My sandwich, also, came with a chicken tortilla soup. LOVEd it. I'm pretty sure I could have just ordered that and be a happy camper.  My friends ordered the Marco Polo breakfast crepe (sausage) and another special of the day that had chicken in it. I wish I knew the name as it was quite tasty. So, was the Marco Polo.  This place is so great that I wish I could eat here everyday so I could try a new savory crepe. Exciting flavors! Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just watermeloooon juice for me **Beyonce voice**
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine and mimosas at 9am never hurt nobody.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis. PB + bananas + bacon + other goodness

DjLSJ840GuG9ZvA39wBZZw.text: A friend of mine said every time they come to Vegas, they make time to come to Crepe Expectations. This was our first time here and we will be back! It was delicious!

rFBR3l4qykWSdeYGj8BjtQ.text: Thanks to the amazing yelp reviews, my friends and I visiting Vegas decided to try out the place while on vacation and absolutely loved it! The food is delicious and definitely good for the price. Not expensive at all. The mimosa trio was my favorite (strawberry, white peach, and mango). The customer service was amazing and we will definitely go back when we are in town again! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Perfect Combination

f4K5ntC5NYVgo30lY7l7og.text: This place lives up to the hype, they are always accurate with your order and a friendly place to go. Great location with inside and outside seating. I believe they are expanding which is awesome. I return at least once a month.

l2SBZM2070JEo75hnrI18Q.text: This place is my new favorite. I tried the Marco Polo and the banana foster. They both were delicious.

ew4FWyuuIsFuzKi0xuCRiA.text: Took my mom here for lunch and she loved it.   I had the Veggie Patch. $7. It had bell peppers, mushrooms, zucchini and hummus. It was wonderful.   My mom had The Grand Turk, $7.50. It had turkey, olives, avocado, tomato and jack cheese. She loved it.   The staff here is very nice. My mom and sat at the bar and watched the talented staff make the crepes. It was really fun to watch them.   Great place for a breakfast, lunch or tasty treat!

7NAkOag6u9mNzg-wvhCV_g.text: Just left this place and wish I would have never came.  If the long line and the very rude order taker, a biker looking guy weren't a sign this place was bad then I don't know what was!  After waiting in the very long line for 25 minutes then being berated by the order taker my crepe came and it was just so fatty and rich!  No wonder everyone here is overweight!  The fattiest crepes EVER!  But the worst thing that will NEVER have me back again was the roach crawling up the wall!  WHAT??  Will NOT be back!  And unless your 150 pounds and still climbing and don't care about disease this place should not be for you either!

R2BwOaU47Fb4yTIIbX5buA.text: Who doesn't like crepes?...If you do, then this is a must-stop when visiting Las Vegas. It's away from the strip so you know you'll get good food for reasonable prices.   The location has a small dining area with tables outside. If it gets busy, put in your name and they call you when a table is ready, order at the counter and wait to enjoy a tasty meal.   I started off with a savory crepe, The Sonoma... carne asada steak, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole and jack cheese with a side of soup. Enjoyed every sip and bite of this meal. I had a few bites of my friend's banana foster crepe. Yum! can't go wrong with a classic.  They also offer, bubbly/mimosas and wine by the glass or bottles and a variety of beers. Cheers!  Other notes: Upon arrival my friend tells me that this location has been on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives aka Triple D. I may have caught the episode. Will have to find and watch it again. Service was attentive and friendly as well. I'll be back!

M9_e4ryHPGhqeIeL5YOxaw.text: If your group is in the mood for something light for breakfast, this place is tough to beat, but don't expect it to be a quick trip.  This place is usually packed and it takes a bit to get your food, but it's worth the wait, and the price is right.  There is a good mix between sweet and savory.  Most all of the sweet dishes are a bit too sweet for me, but I have sweet tooth friend's that love them.  The Veggie Patch and La Jolla are my favorites, but to each their own.  The also have nice flavored water that you can use yourself, but bring your own drinking cup if you're a bit of a environmental nerd like me because although they use plates and silverware, they use plastic for those cups.  Family run place, and you get that feeling that they take pride in making this a nice establishment.  Enjoy.

EpBXSN8SBrhrzup35zQ-Sg.text: Fantastic sweet and savory crepes and everyone working there is so cheery and fun! We visited twice in the week we were visiting. Great breakfast for climbers on a budget.

xILvBxWiJ9YNx3BVq7wU0Q.text: Crepe expectations was the perfect escape from another ridiculously hot Vegas summer afternoon. It was dark (in a good way) and cozy - decorated with purple, mirrors and shinies.  We both went with sweet crepes - Avalon for me, Ana bananas Foster for my friend. The Avalon is actually what brought me in the door - can't go wrong with pears (canned, but cooked to order on the stove with butter), goat cheese, candied walnuts and honey. It was delish.... crepe was light and not too sweet, and you could taste each individual ingredient.  I tried the Ana bananas Foster too - it was good but a little too banana for me. My friend loved it.  We also shared the mimosa tasting with lychee, white peach and pom. The white peach was our least fav, we just weren't feelin it. Lychee was great and went perfectly with our sweet fruity crepes. We also liked the pom, but not necessarily paired with the crepes. It was a good deal for $10 but note that they're cute little tasting glasses, not 3 full sized wine glasses as it kind of looks in the pic someone posted.  It was a great first time visit and I look forward to trying savory crepes like the rosarito and that cupcake moscato d'asti. Never thought of getting drunk at a crepe shop before, but with such reasonably priced wines, why not.

8jioAKBPQLgisuUV2cR7cQ.text: After reading about Crepe Expectations in Desert Companion we decided to try it.  My husband ordered the Chorizo and Egg Crepe and it was a thick, gooey crepe with loads of ground chorizo and very little egg in sight.  He could only eat half of it. Mine was a strawberry crepe and the same thick gooey crepe with a bland flavor except for the chocolate sauce on top.  The $4.50 "fresh" oj seemed like it was from concentrate and the latte was lukewarm.  And, the service was slow.  All in all, it was a disappointing breakfast.

dsxGEGyjjbr-Yu9j8aNjPw.text: stopped by for Sunday breakfast... Amazing.. We visit often and not sure why I didn't write a review until now.. I have had most of their crepes and this time we even had their mimosa trio.. very cute the way it is brought out to you, 3 flavors you pick.. love this place..

ZIUtfyOrMWLHjEwuj8_MIw.text: We had brunch here last weekend and I am smitten! Everything was amazing, including the service. The owner is a real charmer and makes everyone feel welcome. He's happy to make suggestions and he was right on with each one.   As a lot of other reviewers have mentioned, we each had a breakfast-type crepe and one desert crepe to split. Heavenly. . .absolute perfection.  Oh, it's dog-friendly as well. . .there's a cute little dog watering station outside the front door and tables outdoors.  Do yourself a favor and check this place out. We're STILL talking about it and can't wait to go back.

olFqu2vk5i5uawaWyB8bVQ.text: I took my Aunt and two young children for dinner at Crepe Expectations the week they opened.  That was 2 weeks ago and my 3 year old son has asked me everyday for a PB&J crepe.  My aunt and I both tried different crepes so that we could split them up.  DELICIOUS!  The shrimp was great, carne asada was great, the salad was awesome.  The decor is amazing and so calming.  I cannot wait to take more people there...it's such a fun treat.  Oh, and, everyone there was soooo kind!

CJxwSX3nwLKne6mBKjFz1A.text: The crepes themselves are really delicious.  I had the Monterey Crepe and I would definitely recommend it.  Will try a dessert crepe next time for sure.  I'll downside was how disorganized the seating process was as well as the wait time.  Worth the wait though.

jVrqnrGMJBuAvwH0jUrfjQ.text: I have been craving good crepes randomly for a couple months and was told this place was great.  We also wanted somewhere that was dog friendly and had patio seating. Came on a Saturday morning and it was amazing. I can say the service and staff were top notch! So helpful and down to earth. What looked to be maybe the owner is the one greeting you and very helpful with everything. The food was fresh and delicious! The entire atmosphere of the place was feel good. Tons of (well behaved) dogs with owners sitting on the front patio enjoying a beautiful Saturday morning. Very satisfied customer.

Ok0vVxwSjbF9LHJeEGqoWQ.text: There are not a lot of creperies around and not very many places for breakfast either.  While looking on Yelp for breakfast eateries today my wife found Crepe Expectations.  Wow! What a great little place this is!  The owners did a terrific job with decor.  This is a very intimate spot with half booths on one side and high top tables on the other.  Coffee and water are self serve from the small beverage bar, I didn't mind as it is a very short walk to refill.  There was no self serve soda fountain, I assume that was behind the counter someplace, didn't bother me in the least.  There are also a few tables and umbrellas for outdoor dining as well.  Back to the interior, there was a large TV in the dining area showing the Food Channel.  I don't know if that is standard or just for today.  By far the more interesting TV was the smaller one over the register displaying an overhead shot of the chef making your crepe!  Very novel idea!  Now, down to what you all want to know....the food.  Full of flavor, it had a very fresh taste as though it was all organic food, no preservatives.  I don't know if this was the case but it sure tasted that way.  The portion looked small but the crepe was packed, I was pleasantly filled with my breakfast crepe.  On the side we had a choice of cottage cheese or sliced bananas.  While not a fan of cottage cheese, I took the banana....again, I enjoyed this part of the meal even though I didn't think much of it at the time.  Overall, Crepe Expectations exceeded all of my expectations.  We are going back later this afternoon for a dessert crepe...maybe I will do an update.  One last thing, the hours are very limited...they close at 3 pm so  don't plan on coming in for a late dessert.  A great place to eat and I am looking forward to my next visit.  I'll be back in the city in June and I am sure we'll eat here again.

n6k2VgZGfzRx2H9zwzGGOA.text: Today I tried this place for the first time and it was phenomenal. I had the Caprese crepe and it was seriously one of the best things I have ever had. I have had a handful of crepes before and never really liked them, however I will end up having dreams over these crepes. I think I am going to introduce my husband to this place tomorrow.

hHNADNqJ0SFQfhll3WsRBA.text: Great food and friendly staff! It was our first time here and first time having a crepe ever! There is a seating area outside that is shaded. When we first walked up, we were greeted by a man, he took our name and suggested that we sit inside in a "waiting area" while a table opened up. So at this place, you order your food at the counter, take a seat and they bring out your food. Since they were so busy and had no available seating, the man suggested that we wait to order our food until we had a table, which makes sense. We were offered two spots at their largest table where we would share the table with other customers, but we passed up on that. We waited about 10 minutes until we had our table and ordered. Our food took about 10-15 minutes to come out. I had the The Sunday morning which had scrambled eggs, potatoes and cheese which was delicious and super filling. My husband had The Berry Delight which had strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, powdered sugar on top and whipped cream on the side. It was good, not as filling since it was just really fruit, but still really good. I would give this restaurant 5 stars, but when you're inside, it's small, you feel super cramped up and it's pretty crowded. It was a busy Sunday tho, so that's understandable. Other than that, it's a great place for breakfast/brunch!

tAOZGE2_6Uajoox8dF0aNw.text: Awesome service! Cute little spot with great fresh ingredients. Best crepes I've had in town!

x_MNpNw3y7UXTpyap0uNxQ.text: I have not found a crepe place in Las Vegas that even warrants a good review until now. The crepes at this place were delicious. I went with a group of wonderful people so I was able to try a little of everything. I ordered the Avalon which had buttered pears, goat cheese, walnuts, and honey. It was absolutely delicious. It was sweet but not too sweet if you are in the mood for dessert. I had the flight of mimosas which was also delicious. My favorite mimosa is the one with passionfruit even though it is a little sweet. The cashier we spoke with was very friendly, happy, and I really enjoyed our experience at this place.

5TFreFAj3l2tsHpZjJ2PfA.text: This place is everything you could want. Friendly and engaging atmosphere coupled with delicious crepes make this place a jewel. Definitely went over and beyond my expectations.

vowEL9pVQ6BN9EGudEgJ2A.text: "It's legal to take a crepe in public"   This little hole in the wall was everything I hoped it would be. They got me excited before I even walked in the door with their bowl of doggy treats and water on the patio. Their menu is full of so many options that I'm sure everyone will find something they like. The place is designed beautifully from the purple walls to the TV screen hanging up so you can watch your crepe being made. Specialty sodas beers and mimosas are on the menu as well as sweet and savory crepes. The food was absolutely amazing, melt in your mouth. I had the Monterrey which was just the right amount of bacon and spicy goodness all mixed in. 2nd best part of my visit here was the customer service. Polite, friendly and everything you would expect at any establishment. Our crepe cooker even came to the table to ask how it was. Of course my mouth was stuffed so all she got was a big head shake of approval but I really wish I could have hugged the woman. Definitely give this place a shot if you are looking for a light meal that will most definitely fill you up.

o0dDN-RFC4qZQMtIM2pG7w.text: The decor and ambiance were very appealing. The food was fantastic. The mimosa, typical. So why 2 stars?... The restaurant is small, tiny in fact, especially when the weather is not nice enough to utilize the patio. Furthermore, a friend and I were told, after 1 hour and $45, that if we were not going to order anything else he needed to "turn the table over." I understand the concept and reason but what I don't understand is the attitude and the rude nature of the person (I believe he was the owner). I will never return to this establishment.

NjkQPkhvgKtPaagjYrn1IA.text: Everything was wonderful. Prices were vey reasonable.  They had A LOT of variety and portions were a good size. You won't be disappointed.  Get a seat when you come in because it's busy.  Definitely will come again.

U0trovl506liMfu42wzUcg.text: Fantastic crepes! Awesome chef and servers. Very entertaining and friendly. Best breakfast place I've been in Vegas and I come here alot! Definitely coming back. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!

6pp42fwGg8YjVd5wLxemMg.text: lovely decor and lovely ambience! i thought it was super cool that they have cameras in the prep area so you can actually watch them prepare your crepes on the TV. I had the goat cheese and crepe and the bf had the sonora. i enjoyed mine but i ended up eating his crepe since i realized i was more in the mood for savory than sweet. Also had the pomegranate and lychee mimosas which were oh so divine! would come back here w. the girls =]

r2po4sDpnm9lsJ9IYT2uZg.text: The crepes are amazing.  There is no doubt that this place has fantastic food.  Crepes are thin, crispy and perfectly cooked, and filling choices are varied with something for every palate.  Fresh ingredients, great flavor combinations.  All that being said, I gave this place only 3 stars for the way they treat customers.  Their posted closing time is at 3 pm, but be prepared to be given the boot a few min after 3 pm.  What restaurant does that?!  I've never been directly asked to leave at 5 min after "closing".  They started breaking down at 2:30, carried away the self-serve drinks, swept, closed out the till and set chairs on tables well in advance of 3 pm.  Then at 3:08 pm asked us to leave.  So basically, this place should state their hours are until 2 or 2:30, but not 3 pm. We arrived before 2 pm, expecting to have a little over an hour for our meal - we did not expect to be promptly asked to leave at 3 pm.  Both good food and good service are necessary for a thriving restaurant business.  If you don't love it, don't do it.  And if you want to close up early and ask customers to leave,  perhaps you should build ejection seats into the chairs so you can get rid of those pesky customers finishing up their meal as soon as possible.

xjrfAK5wLSKa9SCKX6mD7A.text: I'm visiting Vegas and my girlfriends and I wanted a solid breakfast. This place is awesome. I got the Sunday morning and added bacon. It was more than enough and left me feeling great. Everyone who works here is very friendly and seems like a family owned place. I will def come here again.

OC1PlQNjge5oxwjjKKrDnw.text: Disappointing!   Who told them they could make a crepe!  Overstuffed with unflavored food.  Ordered the chicken Chile verde. Horrible and the Berry Delight was just as bad.    Chunks of strawberries and crepe was hard.  The kitchen work station lacks order and sanitation.   This place was much better when it was in the smaller location next door.   Will not be returning!

nbi_7NgtshhRObpkuKNXxg.text: This place is good customer service is amazing staff is friendly. Food is good as well. The new environment is awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cnqp5KeApfyHZSo1NWz3XA.text: This place is AMAZING. Their mimosa sampler is so good and a great price. Best crepes in town. Will return again!!

r3MKokYc5kdx_jUl95_y9g.text: Came here for the first time last week. I want to say the Crepe I got was the berry delight... it was really good. The way it was folded with the berries was kind of strange. The outer parts would just be the Crepe & the middle would straight be the berries. I had to open it up to evenly distribute it. Wish it came with a liiiitle more whipped cream.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry delight

_TGv7H7ID-m3GrO7RAoQ9Q.text: Went here with my family because of the great reviews. When we walked in we saw the owner talking and laughing with customers in line, which was a delightful surprise.  However, it seems as if those who know the owner personally get special treatment here. We were told that there was no seating inside for 6 people and would have to sit outside. Since it was early morning and roughly 54 degrees it seemed a little much. While waiting in line the owner allowed a group of 4 who just arrived to go before us because I assume from the way they spoke they knew each other. Extremely rude, and unprofessional.  To get coffee you have to walk up yourself to a little dirty table in the back, where cooks also leave food for the waiters to deliver. Coffee was out and when I tried to ask the guy behind the counter to refill it he completely ignored me.  Only 2 stars because the food was okay. If you're a larger group looking for breakfast, or don't know the owner, this place is not for you!!

igkUo81E5FT4-9nkKCDa1w.text: I came here with a friend for breakfast. Love the concept and let's face it anything crepe is awesome. I looked at the menu online and the crepe I wanted wasn't on the menu when we got there. I really like that this place is family run. I love the sampler mimosa idea but I really expected it to be fresh purees and not syrups. Over all it's def a place to check out at least once.

YdxQNqRbVbaef0efTTtSVQ.text: This is the only place I will always go in Vegas. It is off the strip but well worth the drive. Even on a road trip will make sure we start our day here!

d957lXHWREG8oOVtgJGJoA.text: My first time trying crepe and it's like eating a delicately thin pancake that is serve with a variety of savory or sweet fillings. I chose The Greek ($8.50) with a side of fideo soup, The Avalon ($7.75) with a side of cottage cheese, and an order of Guava juice ($2.50). The Greek is a savory crepe which has grilled chicken, spinach, feta cheese, tzatziki yogurt, kalamata olives, red onion, and tomato. The Avalon is a sweet crepe which has buttered pears, goat cheese, candied walnuts, and honey. For The Avalon I did ask for peanut butter filling and was charge an extra 50 cents, but when I receive the crepe there isn't any peanut butter. I had to reach out for caramel sauce just to sweeten it and add more flavor. Both crepes are good but it's not something I would enjoy as a daily meal. I'm more of a soft and fluffy pancake type. The fideo soup and guava juice are probably the only two items I like the best. Overall the service is friendly, I like that the server is attentive. I just wish they had paid more attention-to-detail making the correct order.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon: Buttered Pears, Goat Cheese, Candied Walnuts, Honey and Added Caramel With A Side Of Cottage Cheese
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek: Grilled Chicken, Spinach, Feta Cheese, Tzatziki Yogurt, Kalamata Olives, Red Onion, and Tomato With A Side Of Fideo Soup
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fideo Soup: A Mexican Noodle Soup With Fideo Noodles and Tomato That Is Serve Hot. It&#39;s What I Like The Best

iC2tYsp0GRjR9LyU9FDklw.text: We came here for an anniversary breakfast with the family. Never did I think crepes went well with cheese, eggs and potates; its works and it tastes amazing.  Our kids had the berry crepes and they loved it, especially the whipped cream.  I had the Sunday crepe and my husband had the chorizo one. Quantity here is plenty! Waiter was very friendly, had ordered my kids a guava juice to share, when he realized they would share he came back with two cups with lids and some water to add to it; that was a very thoughtful gesture, thank you!

rdPSAKYPT-3EQm6JwVhwew.text: Cute little brunch place to enjoy the day. I got like a BLT crepe, wanted to try the savory crepes, and it was soooo delicious and very filling. I tried to eat all of it but I couldn't. They lathered it up with spicy mayo and it was just heavenly. Along with my cranberry mimosa. It's a perfect combination. Would definitely go back when I return to Vegas.

qBfMA4Yw9kbhPsFssAD0Fg.text: As I write this, we haven't even eaten yet. From the door to order taking/making, and the awesome service in finding a table for us on a busy Sunday--- wow. I'm in love.

6huUVn_kaMAgplL2YOJctQ.text: The people who made this business made it with love and still continue to do so daily! Awesome staff and management and most of all great food!

TBlUF7KHMFr0CLdzK2arrg.text: Instant friendly face upon entering. Very busy (expected for the time). Small, small, small. Elbow room barely.   You order from a register instead of at your table. Good enough and likely a time saving measure.  We both ordered the Marco Polo Crepe and we added spinach, onion and tomato for less than  $1.00 each. We shared a strawberry and blueberries crepe that came with light whipped cream.  It was all light in flavor, no excess anything, which was great. We left feeling nice and full. Nothing was excessively oily, salty or sweet...Perfect for the palate.  You get the r/o water yourself from a table with plastic cups (cucumber infused).  The experience was fun and I'm glad that we listened to the several great reviews from recent history.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Should have opted for a closer look. Tasty no less!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small and dark while friendly and welcoming

KA7RKVZ6SqqglHBDLgMuaw.text: I went to Crepe Expectations today with my husband because I was really craving mimosas this morning. We ordered the banana foster crepes and they were delicious. Service was friendly and fast. My only complaint was from my husbands michelada. He said that it tasted stale and didn't finish it and complained on the car ride home about it. All and all delicious food, good service just bad micheladas.

a09Ynkyib3G-WDipD_aVGQ.text: This place is amazing. Service and food as well as ambiance are all on point. My wife and I come here once a week and aside from one time being a little burned (it was a pretty busy weekend day) the food is always amazing at an affordable price.

9spbJGjV-kaglm8Jh53Kxg.text: We are in town to visit a family member. We stopped in this plaza for some food. We decided to get some drinks at the Brew Tea Bar and then walked over to Crepe Expectations.  We ordered some crepes and sat down to wait for our food. The owner came over and told us he doesn't allow outside drinks to be inside his restaurant.  So I guess I have to inhale my drink before entering the premise? Or get the order to go?  I am a paying customer who was very eager to enjoy the crepes.  His attitude and demeanor definitely gave us a bad taste about this place.   The food was alright. I wouldn't recommend this place. To the owner... make you need to readjust your attitude to paying customers. Just sayin'....

R5fjweqwwW1Nm-P7LJUmfg.text: This is another go to breakfast place when we visit Las Vegas. The crepes are amazing, the staff is always very friendly. I recomend the Elvis and mimosa trio.

pZYHKLnvMGCD9Gvkz-SkOw.text: Great place. I had chorizo, guacamole and egg crepe. Well made and excellent. Wife tried a sweet one with pears honey and nuts. A little sweet for brunch. Coffee was great and the mimosa sampler fun ( we tried mango, raspberry and white peach. The first two were better   Helpful staff got our seat assignment while waiting in the order line.   Nice experience. Efficient service.

dPV-N4xyP56ACZVGCbVy9g.text: This place is "da bomb!" Everyone is so pleasant and of course the crepes are amazing.

3VckFyt4alKPewjvqESTPw.text: Great food but bit down hard on a chicken bone in my Chicken Chile Verde Crepe. Couldn't eat any more because of it. Waitress offered another meal. Good service. Steer clear of anything that might have bones in it

uBDvGyAoa0tVFQ4jMBdn2A.text: Had a breakfast crepe, just ok. The chorizo seemed like spiced hamburger meat which was a bit strange. The fresh squeezed oj tasted as if it was concentrate. Cost was high for drinks, latte and oj, considering quality.  I think this place shines for its desert crepes. Try one of those, stay away from the breakfast crepes.

qOlVmlAKfaWzv__o0IcyJg.text: This is a great place to enjoy breakfast. The food and service were great! We met the owners, who also work here, they made us feel welcomed. I had the Monterey crepe and it was delicious. Coffee and mimosas (13 flavors) on point. Will definitely visit this restaurant again.

BfEVYOYvtU2za1vUQUg2Hw.text: Walked in on a whim with a friend of mine. We were drawn in by the crowd of people dining outside. My friend was skeptical when he realized that the only thing on the menu was crepes. He had never had one, and was doubtful he would like it.  While we were discussing possibly leaving for somewhere else, the gentleman behind the counter started walking us through the ordering process by asking us things like "sweet or savory? Spicy or mild? breakfast or lunch?" until he had the perfect, individualized combo of ingredients to go into the crepe. No backing out now!  We swung by the condiment station to grab some of the lemon and cucumber infused water, and then went outside to sit down.  Food arrived, and was absolutely wonderful. Hot, flavorful, large servings. Crepes come with either banana or cottage cheese, which were both also delicious. I had a spicy chorizo crepe, and it was cheesy and meaty , with just the right amount of spice. Prices are extremely reasonable for the amount of food. I will absolutely visit again.

qXRdE_K8rdYJS1so2ozYrA.text: This place is absolutely amazing. I am from S. FL and just had to check this place out. I am beyond impressed. The food is delicious and the staff and owner are just simply amazing. I will most definitely be coming back. Loved it!!!

rsXusR4v7dC5RAzboNKLQA.text: I enjoyed the Champagne Trio. The coffee was self-serve which was nice to have to ask the staff for refills on the coffee. It was nice they had complimentary cucumber-infused and lemon-infused water.  We opted for the chorizo and carne asade crepes, they were delicious.  I usually skip crepes, too sweet for me.  But think of these like thin tortillas, a burrito, able to fill in with whatever your heart desires.    We had a 20 minute wait to get a table, then another 20 minutes waiting for the food to come out. Luckily we had great company and the time flew by.

BnOlLnbpdhzfwhcShUQmmg.text: Excellent crepes!  We tried the Rosarito with chorizo, if you like chorizo I recommend.  The Fideo soup that came with the Caprese crepe was on point, similar to my mom's recipe.  Also tasted the Bananas Foster Crepe and it was delicious.   Friendly staff.  A great yelp find.

Hxge9hObr7oK5X3l6soTFw.text: I LOVE CREPES!! I would give them NO STARS if that was an option.  Drove here all the way from Summerlin, excited to try this place for the first time.  I wouldn't know if the crepes were any good.  We walked out because their system to sit people and order food is bad!!  The cashier was cleaning tables, calling people, serving meals, etc.  It was chaotic and disorganized!!  Many other places in town for crepes.  I was so disappointed, had my heart and palate set on crepes.  :(

Jfp70HdIGcZ0bOqBL_Edpg.text: The place is tiny and the seating/ordering is odd at first (you order at the counter and they give you a number and bring your order to the table). But there is a friendly, boisterous bear-of-a-man that talks you through your order and keeps the line moving along smoothly. The service is good and the crepes are fresh and delicious! I have tried most of their savory crepes and quite a few of their sweet ones and none of them disappoint. The Grand Turk is my all time favorite and in the cooler months it comes with a very simple but very tasty Fideo Soup.

oI_gjfRsNBF3J8LWRy6jag.text: I completely misunderstood what a crepe was, I thought it was a boring pancake filled with Nutella... I was soooooooo wrong. This place is excellent. I love it so much. I'm so glad! If you haven't already: try the Elvis or of you're there when they do the pulled pork crepe don't miss it. I had bites of my companions' crepes and the here delicious too. Their mimosas are excellent as well.

iiRezYc4yPkpC9VxAVO0uw.text: Best place ever to have breakfast! Super nice workers too.  I'll be definitely going back soon.

PXfP4XHRP9d3RL-jaS5d6g.text: My fiance tried this place out for the first time and it was absolutely amazing! The people there were so amazingly sweet they made us feel so welcomed and talked to us as if they have known us our whole lives! So pleasant and amazing! The food was out of this world! I have to eat gluten free because I have celiac and I was nervous coming here but they knew their menu and the one thing on the menu I wouldn't be able to have they said they could modify it for me so I can have it. I love it! Their mimosas were delicious! The bathroom even had a salt scrub in it. Wish I didn't live 35 min from this place! Also, they cater! We will def be back!

kDWzZCXqBQ5V9BFJTJdcbw.text: Great crepes!! You can watch them make them because they have cameras that do a bird's eye view of the process.  The seating is weird. If you go on the weekend when it would busy, you have to go to the counter and let them know how many people you have, and they won't take your order until you're seated, which has its pros and cons.   The owner is usually working the register and he's awesome - he'll make great recommendations based on what you like or are in the mood for and he's really personable.  Only four stars because when it's busy, it's a bit of a long wait. That being said, DEFINITELY worth it!

cbd127XELgu-y5tIkGEjXg.text: This is by far one of the hub's and my favorite places to eat breakfast. We're probably there once or twice a month. Let's start with the service - Lou (at the register, and the owner) and Mike (greeting and serving) are both so kind and friendly and instantly make you welcome. They make it feel like a family place, which is so nice. Often we have to wait to order and be seated, but it's well worth it and a small space so not surprising in the least for how delicious everything is.  I've tried every breakfast crepe on the menu and my fave is by far the Rosarito - eggs, guac, jack cheese and chorizo folded into a delicious crepe. First, I generally can't stand chorizo, but this is additively delicious and not greasy in the least. Second, I prefer egg whites and that's never an issue to customize as desired. Hubs always gets the vegetarian breakfast one that has potatoes and adds guac. Then, we order some salsa on the side. Never before had I thought of eating savory crepes before here, but they are oh so delicious!  So, the salsa...Mike by now knows hubs well and that he loves spicy so if their not too busy and have hot peppers in back, he has some super spicy salsa whipped up for him. It makes them both happy which is fantastic, and just a nod to the wonderful experience they provide there. I can't recommend Crepe Expectations enough - the crepes are all beyond delicious and the quality and caring service provided by Lou, Mike and the rest of the folks there is wonderful.

x5ZBsgBnxNouYwSj7vw-Ng.text: This is a must stop breakfast place when you visit Vegas.  There were some really unique combinations for their crepes.  I chose the savory route, the Rosarito was a spicy, yet tasty way to start the day, with a guava juice to balance it out.  The other members of the crew chose the sweet route, bananas foster and the monkey crepes...also very tasty.  Definitely worth a try!  Staff was very friendly, helpful with the menu and very attentive.

iw26d4b9Bc_DS2VxebnxFA.text: This place has incredible service and amazing food. Mike is delightful and stays upbeat and positive under crazy fast moving conditions! Love this place and their amazing service. These are people who love their jobs.

xdp4rJDRaaLy8IowDJdD5A.text: Fresh ingredients make Crepe Expectations a great place for breakfast and lunch. I got the Monterey because I was in the mood for bacon. The crepe was well prepared and all the ingredients inside the crepe were fresh and distinctive. I also got a lemonade with three kinds of fresh berries juiced and added. It tasted good but the flavor wasn't especially distinctive. The decaf coffee was also good.  Service was friendly. I'd definitely like to return and try some of the other crepes.

jUuYCTvFAgPBmb0rXpMbsQ.text: My husband and I just had the most amazing crepes. The coffee is very good as well. The staff is very friendly and they offer you choices or substitutions if you need them. We are visiting from out of state and they made us feel very welcome. I highly recommend this place. Great job Crepe Expectations see you soon.

muv0cNwbBxWEqcKAbUbyQg.text: I am so glad that we traveled quite a distance from the strip to enjoy this adorable place. My husband and I were both in the mood for some fresh delicious crepes and had zero desire to walk to the Paris hotel and casino. I looked up crepes on Yelp and was really impressed with the 4.5 star rating.   This is an adorable little place nestled in a strip center with a ton of other restaurants. They have a nice little seating area outside, the interior isn't too big. We ordered the Monterrey breakfast crepe with bacon, eggs, peppers, cheese and chilies, the Crepelete with Swiss, eggs and thick smoked ham and the Monkey with Nutella, sliced bananas, whip cream and chocolate drizzle. Each crepe was totally different and delicious. They were generous with the fillings and  given a healthy dose of cheese. The Monkey was super good and went perfectly with the other crepes and my coffee. They have a camera over the crepe griddles so you can see them make each order. The eggs are even made to order, no scoop out of a warmer here.   They offer fresh cucumber and lemon water to drink along with a variety of mimosas, beers, soft drinks and coffee. There is even a mimosa flight!   I highly recommend this place! Even more so because you are getting quality food without the Strip price tag. Totally worth the drive and you get to see another side of Vegas while you are at it.

Nbe1XeWU4L5R42y-uG7yBQ.text: Food was great, very laid back enviroment. Everyone is super nice. Im visiting from san diego and as soon as i walked i felt like i was a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The creplet
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The monkey

Ral1WHm8UJAuCU2v34KPgQ.text: Excelente Atmosphere. Friendly people.. Come here. It's a great place to try out. It's delicioso!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avalon

jWNQmdBw2vAejqMryMfeFg.text: On our way out of Vegas headed back to Phoenix we wanted some breakfast that wasn't on the strip. We found this place and we're very very pleased. They were extremely helpful and welcoming and the food was delicious. Plus the best part is my wife and I both ate a very filling breakfast for under $15!! Great place if you want to try something different.

9Q5kXYWr9kjZmQlUh1KxrA.text: Best crepes I've ever had and quick service. Got the berries and cream with the Monterey and split both with my mom. Great combination of sweet and salty. Berries were fresh and large, crepes were perfect-light and slightly crispy on the edge, the whipped cream is definitely homemade, fresh and not to sweet. Bacon was crispy- thank you Jesus! The owner recommended the Elvis which is not on the menu but my dad ordered it. Phenomenal. Peanut butter, bacon, caramel, bananas and whipped cream. And I'm not a huge PB fan.  Do yourself a favor and don't miss this place. P.S Guy Fieri went here :)

6w9UTdqmTG9wipQWttPPcg.text: Very tasty food and kind staff. We tried the Sunday morning, caprese and veggie patch - each of them were different, unique flavored with the use of different dressing on each one. All in all yummy !

Zn3Jtg6bS_HvrPPYNgva2g.text: Crepes are up there in price but well worth it I got a Nutella crepe with hazelnuts, big portion large variety of crepes to choose from

dZw0-Ld92Kh1AIFTEbSTIw.text: When I visit Las Vegas, I would always come to Crepe Expectations for breakfast.  Sitting is much bumper spacious as they have moved 3 doors down recently.  I always tried different Crepe each time and I had The Sonora and my wife had the Berry Delight.   Both plates were light yummy and delicious.  Price is reasonable.  Would recommend any out of towners for a try!

xUq40hHBcClUxXkvG3nzlw.text: MAN. From the first bite (Ana Banana Foster) it was amazing. AMAZING. My wife had the Avalon...AMAZING. Coffee is great, ambience is great, if I lived here I would come all the time. AMAZING.

mZOJeZNgoDDd8JtfsE1Gig.text: Great place to have some breakfast with the family. It's cute and cozy inside and plenty of room outside also the staff is super friendly and The added bonus is The free car show...The Ana Banana Foster was delicious.. definitely my favorite..
