_Z-faWbHmvGG5T6dMhLeXQ.text: Yummy!!! We had the white chocolate latte, the Fresco Crepe and the Anna Banana Crepe

qNjXm-CmJnGhTROLzNfNeQ.text: The crepe is very delicious witfh a very very fair price. The service is also great, kind staffs and a lot of choice to choose from!

wdRAu65oDJLJfHamu3-10Q.text: It was good. The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because the person making the crepes didn't do it in one fluid motion. I don't think they use enough batter for their crepes. It was painful to watch the chef struggling to spread the crepe batter evenly. The crepes were alright.

STJS5wakb3CRM3j0XP72Lw.text: I had the cinnamon simple pleasure crepe and a vanilla latte. Nothing to fancy just very tasty. Both come with or without whipped cream. The vanilla latte was more like a small bowl of coffee. It was enormous and delicious. Prices were fair and service good.

v-iw7WqlF3fGhmkp-Qzmiw.text: Absolutely loved this little spot. I was looking for somewhere to take my dog with me for breakfast because he needed to go to the vets afterwords. Crepe Expectations popped up on my yelp and I decided to check it out. Our waiter, who's name we didn't get, was absolutely incredible. He checked on us, my dog, and brought my dog water and treats! My dog had a great time sniffing everything and hanging out and the crepes were delicious. I will definitely be back with my other dog :-)

mnriX0UIAEeDYv30_z5jPg.text: The food is great but the workers here must not have a certain structure to follow. You would assume first come FIRST SERVED. That is not the case here. We have been sitting for 15 minutes just to receive apple juice for my daughter and sister.   Definitely love the food but for the amount of time you spend waiting is just not worth it in my book.   Especially with an antsy 3 year old it's almost not worth the money. I could have had a nice crepe whipped up over at IHOP for half the price and half the wait time. Put my order in at 11:22 and it is now 11:45. This is just one wait that is a bit too far stretched for me  I will only come back if this place gets more staff on hand to deal with crowds big and small.   Actually   Upon waiting 30 minutes(luckily my mom called so I have the call log to prove my wait time) the owner and server show nothing but disrespect. My daughter finished her apple juice in the waiting period. I noticed other patrons that arrived after me already finished and walking out. If you make a mistake and forget a customer, do your best to make it right. Not argue. If you don't have customers, you don't have a job to go to. Thanks for refilling my daughters juice, it's not like I asked you to comp my meal. Especially for a fresh cooked meal, a smile or some respect to your patrons would be nice.   One thing I did not like at all was them arguing with me over the damn juice. He had the nerve to shout in front of everyone "There's always that one person that wants everything for free" When did the words free or give me anything come out of my mouth. Never.   So you just lost a patron. Hopefully more people will see True colors of this place and realize there's much better breakfast/brunch spots in town.   Disrespecting a woman is one thing, but to do it in front of a room full of people is another.   I wish him a better day. Maybe a career choice as well.

GNUuMnlXPQpQE5jUfW404g.text: I had great expectations, and finally got to try Crepe Expectations today.  Obviously a popular place, and a little bit too noisy.  I had the Veggie Patch and a strawberry lemonade.  The first two ingredients listed for the entree were red peppers and portobello mushrooms.  The red peppers did not look fresh, thank goodness there was not a whole lot of them.  There were no portobello mushrooms at all!  Only 2-3 tiny ones but not portobellos.  A lot of hummus, for sure, and zucchinis.  This crepe should be renamed Hummus Mud Patch, there was so much hummus it was oozing out of the crepe!  Or the ingredients listed should be re-arranged wth portobellos taken out altogether.  Sadly, my expectations were not met, definitely disappointed, will not be back.

Kp8AVmpK9L4Hr6t5M7Y7uA.text: Food - 5 Stars Service 4 Stars Location/Interior 4 Stars  It is in a little plaza not too far off the highway, ample (free) parking. Inside it is very small. There is one large table in the middle and booths around the side. You order at the counter and then the food is brought to your table.  I got there before my party and they did not seat me, which was kind of annoying, since I wanted a mimosa. Oh well.  The food/drink more than made up for it. For food I got the carne asada crepe, which was delicious. I cannot say enough good things about it. I also got the cherry mimosa which I never had, but loved it as well.

QAkWqem9t9ZDoT2jvOd45A.text: All I have to say is.. GLUTEN FREE CREPES!  The owner is a sweetheart and just makes you feel great when you go in there! The place is super small so sometimes there is a wait but definitely worth it. Try out the mimosa sampler as well!

l9KweEpBX7NO6GXj1cTECA.text: My husband and I saw the owner on Diners Drive-ins and Dives and absolutely loved his fun personality so when we were going to Vegas we decided to stop by the place and oh my God we are sooooo glad we did! The atmosphere is great, the staff are great, the owner (who was working the register was GREAT) and the crepes were some of the BEST crepes we had. Now every time we go to Vegas we stop by Crepe Expectations. The only downside is that there is only one location

jJ1uDN-vCeimxtHv35YQFQ.text: Good selection of crepes. The mimosa trio is a must have.  So many flavors. They have sweet crepes for my sweet tooth or savory crepes if I don't feel like a sugary dish.

FL8knE8CuWQCi7SkAo1nCw.text: PLEASE EXPAND! Please, I'm begging you! Only reason I can't give 5 stars is we waited close to 50 minutes for our food to arrive, they were so busy, and rightfully so! There is a fair amount of tables inside the place, and additional outside, but the day we came it was cold and windy, so inside was our only option. We needed a table for four, so I had to be one of those annoying people who hang around until a party leaves so I could pounce on a table that became available. The gentleman running the place was very nice and tried to be as accomodating as he could be, I knew he was super busy and trying to take orders and run food at the same time and also clean tables.   While I waited for the rest of my party to arrive, I passed time with the mimosa trio, mango, tangerine and watermelon. Mango had to be my favorite. They have a really good selection of savory and sweet crepes, so depending on your mood, many options. I couldn't decide, so my friend and I decided to split two, The Monterey (which is on the breakfast yumm menu available anytime) it had bacon, scrambled egg, tomato, red onion, serrano peppers and jack cheese. Jackpot!  This was scrumptious! Then we split the Elvis (or was it called Fat Elvis)? Bacon, peanut butter, bananas and caramel. Really? Need I say more?   Props for having a great beer selection (Chimay anyone)? and they have ginger beer! I LOVE ginger anything. I'm definitely coming back, a long wait won't keep me from this place, just can't come starving like I did previous two times.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio

ql2cejPiHEmGWItzuGhGuA.text: Simply Delicious.  I had The Monterey for brunch.  It contained scrambled eggs, bacon, monterey jack cheese, peppers and tomato and it was outstanding.  The fresh squeezed orange juice (made with the right oranges-Valencias) was a great pairing with the crepe.  The side of bananas was nice, too.  The service was very friendly and efficient.  One warning, however, there might be a wait.  I hate, hate, hate to wait, but I waited about 30 minutes here AND I'D DO IT AGAIN.  It was well worth the wait.

BMIhupVjUD7I5v98LbgM6w.text: Absolutely phenomenal. It has been a bit since I have been willing to give an establishment 5 stars after only one experience, but my initial visit to Crepe Expectations was simply all around perfection.   I met a friend for brunch on a Sunday at 11 am. The place was packed, with a line of people waiting to order and be seated. For a minute I contemplated leaving and finding a less busy place to eat, but we had been talking about trying the crepes (and mimosas!!) here for too long to do that... Besides, that may people willing to wait was almost sure to be a indicator that good things were to come to us if we exercised a little patience.   The line moved surprisingly quick, we were seated at the 'bar' in front of the crepe making stations about 20 minutes after arrival. The bar is a prime spot to sit.. You get to watch every crepe get made. Based on what we saw, I already know what I will be ordering the next 2-3 times I go in.   We started out our meal with some of the self-serve cucumber water (love that there is an option other then lemon!) and a mimosa trio. We tried the raspberry (ok), the blood orange (delicious) and my favorite, the nectar of the gods, aka the white peach. I have no idea what kind of bubbly is used at Crepe Expectations, and I do not claim to be an expert on champagne either...  but these mimosas were some of the tastiest I have ever had.   On to the grub!! I had the Sunday Morning with bacon added. This crepe slaughters every breakfast burrito I have ever had with regard to taste. It was amazing, the only thing it was lacking was a little salsa, but it was still excellent without it. Since we were debating between sweet and not sweet crepes, my friend and I also split the Berry Delight. Strawberries, blueberries and blackberries, all super juicy and fresh... with just the right amount of whipped cream.   Honestly the ONLY thing I can say about Crepe Expectations that isn't positive is that it's on the small side. With food and service this good, I think they could easily fill an area double, maybe even triple the current size. Regardless, even knowing there may be a wait, I'll be back. And for the days I can't wait, there is always the option of takeout! I look forward to warmer weather, as the outdoor seating looks right up my alley (and they are dog friendly at Crepe Expectations!!) 5 star, all around amazing place.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White peach, blood orange and raspberry mimosa trio

H7FXhLEZAijJkIqqWIdjAg.text: New to this and it was delicious.  The first time you come you may feel a little off... There is no host and u have to go order your food.  The place is pretty small but it's very familystyle.  Sit next to a strange and enjoy your breakfast. It brings us closet I think.   Great prices and it made my tummy happy.  Another Guy Fereri  stop added to my buckle lol. Come try it out the Rosarito was very tasty.  I will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love when I see this.  Added another Guy Fereri stop and it was worth it.

vBW4hX4Tb-qFwQKdrj0AFg.text: We visited Henderson while celebrating our anniversary in Vegas in May. This place looked adorable and we wanted in! The only problem was that there is apparently a method to being served and the waitress didn't care to tell me when we were seated. You order at the register and then sit down. So we sat for about 15 minutes before I asked the waitress about ordering. She was short and directed me to the register. I was peeved. It's small place. We must have been visible.   But our order was taken we returned to the table. A Greek inspired crepe and one with bananas. They were huge so she split each down the middle and shared. Very good. Definitely worth the wait.

0Zk8lgyz-nq11S0Gz4by2Q.text: My boyfriend and I have dined here a handful of times and every time the food and service has been consistently superb! Today we came about 30 minutes before close and we were given the same perfect service and never felt rushed.

hel508cXOBAo4i1ZgDdtRg.text: Thank youYelp!  We stumbled on this while passing through Vegas.  It is WELL worth the effort to get off the freeway and stop in for a bite. We stopped in for breakfast, but some of their creeps would make a great lunch as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Preparations...

5GPfFBuheVTz6yPOEyeqiQ.text: This is my 2nd time eating here and it once again exceeded my expectations.  The crepes are light, homemade whip creme, fresh fruit, great service, friendly staff..what more can anyone ask for..if in the las vegas area this place is a must try!

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Delight!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chocolate yum! My son says it looked like a whirlpool of chocolaty goodness.

F7ZUbNtWGparmOnWLe3Hkw.text: Sorry short review.  I will have to come back.   We had to leave early for emergency reasons. Unrelated.  The food looked amazing if we could have stayed.

_vOzORYciRunW7atqhLoBA.text: Saw this place on triple D and my wife and I decided to try it. As Guy would say "this place is out of bounds!" So bomb! We got the Sonora and the William tell from the episode and I'm glad we did. Great flavor and texture plus everything is scratch made. Awesome staff. My wife and I were in Vegas celebrating our vow renewal and they gave use a free soup. Which was tasty btw! Get the mimosa sampler you won't regret it.

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sonora
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa Sampler-mango-watermelon-guava

PkiD4Fesjx2j17qZKDkc6A.text: There are very few places to get Crepes.  Thank goodness for this one.  Very small restaurant, but the the ambiance, decor, and furniture is calming.  The dim lights.  I think the word is intimate?  Not that intimate because alot of people go there and it can get a little loud (but not to the point where you're yelling at your friend).  Patio seating is available too.  The weather was cloudy (with some rain) the last time I came, but they had a tent if you still wanted to sit outside.  I did.  This is the perfect place to hang with your girlfriends for mimosas, champagne, and brunch.  It just has that ambiance to it.  Water options include cucumber water or regular water.  Cute.  Cucumber water tastes so much better than regular water.  Sweet and Savory menus.  All crepes are good for two people (unless you're really really hungry, or you just eat more than the average person).  I've tried the Little Italy, The Sonora, and the Ana Bananas Foster.    The Little Italy is (what I think) like a light calzone or a homemade hotpocket.  You can't go wrong with that if you like Italian food or pizza.    If you like mexican, The Sonora is a great choice.  The Ana Bananas Foster has a sweet and semi-bitter taste to it (due to the brandy).  It comes with a side of whipped cream.  Fantastic, but I think they put a little bit too much bananas in the crepe.    Clean bathrooms.  They have a sugar scrub you can try in the bathroom that's also available for sale.

d3xACjk7Jo_CD4MYFNoiWA.text: The complete lack of organization is disappointing. We walked up to get a to go order and was immediately told, without any greeting, "I have a 20 minute wait for a table". We said we wanted an order to go and was told to "go over there", pointing toward a counter.   The man at the counter took our order and gave us a number. There was no instruction on what to do next, so we asked if the order was to go and he responded, "no, you didn't tell me that, I'm not a mind reader". We apologized to him for our apparent misunderstanding of what to do and he took the number back and yelled that it was to go.   After this we stood in the middle of the restaurant waiting for an order with various people asking us to move quite frequently.   This was one of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had, and will never return to this place again. I do not recommend it to anyone unless they are prepared to be confused and belittled.

Yfx9Spf3EVGp6WPOrdhcsQ.text: My wife ordered the Ana Banana foster and I order the Sonora... both were extremely good.  I would definitely come bacm here to try more crepe.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sonara -

YQWLmOum0GhenI1BDgX0Mw.text: What a cute little place for brunch!! We loved as soon as we stepped in. They had an open kitchen in the corner and a video that displayed how the crepe is actually made. It's of course a made to order crepe is in front of us! As much as we loved the look and feel of the place , we were not that satiated with the taste of it. Probably our expectations were high. We ordered the veggie patch and the Avalon crepe. Both tasted good but not exceptionally good for the hype that's given! On the whole an unique place with a decent food!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Freshly made crepes!!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cool :)

iC9pcDFM-AKDRzbQIywe2Q.text: Delicious, fun, and friendly staff...how can you go wrong. So many different crepes to choose from. We had an 'Elvis' that included bacon, peanut butter, caramel and bananas, it was fantastic. We also ordered a 'Rosarito' that included scrambled eggs, chorizo, guac and jack cheese, it was incredible. It was spicy and savory all at the same time. The owner is kind, friendly and goes out of his way to make you feel welcome. Also try the specialty mimosas, I tried the pomegranate and loved it. When visiting Vegas, it will always be on our 'must go to' list.

HwakOxRYFF3DnFlTRghFGA.text: Wow this place is great. Great crepes and great lemonade. Amazing staff! I had two staff members taking care of me and talking to me. It was great. I didn't realize this was a brunch place so it must have been odd that I came by myself. Still amazing service. Whipped cream made in house. The staff can recommend you the perfect crepe. I wish they were open later so I can swing by after work. Still love it! Thank you!

96iNQZkKH4Lxirn1LUajCw.text: CAUTION: THEY USE LATEX GLOVES HERE! I saw the box, and in big, bold letters was LATEX.  Better to switch to vinyl or nitrile for people who have latex allergies. I had The La Jolla.  Delicious.  The crepe was done perfectly and the filling was bacon, romaine, tomato, guacamole, chipotle mayo.  Yum!

RBB9et-lRjind3hQl82Sug.text: My boyfriend and I were looking for a good spot for brunch and Yelp'd open places near us and because it is located in a convenient shopping center near my place, we had to give it a try.    Right place, right time!  We got there just in time to snag a two-top inside (not much cooler than out, but better still).  I ordered "The Crepelet" (ham, swiss, and egg) and my boyfriend ordered "The Rosarito" (guac, chorizo, egg, cheese).  They come with a choice of sliced bananas or cottage cheese and they're HUGE!  I ordered The Crepelet because I wanted something savory without onions, but beware!  The ham has onions and tomatoes kinda on it.  It's not overpowering, but if you're sensitive to onions, keep it in mind.  What's really cool is that the owners are working at the restaurant, so you really get to see that it's a small business!  Another cool thing- you can watch them make your crepe on a tv they have up by the register (you can see it if you're seated inside).  It's really neat to watch them actually make the crepe (not premade and reheated like at IHOP and other places)!    One thing to note: we looked online at the menu before arriving and noticed that the prices online are about 25-50 cents lower than what's listed in store (not a big deal, but maybe you need those quarters!).

fOh06N9N50UZEIabdSkAUA.text: One of my favorite breakfast/brunch places. I've been here a few times and my favorites are the Greek, the grand Turk, and banana foster! The banana foster alone is amazing! Service here is always wonderful! Everyone is friendly and helpful. They have a pretty good selection of different crepes. They get pretty busy but definitely worth coming to especially if you love crepes.

as-XOv1Un1VQTOPETWv11w.text: My fiance and I eat here every weekend, no exaggeration. The food is always quality and fresh and delicious!!! The prices are incredibly reasonable too! Favorite breakfast place of all time!

P4H9_y0fyYp_gbTvu70vPw.text: You know when you've been going to place for so long and then they move - you're like nooooooooo!  Well I didn't know Crepe Expectations had moved a few doors down from where they were located until I decide to go there yesterday.   I felt a little lost, then confused and was like ohhh there it is....  So long story short I really loved the small &  packed crepe house experience I always got when I ate there.   I loved the fact that I could sit right in front of the window and watch the chefs prepare each and every crepe.   And on a busy weekend morning, it's a mad house and you know why people come here!   Now that Crepe Expectations has moved - it feels so big and on a Weekday morning there may have only been 10 or so tables occupied, it felt empty.   So with my mind still racing about the new venue...I will say this.   I enjoyed my crepe and so did hubby! The service was friendly and prompt and they checked in on us to make sure everything was ok.  Maybe I'll try a weekend next time to see how things go.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CO62ObwMfaikBLoE92TwpQ.text: While it can get a bit crowded, Crepe Expectations is an excellent option regardless of which meal you have lined up.   Star 1: How were the service and atmosphere?  Prior to walking in it's helpful if you know the system at Crepe Expectations. It's seemingly always crowded, so know that you have to get in line and while you're there the friendly staff will try and line up a table for you. It doesn't always work, but they do a heck of a job keeping the operation running smoothly even in the face of lengthy lines. Kudos. Star.   Star 2: How were the portions relative to the cost?  Pretty much everything at Crepe Expectations sits below the $10.00, which is a real bargain given the portion sizes. I opted for the special of the day which was a Green Chili Verde savory crepe, and I ended up with a meal that probably could have fed a person and a half. Good value. Star.   Stars 3 and 4: How was the food?  My Green Chili Verde Chicken crepe was very, very good with fresh ingredients and good flavors that came together in the crepe, but it was my girlfriend's breakfast crepe that was truly spectacular with eggs and breakfast meats from far and wide. Two Stars.   Star 5: Would you eat here every day if you could?  I'll be back to Crepe Expectations to try their array of sweet crepes, but until then I can't for sure say that I'd recommend Crepe Expectations head and shoulder above the various competitors in the area. More to come. No Star.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Chili Verde Special: $8.99

_q3YljMnRxFUUz78b2h4Qw.text: Very delicious food, and a great selection of crepe dishes. I've never really been a big crepe fan, and I've never had a "savory" crepe before, but I have to say, I was delighted by the food here. I ordered the grand turk and my boyfriend got the sonora. I'd say "refreshed" is rarely a word that comes to mind after I eat a meal, but I felt refreshed after my meal here. The crepe itself is wonderfully made, and the contents are exceptional as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sonora (top) and The Grand Turk (bottom) with side salads. The dressing is VERY unexpected, sort of a tangy lemon dressing.

0Cv7A3ddHL7x5zqH042AhA.text: This is a great breakfast place that Shanna and I found probably 5 or more years ago. When we first found this place it was a little hole in the wall and it was packed, with a line all the way to the door. Mike the manager is a great guy as well as the rest of the staff. The first time we went we didn't know what we were getting ourselves into and we each ordered a savory crepe and then split a dessert crepe. We were so full since the crepes are so big. Now we know better and only order a savory and dessert crepe and share both. They moved almost next door to the original location and expanded and now have more seating with a nice outdoor patio to sit and dine in. I don't see a lot of the original staff but Mike is still there doing a fabulous job running around taking great care of all the customers and I think I heard they might be opening a second location. It seems to me that the girl that was making the crepes when we first went there has left or is no longer making the crepes and because of that I didn't give 5 stars. I think the quality of the crepes were a little off and they were slightly burnt. All and all still a really great place with good food and great people. Get out of the casinos and the buffet lines and go get some real food.

qOtRtkaXugZ-3rR0YjPsBw.text: I saw this restaurant on DDD last night and couldn't wait to try it! I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED! The owner took our order was kind, funny, and very helpful! The food was outstanding even though the restaurant was packed and the mimosa choices were unique. The gentleman that was running our food was also very pleasant! I will be coming back and recommending this place to everyone I know!

hy1Vjja3rmatKj54ssyfHA.text: Great food, great customer service. The owner was super nice and very personable even with how busy it was. The wait for food was a little on the long side, but definitely worth it. Tons of mimosa options. Big portions, great prices. Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas!

y15zZ_Z1CJ2P-xRAyRVJZw.text: Love the desserts and the savory crepes!  I ordered the lemon cheesecake with berries and the barbecue crepe for brunch. They were yummy.

QnQXITQlsjOHSosbaRANLA.text: I came here with some friends and was really blown away by how good the food was. It's definitely a little different than some of the place you'll eat especially the concoctions of the different types of crepes but it's work it.  We were able to sit outside and each got our food quickly. The service was great and we were happy with everything. I'll definitely come back and would recommend it to my friends to check out if they were in the area.

LPHXOB1OVK6ENYENH3fSyg.text: Now located in a larger space a few doors down from the old space. There is a large covered outdoor patio & several tables inside. We went on a Wednesday around 10:30 & it wasn't too busy. When we walked in we we able to look at the menu and go right up to the counter to place our orders. You pay when ordering and are given a number to put on your table and they bring out your food. Everyone was friendly, quick & efficient.   We ordered the La Jolla, Marco Polo & Chicken Chili Verde. All were delicious and very filling. Plus they each came with a little side. The favorite of the three was the Chicken Verde. I think it was a special but I hope it's always on the menu! Definitely worth a trip back.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La Jolla
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marco Polo
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chili Verde

uqRqu_LaZGVdWtBe7l4ivg.text: Wow!!! How have I not found this place sooner! We went this morning due to me finding it on here for gluten free opinions. They make the crepes right where you can see. Very clean environment! Staff is amazing and very friendly and helpful. They are very supported of our military as well!!!! Now to the food....huge portions and fresh top quality ingredients. I have been to many establishments that are not half the size and/or quality for a higher cost. They cost is another amazing thing for such quality and quantity!!!! I had the veggie delight with added egg whites gluten free and the Frisco (blue berry and lemon custard) gluten free. You cant eat one in one sitting they are so large!!! The flavors are fresh and well blended. They do not skip what so ever on the size or amount of the ingredients going inside of the crepes! Husband had the greek and berry delight. He was just as happy about his order. We were also always looking for crepes not during breakfast times, well now we have one. This will now be a regular stop for us. We highly recommend you try and will not be disappointed at all!!!

YPSIztHONr_Ol4EcxsadQA.text: Amazing breakfast/lunch spot. Great service and big portions. Will definitely return next time I'm in NV!

-6l4BTxBGFOKOOsY30hEuA.text: We are here for breakfast. We have ordered the Monterey, the Reuben and the money. They are making the crepe in front of you. The crepes taste good. The money crepe is the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6THoslPga58YOzZ-4gnxVA.text: This is our second time here and we are from arizona.  We come here when in Vegas because their food is so good.  They are not far from the strip and the food is soooo goood.   I do their flight of mimosas - three for 10 dollars you can not beat that.   We usually go for breakfast and get a sweet to share.   Everyone there is working to make your experience a good one.   They all work together to get you great service - I would come here more often if I lived closer.

EO-d1GyTwIpiiQX66KqB3g.text: In Vegas a couple of weeks ago and read the reviews and decided to give them a try. We went around 11 and got right in. Lots of options to try and our group of 6 tried various dishes. Upon entering we were greeted warmly and had any questions answered. The two men the greater and the one that sat us were over the top in taking care of us. BUT great food and people were a pleasant surprise!  We would have made a second trip if we had had a chance. It is a 15 to 20 minute drive from the strip but well worth your time. We will make this a stop on our next visit!

WnXIGeAuDcuCg7Qo_t7vTg.text: The food was great but WHY IS IT SO COLD IN HERE? It's ridiculous... everyone was either wearing a sweater inside or they were displaying that awkward body posture one has when they're cold. The door was also opened the entire time letting a breeze in... food got cold quick.... and there's no way for them to close the door. Keep the temperature at a normal setting for everyone.... don't just cater to your clients who have hot flashes.

lb2uXz_1Kwm7-nJGN-Wapw.text: So delicious! I had a Frisco with blueberries and lemon custard and my daughter had the Monkey. The crepes are huge so one is more than enough. It's pretty crowded inside but they do have a lot of space outside on the terrace.

UzYQ5soXhhKImkcWY0mUGw.text: Dont know what to say but....AMAZING! They staff are constantly moving in the kitchen, cleaning tables and making sure their customers are well taken care of. This restaurant also has wine for this who just want to chill outside in their patio. I highly recommend this place.

9SSYtfoRmnoQCfd3Y534gw.text: So yummy and the owner is very personable! I got the mimosa trio (watermelon and peach were so good) with the Greek. I really liked it. The next time we are in Vegas we will defiantly be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio and the Greek

uomFRJS7x7jgILWVgxCWHA.text: This place is AMAZING! We make a point to find Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives locations anywhere we go. This was, by far, my favorite place I ate at on our trip. Since we were in east coast time, we were waking up super early so we got there a little after opening. We tried one savory and one sweet- I got the Rosarita (chorizo, egg, avocado, cheese) and my boyfriend got the Elvis (banana, peanut butter, caramel, bacon). Both were out of this world. Holy cow, I dream of these crepes!! The portions are huge, and it's all you can drink coffee if you decide to get some. I think we paid about $23 in total and we left stuffed! Our future trips to the area will definitely include making a stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarita (chorizo, egg, avocado, cheese) with some hot sauce. In the back is the Elvis.

-LV2o4xxwoUFF7EafRz6vA.text: This is one of my favorite places to bring family that are visiting Vegas. They are always busy, but they get your food out to you right away. They have the most amazing crepes I have ever had!

7-Jx91UOZ7UJ1ImbIGzEHA.text: One of the best crepe places in town. Glad they moved next door and increase their seating capacity.

vy3q-YRNKloS0wAUJildtA.text: I was pretty disappointed after eating here. I love crepes and make them and blintzes at home, so I was so excited to eat here after our trip to Las Vegas. The atmosphere and decor are pretty depressing, tired looking and in need of some interior design. We ended up eating outside and it was fine until I tried to refill my coffee. The sliding door didn't work and I had to walk around the tables to get back in. Also, the table where the coffee is set on is way in the back where people hover, and I had to walk around tables again just to return outside. Bad planning.   The crepe itself was pretty good but nothing to speak of. I ate The Frisco. My first thought after my food arrived was "that's it?"  One measly crepe for $7.50+tax. I could have easily eaten 2 more. The filling was just blueberries. I was expecting them to be prepared a little bit more elaborately, like a compote or some sauce.   Lastly the bathroom. The women's was fine but my husband said the men's was filthy, comparable to a gas station bathroom that hadn't been cleaned in a year.    After eating here I wished I would have had the crepes at Paris hotel's buffet instead.

vhi19q76qQYCJxH0tIgYXw.text: We just had the crepe with the Carne asada and the elvis. Wow hands down the best savory and sweet crepes I have had in Las Vegas. The meat was well marinated and tasted like authentic tex Mex I have had in South Texas!!! Made me miss McAllen! The coffee was awesome and tasted fresh. The soup I got with the Carne asada crepe was very flavorful as well. Also these guys actually are not afraid of making their asada with a nice kick for some hello in your mouth at breakfast time. The service here was perfect, with the head chef adding a perfect amount of playful banter and information on their dishes. I WILL BE A Regular here. Side note I got here early so no wait on a Sunday but by the time we was done their wasn't a seat in the house!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First in this morning
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Elvis and the Carne asada crepe.

UWeGhVtH9_NCtNxRcMkJvw.text: There was no greeting upon arrival and as we entered looking clearly lost and unsure of what the place was about no one asked if we needed suggestions. After we made a decision we ordered paid and then the cashier gave us a number and told us the food would be right out. We sat down at a random table got our drinks and then our food was delivered twenty minutes later. The crepes were tasteless and the customer service was nonexistent. They walked by and slid the silverware on our table. I ordered a berry crepe and some of the fruit in it was hot and other fruit was super cold. Overall just an underwhelming experience and I wouldn't recommend to anyone.

VoRQVxR_mJAe6hg120D2Aw.text: Disclosure: friends of a friend own this place. My friend brought me for breakfast because the food is excellent and he was right. I met the owners on this visit, because they were working, and really only said hi. But it's nice to support a small locally owned restaurant.   I love crepes and these are amazing. And, IMHO, under-priced (when do you ever say that in Vegas?). I opted for the Monterrey - bacon, eggs, tomatoes, mild Serrano peppers, onions, and Jack cheese (hope I remembered it all). Absolute perfection for breakfast. It was huge but I managed to eat most of it. It came with cottage cheese or bananas on the side. I went with bananas and the sweetness was a perfect complement. I also got a white peach mimosa - yum!   My only regret is that we didn't hang around in the area for a couple more hours so I could go back for a sweet crepe.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pomegranate &amp; White Peach mimosas
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monterrey. Huge but so delicious I made myself eat almost all of it.

0vnEw1m9CThhfx3Wkzhjbg.text: I don't get the hype. Had one sweet and one savory. The savory was WEIRD. Hot, cooked lettuce is something no one wants to eat. Not much flavor at all. Sweet was okay- did the apple one. Not nearly as tasty as expected. Just because a place is on a TV show doesn't mean it's good...

TQkahvxYBJBusfAFYyOpmA.text: This place is the best! The owner was very friendly, helpful and attentive. The customer service was amazing, all employees were very polite. My part got the Monkey, the Elvis, the Perfect combination and Sunday morning... all of them we so delicious, made w fresh ingredients. The texture and batter of the crepe itself was like no other! I will definitely come back on every trip to Las Vegas!

TW24HqwcKMFH2MHdRZAP-Q.text: Excellent I got the Rosarito crepe and my friend got the Monterey crepe, the total of $16.97. We drank the cold lemon and cucumber water available for free. Everything was delicious and filling. Neither one of us could eat our entire crepe.  I can definitely recommend this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just waiting for food that smells delicious and looks good while waiting.

BB5cgp1sVr6QxFMYWVE8Bg.text: I love this spot! The manager took my order and kept it light. Make sure you know what you want to order by the time you get to the front of the line. It's pretty busy but the wait is worth it. I got the chicken chile verde, it was delicious. But, I really like the idea of how the place works, all types of crepes, the desert ones are great. But, breakfast and lunch crepes are delicious too, can't wait to go back!

hEXB8orOJaxTm2rXaruVqQ.text: Another solid choice from DDD. Fresh crepes both sweet and savory made to order right in front of you. It's a cute spot with limited seating but has a local feel to it. All of the crepes we had were great and super reasonably priced. Also can't argue with a solid, somewhat strong cup of fresh-brewed coffee with refills.   I ordered the rosarito, which from the description was hard to turn down: guac, chorizo, eggs, and cheese. I'm normally a sweet crepe person but this was really superb. Flavorful, unique, and not too heavy yet filling. Plus it came with a side of bananas! Add some salsa and definitely get Highly it.  The sweet crepes though were also great. We shared the perfect combination (strawberries and chocolate drizzle) and the berry delight (blueberries, blackberries, and strawberries). For those who prefer crepes on the sweeter side, you can't go wrong with either.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito

ManCT_eUo0kbKXvo_mqcZA.text: First time here and I loved everything. We ordered the Monterey, carne Asada one, and Ana banana foster. I have a sweet tooth so I would say the banana foster was my favorite. We also tried the mimosa sampler. You choose three from a selection of fruit flavors. We tried the blood orange, mango, and white peach. I liked them all but prefer the peach and mango better.   The place is small so I can see there being a long wait like others reviewed. I went around noon and it must have been the perfect time because there was no wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What their crepes look like
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler. White peach. Blood orange. Mango

F_x6RNOMJU0z22sSKI9etw.text: As we're heading back home, my husband wanted to try this place and it didn't disappoint. This is one of the best breakfast crepe restaurants we have been too, by far. The staff is friendly and they all are hustling even the boss!! Would definitely come back!

ONP1BX-yzWeRUFpNF_UUug.text: This place is so popular and busy because they are masters of the crepe. I haven't found a better crepe anywhere else. The owner is here working alongside the other employees every time I'm here. You can see them making your crepe right in front of you. They offer free cucumber water and a wide variety of delicious mimosas. Since it's hard to choose I suggest getting the flight so u can chose 3 flavors. I've never tried any of the sweet crepes but they look amazing. I usually split a meat filled crepe with my friend.  According to the plaque on the wall Guy Fieri visited at some point.  If you love amazing crepes you must try this place. I just wish the building had more seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I haven&#39;t had a better crepe anywhere else.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all of the mimosa flavors.

SxFQd8zXtOlgwSQY7u86TQ.text: Excellent food, super long wait. Don't drink the water order the white mocha instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The monkey. Bananas and Nutella. Mmmmmm!!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The soup was fantastic! This is the Sonora.

IGAKGjYhix1IqdiXNqq46g.text: The BEST always friendly like you walked into cheers for breakfast.  You can also watch them make the crepes which takes a lot of skill lol I couldn't do it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosarita!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa &amp; beer menu!

_pWYSQsdE5rjozG9y79XVg.text: Came here for brunch with a friend, it was delicious! My puppy came along as well and they gladly set up a table outside for us to all eat at.  Very light and tasty crepes, they have great drink selections and made me the most amazing Carmel cafe!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Khloe loves this place!  Out new brunch spot

gXbGzhuUNvrHh-BWTHvBsQ.text: A must try.... very delicious and the service is awesome!! Tried eight different ones eith a party of four and they were all good!!!

sxLtCkwe6XQ5D9nXdrBjIg.text: You may not realize it, but this is a great place for lunch!  Their lunch menu is amazing and the atmosphere is perfect for a casual or business lunch.

V6RCSR68rBQ3PEddQkYIEw.text: The food and mimosas are truly as good as it gets! Any of the fruity, sweet crepes are my favorite. We used to always go to Paris on the Strip, but the quality of those went down while the prices went up - Crepe Expectations is MUCH better! The mimosa trio is such a great bang for your buck as well. The description makes it sound like you'll only get a sample of each flavor you choose, but you really get 3 full mimosas.  During peak meal times, there can be a bit of a wait for a table, but you can enjoy a mimosa while you wait and they're working on a bigger, better location so soon the seating won't even be a problem.

VGKio_pqZbu_s0QwyQxvrQ.text: Carne Asada, Guac, and salsa in a Crepe... Did your head just explode??? This place will blow your mind.   Think of anything awesome and then wrap it in a crepe and it becomes even more awesome. Or like any awesome sandwich or burrito but instead a crepe is used. The bbq, the clucker, etc.. Amazballs! You already know the sweet stuff is going to be good.   I read reviews on here knocking the owner but I kind of like an owner with an edge. I thought he was cool and made plenty of recommendations. The place is busy on the weekends so prepare for a wait unless you roll your lazy behind out of bed early.

-SvDG2rKHiJxkLD0FG91AA.text: A must go to for any meal. First off the decor is super trendy and my favorite color...purple! A great place for a date night. My friend and I stopped here after dinner and ordered desert crepes. I had the classic crepe with added strawberries (heaven) and she had the William tell (awesome). I can't say enough about how melt in your mouth these both were. Be aware, they are super sweet and worth sharing. However I found myself finishing off mine and then eating my friends too. The warm, tart apples were perfection paired with the caramel drizzle and my nutella was melted perfectly inside the yummy crepe and strawberries. Complimentary water and or cucumber water is served to wash it all down but next time I'll definitely try the mimosas or one of the many sodas.  There is a great selection of dinner crepes too that I'm dying to try!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Classic w/strawberries
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The William tell crepe!

gbovuZQ4LC_BvHTE6KzNTA.text: Driven by this place many times and didn't even know it was there.  Its in a center with a lot of other restaurants.  Its a small location with probably 10 or so tables with a couple more outside.  The place was packed when we got there and this is where the process is a bit weird.  You need to check in with the cashier to put in your name down.  This is the same place you order as well but not until a table is ready.  Sort of a hybrid of the order and pay with open seating and the more traditional sit and then order from a server. Even though there are no servers  the staff roams the floor looking to help where possible.  The only part I didn't like is that waiting for tables is done in the hallway toward the back.  Not much can be done with that though because the place is pretty small.  As for ambiance the location is cozy and has low lighting even during the day.  The crepe stations are up front and open so you can watch the chefs work their magic.  They've even got overhead camera view above so you can watch from the tables.  There are also 2 TVs on the walls which were showing football today which was a pleasant surprise.  The service was friendly both at the cashier and the staff walking around.  The iced tea cups were pretty small which is always a disappointment for me because I drink a lot during the meal.  Fortunately the staff member that brought the tea must have sensed my mood because not only did he ask if we usually drink a lot of tea, when we replied yes he brought a full pitcher and left it at the table just for us. Even better there was plenty of ice in the pitcher so no concern of tea melting the ice in my glass (another pet peeve).  On to the food.  I went breakfast with the rosarito which has chorizo, scrambled eggs, jack cheese and guacamole.  It was quite tasty.  Only thing missing was a bit of salsa on top (maybe some sour cream too).  Also came with either bananas or cottage cheese on the side.  I went with sliced bananas which were a good compliment to the savory crepe.  My wife had the little Italy which was pepperoni, mozzarella, and tomatoes basil sauce.  It was like a pizza in a crepe (thankfully she let me try it as I'll probably get that when I want lunch.) Her crepe came with fidejo soup which was like chicken noodle minis the chicken chunks.  Very good.  We couldn't be pass up a chance for a dessert crepe so we split the monkey which has Nutella, bananas, chocolate, whip cream and we added strawberries.   This was definitely my favorite of the three.   The portions are quite large so we couldn't eat everything. Probably could have split one savory and then the sweet. The crepes were all delicious and it was cool to watch the chefs make them to order too.    To round out the experience both the wait staff and the cashier thanked us for coming in and made sure to ask for us to come back soon.  The only reason I didn't do 5 stars was the somewhat awkward waiting in the narrow hallway.  I'm not sure there is much they can do about it though and it will definitely  not deter me from coming back again.  Thanks for the great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small tea glass but pitcher to ourselves saved the day
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting in the hallway for a table
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe stations on display

TKWxEvdyeERjy0r7oO_oWw.text: A month or so ago (yes late review), when my roommate suggested we go get brunch here, I was delighted by the prospect. Brunch is my favorite meal of the day!   The crepes here are quite delicious, and they have screens so you can watch the crepes being made. Everything tasted really fresh. They have tons of variety, and lots of different drinks too. I got a freshly made strawberry lemonade and a Greek crepe. Everything tastes really fresh and clean, and like a high quality meal. The crepe was stuffed quite full, and by the time I was done eating, so was I.  They also have a lot of different flavors of mimosas, and you can also get a sampler of mimosas and you can try three different flavors.  My one complaint about this place is that it's small and a bit cramped. You order your food at the counter and then you get a number that you put at your table. Problem is, if there are no tables, there's not really a waiting area or anything...so it can get awkward.  Regardless, I need to find an excuse to come back to this place.

mXOtVTd11xvZprvO1wS9_g.text: First time here, definitely will be back when I'm in town. Owner(s) super friendly & an extensive list of flavors. Had the mimosa trio & La Jolla crepe. Hubby had the Pirate. We lucked out on the seating, had a 4 person table to ourselves. If you can't find something you like here I'd be worried (about you!)

204TZqGukjDHmlX9WVTRNg.text: The food was off the chain I also ordered the sampler mimosa cherry, blood orange, and pomegranate they were delicious

_Gx2kf-FbG-wyR5q7X737w.text: The Greek, a savory chicken spinach delight and The Berry Delight, a fresh berry sensation with fresh whipped cream were a resounding success and a good value.  Perfectly seasoned.  Espresso Carmel mocha was flavorful with whimsical presentation.  Best in Vegas area that I'm aware of.

w0Te5Re_CaHV6hXDM1CIuw.text: This place has a great selection of sweet & savory crepes coupled excellent service!  Crepe Expectations is one of our favorite breakfast spots!  Other reviewers complain that there can be nasty wait times, but I haven't experienced this.  I've been several times and have gotten right in.  Although, I am the up-at-the-crack-of-dawn-to-beat-the-breakfast-crowd type.  Hmm... perhaps this strategy is working.  The owners are charming and attentive to detail, and the food is delish.  I highly recommend giving this place a try.

mYY1yepugdGUtho6aenOBg.text: I saw this place on Guy Fieri's Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives television show while visiting Las Vegas. I suggested to my hubby, and two girlfriends to give it a try. It was a good choice. The owners and the staff were very inviting, polite, and had a great attitude. The food was made to order and was absolutely delicious. My girlfriends tried the mimosas, which there were thirteen flavor a to choose from. Everyone in our party of four enjoyed the food and experience. I will visit Crepes Expectations again on my next visit to Sin City.

yDSOch0IPmhODZrYja7Sig.text: A little off the strip we found this place while on vacation and we had a good experience:-) I ordered ham and cheese breakfast crepe and while it was pretty good I wish there was some kind of sauce to go with and instead of a choice of banana or cottage cheese, a side of salad would have been nice. My husband had no problem finishing his crepe which was basically pepperoni pizza inside... One that we got for our 2 year old daughter which was the cheapest one on the menu with just sugar or powder inside? It ended up being my favorite out of the 4 we ordered... They have two different kinds of water which was nice, I think cucumber water and lemon water I think... Overall it was a good experience and we shall return again when our girl can sit still and enjoy her mean a little longer...

JwqfBMZwkqqmEpc-vRfdqQ.text: The coolest little brunch find in Vegas! The owners are rad and their staff are super attentive and friendly! Food is top notch! My hubby and I shared 3 different ones and were hard pressed to choose a favorite... Highly recommend the fresh mango orange lemonade!

aBL8SLYSzrt3vovJG2fpNg.text: This cute little crepe restaurant is so awesome and they're food is delicious! They are very popular so I recommend going earlier than you planned to get a seat ;)

lDY3BE_pVegZ3lc7KzemKA.text: Love, love, love this place. They serve my favorite ice cream, Thrifty's. I grew up on that stuff. The crepes are fabulous. My favorite is the Smore with salty caramel ice cream. The crew here is always smiling and friendly. This place brings me back to my days living in Japan. It's excellent and very family friendly!

8_eE-WMoFxzO3Ib3vD4dNA.text: When my brother and sister-in-law lived in Henderson, I loved to eat at places away from the busy strip. This was an amazing spot for crepes. We went here for breakfast, and the food was deeelish! Since it was a few years ago, I remembered that my breakfast crepe had chorizo and guacamole, and my dessert crepe had bananas and nutella/hazelnut. Yum! I must return for crepes!

wOiGdlBf2cNDKL21GsiOsg.text: This place is soo good! The staff are really great and the crepes are amazing. I got the bananas foster crepe with strawberries added. The mimosa sampler is delicious (I got blood orange, white peach, and mango). Coffee comes with free refills. Indoor and outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler (blood orange, white peach, and mango)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster crepe + strawberries

5-QVEVdPVHX9EErG1i5kOg.text: My gluten free vegetarian crepe was really great! I got both the savory crepe (The Veggie Patch) a sweet crepe (The Avalon) and both were really fantastic! They also have mimosas on the menu, and I will be returning soon to have a girls' brunch :)

p76RNatXaHUpnfSCIrZgxg.text: Coming here for breakfast turned into a clown show. We waited 40 minutes for a table and watched 2 couples who came in after our small party of 3 get a seat before us. Then before they took a third couple I kindly reminded them we were still waiting. We ordered our food and ended up waiting another 45 minutes. They need a bigger place with more employees to cater to guest. I do have to take my hat off to the one solo girl making crepes, she worked her butt off putting food together and it was great. Don't go here if your in a hurry or if you have less than 2 hours to spend eating. Would love to give them 5 stars but get your shizzz together and get organized!

Jnf1d4p_oKNuT-0cyM44pg.text: This place is just spot-on in so many ways...  The decor is pleasant and unexpected with a personality all its own (and no country or breakfast theme -- man I hate "barnyard" decor).  The owners are sweethearts (Lou took my order today with an enthusiastic "Talk to me, Goose!" and tends to refer to everyone in terms of endearment).  The drink selection is impressive (premium sodas, beers, wines, coffee/espresso drinks, and at least 13 flavors of mimosas -- my favorites are passion fruit, guava, and blood orange).  The food is just awesome, no other way to describe it. I used to think I hated crepes, but this place has made a believer out of me. I can't vouch for the sweet ones since I'm not a sweets person, but the savory & breakfast crepes are effing genius. My favorites are the Sonora (carne asada steak, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, jack cheese) and the Monterey (bacon, scrambled egg, tomato, red onion, serrano pepper, jack cheese). If you get a breakfast crepe, you can choose sliced bananas or cottage cheese as your side. If you get a savory/lunch crepe, you can choose soup (usually fideo) or a green salad with vinaigrette. Don't let that description fool you into thinking the salad is boring, though -- the dressing is homemade by Lou and has a base of cumin, lime, & garlic (my kind of dressing!!). OMGYUM.  I heard they're looking to open another location on the other side of town. As long as this one doesn't go anywhere, that's allllll right with me.

JkShx6PR9aC19maqFfCkyA.text: Absolutely delicious! Very welcoming and home like feeling the ambience and food is fantastic :) LOVE IT!!!

oNiyueuHq99-emPBplxQsg.text: Spectacular!  Not only was the food excellent but the service and people working their were outstanding.  You couldn't ask for a nicer staff that is attentive, without being annoying, and extremely helpful.  I had the Greek crepe which was absolutely delicious and my husband had a breakfast crepe with chorizo which was equally delicious.  We would definitely go back there again and highly recommend them to anyone.  We just wish they were open longer since it seems the only time we are over in that area is after 3pm.

nLcm4iRihL15CupYahV80w.text: Crepes! What's not to love!!  A wonderful crepe batter envelopes all sorts of fillings from breakfast to the savory to the sweet!  I love The Sonora. My dad opts for The Monterey -- hold the monterey (he doesn't eat cheese). My mom's goto is the Marco Polo. And my sister is a complete fiend for the Ana Bananas Foster. Seriously! She won't share!  Of course we always try to try different crepes (Also recommend The Caprese or The Avalon! Yum!), but we've come to the conclusion that you really can't go wrong here.  AND! They have a cute little station for the Sunday morning doggies who want to grab a bite too! Haven't brought my pup yet cause I'm not sure if she can behave herself around the crepes!  Larry and Ana are extremely gracious hosts who do everything they can to ensure your experience at Crepe Expectations exceeds your great expectations. (And they recognized me as a guest when we ran into each other at a supermarket! That's hospitality!)

u69pIVSp_mob9CE8iXIzrw.text: I met the male half of the tag team ownership and he was awesome with all capitals. The wait staff was great as well. Usually when I try a place out for the 1st time, I order appetizers, but I ordered the bread pudding and the hard and cheese crepe. That bread pudding was stupendous and the crepe was yummy as well. It's a busy place, order ahead people!!

PR-Yr1ZAoglKAPW7NGr08w.text: My son saw this place on TV and asked if we could go on our way thru on vacation. I'm SO glad he did!! We went on the day we arrived and again on the day we left. Of course the breakfast crepes are delicious but the real gems are the savory crepes! Loved the Grand Turk and The Greek.

dB3Vi07YoSxLBDwxxiBkUQ.text: We never been here before but we decided to try it out because of the reviews online and everything was just as we read online. Food was delicious! We ordered Rosarito, William Tell and the Monkey. We definitely come back here again.

s-6fap5ZkSWdbAHhqeMTRQ.text: Still LOVE this place.  Been coming since day one.  Lately haven't been able to get a table though, too crowded. :(  Obviously business is good, but please please consider expanding or relocating so all of your loyal customers can actually eat here. Missing my crepes.  :)  On the up side for us, we've actually found a few other great breakfast spots.

JkqF3WSUIftg66AqJ28n9A.text: My goto locale for a great breakfast with my wife.  Friendly staff, food is delicious and well priced.  Calm, casual atmosphere with a low hum of chatter and kitchen utensils.  Two large screen TV's if that's your thing. Seating outside, and never waited more than 20 minutes for food, even when the tables were full.  A Las Vegas gem.

S7bJ6Z_25m29dGFS9sM4Tg.text: Stumbled across this delicious place while visiting last year; made the trip specifically this year. Fantastic and creative food, exceptional staff, total win!

Wr2a9xjnw-UCkGjwRdrTxw.text: Love this place! Tried it for the first time and it was so good!! I got the Avalon, buttered pears, goat cheese and candied walnuts. My husband tried the Elvis, peanut butter, bananas, bacon and (extra) caramel. I also tried their lattes. She made a combo of pumpkin and caramel, it was delicious! Going back for sure.

lZfaDEOcEtPZ9mUFZzJOew.text: Great food, great service, good value.  A local business that deserves its success. Lou, the owner, is super-friendly and will walk you through their entire menu if need be, right down to the drink selections.  The main menu is broken up into breakfast crepes, dessert crepes, and dinner crepes, and I've sampled dishes from each section. I haven't been disappointed yet!  On my most recent visit, I had the Sonora - a crepe filled with carne asada, guacamole, and jack cheese. It was hearty & delicious, with a nice touch of spice.  Highly recommended!

H2DO4rRhwMLPvP7S-A97BA.text: I have been to Crepe Expectation about 5 times now and every time is as good as the last. Everyone who works here is committed to guest service. Super friendly and accommodating.  The crepes are amazing! I've probably tried 7 different crepes and they were all excellent. My favorite is "The Clucker". It's not a normal menu item but they have it as a special quite often. The only downside of Crepe Expectations is on the weekends they are absolutely slammed. I really hope they expand because we need more restaurants like this one!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PqykjXQOteGmcj3n4URNrw.text: Everyone in my party absolutely loved this place!  The food was delicious and the service was great.  You can actually watch them make your crepes on a screen above where you order.  The mimosa sampler was also a big hit but everyone agreed that the blood orange mimosa was the best.

kUhKhPnLFTrx9rWzcj7khg.text: AMAZING crepes! I got the Greek my first time, and the spicy tuna one my second time. I highly recommend both, and their soup is awesome. Very simple, but still awesome. Ooh and their blood orange mimosa was delish!

yY6_bpchv4PVlaiJ38e47w.text: Awesome place! I have been addicted to crepe lately, and i found this place on yelp. They did not disappoint me, their crepes are incredibly delicious, and the prices are decent. Now I come here almost every weekend for brunch.  I always get Caprese with grilled chicken and pesto sauce, sooooo good. About mimosa I have tried most of flavors, but my favorite is mango mimosa. White peach and passion fruit are also good choices.  If you are not a big fan of sweet crepe, you'd better get savory one. In my personal opinion, their sweet crepes are not as good as savory ones.

Opkfb4OKZ7FlpjyMvMc4PQ.text: Absolutely the best crepes ever!   The coffee is amazing too.   Great atmosphere and customer service.  My recommendations: Ana Banana Fosters, The Monterey, The Rosarito

DYeJ9_Z9rsXOqA71Iprl4w.text: I absolutely love this place ! I would have never thought of some of the crepes they make. The chorizo is my favorite. I also can't resist getting a mimosa trio sampler every time I go - they have a ton of different juices to choose from !

mPrx7suCwNIyumbzBEhXDw.text: First time here and we'll definitely be back! Excellent crepes (both sweet and savory). Lou and the staff treated us wonderfully.  Watching the crepes being made (camera over the griddles) is fun too. They have an excellent system- great food; reasonable prices, nice staff and quick service.

PcsgAUNI4Zf7p4xK3Ip3sw.text: Not only is the food amazing but the service is also exceptional. I have been going to this restaurant since it opened and they have never stopped providing 5 star service even when they are lined up out the door. The food and people are worth the wait. I promise you won't be disappointed!

VVUWEl7otmQ9thy_M7PfVw.text: Delicious crepes and great selection. The mimosa trio was excellent as well, especially the passion fruit mimosa. Very friendly and helpful staff. My husband had a savory crepe and I had a sweet crepe, we were both very pleased. We sat at the bar area and although the ladies cooking were very busy they smiled the whole time and let us know when they were preparing our food. Great experience, we will definitely return soon.

2vSE20Ubtrcm9LglQj8CXQ.text: Excellent chorizo. Loved their homemade salsa. Fresh squeezed OJ. Nice personable staff. Great food + great staff = great time

Or1YVY2YIX3xKBl7mIsnsQ.text: Forget the Strip when you're in the mood for crepes!  These folks have it down to a science (and art)!  Plus, they're extremely friendly, accomodating, and gracious.  Crepe Expectation's crepes are large and packed with only FRESH ingredients.  They're all made to order right before your very eyes and adjustments to ingredients are well received.  Ana has this graceful technique when she makes your crepes.  I was so mesmerized on her skill, that I actually thought I could spread crepe batter at home as perfectly as her (yeah right, lol).  Speaking of they're batter, it contains no extra salt or sugar, so it's perfect for entree or dessert crepes.  Menu-wise, they have crepes for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and dessert!  DINNER: I can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review for this restaurant!  It's been so long that I can only remember that I had a breakfast crepe filled with scrambled egg, cheese, and breakfast meats.  So delish,  filling, and comforting!  The hubby had The Sonora which was carne asada, cheese, roasted tomato salsa, and guacamole.  He loved it so much he came back the next day for lunch with three coworkers.  DESSERT: We were soooo full by the end of our dinner that I almost had to unbutton my jeans.  Somehow, we made room for desserts.  Yes, desserts with an "s" on the end; not a shared dessert; two individual dessertS!!!  I got the Perfect Combination with a heaping full of fresh strawberries, fresh whipped cream, chocolate drizzle, and powdered sugar.  Hubby got the William Tell which was sauteed apples, caramel, fresh whipped cream, and powdered sugar.  WOW!  The restaurant itself is located in a large strip mall next to the indoor exotic car dealership.  It's small inside but, every space is well utilized.  That being said, the building does face the west, so during the evenings the sun is blaring in, making the restaurant on the warm side.  The color inside is mainly black and purple (eggplant'ish), accented with marble, stone, and glass, very classy and contemporary in my opinion.  Somehow, they managed to fit in a small coffee station where sugar, honey, creamer, tap water, and cucumber water (complementary) are available.  Speaking of coffee, they are also a full service "coffee house", serving (Illy's I think???) cappuccino, espresso, latte, coffee, and hot teas.  Feeling a little tipsy?  They also have beer and wine!  All other beverages are bottled, including sodas, juices, and waters.   Last but not least, Crepe Expectations does have a few outside tables and welcomes canine patrons with an outside bin of complementary doggy biscuits.  Have a Crepe Day!

ViKX8pmt4T7yQ4mcu9b0xQ.text: Everything is delicious! Can't decide between sweet or savory? get both and share! It'll be worth it!!!

EEpV3Z-Z3jhGZUU7Zup6Vg.text: Had brunch here couple weeks ago with the love of my life. Their mimosas and Crepes are absolutely out of this world and I'm not even a crepe person, like at all. The Crepes can get a little pricey for their size but the flavor is to die for.

SnIrdWFs8r7G-Gib0Eo6-A.text: First time here, liked it a lot. The atmosphere was hip and lively. Outdoor seating was at a premium on a weekday morning. Loved the food. Portions were good. Staff was friendly. Had the Monterey Crepe and tea. Great eats for Las Vegas and at a good price!

jpK7k0EcEhQ5_dZaj1PCtA.text: Yelps 365 Review Challenge - Los Angeles #9 - #365  I was looking to have a not so heavy breakfast with my friend Ian A. and decided to buy some donuts, then he suggested Crepe Expectations. I've had Crepes before but early in the morning was a bit unusual for me. It's located in a strip mall and offers patio seating where you can enjoy the sunny skies of Las Vegas while enjoying the savory goodness.   Checking the menu, I decided to go with a dessert Crepe instead of breakfast.   I ordered, "The Perfect Combination" - $7.50:  +Fresh Strawberries +Chocolate Drizzle +Fresh Whipped Cream +Powdered Sugar  For my drink, I ordered the, "Mixed Berry Fuzed" - $2.00   The best thing about the drink was it was bottomless and tasted very refreshing. The place was packed so we couldn't find any open patio seats, so indoors it was. It just shows how popular Crepe Expectations is, just like In n Out (Burger Wise), this place has a staple with my sweet tooth!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemonade of the Day (Mixed Berry) The Sh*t!!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Combination!!

pzQ2qflISjvWIBGPUMSd1w.text: We were BLOWN AWAY!  My wife and are always on the search for excellent food, in every city we go to. This food is outstanding. Service is very accommodating. This is now the first place we will always go to when we pull into Vegas. And the Mimosas!!!!  Try them all.

48cOyzRGGjaLH4kfOovXzg.text: We waited in line to get our names on the list to be seated, we were told it would be a 25 min wait. Which was a reasonable amount of time, until 2 other customers that just arrived walked right in, ordered and sat at the table we were waiting for. The seating arrangement is a little flawed, if you aren't stopped by the gentleman taking names/cleaning tables then there's no way for you to know of the process.   We both ordered the perfect combination, I was a little disappointed with it, it was good I just wish I ordered something more savory.

jeTyYBSJwXbSoZ3JvvENRQ.text: Amazing food, amazing service, amazing owner!!! Just plain amazing place to go. The best crepes you'll ever eat!!!

jna27UyTQBUpM7RdmgBGUw.text: Love this place, it's very cute and small but has the option for outdoor seating.  Today was windy so we decided to eat indoors, the turnover is pretty quick since all they're serving is pretty much crepes which don't take too long to prepare.  We ordered a strawberry and mango mimosa, veggie patch crepe and the nutty classic crepe.  While waiting you can watch on the tv screen your crepe being prepared in real time.  I was thinking my Nutella crepe would be super sweet so I helped myself to the cucumber water (they also had lemon water) while we were waiting.  The crepe actually wasn't that sweet at all, overall I enjoyed the food, the infused water and the quaint dining room, our cashier was also really nice and knowledgeable which made our entire experience here great.  We will return and try more crepes!  They have about 13 varieties of mimosas and they serve beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OCHikaNvmQXC0_u-jU1lUQ.text: We had a large group and they were very accommodating.   We ended up splitting group inside and out with no problems. Everyone ordered no problem and finished what they got, Even the kids! Staff was friendly and very helpful as well food was great

z81Qx6q6lDc4GzUL6GwIxg.text: The best crepes in Las Vegas. I feel like I'm back in France! I love the location, atmosphere and staff! The mimosas are amazing, guava is my favorite. You can pick from savory, sweet or breakfast crepes. I love the Crepelet and the Nutty Classic. I would eat here every day if I could!

6wllD7jhDN6lSC0cEpGXow.text: One time I got drunk at a wedding and had a crepe. It was good and only filled with a mild amount of shame. From then on, I've been on the hunt for crepes. Luckily, located in what's quickly becoming my favorite shopping center, Crepe Expectations specializes in the craft. While the place is small (maybe 8 tables?), their menu boasts 23 ways you can eat this thinny pancake. I scooped up The Sunday Morning (scrambled eggs, seasoned potatoes, jack cheese and bacon added) and it was way better than expected. These things are large and the perfect size for lunch. With flavored waters and a side salad included, this is solid deal for under $8. Def worth a try for a croob (crepe noob) or crexpert (you get it).

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sunday Morning with added bacon

avG3_ofsvFJg9I0K1ciVCg.text: The best breakfast in Las Vegas! Hands Down!!!  The food is always perfect and prepared with the best tasting ingredients.  Whether it's something sweet or savory it always hits the spot! Lou and his team make you feel like family....they feed you like family too!

NM6ZtBM3pLCiolqMlA75eg.text: First time here, unfortunately! I've lived around the corner for five years and never ventured in. I'm kicking myself for that! The service was warm and friendly. Loved my Willam Tell crepe! So delicious! Also loved the Mimosa Trio with so many flavors to choose from! Great little place. I will definitely be back!

DI4WT59e6r4jC3ueCmD1LQ.text: I've lived in Henderson for two years, and the best part of it has been Crepe Expectations.  Lou and Jenn are amazing people.  The food is ALWAYS amazing.  My favorites are the Rosarito and Perfect Combination.   On top of that, I retired from the USAF after 20 years, and they opened their establishment after hours for me to host my retirement dinner and ceremony.  It was the most perfect experience.   I will truly miss everyone there.  Thank-You for everything Lou and Jenn!

62Nt3oey91qx89tU90Tv6A.text: Always the best service in town! Family owned and operated! Makes you want to be a part of their family! AND the food is delicious!

Qz5RVKA-IErCohPhAYKF8g.text: Do not go here on a Sunday during lunch time it is absolutely PACKED! A friend and I had to wait in line in the back where the bathrooms are for 20-25 minutes. The wait wasn't that bad! The deliciousness of the monkey crepe I got made up for it. Along with the awesome friendly people that worked there. There mimosas are great. The mango mimosa I tried was wonderful along with the mango fresh squeezed lemonade of the day I tried, was very refreshing.   I think they should really expand! Because it gets really full in there. The booths, seats, and tables are pretty close to each other so you can pretty much here the conversation of the family of four next to you. The seats are super comfortable though which is a plus.    It was a little hard for me to find since my GPS was telling me to turn on Hardin a street that didn't even exist. So I called in and it's a machine that talks to you but the operator successfully gave me directions. It's in the big plaza where BJ'S is.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry Delight and The Monkey crepe

j5iQADVrnGc8qllBg1HtJA.text: This place is excellent.  Every time we come to vegas we go there.  Meet the owner this morning.  He is a great guy.  This is a must place to eat.

tNt0FWX58BPupOHtb-29pQ.text: THIS PLACE IS AMAZING! We got greeted promptly at the door and the chef made recommendations on what we could order. We were a party of 6 and everyone liked what they ordered.  The food was awesome!!!!!! I would definitely visit when we come back to Vegas!

aDF8jfkrX5Fp8RgGhKPmBA.text: Came in for breakfast Sunday morning and arrived to a packed house. Luckily our projected 10min wait turned out to be less than 5 min because I would have kicked myself for walking away without trying one of the various crepes offered at crepe expectations.   I had the Rosarito and thought it was great. The crepe was thin yet had noticeable texture, the chorizo was tasty and the guacamole added a nice creamy element to the meal. Both of my friends crepes looked appetizing as well (Greek & Sonora?) and both commented on enjoying their meal enough that they'd definitely be back. Oh, and the cucumber & lemon water was neat for a change.   The location is on the smaller side but the decor and atmosphere fit with the overall coziness of the building. The owner's outgoing personality and interaction with customers really made it seem like he was truly engaged with his business.   Can't say enough good things. Loved it!

9AU3cBno98JCux4jHEAMAw.text: Just had the best crepes we've ever had. The food was hot, delicious and full of flavor. The owners and wait staff were fantastic,  making sure everything was perfect for us. I highly recommend Crepe Expectations for the food, ambiance and the great people.

pHv_jtK9WqniCzVNzzH-EA.text: The food is delicious. Unfortunately, this place is so crowded that you really can't relax and enjoy yourself. I found myself just inhaling the food and getting the heck out of there. Too bad. It would be an even better place if it was at a bigger location.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek crepe
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crowded place on saturday. Order at the counter and they bring it to you. Ordered the Greek Crepe.

T3Y_jAwVXT57XtCCxTLyZQ.text: I absolutely love this place! From the staff to the food! It is a smaller place so expect a wait on the weekends

CHahiq-y3Tqml3Q2e8NEQQ.text: I have never had more friendly staff (from cashier to chef to server) in all my dining experiences! So kind and refreshing all around. The crepes were great and of a good size. My mimosa flight was awesome--I recommend the blood orange and white peach!

UcB0cfPC8i7KzjSj4GOLKg.text: Absolutely delicious! I've been here twice now and will definitely return! Very busy, but I didn't have to wait either time. The staff is extremely nice and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9_utfha5vJD-g0nzSwrHyw.text: I've been a customer for 4+ years, I first came here and loved it under the previous owner. The food is great, and I do think it's a good value if you do not buy all the overpriced beverages. I think the new (current) owner thinks pretty highly of himself-he spent like 15 minutes talking to me at my table (on a non busy day, 2 yrs ago) about how he is a real chef and was going to add menu items, etc. I think that's great (no new notable items have been added since original owner tho), but bottom-line, if you can't care for your loyal customers, in a timely manner, you will ultimately lose your customers.  I visited yesterday, a Tuesday, and arrived/placed my order 9:40 am. I waited 25 minutes to receive my order. The party that ordered after me got their order about 7-10 minutes before me. The couple that ordered before me received their food in less than 15 mins. I had to ask where my order was. The cashier who took my order said she would have to check. It came about 5 minutes after my asking. I ask the person who delivered it, what the delay was. She said they were just really backed up. I asked why the party who ordered after me already had and well on their way to eating half their plates. She said she would need to check.
