She came back and said it was because they ordered sweet (vs. savory crepe). Not a great reason IMO. And no apology for my wait of 25 minutes for a crepe!, on a Tuesday morning, with only one party ordering in front of my order. Seems really unreasonable.   After being a loyal customer for years, I will not return. I will need to find another great crepe place in the Valley that values their customers.

wNfoEkmPDfQA5xuLKlB1Og.text: This place ROCKS from the decor to the crepes!!!  The owner is exactly what an owner should be, present, charming and helpful!!  He loves his business and it shows!!  He was helping his customers get a table and offering suggestions all with a smile on his face.    The Mimosa selection is plentiful and I'm looking forward to trying it when I return on Sunday.  As was the coffee selection!  Let's get down to the crepes since that's what you are here for!!  I had the ? with walnuts, pears and goat cheese.  It came with a side of whip cream which I thought was strange up until the moment I tried it and found it complicated the crepe extremely well.  The crepe itself was delicious.  The selected ingredients were good but I would definitely try a different selection before I made my way back to this one.  My kids had the berry one, LOVED it and my son had the Perfect Combination which I know he loved when I saw him licking the plate.  Come with an appetite because these crepes are huge!!  The homemade Strawberry Lemonade was the best I ever had!  Watch your crepe being made on the TV!!  Free Lemon water and free cucumber water!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The simple delight and the Monterrey with avocado added to it.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect combination
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon

jSFKTuZqUIqN3m3cYVMECQ.text: Is a small place with limited seating. Ac must have been broke because it was hot. Had the Reuben crepe and was good! Friendly and helpful staff. Really liked the decor. Will try a dessert crepe next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben crepe.

4cA_-GPHKjvQNhNS0F1fSg.text: Great place for Crepes. I enjoyed the chorizo Crepe and one of the desert ones which was very appetizing (and filling). The little Italy wasn't that great. I met the owner of the restaurant he seems like a very cool guy. Inside is a little squeeze, they also have seats outside. It's a fun place to grab a quick bite. I'll definitely recommend. The crew is aware of their guests. Great service. There's also a tv to watch them make your food.

znY9zOurGHMVa7HsjWc96g.text: I was in France for a week, earlier this year. My brother had regaled me for years with stories of delicious crepe carts on every corner as far as the eye could see. But alas it was not so. Out of maybe 6 or 7 places we stopped at, only one was worth coming back to, and when I did return (the next day actually) they were closed. "Seriously?! On a Sunday?!"  I came home utterly devastated. More so in commiseration with my wife, an avid crepe connoisseur,  for whom the word "crepes" had been number three on her list of reasons we needed to see Paris.   I would never have imagined that we had a place that served Crepes, better than any we had on our travels, and that it was right down the street at Crepe Expectations.    I recommend you try one savory and one sweet, like the berry crepe with lemon custard along with the egg and bacon crepe. I forget the names. Also, since it's cold out, I believe you can sub a soup for one of the side orders. I didn't see it on the menu and there might be an additional cost, but I saw a few people order it and their reaction seemed favorable. Also, while your at it, treat yourself to a flight of mimosas, a sampler of three glasses of champagne with fruit juice. As I recall, the Pineapple mimosa was my favorite of the three I last ordered.   ( I could not help myself from writing this review as if I were some kind of fancy gentlemen. But honestly this place is good tasting, high quality food, and they work hard to provide the best service they can, despite the high volume and small space. Expect to wait a little while for a table, but if it's empty take your time and enjoy it! )

sNrLlH64Q_MjGWWk2UiLQw.text: This cozy little place serves a large menu with crepes that will satisfy anyones desire.   There is breakfast crepes, veggie crepes, and sweet crepes.  They even have a few savory crepes, so walking in and looking at the menu can be a little overwhelming, unless of course you already know what you want.  I wanted to look further, but the place was packed, we were in line, and I had to pick something right away.  The only available place to sit was outside, thus I couldn't continue to study the menu.   I picked a sweet crepe, I got the Berry Delight, made with fresh strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries, fresh whipped cream, and a light sprinkle of powder sugar.  It was yummy!  The berries were plumb and sweet, the crepe itself was delicious.  I would love to take another look at the entire menu and maybe try something other than sweet, I don't think they have a slow time, but I think that's what it's going to take for me to review everything the offer.

fQhqnXlFhQeCvuGzsPybdA.text: Love this place so much! The owner, Lou is such a great guy! He makes us feel so welcome every time we visit. Very accommodating. The food is fantastic! I bring my friends here every time they visit. You can always count on the deliciousness of the food!

JdYhBmE6hk8l_auWPhJKdA.text: The Monkey is a must try, it is so delicious. Just enough bananas and Nutella! If you have a sweet tooth I would definitely recommend you try it, you won't be sorry so gooood!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey;                      Nutella &amp; banana

ZpFVxKmsiv8mlrqp-dHJhQ.text: What a great place! Crepe Expectations is the perfect brunch spot. It's in a huge strip mall. You might even miss it snuggled up against other shops. The word Crepe stands out and your eye will immediately see the outside tables set under canopies.    It was my mother-in-laws birthday and I knew she would love this place. We placed our orders with the chef. I ordered the Rosarito. My mom-in-law had the Monterey. The other people in my group went with the Ana Bananas Foster. I love that with the savory crepes you can pick from bananas or cottage cheese. Since you pay and then pick your seat we were going to sit outside, but bees started bothering us so we moved inside. Which was great because you can watch the chef on a flat screen tv make your crepes. I really loved that feature. Our crepes came out and were so pretty and even better tasty! My Rosarito had spicy chorizo, guacamole, eggs and cheese. What a great combo. The crepe itself is light and the perfect vessel for just about anything. My mom-in-law really enjoyed hers as well. (Yay!)  As for Crepe Expectations drinks. Get the mimosa sampler! It's three glasses of champagne with your choice of juices! For only $10! I loved the cherry juice. It's a wonderful combo with any of the crepes.  I love this place. Except for the bees. Watch out if you choose to sit outside. On the weekends it gets packed so be prepared to wait, but it's so worth it. Another great place! I must credit my fellow Yelper Jessie B for clueing me in to this place. Yum, crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory crepe! Filled with carne asada, cheese, guacamole, &amp; salsa!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry mimosa
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosarito

DRvCTDqNx8gj9K9tFuwizA.text: This place was alright. Overrated for sure.   The place is real small so we had to wait before we got a table. Once we got a table, we had to go up, order our food and pay first. After we did that, we got some water and went back to our table where we proceeded to wait over half an hour before we got our 2 dishes. The first few bites tasted good and after that it was just meh.   My bf's dish didn't look to appetizing, almost like they did it so sloppily on purpose. My dish was quite dry for a chorizo crepe. i did enjoy the bananas though! lol.   There were also huge flies inside the restaurant because the doors were constantly being opened and closed so that was annoying.   I don't think we will come back here to eat, esp being that it's so expensive.

d7B3dy0KlRNIB5_bxAxTdQ.text: I used to come here all the time when I worked upstairs from them. The owners are absolutely amazing and make the most wonderful food (reason for 2 stars).   My friend was having a bad day so we stopped in at 2:30 today. We were promptly and rudely told outside the front door that they close at 3 and would be "kicked out" if we were not done with our food by then. I understand the kitchen closing early so they can clean up but being told I had to leave promptly at 3 by an employee was totally out of line! If I'm going to pay $45 for two people to enjoy lunch I want to be able to actually enjoy it.   I know this isn't the philosophy of the owners and was sad I was "greeted" outside the front door by this rude man, because he saved me some money!   Sad that such an amazing place is ruined by a grumpy employee. Maybe time to freshen up the staff a bit?

ftYeNN9YYyaHvqAsyQ6CWw.text: I give them a zero for the worst  customer service. I ordered for pick up and was told it would be ready in 25 minutes. I pay and wait and after 30 mins I ask a lady where my order is and she tells me it is going to be 30 mins and there are 4 tickets before me. I ask for the money back and go to the cashier. He asks me what's wrong and I tell him it has been 30 mins and I am told it was going to take another 30. I give him my card for refund. He throws the card at me and tells me he cannot refund to my card and tells me I lied. He yells at me and is super rude. Last time I will be supporting a business who has no customer service skills.

8buDEZPMYfWJbaqadp4WMQ.text: Customer service is five stars for sure!!!  Sadly, my crepe wasnt!  Ive wanted to come here for a year or so and just never got around to it, not to mention its located off of Eastern and I live all the way in Summerlin but  was so excited to come here!  Finally, I set up a girls day with my friend and we started out here first!  I ordered the Greek Crepe and we both ordered the trio mimosa sampler.  My crepe was kinda dry and over cooked, the flling was overkilled with too much Feta ( its all I could taste) and chicken that was so dry I opened my crepe up and pulled the peices out. :-(.  My trio mimosas were also way too syrupy and not mixed at all, maybe they forgot to mix them cause the syrup was sitting at the bottom of all of them.  I dont know, maybe the sweet crepes are worth a shot!  There's just too many other crepe places in town.

hxmE5WAxmXamETqTGkPiMg.text: My favorite place to eat in Vegas!  My favorite is the Greek Crepe and I like to add pesto:)  cappuccinos are delish and so are the mimosas!  Its all Yummy! Great family owned Restaurant and service Is a thumbs up. A must try.

1fRN-M1hcPQnHjga5YzXlQ.text: Holy crepe the 4.5 stars are very accurate for this establishment  The .5 star deduction is for short hours ..closing at 3 in Vegas is lame Also don't bring 5 bucks in here expecting anything more than Free cucumber water   Now for the greatness of CE   They have a big variety of sweet and savory crepes I had the monkey and the Elvis both on point It's also a great little morning date spot to pretend you Are sophisticated   If there is a better crepe in Vegas  Please let me know  For right now CE holds the crown

Fqi3XptUPVXaaMVY1pfbDg.text: 1st time here and it won't be the last! I had the Monterey crepe and flight of mimosas... you get to choose 3 flavors.. I tried the passion fruit, raspberry and pineapple.  They were all good but my fave was the raspberry. Service was great and food was AMAZING! This is my new breakfast joint!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven

gS_M4J9D42nmRjhvgTXD0w.text: One word for you: YUMMY !!!! Exceeded my expectations indeed. I went here for three days in a row during my Vegas trip and can't wait to come back!

Gaj5_pvGImsPDYvTMZs6xA.text: Absolutely amazing. The crepes are made fresh with all of the ingredients made in house. Everyone is friendly and helpful.

1OSSlyj1heXkK_SCYYDjnA.text: Love love love this place. A very friendly environment. Almost makes you feel like family. The food is great and you can find something that you will enjoy on their menu.

GebqoR8Po17f50EKhlc0Jg.text: 3 of us went there for lunch. Was very good.  The side of watermelon was interesting; however.  I would've preferred a crepe and a small side salad vs. a steak crepe and a side of watermelon?  I also wish they would have mini dessert crepes vs having to buy 2 crepes :)

OUUkdD-d_CrUJEhCLPdM0g.text: I've been waiting for a place like this to open off the strip. Crepe Expectations exceeded my expectations with their friendly staff and their variety of crepe offerings. You can choose from breakfast, savory to sweet crepes and in addition beer, wine or a number of different mimosas. The crepes were very authentic and presentation was nice. My only knock is the dark interior but the last time I checked, I'm not an interior designer and this all about the food and service which were both fantastic. It was very clean and modern inside and they even had a tv showing your crepes being made. The other great thing was that they served Illy Coffee and free refills, thats pretty awesome. Anna and the rest of the staff were super friendly and constantly checked up on us, I will definitely be a regular at this spot! In regards to the food, my wife and I shared one of each of the breakfast, savory and sweet. The crepes were thin, light and held up very well with the fresh fillings...so good!

NRpPFscNtcq0EYMPNrPdPQ.text: Excellent! Good find in Vegas off the strip. Went twice on our recent trip. Wonderful service and the food was great.

NBFrTVyB6uiSUPQ29DtJRw.text: My sister and I got lost and we ended up finding Crepe Expectations. I love crepes and convinced my sis to go. We got the Sonora (carne asada, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, and jack cheese) and split it because we weren't really hungry. But it was so delicious!! The crepe also came with some fruit on the side. I like how they are specialized in crepes and not 10 different things and their menu may be short but from our Sonora crepe; I bet all the crepes on the menu are good too. The decorations inside gave you a chic feel to it. The atmosphere was quiet and peaceful but the owners told us we came after the rush hour. We both talked to the owners and they were really nice. We found out that they make everything in the kitchen fresh every day. They're trying to make their own hummus. Outside they have some food and water so it's good if you want to bring your dog or cat with you. Although in the heat, I think the water would be boiling. We live on the other side of the town but we are definitely going back the next chance we get. Especially when we did get to try the dessert crepes.

CX5MfnhOrQgvRDl3f-6ohg.text: Breakfast bliss!  Our family was fortunate enough to grab a table inside during a robust Sunday morning breakfast rush.  Crepes were divine! Hubby had the Monterray - - his fork never stopped moving from the plate to his mouth! :-)  Beautiful girl had The Monkey - - filled with Nutella and banana creamy deliciousness.  Happy, happy girl. I had the Avalon - - moment of silence for the exceptionally partnered pears, goat cheese, walnuts and honey.  Beyond beyond!  Topped off with the mimosa trio - - I chose tangerine, watermelon and white peach for my indulgence - - it was a beautiful Sunday morning.  Was truly impressed to see the owner manning the register and taking orders like a champ.  Staff was beyond busy, but wonderfully friendly.  Only nose wrinkling moment was at how, shall we say, "cozy" the space is.  People were literally packed in line so densely that the servers couldn't get around them to deliver drinks/meals.  But that is again a testimate to how delicious their food is....we were all willing to wait.  It is so fantastic to finally have fabulous, locally owned restaurants in our neighorhood!

X0Ip5GNWLjvuCYLHHFMVkA.text: Excellent gluten free crepes and the service is always great here. We eat here every time we come to Vegas since we discovered it a few months ago.

1zZdxPUwYMDJt5PwonAICg.text: Delicous food and fun atmosphere. I love this place! I've been here a few times now and it is great every time. You get to watch your crepes being made on television right in front of you! Great added feature.

N3A0zBhfVNT_MPX84-2nnA.text: Bankers' hours? Is this a joke? The place is open after everyone is at work and closes before most people get off work (except weekends, unless you work weekends, too). So, who is this for? Senior citizens (who should be watching what they eat) and those on welfare (who should be watching  what they buy)? Yes, the crepes are decent, but until they have meaningful business hours, their rating will remain low in my book. After all this is Vegas, where the best fun starts after sunset...

-1B0nO5oVkhMTu2bc-fOuA.text: SHOCKINGLY GOOD.  Took my boys here this morning after dropping mom off at the airport.   Had a wonderful meal that was served up not more than 8 minutes after we ordered even though it was busy!   We luckily snagged the seats right in front of the kitchen and the boys LOVED watching the crepes being made.    I can't recommend this place enough and we'll be back next weekend!

XMJxKr7Y7LeGAKeympNP2Q.text: The best crepes on the west coast! Try the mimosa tri and the Ana's foster!! Delicious!

QKrbD-yH7nxhyiTe6YmRBA.text: I am a crepe fan!! And I am happy to say I have found a new breakfast favorite...you had me at cucumber water and passion fruit mimosa...but the crepes were fantastic! I even broke my rule and ate some of my BF's crepe that had chorizo and it was sublime!! If you have a vegetarian option for that crepe, I will officially camp outside your door until you open every morning!!  Thank you for the fantastic service and the amazing food! We will be back soon to try out more stuff on your menu!

l-t8fL__5Nna05z96x0TgQ.text: I wish there were more stars because 5 doesn't seem like enough! We tried 8 different crepes on our 2 day visit to Vegas! We even extended our rental car a few extra hours so we could drive out here again. Only about 10 minutes from the strip and worth the drive!

odCK_vLZEW4NzRcUNCLHwA.text: This is my first time trying this place and I'll definitely be back! The food is delicious and the portions are generous. Next time I'm bringing a friend and trying a mimosa.

9faqq2-APiXyI_whdegupQ.text: We go to the Farmers market in the shopping area where this place is located and always wanted to try it.  We are SOO glad we did!  The people are so friendly, the restaurant is beautifully decorated and we LOVED the crepes.  We would HIGHLY recommend this place for food, coffee or just a place to hang out!

3-Vf6xTfhArxHzoxeyi58g.text: I'm not a fan of Crepes, but seeing the reviews on here, I just had to stop in and try it...I'm SO glad I did!!  I am a crepe convert!!  I had the Rosarito for breakfast which was simply amazing and I couldn't pass up the Bananas Foster...to die for!! We will be regulars here!!

COA4AWsRZA21Jqe24AzB5g.text: My husband and I found this hidden gem on our last vacation to Las Vegas last fall and ended up eating here twice then. This trip it was my first stop, straight from the airport for lunch. Once again I got the Del Mar ($9) shrimp & zucchini crepe and it was delicious. It was loaded with shrimp and tasted very fresh with a light butter sauce. My friend got the Sonora ($9) carne asada crepe and was amazed at how good it was. She loved how the slightly browned exterior of the crepe gave it texture against the hardy filling.  Be sure to check out the "Crepe Cam" over the cooking station so you can watch your food being made. Also, love that they have complimentary flavored water available that you can help yourself to. Just wish they were open in the evening so we could stop by for a dessert crepe after a day of gambling/sightseeing.   This place is a definite must for visitors and locals alike. Tell your friends!

KU5F17AqUaX12hDu1J_Ltw.text: Excellent! Service was great! The crepes, are authentic French style, and delicious. The mimosa sampler is a must!!! Three mimosas for 10$. The only drawbacks, seating is limited (outside seating is available and goes quick), I would have liked to been able to make my own crepe (I was told to ask and they will make it) we will see, and they close early. Although when you hear why they close early, it makes it a bonus not a drawback. This is a great place! A great locals place, that makes you feel special, and is unique. I will be back.

4eOjrtcRohUz2c17KxwSiw.text: Food is amazing I would eat here every day if I could. Their flavored mimosas are very good as well.  The place is super busy on the weekend and you can expect to wait an hour.

XD91-HyyR4a5ljF9_lWHmQ.text: Always a great experience and such a friendly staff. Mimosas are amazing. I just love this place!!!

LboXwj4hbAlN4jrDg7ohCA.text: Went here a couple of weekends ago for breakfast. The place gets really busy on the weekends, but the service there was really good at finding me a place to sit in less than a minute. The cool thing about this place is that they make the crepes right in front of you so that it's fresh. I ordered the Sunday Morning Crepe, which is just scrambled eggs, jack cheese, and potatoes and it was awesome. I would definitely come here again.

qPQ2LFimVLQJzDieLlKJAA.text: Best crepes ever, without a contest.  I wish I went for more variety, as I can't find anything that suits me better than the La Jolla. It is amazing, but so is everything else.  The soup is great. Even the cucumber water is great.  This is one of our highly recommended places to take our visitors from out of town, and so far have excelled each and every time. The seating is a bit cramped and crowded, especially in winter/summer when it's not seasonal to sit outside. The staff is always very accommodating in getting people situated, so rather than feeling like it's a bad thing you feel taken care of.  It has consistently been a great and not very costly meal.

2rpaWALzpRnfq_5gyBLrAg.text: love this place for breakfast / brunch!   sweet crepes, egg breakfast crepes, and lunch crepes! you can get whatever you're in the mood for.   the flight of mimosas is a must! you can choose 3 flavors from a selection...of thirteen I think....definitely over ten.   I got one of the crepes with egg because it was breakfast time. I made a substitution and asked for turkey instead of bacon. and the rest of the items the same - it was so great! and then for the side I got half banana and half cottage cheese. they ask you for either or. I just got both.   the service is great here also!

3EpgIgLGl-GGRB6JHtWNyw.text: Great places for breakfast. From their sweet to savory crepes, each one is beautifully made and with well balanced flavors. Their sweet crepes are perfect with a nice cup of coffee. I usually come here when I am craving something sweet but light for breakfast. The Ana's Banana Fosters and Monkey crepes are delicious. I love them because they are not overly sweet.   I have yet to try their mimosas but their fresh fruit juices are always great. I generally will get partake in the fruit juice with my savory crepes, the Sonora being one of my favorites.  The staff is always warm and welcoming. Quick to offer suggestions and inform guests about specials.  I highly recommend taking advantage of their seasonal lattes as well.

5B0Nnj6-erdxdSoxWi4XAQ.text: Small and cozy place..Little bit of a wait but worthwhile...big portions, nice menu variety...The 'Elvis' was scrumptious. I'll be back.

YSsmxum9ruxKznq1CLek-A.text: This is it!. Need a crepe' fix? They've got em. Sweet or savory they can't be beat. Fun people, great food, nice environment. What more do you need? Go there!

mbP0Ijed1Qfwh6Fpx4vTNg.text: I give this place 10 stars,  ha ha,  have been meaning to write a review but haven't had the time till today.  The service is great,  staff friendly,  food is delicious!! Mimosas to die for!! Lou and Mike are the best!! We visit this place 3 times a month and have never had a bad experience.  Food comes  out and fresh and they make sure you have what you need before they leave your table. One of us usually orders the chorizo crepe believe it or not I forgot what it's called. I would go there every weekend but have to give other customers a chance to try this place out keep up the excellent service guys!!

I_svYzx0mD0RqqjQE14zDA.text: I absolutely adore this place! The crepes are delicious and the customer service is excellent!   I've never had a bad crepe at Crepe Expectations, but I do have a couple of favorites. I suggest "The La Jolla" for a Savory Crepe. It's like a BLT with guacamole and a tasty chipotle mayo spead. I always add turkey and I highly recommend it! For a sweet crepe, I'm addicted to "The Avalon". This one has pears, goat cheese, candied walnuts and honey. They offer different fun flavors of mimosas and you can order a trio to taste a few. The coffee is excellent! I always get a White Mocha and in the warmer months get it iced. Yum yum yum!    This place is family owned and everyone there is very kind. It's an order at the counter joint, they give you a number, you pick a table and they bring your food out to you. However, weekends are quite busy and you have to put your name down on wait list for table. They always have refreshing Cucumber and Lemon water out while you wait. Enjoy!

HsUrmA1W0IElxgzW84SZRg.text: Yum savory crepes!  The owner, Lou and the staff are very friendly and fun.  The crepes are delicious and unique. If you want something different and fresh try this place.  Seating could be slightly better, but the crepes are top notch

tZSAaro6wxVdn3h6BCK8IQ.text: Needed a breakfast date somewhere cool and different.  We chose Crepe Expectations because the reviews were consistently good, and the place lived up to the... expectations!  This place was pretty busy for a Sunday morning.  Everyone working here was super friendly and smiley.  I liked that their menu had lots of fresh ingredients in most of their crepes.  I ended up going with the Rosarito because I rarely turn down chorizo haha.  My friend got some kind of Nutella crepe (how can you really go wrong?), and her little girl got one with strawberries and some chocolate in it.  I loved that mine came with fresh sliced banana on the side!  Everything was really good.  We'd come back for sure.

52M1Gg11Gf6P_dy08twbjA.text: Love the watermelon juice.. good strong coffee.. amazing crepes. Nice and friendly service. Will be back. Nice to see local business thriving well!

5XLJeE1yiQGDUt0I-zohzQ.text: I was recommended to try the banana foster. Very good option I may say. I did have it as a to go option wish I would have sat down to enjoy but nonetheless worth the option. Very good and they will add anything with it.

bPxMfaP_9_bjwiBK9yehng.text: Amazing, very very friendly, and genuine staff. I love everything there! To the costumer service, to the food, to how the place is even decorated!! Highly recommend!! Once again costumer service is rare these days and they make up for the people who lack if!! Way to go guys!!

NASwWpsywJ9jAoyzeNgODQ.text: This is a huge MUST!!! Love this place, food and service is always on point. Coming on the weekends can get a little crazy and it's a small place but the food makes it all worth it!!

9Zrjn-FZzusifybGmVNtFw.text: This place is absolutely amazing. My girlfriend is a native French Canadian and quite the crepe critic. Even she was amazed. The Elvis and pastrami crepes are amazing.  This is a must go. Don't think just eat!

prdeqvlaqUjMMBrVSfh7kg.text: Very nice breakfast.  Lunch crepes were good too.  Service was excellent.  We took 3 adults and 2 kids.  Everyone came away happy.  Food was fresh! We will return

cGlhSi-zSYN8ZEGNTV3TCQ.text: Got the William Tell for my first time trying this place and it was really good! Food came out quick and the staff was nice. Not a fan of the diy water service, but that's not a big deal. Coming back soon!

yGX2GSuR3XzUHYcmwt45dA.text: somewhat overrated by other users. a crepe is a crepe. theirs are good for sure but nothing extraordinary. plus, the ambience of the place is seriously lacking - it has very little room and almost all of the few tables are community, not the most welcoming environment especially for the claustrophobic. in addition, their hours are very strange especially for Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. behind the counter at crepe expectations

YSpBDfdPiavYBdysrIC6Nw.text: Really nice place, very friendly staff, and nice selection of Crepes. I had only one dish (The Rosarito), so my review won't reflect on the rest of the menu. I wish that Rosarito would have a bit more guacamole and less meat. It might be just my personal preference.

B3Li4SwVAhjH7_55D_LCnQ.text: Amazing! We will definitely be back. I want to try everything on the menu it all looks so good. This is a  place I'll bring family to from out of town. The employees where also really great. They all seemed happy to be there and happy that you're there as well. Wish they were open later tho!

bVWPXrysMapp72querXmCw.text: As authentic as it gets. Trying new stuff. Staff is cool and crepes are delicious, made fresh

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HGDPDzLd0GTKWoqGuj4QQQ.text: This place is amazing the food in made with love and passion, which makes sense... The owner is a nice guy and put his heart into his passion. We waited over 45 minutes for him to open and the whole time he talked with us while he prepared for the day!!! When ever we have company this will be the place to take them.... If you have not tried this place you are holding out on your tatse buds..... So hurry on down and try it tomorrow!!! Thank you for great food and awesome service.

PtXUA2Mkyc2MRITi9YUxww.text: Be prepared to wait 20- 25 minutes for your order. Don't think I'm coming back here anymore

emn2llmwpEF0yUajwvnl0w.text: I got the Ana Banana crepe, my friends got the savory Monterey, and lattes. Everything was great! The food was spectacular and the service was fast, friendly, and efficient.  My only complaint was that the vanilla latte was insanely sweet, but that is just my personal preferance.

EtKC8Rb5ZxUPahIlkm1xcA.text: Yummy!! The mimosa sampler is great, as are the crepes. They are good sized and they definitely do not skimp on the fillings as some places do. Reasonably priced as well, and great service! The only reason they lost a star is because I feel like the two times I have got the berry delight crepe the strawberries have been somewhat tasteless and not super fresh. That's ok, just won't order that one again. Will stick with all the other fabulous crepes they have to offer!

aqMdZT81uYJUPLh6a_sINg.text: Best Crepes in Las Vegas!!!! The owners are so sweet. Love this place!!!!! Sonora is my favorite for breakfast and desert will be the berry delight with the mimosa trio sampler. Everything is so fresh & delicious!!!!

QDBKeKOw425RkxVwmuwWAg.text: Absolutely in love with this place! Amazing food, best mimosas ever, and the people who work there are the friendliest you've ever met. Can't wait to come back again and again. Love the fact that the owners are so friendly and hands on. Couldn't think of a single thing to make this place better.

7gdrScQYfm6QqVPWtypfqg.text: Absolutely amazing.   Great food and such sincerely friendly service! These guys definitely love what they're doing.   Just be ready for a wait. Or have them fire up the heat lamps outside, which is what we did. So glad we found this spot. Thank you yelp!

tKMQKsYPgTrAbZ80PrjVog.text: My husband and I tried this place on a Sunday morning after deciding we should probably eat something before going to the farmer's market. Given the decor I was a little skeptical the place would be pretty expensive but the person behind the register was so welcoming and friendly I would have felt guilty walking out. Good thing we stayed, upon closer inspection the prices were quite reasonable.  My husband orderd the greek crepe which came with either his choice of soup or salad and I ordered the special which was bbq pulled pork with with a side of apple and blue cheese coleslaw. I have lived in Texas and I do love me some slow cooked meat but I am not a fan of bbq sauce. No problem they were more than happy to put it on the side. My husband's crepe was huge, the veggies inside were very fresh and maintained a bit of their crispness. He loved it and said it filled him up, which believe me is no easy feat. My crepe was delicious also, the pulled pork truly did rival what you would find at a good bbq in Texas. The slaw which had intrigued me enough to order the dish did not disappoint. I could have eaten a plate of that by itself.  One of the best things was the free flavored waters they had. Cucumber or lemon. I don't know if they change out the flavorings but I love flavored water and the fact that it was free made the place even more affordable. The place was small and had televisions on Food Network with the sound either very low or off. It was very busy but at no time was it so loud that I had trouble having a conversation with my husband.

C7RVz3OVB6CCo3TVXNHuYA.text: Husband and I moved here a few Months ago and found this place near our home.   We usually have a hard time finding a GREAT breakfast place. We are happy that we found Crepe Expectations.   Not only is the staff friendly but as busy as this place gets they amaze me of how great of a service they provide to all their customers.   The only "negative" thing is that is a bit small of a place. But I must say it is worth the wait (when waiting for a table).  Hands down the best place around.   And the food is delicious as well as the mimosas.

ZPMCybE5x4ZMLM3RY-6A2Q.text: The Skinny: solid crepes, drinks are very good (4) service: it's counter service but the bevie bar is the best! (4) value: even though the tea is really pricey ($4 for a teabag in a pot, yikes!), they've got endless refills of illy coffee for around $3 and $10 for a trio of mimosas. That's value (4).  I brought my out of town friends here for a little Sunday morning breakfast. As we first walked in, they loved the hip colour scheme and the comfortable seating area. Add in the video screen to watch your crepe being made, we were really feeling the love.  The owners strategically placed large containers of flavoured (lemon and cucumber) iced water, self-serve coffee, and condiments on a cute little bevie counter. I loved this feature - so much more convenient for customers to be able to help themselves. The only thing I would like to see added is a canister for refilling hot water for teapots.  I also enjoyed the fact that the menu is varied and offers not only sweet but savory crepes for those who aren't really into sweets. They also offer gluten free crepes as well. Prices range from $5.50 (simple sugar crepe) to $9 (crepes with steak or shrimp in it) with the majority of their specialty crepes falling around the $7 mark. Trust me, for the quality and the ambience, it's definitely worth it.  We each got a Monkey crepe - you know - the standard nutella/banana combination. I have to say, it's one of the better crepes I've had in a while. It had a nice texture with it's lovely brown crispiness on the outside which pared well with its molten chocolate hazelnut filling. Truer to the French styled creperie (a little more butter content, a little thinner and less spongy) than other places (lots of Asian creperies around), it's a really solid rendition of a culinary classic.  I was a little taken aback by the prices for tea. $4 for a teabag in a pot seemed a little steep for my tastes although the Earl Grey was nicely mellow with lovely floral hints when I tried it.  Too bad I don't like coffee because the real steal here is the self-serve bottomless cup of illy coffee for less than $3. Yep! it's like the best deal in town for a quality cup of joe. My friend  was amazed at how good it was ("it's so smooth!")and had at least 3 giant cups ("can I get another cup? We're not in a rush, are we?") before she left. Beat that Starbucks!  Given my excellent experience here, I'll be sure to drag the hubs back here to try their savory crepes and mimosas.

9P48Efm6IQ4_Q73wi8SyOA.text: I got the Avalon, (with pears and goat cheese)-was absolutely amazing! Best crepe place I've been to so far. And their service was excellent; very kind!

W6dK3GiZ8DSy7442eSLgCQ.text: I'm not going to be redundant with pictures or descriptions of our delicious crepes.  Let me just say that it is worth a drive from the strip and I consider it a bargain for the quality and yumminess.  The owner was VERY friendly and made it a point to visit with every patron.  It was a really outstanding visit and I will be going back when in Vegas again!

IbBV0BHREKK4QZCeJKLAiw.text: If you like crepes and are not interested in seeing of any Kardashians roll thru or if the owner is willing to play silly word games with you, this is where you need to go. Forget Paris and any other so-called french places for breakfast/brunch. The crepes are really good. So guess what? If they are busy, you may have to wait. In a super-hurry? Eat a bowl of cold Captain Crunch at home or grab a hot pocket on the way to the dollar store, Genghis! The food is made here, on site, by a real chef who cares what goes over the counter. I have only had great food here. If you seek a $5.99 meal, go hit some dive-ass buffet at Slots O Fun or somesuch. I prefer to get good food made by a pro who cares, not someone with a bad a attitude and a flaky scalp. This guy is on top of his game.

saMEBDIh5eaAVlfo6Tn5AA.text: I've been here twice so far. The menu options are fairly limited but the quality has been superb.  They're busy on the weekends but it is worth the wait for a table. Prices are fair compared to similar restaurants. The breakfast entrees are delicious and their lattes are good too.

43CiljfFxA6e6e9fxaX6kw.text: Amazing!!!  We got the banana foster crepe with strawberries and it was light and tasty and just perfect. The people working here are so friendly and polite. The guy at the register missed his calling as a viking but I think he is too nice for that anyway. The have lemon water and cucumber water. The coffee is good. Atmosphere is very comfortable and inviting. You can watch them make your crepe which is cool. Great experience and great food. I highly recommend.

pKOyGFAPzfIpd1W0ao9Utg.text: EVERYTIME my dude and I take our Vegas trip Crepe Expectations is one of the spots we MUST hit up. 1. Their crepes are POPPIN! 2. You can pick flavorS for a flight of mimosas. Das whsp, in San Diego that is NOT common. Quantity-quality-price ratio is worth EVERY dollar. There could be a wait to be seated and maybe a little longer for your order but they haven't disappointed yet. Order ahead, take it to go, but for mimosas you have to stay. They don't take your order at the table, you order at the counter and find a seat which is the only down but it's still WORTH IT. They have flavored cold water you could serve yourself also. It's worth it for us San Diegans.

Q4Y5oIi_Ze__EZyqxh5jKQ.text: Love this place.   The menus and prices are good for the quality. The service is excellent.  I wish they can have s bigger place.

hjKGsftoEEPPMKPQyJNTig.text: I love crepes so I had to go check this place out. There are so many options I couldn't make up my mind! I went with a lemon curd crepe with strawberries and blueberries. It was great! Lemon curd was excellent as well as the fresh berries. I also had a fresh squeezed OJ. I will definitely be back for breakfast and lunch. Go!

58GA_fFE-BejRPJ_tgUVMw.text: This place has the most AMAZING coffee. The crepes were the best I have ever had.....What a neat little place. The decor is so nice a warm. I have refered this place out a few times already. Keep up the great work.

O60ucW9UCG7PdYtAueB76g.text: Excellent food, excellent service!  The gluten free Monterey crepe was beyond awesome!  Perfect amount of bacon to eggs to chiles and cheese! This place will definitely be my go to place every time I come to Vegas!  The added bonus was the small farmers market in the parking lot out front on Sunday morning!  Make sure you stop by and taste the raspberry jalapenos jelly!

qpoBhgutAxIaSFr_Py7W3A.text: Service was excellent. Owner even stopped by to check on our table. Food was amazing. This is our new breakfast spot.

Gd6phNEFF0cW3QG3VeXQHw.text: I'm impressed ! I make quick trips to Las Vegas and Crepe Expectations has become a routine stop for me.  Friendly service and a local favorite. Yelp ratings have made this place a foodie destination and I feel it is worthwhile.  Large selection of delicious crepes. Great atmosphere. A little small, but cozy.   Watch the crepe making magic right from your table with "live" Crepe Vision" on large screen monitors. Delicious brewed coffee and fresh cucumber water available. Prices are reasonable. You will be happy you left the strip for this place. ENJOY !

MAvLM3awu4ZFvvTWcEGDyw.text: this place is AWESOME if you like crepes! they have so much variety for amazing prices. great customer service and beautifully decorated. oh! also a wide variety of drinks. during summertime, they usually give you a side of fruit and during winter right now, they are serving soup (fideo soup which is super yummy). plus many different menu items, sweet crepes, crepes that would usually be in a sandwich, and breakfast crepes. my favs are the rosarito and the grand turk. no matter what you order, you can never go wrong! no other crepe place can beat this one!!! enjoy!

JvjG4OBr1QUKvxSjaXIfzw.text: Food and selection was good.great friendly service. Sat outside and enjoyed our breakfast. Dog friendly with little treats and water so next time we may bring our dog, Doug.

xkw15YpdCmldzpWbWBiZhQ.text: My husband and I had a late lunch here yesterday.  Everything was excellent from the food to the service.  We had the Greek crepe which was generously filled with high quality ingredients...including real kalamata olives. The plain crepe with lemon was just like the ones I've found on the streets of Paris. We will be back soon....

x-s-LGx7kEIW-eXhnWxlHQ.text: Small quaint restaurant that is modern and trendy inside. Food was excellent and the staff mirrored the food in excellence! Pricing was very fair, my only complaint as I don't drink coffee is that there was not a fountain soda so my can was empty before my food got there. I will be going back for breakfast tomorrow morning as a matter of fact

mOjydUYE07TJd6xGh8dqJw.text: Deeee-licious!!! I got the nutella-hazelnut-whipped cream one and my bf got the western omlet inside of a crepe! Both were amazing, great flavors, good portions and the little patio outside was perfect for our little brunch! Free refills on coffee too!

rxN9L0C_Opa3Z5NY8zBWOg.text: Well, I was going to this place at least once a month with my boyfriend and it was delicious, so I suggested it to a female friend of mine as a good spot to grab brunch together. I won't be going back. The... Owner, I believe? Just incessantly called us "baby" and "doll" and "sweetheart" and "honey" etc as we ordered, which was a little overwhelming/patronizing (we are both nearly 30) but I put up with it. My friend went to get coffee from the coffee bar, and I sat down at the table. When she came over to sit she said to me "WOW I'll take a side of harassment with my crepes, huh? That's... Old school!" I agreed that being called all those pet names was a bit disconcerting, at which point she told me he had actually come up behind her with the coffee refill and put his arm around her while telling her "atta girl" as she filled up her coffee. I apologized profusely and explained that I never had this treatment when visiting with my boyfriend, and I will NOT be returning.

x_VQ1IyZSZWZFBuyn1_Zww.text: Great food, awesome atmosphere! I love local restaurants, and I definitely recommend this place! The crepes are really good - second best crepes I've eaten, but definitely the best I've had in Henderson. Its a little small, so it can get loud and crowded during peak hours like Saturday brunch.

tx9mRVAgGt--keVvWIeJIQ.text: We had "Sunday Special" and "The Greek"  Crepes.  Both were really tasty and filling.  Friendly staff and good service.  Huge cup of coffee with free refills.  As mentioned in another review, you can get lemon or cucumber flavored water.  Side of salad with "The Greek" had an amazingly good dressing.  Highly worth the drive from Strip to get a good meal.   Reasonable prices.

DlbWuIsDtpGkxFrKrNNNpg.text: I lived in Vegas when this restaurant opened and went many, many times. Now I have moved to the east coast but I make sure to visit Crepe Expectations every time I am in town.  Their food is made to order, always perfect. And they have a really fun selection of flavors for their mimosa trio. I just wish they would expand so there was more seating available. hint hint!

bT2fpSRrrjZX_aIABDXkUA.text: First time there yesterday.  Food & Service excellent:) Will be back and tell others to go there! The Razzle Dazzle with fresh rasberries and lemon curd and whip creme was delicious! A friendly place and the free cucumber water is a nice touch!

SpG2yDdDNfz8TNe222b0_A.text: Never knew this place existed untill I found a facebook review from someone I know. The place is small and often few seats available to sit down in. It's kind of winter now so outside dining isn't quite that pleasant this time of year. There are a few people that help you get seated and clear tables, but they aren't actual waiters since you have to go to the counter to place your order, but they do bring your food out to you using the number system, they are very helpful and friendly. The menu is very extensive and the many different choices can stop a newcomer in their tracks. We ordered off the breakfast menu and all was just perfect. You can watch them make the crepes right in front of you and the ladies do a very nice job, so many choices on fillings. They also have a large dispenser of cucumber water and lemon water for free or you can have wine, mimosas or various bottled soda pops. The crepes are traditional or exotic, but always good, we just wish there was more seating. Congrats to them, they have a nice following and we are included.

3oABs4ll21jGqvYnLrS_eA.text: My wife and I went there last week for breakfast.  First time there.  This is one of the best crepe places that we have eaten at. We have tried many places in Vegas,  Quebec, Montreals, Canada. Good selection for sweet creeps and regular breakfast and lunch style crepes. Saw the Greek salad crepes, and look so good. Friendly staffs, clean, and good selection of different water that you have to serve yourself. They put cucumber and lemon in a water pitcher that you can serve yourself. There were one more but does not remember. They are very busy on the weekends according to a staffer. There are line of people waiting. I gave a four instead of five, because you kind of have to serve yourself with water. Not sure if this a restaurant, restaurant or a Starbucks type. They bring you your food at the table. I tip like I would at a restaurant, but you have a server at the restaurant. This is not a big deal. We would come back, nd recommend to our friends.

fLlN1HxJZijXpO6menw2sw.text: These are not only the best crepes I have had, but they are made by a Crepe Artiste! Ana greets you with a warm smile and lovingly puts her chef skills to work, which you can watch up close or on a monitor.  I had the Veggie Patch. The vegetables were freshly cut and grilled, combined with a tangy hummus, it was delicious. Since it was so light and low-cal, I decided to order the Berry Delight for dessert and a delight it was! It was worth the 25 miles I traveled to get there, so more visits are planned to satisfy my gastro-cravings and to enjoy the home/family comfy feelings felt while dining.  Larry and Ana, the owners, are cordial and ready to please. Don't miss out on this treat. It's like sitting in Mama's kitchen.

jONZUI7gGHDmO0yU6R3Gdg.text: This place was great! The breakfast crepe I had was delicious, I got to watch them make it, and the staff was really friendly. On top of it all, the lovely lavender decor just tickled my visual senses. I would go back here any day of the week!

Wdban4VK9CCKoy3mQrTzNg.text: OMG.  There really aren't enough "OMG"s to go around to describe this place, but OMG!!!!!!!!!!  Me and my girlfriends came to Vegas 2 weeks ago to celebrate a birthday.  One of my friends, ever the planner, found out about this place via Yelp and her eyes popped out of her socket when she saw the Mimosa Trio Sampler on the menu.  'Nuff said.  We were definitely going to visit when we got to Vegas.  Oh, they have crepes, too?  That's cool.  So we touch down in Vegas at the abysmal hour of 10:00am (!) and proceed to Crepe Expectations.  There was a total of 4 of us so we decided to get 2 breakfast crepes, 2 sweet crepes, and then we would just split them all.  The 2 breakfast crepes that we ordered were the Monterey Crepe and the Rosarito Crepe.  I can't...I just can't.  I'm getting a headache now just thinking about HOW GOOD that ish was.  Really?  Really?!  The cheese was gooey and everything was so flavorful.  My friends were debating which crepe was better of the two.  At that point I'm like, "Who gives a f@ck?!"  They were both blowing my mind!  Cut to the 2 sweet crepes: Bananas Foster and Perfect Combination.  The Bananas Foster ruled HANDS DOWN!  God I wanted to lick that plate.  But on to better things:  THE MIMOSA TRIO SAMPLER!!!  We EACH got a sampler, so yes, 12 mimosas were on our table.  I ordered the orange (yes I stay True to the original, thank you very much), white peach and passion fruit.  When you order the passion fruit they provide a little spoon for you to mix the drink with.  There are also several other flavors to choose from as well.  I thought that the white peach and passion fruit were too sweet, but the orange?  JUST RIGHT.  And DON'T call me boring because the orange was my favorite.  I just appreciate the classics, that's all.  They're in pretty small glasses, so....yes, I ordered another sampler.  What?  Don't judge.  But when I ordered the second sampler, Mike, who I believe is the owner and totally AWESOME in every way, gave me the rest of the champagne that was left and told me to go to town.  And go to town we did.  When we were done licking our plates and boozing it up, Mike proceeded to bring us free bowls of soup!  What the hell?!  Mike, we love you!!!!  So we stumbled out of Crepe Expectations at 12 noon (yes, we had been there that long) with our bellies full and our sobriety greatly compromised.  Three cheers and 5 stars all around for Crepe Expectations!!

6ZAT6z3Wsn88bU6Zey1bLA.text: Great atmosphere.. even greater Staff... Crepe Expectations exceeded mine.. cool Lil Vegas getaway

ukoDGsOW4C_PwTQByqReTA.text: Came into Crepe Expectations with high expectations especially since when we walked in we noticed a sign indicating it was it on Food Network. We were seated quickly and handed menus and tins to get up and order at the counter when ready. That wasn't a issue with us. The restaurant is small but cozy, and ha mostly high top tables which I enjoy since I'm rather teller. On the side are some bench style seats wit chairs on the other side. Not really too good for big groups of more then 4 people.  Back to our experience. We ordered The Little Italy Crepe and the Caprese chicken Crepe with grilled chicken. Took exactly 20 minutes from time of receipt to time of food being delivered to our table. That was extremely long since it wasn't busy. All other tables already had their food. So why the length of time? Unsure.  The Caprese salad Crepe was flavorless, with huge chunks of tomatoes and chicken in it, but the pieces were not cut into bite size or manageable pieces plus the lack of chicken for the extra dollar was appalling. The Crepe itself was tasty, and would be good with a sweet Crepe.  The Little Italy Crepe was over filled with tomato sauce, using that as the star ingredient. Tasty but then again it seemed like it was just tomato sauce only.  Manager or owner was floating around saying hello and thank you to everyone but managed every time to forget us. Maybe because we didn't buy a bottle of wine or champagne...smh.  Overall the ambience of this restaurant is cute and cozy but the food lacks everything. Try somewhere else.

MrjkAZRClDV6HJUcu33yPw.text: Best breakfast place around. Never have tried anything we didn't love. Ask for the Elvis if you like bacon, peanut butter and bananas...you will be amazed. My 11 year old only wants to go here when we do breakfast so they have something for everyone!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0vRDYvrZ-bLik2aeeSSyag.text: The crepes are amazing and the staff is super friendly. Ask to see their Star Wars snowflakes.  I had the William Tell crepe and my boyfriend had the Monkey, both were so much better than any other crepe place around town.  The ladies next to us were visiting from Ohio and made it their first stop after getting off the plane.

AzBe_yBMDCKeUvzPLjzviA.text: I've heard wonderful things about Crepe Expectations so I had to try it for myself. My wife and I were greeted at the door by the friendly staff, and even though it was fairly busy, we were able to find a seat right away at a shared table.   Everything on the menu looked great, and we eventually decided to share a savory breakfast crepe and and a sweet crepe. The Rosarito is a delicious blend of chorizo, scrambled egg, guacamole and jack cheese, and I highly recommend it for anyone who likes their food with a little kick. We followed it up with the Berry Delight, which is as delightful as it sounds.   In addition to the great good, the place has a great atmosphere and service. When you get a chance, drop in. You won't be disappointed.

19jXn33uP5cRsps0s0sauQ.text: Stopped in on Saturday for lunch and totally enjoyed the Elvis Presley crepe which included a fantastic blend of peanut butter, bananas, carmel, bacon and of course those crepes with plenty of freshly whipped cream and powdered sugar. Service was excellent even though this was primarily a casual place where you get your own coffee and place your order by walking up to the cashier. Portions are generous and servers are prompt and cordial. My only disappointment is that they closed at 3pm on Saturday because I could see myself coming here at 4pm or 5pm or even a late night dessert. If they were open at 3am it would be more fun than a run for donuts or pancakes.

2_sG-aozxP4QHHCuiQKXfA.text: Ah so good!!! Had the berry delight: lots of various berries, thin crispy crepe and whipped cream...yammy! Friendly staff, nice atmosphere. Good spot!

_zZVPxwopICu3ZkdfgdPTg.text: If I could give this place zero stars, I would.   Not only is it overrated, but over priced and run by the most rude people.   My first mistake was going on a Saturday. My girlfriend say the overwhelming, yet over zealous, reviews on Yelp and wanted to go. Upon entering we realized they were packed! We waited in line for a while with a family behind us that we made small talk with. We got to the counter and that's when it started, our horrible experience. It's a Crepe place, right? Well, anyone who has had crepes before knows they are not very filling. Seeing their menu, I was confused as to whether or not they had a full crepe meal. Second mistake: asking the owner/chef a question.   The owner was running the cash register when we went to place our order and I asked a simple question: "Do the crepes come in a meal?" Seems like a simple question to which there should be a simple answer, nope. The reply I got was "I don't understand your question. I have stuffed crepes..." So I asked again, this time I explained myself. I wanted a meal, with eggs, bacon, hashbrowns...something other than one, thin crepe. The reply I got was much worse the second time around. He asked, " What does it say on the menu? Read it to me." And that's when my jaw hit the floor. Did this a**hole just ask me if I could read?! Did he just insult me for entering his establishment?! Am I going to jail for putting this mans face on a hot skillet?!   In disbelief, I ordered a number one and did not walk out like I wanted to. My girlfriend wanted to stay and continue our nice (until now) Saturday. We ordered two crepes and a mimosa flight. The bill came to over thirty dollars! I not only paid for NOTHING but paid to be insulted. Then it took 45 minutes to get our food. The meal was only two crepes and watered down mimosa's. We were hungry within an hour after eating and pissed that we had to wait so long.  Not worth it. The family that had ordered behind us were still waiting for their food when we left.   This place might be trendy, and have neat decor, but it's small, doesn't have A/C (IN VEGAS!!), and is very over priced. Don't bother.

gJP-qHb-yrMm8h5huJ501Q.text: I love the menu and the concept, however the staff do not know how to cook crepes. They over cook them and the crepes turn out hard and crunchy.. If you eat the middle, you will be ok but the rest is not good at all. You should not need a knife to tear apart a crepe..  I have tried this place 2x with ordering savory and sweet crepes and the results are the same.

BKeV0GrLsJjnHms6A_M1Cw.text: 1st place I eat now when visiting my sister! Love Love Love... The Rueben! Staff is fantastic and couldn't ask for friendlier service!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love Love Love... The Rueben!! Awesome place to eat and the Staff is fantastic! Always first place we eat! Highly Recommend

qPtEcRSRYGsLxPQIyrRdbA.text: It's always great here. My kids and I always order the Monkey.   Mike is very nice and friendly. He always makes us feel important.  This is our Sunday spot.

jsDaa3RGgPJhR25GfOhnUw.text: I went to Crepe Expectations today and will never go back again. To start off the place smelled like dirty wet rags. When we finally got up to order the gentleman at the register took a whole order on the phone without even saying excuse me or anything. We had been waiting for a couple minutes in line and the phone rang and that order came before us. As I waited for the cashier to finish taking the phone order I noticed the place looked like it had not had a deep cleaning in months. The walls have splatter of food, there is trash on the ground, stains on the ground, and it just looks dirty. After placing my order with the cashier I went to the restroom. The restroom was just as bad if not worse than a gas station restroom .. my guess is it probably hasn't been cleaned in months as well. I was completely disgusted. After my bathroom experience and as I was walking back to my table I saw and noticed the kitchen door open and not to my surprise it was also dirty!  I saw a collection of dirty towels in a basket ( I believe these are the towels they use to wipe up the crepe mix from order to order). As I'm sitting there waiting for my food (which by this point I was thinking I might not eat) I look over and see one of the "chefs" wiping his sweat off  his head as he talked to some customers sitting in the crepe bar area. I continued to see if he would go and wash his hands after but he didn't and proceeded to serve plates and take them out to other customers. All in all, not the five star experience I expected from such a highly rated food place.

yGozOucrQZ8r3-nRp-6ZjQ.text: Becoming one of my favorite places. We need more restaurants like this. So far everything I've tried has been a hit!

YoiKrNn0Y_y2y73A8eXOtA.text: I really cannot say enough about this place.  Crepes aren't just for dessert anymore. CE offers a wide variety of delicious crepes to match whatever you are looking for. From a sweet tooth to a hearty meal they have it. I cannot pick a favorite because every item I have ever had there is amazing and excellently crafted.  CE is located in a very big wide open plaza with a lot of dinning options. The kicker here is that they have limited hours. Only open to 3pm so you really have to get there early. Best time to visit is during the week as weekends are absolutely crazy there. Great sign for the business, bad sign of you are seeking a crepe fix fast. The service is great for not actually having a server but the register/cooks are always approachable and helpful. Any menu item can be changed to suit your taste buds.

bmvl55n6U8JZgDZn3QvaWg.text: Love this restaurant!! The Crepes are Amazing!! The Food is always consistent, you can even watch your crepe being made on a TV screen, its kind of cool! My favorite is the warm Banana Foster with whip cream, yes it's so delicious!! You will love it!! They have alcohol here, so you can get a mimosa, if you would like, but I usually just go with a caramel cappuccino:) I know your drooling...Its good, give it a try!

PS7xHX3HwkFs8Cr08jqfGQ.text: I swung by here with some friends on my way out of Vegas for a nice breakfast. I was very impressed by the great service and enjoyed my food.  We were quickly seated upon our arrival, despite the place being pretty busy. The manager (possibly owner?) was really friendly and spoke to us for a few minutes after we sat down. He let us know the lay of the land and made some recommendations as well. I ended up ordering the vegetable savory crepe and added a couple of eggs to make it a bit more substantial and more of a breakfast-type crepe.  The crepe itself was well made, and with the 2 added eggs, was a perfect portion size for me and came with a side of bananas, cottage cheese, or a third more lunch-y option that I can't remember right now. I also tried my buddy's crepe, which was the bananas foster  option. It was pretty tasty as well--definitely more of a dessert-type option.  I like the setting. There's a nice covered patio area on the sidewalk in front of the restaurant. The inside is light, and you can watch the crepes being made through a glass shield. It's a lively place, though a bit small, so it seems like it could get a little noisy.  Solid breakfast/brunch option. I'd come back.

LMbS_k9om1h0_EyiblVN1A.text: One of my top favorites. We've been going here for a few years. We always bring visitors here to start their stay off right. I started at the top of the menu and worked my way through the whole thing. Loved it all. Lou, the owner, is a great guy and super friendly. Mike is always busting his butt to keep everything flowing properly. All the Crepes are so good. They feel like you're eating light but I never leave hungry. The amount of filling in the Crepes is perfect. Can't wait to see what the new year brings.

KduA8ULsGKvqhq2nxTbs_g.text: Such a lovely little place! It is not your typical crepe shop that's decored with white walls and contemporary furniture. This crepe shop has a whole lot of personality that screams black and purple. Its very intimate and romantic (great for sunday brunch dates or coffee shop dates. Wink wink fellas!)  It is a petite shop, and you better believe the seats never stay empty! There is also an outdoor seating area which is a nice spot to have Saturday breakfast when all the cool vintage cars are parked outside. It makes a great start for conversation!  I came with my mom who absolutely adores this place (if my mom is willing to a take a trip down to this area then you know its for a good reason!)   She ordered the Berry Delight crepe ($7.50) and you get the berry works! It includes blackberries, blueberries, and strawberries with whipped cream on top. Its berry delightful! (Insert drum roll here) If you don't want a sweet and heavy crepe this would be a great option. Its filled with fruit, which won't be filling to your tummy. I picked the Monkey ($6.50). It's a typical choice for me since my favorite crepe includes nutella, bananas, and strawberries. The Monkey has bananas, nutella, and whipped cream. I also added strawberries as an additional ingredient. I intent to come back again, and step outside of the box to try the rest of the menu items. They also have great Savory Menu with crepe items that have pepperoni, spinach, mozarella, tomato ingredients, and more!  Lastly, a great pair with our crepes was the Mimosa Trio Sampler ($10.00) which provides your choice of three various mimosas to taste that you can pick from the menu. Its a perfect sample size especially if you're in it for taste and less on getting crunk in the AM or afternoon. (Fellas this would be a fun option if you bring a date with you! Hint. Hint) We chose the blood orange, guava, and cherry mimosa to sample. My favorite was the blood orange! Filled with a variety flavors on the menu and they are all such original selections. I never knew that there was a variety of ways to make mimosas besides OJ until now!  How fun! You can watch them make your crepe on the tv as well. So you know exactly when your order is coming! It's a great family owned business and they are all so helpful with assisting you in making a decision. They really know how to be welcoming and feel like you're right at home. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey: nutella, bananas, and an add of strawberries
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The berry delight: blackberries, blueberries, and strawberries. Yum!!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry...guava...blood orange mimosa sampler!

FWbOQHMpyjc8gatIGT8yTA.text: Excellent fresh tasty,  very accommodating if you have a dig with. Love the cucumber water and the natural soda options

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious crepe

XhFspMC0zkzYXQkdTx-CEw.text: Stopped by here one day around noon because 1) I love crepes and 2) I heard this place was good. No one in line, and only a couple tables taken. I had a very difficult time deciding which one to order because several looked soooooooo good. I finally decided to stick with a Vegas theme, and ordered the "Elvis" which is banana, peanut butter, caramel, and bacon. Served with whipped cream on top. Oh my....sweet and decadent. Delicious.   As I sat down to eat, the restaurant filled up with a line of 10 and soon all the tables were full. It's very popular, and I know why. The man at the counter was really friendly, he even brought out two ice teas instead of one because he knew I'd need it.

ldefU73JaR2HifQhEa_y0Q.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon and this place was still busy! I'm so glad my friend suggested this restaurant because I've been in this complex a dozen times and can't believe I totally missed it. We were greeted immediately and decided to sit outdoors since we had a dog with us. All the staff was so friendly, and they even brought out a water dish and Woof Gang Bakery treats for our furry friend.  We walked inside to the counter and chose our sweet, savory, or breakfast crepes. I opted for the Sonora (steak, salsa, guac, cheese), while my friend ordered the Banana Fosters, and we split the Mimosa Trio Sampler. The lemon water & cucumber water is self-serve inside. The crepes were definitely delicious and I LOVED the crispy edges since it had such a nice taste to it. The portion was perfect and I also had a soup of the day which paired with my savory choice.  I cannot WAIT to come back to try the rest of the menu. Keep up the amazing work, Crepe Expectations.. I know I can EXPECT nothing less than greatness ;)

t0kzcDMfQsi_7je-HWpwKQ.text: Everytime we're in Vegas this is our  place for breakfast right before we head back to Los Angeles.... the food is so great and the staff is so friendly... portion are good size.. and satisfying.

cKjdVAn5_Bjsbtc6uIChNQ.text: I had high expectations for Crepe Expectations, but the experience was just ok. We decided to dine outside because they are dog friendly, but unfortunately their patio furniture doesn't get any sunlight (even mid morning).  Seeing all the different crepe combinations was fun, but when we actually got out crepes we didn't really expect all of the ingredients to be minimal. For example, instead of using actual fruit or berries, it was a puree version.   The caramel latte was pretty good and was served in a large wide mouth cup, which cooled down pretty fast. The rest of our party ordered coffee (they had you a mug to fill out own), and they easily exchanged the chipped mugs for betters ones when we asked.  Overall, Crepe Expectations would be a great place to come back later in the day when it's not as cold and when I'm not expecting a full meal to hold me over. I'd love to try their mimosas on a lazy Sunday.   Yelp 100 Challenge 2014 - 20 of 100

1Dmkq0R1qbF0kFhPmZjCCw.text: I absolutely love this place! The line is long, and the wait is worth it... Take the time to go there, they have a great selection of absolutely Delicious crepes!

AxowMz49qjoGgXi4n65BRw.text: This is hands down the best damn place I've ever had breakfast.... period! I love that the owner and his wife are usually there. The food is out of this world yum and they have a ton of different mimosas. How can you hate that??? Sometimes the wait is long but it's always worth it.

uPBmu5H4S1J8AlksKgHTug.text: Firstly, the ambience is cool, it's busy, bustling and people are clearly having a good time and enjoying their food.   The man behind the counter, was the owner and he was extremely polite, I hate to keep saying cool but that is more descriptive. Very kind, accommodating and wanting you to enjoy his experience.   The food was unlike anything I've had in a crepe. Check out pictures. Where do you get chorizo and eggs in a crepe with homemade salsa? And where do you get a flight of mimosas with different fresh juices? This place is one of a kind and my wife and I absolutely loved it.   If you are ever around, give it a try. I'm seriously doubt you'll regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We may have drank one already, but you still get the idea.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas foster crepe with strawberries
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo Crepe with a side of bananas. Be sure to ask for their homemade salsa too!

iZNv4j2tsNY58zIyrwOfbA.text: This place is great ! Very small sitting area and sometimes there can be a wait but soooo worth it ! Today I just got a basic Nutella crepe and it was amazing! I look forward to trying all they have to offer. Everyone should check this place out !!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella crepe

_gOCvAElyDOe4bW8hBwgmQ.text: I would go back.  It was easy to order and the menu is small enough that it is not difficult to choose what sounds good or not.  I liked the free cucumber or lemon water.  We got one savory crepe and two dessert.  The portions were decent but not enough to share.    Service was great.  Small place and not good for groups.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito

EMP8w26umjQXeUfISE-BKg.text: Crepes were large, price point was good for serving size. One crepe is plenty for one person. Lots of options to choose from, both savory and sweet.   Owner was very friendly and service was fast.   Crepes were good, but not amazing. Everything was fine, but would I go back if in Las Vegas? probably not. It seems like everyone in our party (7 adults) were all a little underwhelmed and said their crepes were good, but not great.   My husband and I Ordered 3 so we could try a couple: Sonora (carne asada, guac, salsa, cheese) - good, spicy; Perfect Combination (strawberries, chocolate) - just okay, strawberries were dry and crepe seemed a little underdone; Monkey (bananas, Nutella) - best of the three, really good, but rich and a little heavy on the Nutella (and I LOVE Nutella, so that's saying something).

zLv10J-SMtS905RASwTkyA.text: Awesome Gluten FREE/Regular Crepe place! The owner told my family and I the story that caused him to open the store in the first place, and all I'll say is, he's truly a great individual! If you're in Vegas? Get there, and enjoy. They're only open from 9 a.m. till 3 p.m., so go for lunch or brunch, you'll be glad you did. The owner even let a person come behind the counter to make her own crepe.

9QHuNXsQYuM6OJiQox94HQ.text: Came on a Monday. No wait. Prett casual ambience. A lot of hype. Don't get me wrong. I ordered the perfect combination and it was really good. But I have tried some places that were better. The mimosa sampler is worth it tho! Get a little buzz for a good price. And lots of flavors!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect combo and added bananas. Pretty good.

1WzfeM8w7qDwy05e7sR-Sg.text: I was kinda disappointed in this place Prices are too much for too little food. And the food wasn't really savory.. Only reason I gave them 3 stars was because the mimosa flight made up for it. They have a great assortment and really tasty.

aCacaNJjvW9gorbO9RcP8A.text: I am a sucker for restaurants, which cook the food right in front of you. Crepe Expectations is located in a busy plaza on Easter, this is the most competitive area for restaurants. However, they do manage to offer something unique for the area. I have had crepes before, but it wasn't at a restaurant that specialized in making crepes. I got two crepes to try out two different flavors; savory and sweet.  Savory Crepe I asked for their suggestion on their savory crepe that had some spice to it. They recommended The Sonora, which is essentially a carne asada taco with guacamole. However, the crepe has an interesting texture, where the pores will absorb all the juices and when you eat the crepe you can taste all the flavor at once. I could taste the salty meat juices and guacamole flavors just in the crepe. Meat was very tender and the meal did come with a side salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing.  Sweet Crepe I also go their sweet crepe to taste, and I was more impressed with their sweet crepe then their  savory crepe. The Ana banana foster, crepe had carmely sweet sauced drenched on top and with in the crepe that was full of bananas. They gave whipped creme to go on top. The flavors were amazing, if you like bananas then you are going to enjoy a rich buttery/banana flavors that just ooze out of this crepe.  I am definitely coming back for more, the prices are reasonable ($7-9/crepe). Parking can be an issue during their busy hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iYsyCdSV326bS8XKYMf6SA.text: Great experience! Welcome my puppy Buddy with outside seating. Have mimosas and healthy food options. Very organized and great service. I will return and order the pineapple mimosa :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sampler mimosas

99wdE-Kd4b5x1UOH7q5_Dg.text: The place is in a strip mall with alit of other places to eat.  The decoration was nice and I hear we got lucky that out as slow when we got there.  I heard other people say that they usually have a 45 minute wait.  They make crepe fresh but my carne asada was not as fresh and very dry.  The Sonora sounds good but there was very little cheese  to my taste.  Also the guacamole was good it helped the dryness.  The chicken noodle soup taste like I hate to say liptons chicken noodle soup from coffee vending machine ones when I was in college.   My husband got the la jolly and he enjoyed it.  My son got the sweet Apple one and it looked pretty good.   I use to go to the magic pan and for some reason I remember it to be tastier.  I don't I will be coming back here even with all the reviews and high stars.  My meal was not worth 9.50.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora, dry meat and little cheese disappointment
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La jolla
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apples

Lncsl2wjhDuaK7rpHDUXBA.text: Crepes were delicious. We chose both sweet and savory. The Nutella and strawberry crepe was our favorite. Small space inside and some nice outside tables.

NtxeYGWwZPsjsFk2IXGpHQ.text: First time here and it was a Saturday morning during the car show that they have in the plaza parking lot. Wait time was about 10-15 minutes.  So you put your name on the list and they'll call you when it's your time and you have to stand in line and order. You can't just walk up and stand in line without putting your name in... it's bad manners! Just kidding. But you do wait until you're called.  They have a large selection of crepes from sweet to savory. The Ana Banana Foster was delicious! I ate everything! The Nutty Classic was kind of too sweet for me, but that was to be expected with the Nutella. The crepe itself was good and they seem to serve the perfect amount of filling.  If I am ever in the area again during breakfast time, I would go back. It's just such a long drive for me.

DmBH7JNBBNubFB_LCKfJiA.text: Wonderful place with great service. Wonderful mimosas and service is on point. The food is delicious and both desert and savory crepes are worth it.

o9M1tdJEFnRSSeJTc4TAcQ.text: I normally love coming here. But it has become too popular for the amount of space they have available. I ended up waiting over 45 minutes for my food to come, had to sit outside in the cold, had my coffee knocked over in the wind and just an overall bad experience. The Crepes are good, but they're too busy! I went at 1pm on a Wednesday even! Not a peak day. Crepes are good though.

0KmDa4ytl2mXV3zkHZ8xDA.text: I tried this place twice and both times I haven't been impressed. Maybe I am just ordering the wrong thing, but it just didn't do it for me. The first time I ordered the Caprese with chicken. The chicken was just dry and hard to eat and my husband ended up commenting that the pesto looked like something disgusting. The flavors just didn't do it for me, but I decided to come back a second time for a sweet crepe.   I ordered the Berry Delight asking for whipped cream on the side. I had ordered this to go and they told me it would be ready in 5 minutes. I ended up waiting about 20 minutes to get my crepe. I finally was able to dig into my crepe and I didn't care for crepe itself. The fruit was good, but I was not impressed yet again.  The crepes are definitely big enough to feed one person though.  This place is super cute inside, but I probably won't be rushing back anytime soon.
