photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Insides of the Caprese with chicken
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese crepe with grilled chicken
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Togo box!

ilq_I-hiy38kua7CHC2_2w.text: I love the Sunday Morning! Potatoes and cheese in a crepe. Plus a great selection of flavored mimosas.

E_80p74DvmDaLz9QkPFnIA.text: 1. Friendly staff makes the crepes even better. 2. Complimentary flavored water. Super! 3. The carne asada crepe is amazing! 4. It's a good idea to share the crepe with another person. 5. Perfect place to get away from the strip to enjoy quiet time and great food.

szr9mE8OZTWQzUPNC1iQmw.text: The food,service and mimosas where on point like always. Mike made sure I our experience was exceptional! They should rename the place Lou-Exceptional!

nIb8EZ9k5iniGW8I2-7xHA.text: The best place to come for breakfast!! Our favorite spot recommend it to anyone living in the green valley area

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our yummy vanilla latte

4HTrjcHr_Fp0sj_BoeN39A.text: Crepes and mimosas and beers and sodas and...there is almost too much yumminess packed into this little purple paradise. Yes, crepes both savory and sweet are the main attraction, but it is the little extras that thrilled me.   For crepes, you choose from savory, sweet or breakfast (available all the time) all around $7 a piece, and each one is definitely a meal. The selection makes this the perfect stop for any time of day. I ordered the Monterey which featured bacon, but not because of the bacon. I actually selected it for the serrano pepper. I wanted something with a kick, and I was pleasantly surprised with the nice heat. Every bite was delicious, and it was served with a bowl of juicy, sweet watermelon. Thoughtful touch: they have a video camera installed above the crepe station so you can see your crepe being made from above on a TV screen! It's like a Food Network studio!  But, what I truly adore about this spot are the beverages, including the adult kind. They have at least 6 craft soda pops, a small and tasty beer menu, wines, champagnes and mimosas in five flavors! This really takes brunch to a buzzy level of fun. If you're indecisive, you can get a sampler, but I went with the pomegranate. If I had had a designated driver, I would have had 3 more! Plus, they have big containers of ice lemon and cucumber waters. The perfect touch for the crazy heat!  If you have "crepe" expectations, I am pretty sure they'll get met here!

c-1LyyGkudltwQdm0PBc-Q.text: Always a pleasant experience the owner is so nice!! It's always great energy and great food. Don't get me started on how delicious the mimosas are!! So many different flavor a to choose from.

ILQ0U8y6J9SHjTRAOAr5aA.text: Huge crepe fan here, so I had to see what this place was about. My first time I had the Greek, probably my favorite now. Huge crepe filled with chicken, ricotta cheese, olives and other stuff. It filled me up.   Definitely have to have their mimosas because some of the flavors are fresh squized juices. My favorite is definitely blood orange mimosa.  Second time I had veggie crepe. It is smaller serving and tasted just ok. Probably wont order that again. Atmosphere is very nice, great decor. They dont have a lot of seating for how busy they can be, but they do have few tables outside. Service is great too, very friendly environment.

1-sFMCpkT2CSwoomm3ajUQ.text: I totally recommend this place! I had a breakfast crepe and it was yummi!! I also had a mimosa sampler, loved it! My favorite was the pineapple one. The staff is super friendly! My friends liked the place too!!

t1hebZ6EA6MSbWdZ24P3jQ.text: Great friendly staff with excellent tasting food. I like how the tv shows the food being prepared. Free wifi makes it great for a business meeting as well. My favorite is the nutella crepe. Great for a saturday/sunday w outdoor seating. Highly recommend it

rNB_7zFPPH8m306dEuI7OA.text: My goodness, crepes, where have you been all my life?! This place is so amazing that my boyfriend and I almost make it a point to have our biweekend ritual here.  First off, the staff is just stellar! They are always so friendly and accommodating and are quick to make some helpful suggestions and recommendations.  Next, the crepes themselves.  I've tried probably 3 different crepes now and 2 dessert crepes-- all super good and just all around delicious!  I haven't been when it's super busy from gauging the other reviews.  But what do you expect from great food?  Of course it's gonna be busy!!! I suggest coming after 1:30pm if you're late risers like we are to let the rush pass.  Happy dining! :)

R-8XJAxjGPVq2y4w0cZLag.text: Great lunch place! Stopped in today with a colleague from work. We each had a lunch crepe and a dessert crepe, plus a cup of coffee. It was all delicious, with efficient, friendly service. Would happily return for more on my next trip to Vegas!

uar6YWnit6BCCyCUWwtFdw.text: Absolutely great... the wait was to be expected and was able to take our dog, which our son loved... the staff is amazing. Would definetly return again. Tried the Sonora and is was so yummy and the nutty crepe just added peanut butter and made it perfect.

6XV6B231P3xD7Da0yqr7pA.text: Meh... Just average crepe with a bunch of stuffing of your choice.  I ordered two different kinds, one spicy something and one sweet one.  My little one just licked off the nutella and didn't really care for it.  The owner/cashier was very nice.  I won't drive here from far nor wait in line to get crepes from this place.  It's just crepes...nothing special about this place.

rRHr1AYlp2yXWouDgCJOrQ.text: Two things: 1) It is SO difficult to find a crepe place that isn't on the strip. 2) If you do find one, it's more dessert crepes.  This place does it all.  We went for brunch and had DELICIOUS crepes. I had the La Jolla crepe (bacon, lettuce, tomato, guac, and chipotle mayo) and it was UH-Mazing.  I was also stoked that I could order a mimosa! I had one with pineapple juice instead of orange. They serve all different juice blends as well!   Even their water is yummy- infused with lemon and cucumber.  Refreshing!  So the other thing that was great was the service.  They are all so friendly and easygoing.  I'm pretty sure it was one of the owners that waited on us. Nice to see a place that cares about their guests.   Now I MUST go back because I see that they have "perfected" their gluten-free batter!  Can't wait!!!

-wIjkfKXoS_NISz0qj0Qug.text: Amazing food. Best creeps I've ever had. Definitely worth the visit.    The fresh squeezed juices are great as well.

S_N0XJh3UW4JUJe_uklp5w.text: Oh the particular morning I went they were insanely busy. I felt claustrophobic in the packed restaurant and placing an order was a task. The way the restaurant is set up you order and pay in the front and then they seat you. The crepe was great and I would go back on a week day to try the place out again. I wouldn't recommend this place if you have a large party or if you want a relaxing breakfast atmosphere. The outdoor seating is great and on a less busy day I'd probably give the place 5.

dn3qJMyQTO0Dcn9yQCAOwg.text: If you want to be treated like a million bucks AND eat the most decadence crepes in Las Vegas then you NEED to pay a visit to Crepe Expectations!!! The owners Lou & Jen are def rare gems in the business world. Lou greets EVERY and when I say EVERY I absolutely mean EVERY person with the biggest brightest smile I've ever seen in my life and the most genuine warmest welcome ever!! I often take my daughter here to have brunch & every time we come in I'm truly amazed at how Lou greets every customer as if they're the first customer to come in & it's his first day opened with his brand new sparkling business! Often if you go to a business and its towards the end of the shift you will get this almost robotic insincere greeting but with Lou that just doesn't exist. You could come in 5 min till close & Lou will greet you as if it's 5 min after open!  I really wish I could give this place infinity stars because that's what they deserve! Each and every staff member is so positive and full of the greatest energy. A happy staff makes for happy customers. I always take the time to observe how the staff treats not only the customers but each other from the owners to the dish washers they are really a team effort & I couldn't be happier with the service they provide me each time I come in. Thank you Crepe exceptions for amazing service & delicious crepes!

Z_jG5I5cqoWQmWgl8hX4qw.text: Wow I never had a crepe  egg omlette.  It was different and very tasty.  This place is mostly geared for kids probably above 7.  We made the error of ordering an omlette for the little kids and it was a little soicy foe them.  Their specialty ice coffee is just as good as Starbucks.  The cashier is friendly and so is the servers.  It is a local hangout.

1ekpTOUH_9Tjd5Ad8DhBjQ.text: Fantastic service - everyone was so friendly. Lots of sweet and savory crepes and they were delicious. Our 3yo kid enjoyed sitting at the "bar" upfront where you could watch the crepes being made! This was worth the drive off the Strip!

M6U_fWWBipJHQ83_EMA_hg.text: A perfect brunch [noun] A meal with a delicious and wholesome breakfast crepe and a glass of freshly squeezed orange juice.   Crepe Expectation is definitely worth a try if you are sick of Las Vega's crazily large-portioned breakfast buffet. I had the Monterey Crepe - filled with goodness of bacon, egg, red onion, mild serrano pepper and cheese.The serving was generous, the flavor was good, however the crepe was a bit on the soft side (probably because of the melted cheese).  I can see Crepe Expectation being a great hang-out spot after a late night of drinking. The place is a bit on the dark side because of the extremely tinted door and dark-color decors. It does not send out that vibrant and energetic vibes that you would like to have in the early morning.

BWn4ua6deyfB0heMvI154Q.text: Went in on a Wednesday morning to get mimosas and a crepe with my sister. When we walked in it was crazy busy and you could barely walk through the place to the front counter. We were told it was a 15-20 minute wait for a table, so we decided to sit outside. It was sooo windy that the whole time we were trying to make sure our mimosa trio sampler didn't fly off the table. About 30 minutes into our visit, the man waiting tables came and told us he had an available table we could use. We were on a time crunch and were only going to be there for a little bit longer so gave it to another couple sitting outside bearing the wind with us. The food and mimosas there were amazing. I can't say it was a 5 star experience, but definitely 5 stars on food/beverages. I would see myself going there again, but maybe on a less busy morning.

IHs61UxpMOmbLcA6ioz5ww.text: This is the place where we usually take our frindriends from out of town. They have perfect breakfast, brunch or even lunch, with mimosas!

TJE60SpJ87jBsGrVUguiYw.text: The hardest part of this place is picking a crepe, what a large selection they have here!  I am a big banana fan so I settled on the bananas foster crepe, however they did have a couple of variations to choose from.  Seating is small and we just beat the rush which leads to a line forming in the back of the inside.  Pricing is moderate and on target with what is offered on the strip.  The owner who was playing cashier when I was there was very nice and genuinely friendly.  I don't get out much for breakfast, but this is a place worth visiting if you are in the Henderson area!

pstU03JFqz5BoU8zHxtMYQ.text: 5 Stars. So well deserved. They have things together. Amazing selection and wonderful tasting food. Amazing ambiance and a friendly staff.

Cil1u889mPM-Lxu_3zHY4A.text: You can't beat a place that offers incredible food along with excellent customer service. The ambiance was cozy and the owners constantly made their rounds to every table checking if your experience (whether a first-timer or a regular) was amazing. The Avalon (buttered pear, goat cheese and candied walnuts topped with honey, finished with whipped cream on the side) was INCREDIBLE. This was my first experience with the place and it definitely won't be my last.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon: buttered pear, goat cheese, candied walnuts and honey.

Erg2ETO8Th4wW9FHNtWUmg.text: "They're just really thin pancakes." No, they're not. This place takes crepes to a whole new level.   Going in first thing to hit me was the decor. Everything works together. If this place wasn't done by a pro interior designer, then the owners have a promising backup career in case the whole crepe thing doesn't pan out (knock on wood!). Everything's black and white with pink/fuchsia (sorry I dunno my colors, I never got those huge crayon sets as a kid). It's super classy and cute. They also have two tvs on the food network, and another smaller one hooked up to a camera above the cooking area so you can watch your crepe being made.   I shared half a Sonora crepe and half a Greek crepe. The crepes themselves were perfectly done, thin and light and almost melt in your mouth. I think I liked the Sonora better, it was super savory and filled with carne asada, smooth guacamole and gooey jack cheese. The Greek was literally a Greek chicken salad in a crepe. It was super fresh from the spinach and tomatoes, with a nice saltiness from the feta. I was stuffed and decided to pass on a sweet dessert crepe today.  For my drink I got a white peach mimosa. The sampler trio is super duper popular, but I've had it enough times to know which flavor is my fave. They also have a ton of fancy sodas that I've never heard of. I'm tempted to try the ginger beer, but the mimosas are just too good to pass up. The mimosa was served in a neat flute glass and was sweet without being too sweet.  It's all the little things, all the attention to detail that shows in the decor/crepes/drinks  that gives this place five stars in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sonora.

3lV87hZiGhzFd6jISbN5kw.text: I would give this place 5 stars if it had more seating. We had a pretty long wait lined up down the hall to the bathroom. Maybe they should add a bench or something so people can sit while they wait?   Food was excellent. I had the Turk with soup. The crepe was the size of my plate and stuffed to the brim with fillings. The bald guy at the register, who I later found out was the owner, was very nice and gave us his recommendations on menu options. He came to check on us during our meal, chatted for a little and made sure to thank us for coming by. Great customer service. I also LOVED that they have a self serve cucumber water cooler, DELICIOUS! I will definitely  come here next time I am leaving Vegas

fT-FWeV2goUsWglHgv0gZw.text: Every time I leave Vegas to go home, this is where I eat.  Friendly restaurant for crepe lovers.  I try to find a crepe eatery every city I visit; this is my favorite for Vegas.

RFmkZhSa6qN8NeP-zov5Jg.text: Food was delicious, mimosa was awesome. The Owner was so nice about bringing our dog and even brought her a bowl of water and dog treats to the patio. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for something sweet!

abPDMOVAcVz9D4dRode8QQ.text: 5 star establishment...  I can't describe the happiness that these crepes brought to my stomach. I had the italian crepe with sausage pepporoni and marinara. The sauce was out of this world and made everything come together perfectly.   It was busy of course but the owner's attitude and kindness made the time pass. You could tell he cared and knew many of the regulars visiting that day.   If you go anywhere around Vegas, stop here no matter what you do!

cQVkufhfuxEKK1vJIOruFw.text: I have a new favorite place to come eat breakfast. I ordered the Sonora which comes of choice of soap or salad. I got the Fideo soap. It was so flavorful and delightful. I got the mimosa trip with 3 choices of juice (pineapple, blood orange, raspberry).. Place is inviting and service is great.. I will make a trip from LA to Vegas just for a crepe!!!

o9b8UKitS4WW7CGTmvkZQg.text: First time and it was amazing! Everyone was so friendly and the food was so delicious! I was happy with the serving sizes. Will go again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing food! People here are so nice!

zxdgYlByVxsYxZgOmCH3ig.text: Absolutely love this place for great food and very friendly staff.  Love that it is locally owned and that the owners show such great customer service.  The crepes are made fresh and they have a great variety of savory and sweet and easily accommodated my request for a custom crepe filing.  The hot chocolate is worth the $. Always check the counter for the crepe specials. Those never disappoint. If it's a weekend or holiday during brunch plan for a wait. I gave 4 starts because of the delays. It's not really the owners fault... the food is so good they just have more customers than space!!

GhG_eaxTuuSEkqb86o2JRg.text: Perfect experience every time we go!  The food is delicious but the customer service is second to none!! Try the mimosa trio... The white peach is amazing.  Best thing we do is get a savory crepe and a sweet and share.. Best of both worlds!

THC9ZIbs5WvC8aJhi-r-uQ.text: If crepes are your thing, this is your place! Dining inside or out the service is great, and food exceptional.

Y0tJdL8yzzcVs0jlEioPRQ.text: My first time here and it was delicious! I ordered the Monterrey with banana on the side. It is modernly decorated with outdoor sitting. I came in a Sunday when it was packed. We were put on a waiting list which we were fine with.  Their fresh squeezed orange juice is really good. I definitely recommend this place. I look forward to trying their dessert crepe later on. Great for brunch, too.

fX1ePpqiBWRfIs24X8XQIA.text: Absolute best crepes in Las Vegas. They lose a star though because the seating is a little "off". They need more seats, and also I wish they were open later. Also even though their crepes are always delicious, the mimosas are WAY lacking. That last sip tastes a lot like rubbing alcohol. So skip the mimosa, and stick with the crepes.

NP3UAvpuRIdMHhRpX2hWIg.text: The staff is has always been pleasant and service is great. Love the cozy ambiance of the restaurant interior and the front patio is awesome for dining on those warm sunny days. They offer complimentary cucumber or lemon water and the food is wonderful.  With both savory and sweet options, this is a great little local spot for breakfast,  brunch or lunch.

NilI_l6no3blOHDkq5D0xg.text: Mimosa Sampler is a must! My favorites were the lychee & guava. We normally do crepes for dessert, but this time we went savory and was not disappointed. I had the Greek- stuffed with chicken, spinach, feta, olives, & tzatziki sauce. I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing. My kid had The Sonora- carne asada w/ guac, salsa, & cheese...good & spicy.

3nUCC4d1G1-nAL6FzPmqYQ.text: Delicious savory crepe, gluten free for me, husband had regular and tried gf and said it was very comparable in taste.  Great place for breakfast or lunch!

k-U7Ax7ujg4tBuFAmr4gQg.text: Today I went to the new location (right next door to the old one) which is much larger with a lovely outdoor patio. Unfortunately the food was so bad. My breakfast crepe was a Crepelet and was so dry. The eggs and ham were overcooked. The crepe was too thick. If I hadn't had a side of cottage cheese I could not have eaten it. As it was I left half since it was almost burnt inside.  My husband's crepe, the Rosarita, was only palatable because it had sour creme inside the crepe which made it eatable. His eggs and meat were also overcooked. It seems like they cooked the food up ahead of time and left the ingredients in a warmer for a while until someone ordered. The inside food for the crepes was NOT fresh.   The counter service was fine. But with this larger area it seems that the service could be better and have waitresses instead of a counter. The drink counter for the water and coffee were scrunched up on the side. No room to hardly pass by the table. No trays so it was hard to handle the large cups for refills. Maybe it would be better to have paper cups with lids if you are having a drink counter for the hot coffee.   Others that were with our group had the sweet crepes and said they were great. Anyway, very disappointed since I have not been here for awhile. Now I know not to come again.

k-xLyCoRaKlOpAPJn1F9hQ.text: First time and couldn't figure out what all the great reviews were about. Place is dirty the owner has a long beard and sorry, that's not sanitary. Got a crepe that the food was just thrown into. Asked for a salad, got bananas? The bananas were good, but didn't understand how that mix-up could happen. Doubt I'll be returning. Prices are cheap, food is ehhhh.

N5yXJYnfVAjrCDYuM3i0Ow.text: Service and food was excellent. I like how they put lemon or cucumbers in the water tanks that is self serve. It's just a nice touch. We ordered three crepes between the two of us and it was more food than we needed. My wife has a gluten free allergy and she loved her GF crepe!

lZZiUsjz3ZmYG0MIMye8DA.text: 3 stars only because of the friendly and attentive service.  The food was lackluster and the crepe folded improperly.

4aSQfHmc6TbEPoug6FmQzw.text: This place is great, awesome staff and nice calm atmosphere.  The Greek crepe is amazing, crepes are not just for desert, and even better for breakfast!  Go check them out!

duPtkfTBYyEtMH0_HHirKw.text: LIMITED SEATING IN A BUSY PLACE. We ate here this morning to say goodbye to celebrate with a long time family friend that is moving out of Las Vegas. A sort of going away breakfast.  This morning they were a little disorganized and forgot to bring us our Mimosas. After reminding them, the Mimosas did not arrive until after I had already finished my food. Without any food to enjoy the drink with, I did not drink my Mimosa. I am lowering my rating to two stars this morning. This is NOT the restaurant to socialize at. The restaurant has limited seating so as we drank the last sip of our Mimosas, they urged us to leave so that they would be able seat the next customer. This is not a bad thing as they were able to seat us quickly and probably told the people before us the same thing.  The food is great and the staff are very friendly. We love to eat here. Just know that when you are choosing your restaurant  to socialize at that you will feel rushed here. So you might want to instead go to a run of the mill diner if you have friends with you.

4WcOz8ulv2bHvlSR27Dtow.text: Best place for crepes, hands down! I've yet to find another place that does it better. The soup is fantastic! This morning was chilly so I actually asked for a second bowl. I've tried the Del Mar, some of the fruit crepes, and a breakfast crepe with scrambled eggs and bacon, but I always go back to the La Jolla. That sauce they put in it adds just the right amount of spice - heavenly! Their mimosas are good too. Amazing place! Will definitely be back, hopefully next time we're in town!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little italy
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The La Jolla.. the soup was so delicious i had to get seconds!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas.. cherry and mango

m-LEAyQWTlmStS-dK0sWtQ.text: Relaxed feel and great food; where can you go wrong? Prices are better than you'd expect for food this good. Mimosas are refreshing and abundant, all good things. Honestly can't go wrong with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese (forgot the name)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutty classic
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green chili chicken crepe

empulNv2nN8p6a9PEfU-Zg.text: I LOVE this place!  It's a ways off the strip but we happened to be near here and looking for some good breakfast with gluten free options that was open on New Year's Day and this place was!!  I just love that you can get ANY of the crepes on the menu gluten free!!  That is so awesome.  They have salty crepes and sweet crepes!  They were pretty busy this day so we got the first available table which was outside and took 10 minutes, inside was about 20 minutes.  But they had a nice guy who was seating people and directing. The cashier was super nice and I like his general demeanor.  Our party ordered a gluten free breakfast crepe, a gluten free classic crepe (nutella), a caprese crepe, and a fruit sweet crepe.  The crepes come with a side order of your choice.  For gluten free crepes, could choose bananas and something else.  The caprese crepe came with a salad.  You can add whipped cream to the sweet ones.  Everyone liked their crepes!  The only thing to mention would be the sweet crepes are really sweet especially the nutella one which is all nutella then powdered sugar then whipped cream and hazelnuts on top.  BUT that is coming from me who doesn't like really sweet stuff but I can see a lot of people loving how sweet it is. I can't vouch for the non gluten free crepe but my party members said it was really good and it looked good, thin and smooth.  The gluten free crepe tastes like it looks, a bit more on a grainier side and less elasticity then the regular crepe so it breaks apart a little easier but still delicious!  And to have gluten free crepe options is just 5 stars for me!  The breakfast crepe had egg and potatoes and cheese in it.  It was yummy.  I think with the gluten free crepe it was a tad on the dry side, but ketchup fixes that. Nice servers and free parking in the strip mall lot is always a plus!  Thanks for a great New Years breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten free breakfast egg and potato crepe
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese

Rug90zYbkdIfFTgQJCTEcg.text: Crepe Expectations was an excellent start to our trip. Jen was very kind and inviting. the breakfast crepes were delicious. i would definitely recommend. Look forward to stopping here again on my next trip to Nevada

RfqZY_RwHXu8_hknvVIoeQ.text: My favorite breakfast spot in town! Yeah, sometimes the line is too long but what do you expect? The food is amazing!!! Made fresh to order right in front of you. My kids and I come at least once a week. Friendly owner/staff with exceptional customer service:) Love love love this place!

6fCeHOmYQiU8xPA8XfTGxw.text: This place is really tasty! Savory and sweet crepes are both delicious. The staff is super friendly, slightly nerdy, and really great.

8THnJxpSgQVcR6T5JfUG8g.text: I've heard great things about this place so I really wanted to enjoy it when I came here for the first time this afternoon. However, my experience was just okay and nothing beyond that. Walking in, my mother and I looked over the menu to see what interested us. The lady running the register was also helpful and told us some of the great selections they had. We ending up ordering three crepes: the special Lou's BBQ crepe, the Sonora crepe, and the Monkey crepe. I also ended up ordering a Chamomile tea. As we were trying to find a place to sit, the inside can use a little bit of fixing up. But it looked pretty decent. I also noticed a few flies flying around that may not make the place so attractive. We sat down near the area where the water and coffees were. The table was a little wobbly the staff was nice enough to fix it for us. As the worker brought out my tea, I was highly disappointed when I saw a pot of hot water and a tea bag. For $4.35 for tea, I was honestly expecting more. I can buy a box of tea bags at the store for that amount of water and boil some hot water at home. The plate where the cup for the tea was on was also dirty which was really unappetizing to look at. Even if its only for the tea, there should be no excuse for having it on a dirty plate. About 8 or 10 minutes, our crepes came out. As soon as the food came out, I noticed that there was a hair in the salad that came with one of the crepes. I know things like this happened in any restaurant so it wasn't a big issue for me since they were also kind enough to replace it. They looked pretty delicious. I liked the flavor of both the Lou's BBQ crepe and the Sonora. My only complaint was that the meat was a little tough for me and my mom to eat on the Sonora which made us like the Lou's BBQ crepe a little better. After finishing both crepes, they then brought out the Monkey, which was probably the highlight for our meals. I'm a huge fan of sweet crepes so I really did enjoy this one. If you love nutella with bananas and strawberry; I definitely recommend this one.  Overall, service and food was good. They can maybe do something to change the tea or just lower the price for a tea bag and hot water. My experience was decent but I'm not sure if it was good enough for me to come back.

E_OzOUSBfgjgo8DB9pohLw.text: I had an amazing meal here. I got the sonora and the Frisco (best thing I ate in Vegas). The owners are fantastic people! I can't wait to eat here again, next time I'm in Vegas.

jQyZUGa48Hn7dwONWNe3wA.text: I don't go to Vegas for the rooftop pool parties, the drunken bar crawls, or the free drinks you get while playing penny slots. I go to Vegas to eat at Crepe Expectations. Ok fine, I go for the other stuff too, but seriously, one of the first things that comes to mind when my friends suggest a Vegas trip is crepes.  Here's what you need to do, go with at least one other person and share at least one savory crepe and one sweet crepe. Trust me, you need both. The turmoil and heartache that would result from trying to choose between a savory crepe and a sweet crepe would not be a burden I'd wish upon anyone. It looks like the menu has actually changed quite a bit since I've been there, but based on what I've had in the past I'll recommend the Sonora or the Little Italy for the savory crepe and for the sweet crepe, the Frisco is an absolute must-have.  Fresh, high quality ingredients combined with top notch culinary expertise and a dash of creativity make Crepe Expectations one of the best places to eat in Vegas. Please go here and feel free to thank me afterwards.

zPLjrZ1seVQcl5qwGcJMvQ.text: Right when I walk-in I realize why the Laadee wanted to come here.   "Hey, that guy's from T.V."  I say...  The interior is small, but well managed.  So even with that small of a space, there is room to move along with a good number of seats.  TV's on the wall and a "Theater TV" above the cooking station.  Rueben.  This crepe was actually good.  I didn't know what to expect, but this delivered.  The flavor was, well, that of a Rueben.   And filling.    Berry.  The Laadee had this.  I liked it.  She said it could be sweeter but I enjoyed the natural sweetness of the products.  The whipped cream tasted like whipped cream.  All employees were friendly and nice.

CPSosaFsmTPA6qfy6JKnww.text: Very good, long line but enjoyed our breakfast crepes.  The only dislike was how loud the restaurant was inside the day we were there.  Everything was yummy!

JCCarO0YNkqKpuFtee2C0g.text: The food is great and the service makes you feel at home. New favorite place! Order the mimosa trio. We will be back for more

H_wmEV5q-4bxi7nUQpEbEg.text: We had the gluten free crepes SOOOOO good. We are visiting from out of town but went to it because of diners drive ins and dives. I forgot to take a picture because we were so excited we just started eating and it was so good we couldn't stop. I like that you can get Crepe on the menu and it isn't a place where they say they are gluten free but you can really only get one or two things on the menu

GqLhztiPDgm3JzBriMfzEA.text: Not really good at all this place. The Greek Chicken wrap was just plain dry, the cup Salad was drowned with balsamic vinaigrette. Very disappointed!!!

rttEo4P4um7zbA08zECWYw.text: October 27, 2018 Saturday - 9:15 AM for breakfast  2 Adults  Atmosphere - 4stars Food - 5 stars Service - 5 stars  Background - The place was visited on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives so I had to visit this Triple D site.  Atmosphere - Purple is the team here.  Outside patio was perfect for this beautiful morning.  The patio is dog friendly so I sat at a spot my wife could watch the bull dog.  The kitchen is open with a large crepe stations.  Three crepe griddles, a wall of bananas, and another three crepe griddles are right there for easy viewing.  One person worked three crepes which is magic right there.  Food   Drink - Self-service black coffee for me, decaf for my wife.   Breakfast - My wife and I ordered two crepes with the plan of splitting them.  A savory one and a sweet one, yep I wanted the sweet one.  My wife selected the Sunday Morning, even though it was Saturday.  This was a hearty filling crepe.  These crepes are not flat, they are stuffed to the gills.  I had the William Tell, this was like having apple tart.  Oh yeah we ordered the crepes gluten free for my wife.  I could not tell they were gluten free.  Service - When we arrived the line was almost to the door.  Thinking this was to get a seat it was a little dishearten but it was to place your order.  The line moved quickly and you are given a number to take with you.   After a bit the food is delivered to you.  Future - I think this would be an easy sale to my wife to get her back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guy&#39;s tag
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the bananas
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the crepe station

OliwPSRaIvc2gq_Aq8C-ow.text: There is NO comparison to the service and level of deliciousness here. The owner is awesome and welcoming. He has time for everyone. The servings here are substantial. I underestimated the portions and ordered two dish types. Sweet and Salty. The Monterey Breakfast crepe was delicious and hardy. The Bananas Foster Crepe with added strawberries was absolutely amazing. That banana and syrup with fresh whipped cream was perfect. The Monkey with Nutella and added strawberries is going to bring us back again and again! The coffee was great as well. Fresh dark roast!

U_a2Bx8Jnk3e5kIYFn_Jdw.text: Another GREAT food place with HORRIBLE service!  1) we had a table with 1 of our 3 already sitting at with water & napkins... we were asked to move until we had ordered! ... why?!?! Now we did not have a place to sit  2) 3 women for Sunday mimosas... laughing and telling stories... as we walk out... a server said: thank you for being quite!  VERY RUDE!   Owner needs to understand negative customer set! Again, food was great, but  Owner replied: sorry... I guess Wow!  Nothing wrong to hold a table for handicap... but do not expect everyone to know this!  COMMUNICATION goes a long way!  Not one time did you, the WHITE ENGLISH speaking owner say the table was being held!   Not to mention, you replied: my "workers" don't speak clearly... hum YOU as the WHITE ENGLISH speaking OWNER did not have a hard time raising your voice as we walked out and rudely stated "thank you for being quiet!"  YES it was you!

zb_RXblrMpTjfzZBzl8OeQ.text: Great atmosphere!!! Dude that takes orders is very helpful and has a positive energy!! Always running around making sure everyone was happy and had everything they needed!! Got a mimosa sampler: blackberry, watermelon and white peach. Yummy!! 3 full size mimosa for 10 bucks.. yes please!!! Crepes were awesome and very flavorful!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonara Crêpe, comes with soup or salad.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guy Fiere was here!!

PE2ICIeTMlWwOMFel0Q-xg.text: Excellent! If you can live with not-full-service then  try Crepe Expectations. Plenty of vegetarian (not vegan) options. The Caprese is reminiscent of a nice Pesto. In fact a small pasta side would be a perfect pairing for this dish. But,  alas, not on the menu.  It would be way too much food anyway because the Caprese crepe by itself is an ample meal for almost anyone. The coffee is self-serve so be prepared to take a stroll over to the drink bar. Staff, whether at the order station or bussing tables, are attentive and helpful.   Crepe Expectations isn't for everyone,  but for folks like me who don't mind cruising through the tables to the drink bar,  it might just be that little treasure that is a delight to find!

eGhCVGmArdmwzbNTp03Nvg.text: Okay seriously... the BEST crepe place in town!!! The owners are so accommodating. We went here not too long ago with my best friend who recently had a baby and although we were further back, the owner found us a table inside and reserved it for us. I'm glad they moved locations to a larger spot because it really is one of the best spots in Henderson for breakfast. They also have these amazing flights of mimosas, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio of mimosas. You get to pick your flavors!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry and banana nutella crepe with some mimosas at Crepe Expectations!

zt-ndeaKhumF4lsebwYuJA.text: Good place for crepes... they have quite few selections. We had The Monkey, made with Nutella and Banana dusted with fine sugar. It's good.   The place is busy, and the food may quite a while to reach your table, so have patience  It's located in a big plaza, nice area, convenient parking.

l5lkF8rhkxUEVCzNW_rhzQ.text: I have to go with one star and this is for owners to seriously consider and get rid of server dude, bald guy with tattoos. He should never be allowed to be anywhere in the food industry or food service whatsoever. Rude, nasty and certainly needs better understanding of sanitary standards. I asked for new silverware cause we used the old ones on savory crepes, and so I went to grab one and I saw they had one wrapped in paper. he stops me from taking those and he grabbed with bare and sweaty hands unwrapped ones and goes " I'll bring them to you my man" I ordered savory and sweet and we told cashier guy to hold off for sweet ones till we finish savory and if he can bring me cappuccino with sweet crepes. Server comes in with cappuccino first within minute we set down. I don't know maybe it's cultural thing but we drink coffee with desert so I asked guy if they can bring it later and he said "sure if you pay for it"! Fine I guess, I'll give him benefit of a doubt he never worked in food industry or perhaps with humans so maybe that explains but place definitely needs some happy friendly people, with better attitude than what's now there. Food was just okay, prices are very reasonable and place looks very clean and busy. Wish you tons of luck, consider new staff please. After guy started ranting like an angry teen girl in my private mailbox instead like real grown up, or  businessman I attached sample of his feeble attempt to prove point. He mentions I drank cappuccino and I've asked for another one, when in reality I didn't drink it at all, so when foam dissipated looked like it was missing 3/4 of the cup. Louie Louie when will you learn 3/4 of the cappuccino is actually foam lol. Poor guy. Hey you bragging about being 30 years in the industry in your private message to me. You forgot to mention which industry. Cause if it was food, I'm sorry to say but what a wasted three decades. Again, stop ranting and crying cause when people read reviews (and they mainly go for negative ones) they will see that tons of us had problem with your nasty and insolent attitude and crappy service sir. Hey on the good side at least your food is mediocre. And don't step on toe of blogger. That's a big no no. Cheers

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry ranting of an owner at customer in private messages. Blogger customer by the way
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XyiGj3wJytFIe9ejkeG0Kg.text: I've had crepes in the past which were entirely too eggy for my liking. This has always stopped me from coming into Crepe Expectations. But having seen them on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives (recent re-run), I figured I should set aside my pre-conceived notions and give them the benefit of the doubt. I am happy I did.  It was about 10:30 AM when I came in. Too early for me to want a sweet crepe. And I am not a fan of breakfast foods. I had seen the Sonora crepe on TripleD and that sounded good so that is exactly what I ordered. It came with my choice of soup or salad. The soup was sopa de fideo and that beats out a salad. Add an ice tea and I was set.  There is inside and outside seating here. It was kind of noisy inside so I headed out to the patio. This gave me nice atmosphere. It was a little cool and breezy but there were gas tower heaters turned on so it wasn't too bad. I placed my order number plackard on the table and waited a handful of minutes for my food to arrive.  I went in for the small bowl of soup first. A light chicken broth with diced tomatoes and fideo noodles. A pleasing way to open up my taste buds. Then onto the crepe. This large, thin, pancake-esque wrap was stuffed with carne asada, cheese, salsa and guacamole. The asada was tender and citrusy. The salsa had a nice heat to it. Enough to feel the burn but not kill the flavors. The guacamole was creamy and rich. The crepe had a slight eggy essence but not nearly as bad as I half expected. And in all honesty, the combination of flavors from the crepe and its fillings were almost like eating a good breakfast burrito. Not a bad thing at 10:30 in the morning.  Service is amazing here. Super friendly and courteous. The food is good. Portions are alright. A little small for a big eater like me but I would not say that I left hungry. I'm just saying a few more bites would have gone down easy. All in all, this is a cool place with a nice variety of fillings. I don't know that I am a fan of crepes yet but I would not mind trying a couple more options here sometime.

zPIkfv27nN-2zDRH47Bvng.text: The service is great the crepes are good. I personally recommend a savory crepe instead of a sweet one. I think it's better in flavors. I think the sweet crepes are good but it didn't amaze me. The service is amazing though. I definitely would come back but for a savory crepe.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

96MzqBoWc4nET70wjtNwaQ.text: Came here for quick Sunday morning snack, they were very busy. 15 +minutes to get through the time to order, 15 minutes to get the food on the table after sat down. I have to say , yeah I get it it is Sunday I should expect it to be busy at such a popular place. But I think the restaurant can probably do something to improve the process of ordering , people are spending 6 -7 minutes just at the cashiers.   The restaurant is also very hot, we were sitting in maybe 85 degree room waiting and eating the food, it is quite miserable. Again, I guess also expected when the kitchen is open to the sitting area, and people are standing in line at the door  keeping the door opened and warm air coming in.  Anyway! The whole time while I was waiting I asked myself is the food really that good? even despite the slow service and the horrible sitting environment people are still raving about this place ?! The crepes are great!!! It is worth it, I got the berry delight, it was delicious. The berries are very sour though. The crepe itself was probably one of the best I have had

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry delight

IzWE3esoS_h0-AzHCF77EQ.text: Googled best crepe spots in Vegas and this one caught our eyes. This is a hidden gem that has a amazing staff great customer service and the food was amazing. I will definitely be back to try out more menu options I give them 5

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chorizo egg and potato crepe was amazing packed with tons of flavor.

-ZL0lH3WEthPBeyfQ3qhVQ.text: Amazing! Can't believe it took us so long to come here. The service is outstanding and the food is beyond amazing. The crepes are huge and stuffed to the max. We will be back soon.

gEkaRJofRUmGpoYGc3i5VQ.text: Having enjoyed a prior breakfast, we arrived not just with crepe expectations but great crepe expectations. The Ana Banana crepes have apparently gone the way of the dodo bird, but my wife and I zeroed in on the description of the Go Bananas Foster crepe that included an entire banana, creme de banana, and brandy sauce with a large dollop of whipped cream on the side.  At a small up charge, we gladly accepted the offer to include fresh strawberries.  These crepes proved to be delicious though stars have been deducted because my wife's crepe was overdone and the bananas in my crepe were brown at the core.  Once again, the owner and staff were friendly so you can expect future reviews from us.

Y7GoEq2t_RNKVFRaDuy4dQ.text: Amazing service and wonderful food.  I had the crepelette and hubs had the Marco Polo.  Both were outstanding.  I wouldn't have complained if there was a teeny bit more cheese, but still really good.    The owner tended to us personally, nice guy and did recommendations for us, checked later on us.  I would LOVE to have a crepe place near me... but if we're ever in the area, we will be back for sure!

WfkiETe56TQ6_W1XpSCg5Q.text: I expected the best crepe I've ever had after reading all the raving reviews for this place and that's exactly what I got. One of my closest friends initially recommended this establishment for breakfast, but she warned me that great places have a big wait so I needed to pack my patience. Upon our arrival, the line to order was fairly long, but it moved rather quickly. The staff was prompt and friendly which I appreciated, especially during a busy Sunday morning brunch rush. Their prices were reasonable too and the crepe I ordered was truly magnificent. I ordered the Rosarito off the breakfast menu which is a crepe filled with eggs, cheese, chorizo, and guacamole. Sounds tasty right? It was delicious to say the least. I look forward to trying a sweet crepe next time. Looking forward to stopping in again real soon.

q059rXolSK9QFyc7nAbePg.text: So simple! These are the best crepes you'll ever have. But the fillings here are important. The flavor is a knock out. I had a savory breakfast option. It was the chorizo-filled crepes with guacamole, pico de gallo, cheese. The shaded outdoor seating area is really spacious and a nice place to sit. This would be a great place to bring a group of friends for brunch, they have mimosas.

Chicken chile verde crepe-  Tender juicy shredded chicken cheese folded in with a fluffy crepe with a ladle amount of chile sauce on top and cilantro cream dressing.  delicious   I got a coffee. Self serve in large mug. love it.  Every time I visit Vegas this will be on my list of stops every time.

AzvLq0m1sELgvubgkfvZ7g.text: On a Saturday morning, I had a breakfast crepe: Marco Polo for $7.50  - Very cheesy. Italian sausage and cheese wrapped around a crepe - Comes with your choice of cottage cheese or chopped bananas - Play off of Great Expectations? - Order and eat like Panera.  - If you're not WHITE, you'll be a token outlier! Seriously. LOL. LuAnne S. & Chad M called em out! haha - Love the live camera showing how the chef is making the crepe! - Busy. Tell a bud to grab a seat while you order.

Lfnx4ZyEguFfIXLERN0H5w.text: Congratulations Crepe Expectations for making the Diners, Drive in's & Dives Show list!!! You guys deserve all the recognition!!!

EDY-ufXg_zpNVAP2-4SkFg.text: Savory and sweet crepes with trios of mimosas. And all in a great atmosphere with friendly and attentive service. A total winner.  I'd been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally made it over here for a quick dinner last night, So fab. It's a small place that is very nice and modern on the inside. Food Network on the large flatscreen. And a view of the crepes being made on a smaller flatscreen.  They also have a dog friendly patio with water and treat bowls, which is totally awesome.  I opted for a trio of mimosas. There are several to choose from and I went with the white peace, lychee, and pomegranate. The lychee was fantastic! For a crepe, I went with a savory option and had the La Jolla. So yummy! It was like a spicy BLT in a perfectly done crepe. It had crispy bacon, lettuce, tomato, guacamole, and chipotle mayo. And it was a pretty large crepe. And their breakfast crepes are available all day long.  They also have a nice selection of beer, wine, and unique sodas. And the prices are pretty great, especially considering the portions and yumminess.   I will most definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nBTnZTKDatiFwiuVY8WLCA.text: This is one of the best "hidden gems" in Las Vegas! It's boutique atmosphere instantly relaxes you. The service is immaculate. I was dining with my infant son and a friend. The host helped me secure my son which I greatly appreciate and it. They have such a great variety of food and are so accommodating! I haven't had anything here that wasn't outstanding. The soup is awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry mimosa!

OcUenBt7A7-9K-4QtAH9TA.text: The waiting time was acceptable, around 15 minutes. One has to wait to be seated first at the counter, then you get your order. The food was great, and so was the service. People take the time to be sure you get what you ordered, very polite and very friendly. There was a cinnamon dessert with homemade whipped cream and vanilla sauce. It was really something you need to try.

3uO7ZtbklgsrYtijoWSC0w.text: Came across this place by watching the food channel (not sure what show ) but came across this place and knew we had to try it! Problem is we live in Riverside County c a. Well we planned a 1 day trip to Vegas an came to eat here an it was amazing!!! A older gentleman helped us an knew we hadn't been there befor he handed us menus an let us sit an take a look (without being rushed) we ordered our food an it came out pretty quick which was nice after a 4 hour drive at 4a.m an hadn't ate yet. He checked on us throughout our meal even offered a to-go cup for my orange juice. Very good service & food was amazing definitely worth the drive although it seemed a little pricey it would be nice if they offered a yelp check in coupon. Other then that I will definitely be back!!!
