LNkHYBwlCwELCResXhwZvQ.text: This place is amazing. 3 glasses of champagne for $10 unreal. We had 3 different crepes and everyone was so satisfying. This place rocks. Will be back for sure.

jvLoYIOqL-lOML-M6tHu7w.text: Omg this place is so good! I have been wanting to go for so long and finally went! Totally worth it! I can't believe I didn't go sooner!! Everyone must try! There's something for everyone!

sd0mbZuwQhqHODb2XTMMfA.text: Great food, great service and great people! 98% of the time they are busy, but I assure you it's amazing! They have so many different kinds of crepes-some I wouldn't ever imagine being a crepe lol. The staff is always friendly and will make sure you're happy with what you're getting. I always come to this place at least once a week or two and I don't think I'll ever get bored of it!

P5wEyzNPNaxf6THl_lznZw.text: Great breakfast and lunch spot if you are in the Henderson area!  Food prices and portions are fair, with lots of savory and sweet options, depending on what you are craving!  Once we saw Nutella fillings, it was clear to us what we were going to order!  We ordered The Monkey : Nutella, Banana, Chocolate Drizzle, Fresh Whipped Cream and Powdered Sugar. This was great, and they weren't shy with the Nutella! Lots of sugar though...so not super filling IMO. But definitely yummy! This was about $7 including the strawberries added.  Since I was still a little hungry, I decided to drive across the street to Nielsen's Frozen Custard! Keep it in mind for after lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa Trio Samplers!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey : Nutella, Banana, Chocolate Drizzle, Fresh Whipped Cream and Powdered Sugar. This was great...with lots of Nutella!

PxY-bBgoQycgkk_HmVzb3A.text: Loved Crepe Expectations! They have sweet and savory crepes (which reminded me of my visit to France and Crepes A Go Go another delicious crepe place in Aix en Provence). We came a little bit later on a Sunday afternoon (about 1PM) so we missed the rush and the long wait time.   We were greeted right away. Since it was our first time there, the host gave us lots of recommendations. We tried the Frisco and the lemon curd was tart, tangy and sweet, just like it should be and perfectly paired with blueberries.   We also tried the guava juice which was delicious. We had to wait a bit for our drinks, but everything was definitely worth it! Finally tasted a crepe in the U.S. that was delicious!

U2BiRtSBE7IAmlcGfh80WA.text: Good food but there was a hair on the inside lip of my glass.  Exchanged with no apologies.  #not cool #Gross

3_u52LwoP3REYM2MHW3GoA.text: Delicious crepes...perfect sides...awesome mocha. This is the place for a nice breakfast experience. Thanks, Nick, for the great service.

4BXvgsLo8HBrym_FoLv_UA.text: This place is amazing! The food is to die for, always bursting with flavor.  The service is five star it's self, they make you feel like you're right at home. I live on the north side of town and am more than happy to drive to Henderson for a yummy meal any time.

PaMRB6r2sb3LoYi6IOm6Vw.text: Every one is always friendly and personal.  The wait for food is not long at all.  And they make crepes gluten free as well.  No matter what you order it's delicious.

I_ETO4qmhhJKYyQQ5O699Q.text: We have been going here since it opened, when it was owned by the original Larry. And we use to love it. But at this point its "too popular" and though the food is ok and service is good the wait is usually beyond horrible and the pressure to eat and leave is uncomfortable. While your still settling up/finishing up they already have the next persons ticket on your table. People are literally standing next to you while you are sitting eating waiting for your table. They really need to expand locations in order to keep neighborhood locals coming. We are sad to say that today's breakfast may be the last time we fight the crowd to eat here.

cRXk0dLKYJc3R-8coh-D_Q.text: Place was fantastic! Went there after landing in Las Vegas and did a Yelp search by highest rated and this one came up.  I had the eggs and mushrooms crepe and the fresh strawberries with chocolate drizzled on the top with fresh whip cream and a fresh squeezed OJ.  Highly recommend this place to anyone that is close-by.

b-3XJB6z-DNa_jwyQO5jTw.text: Love this place! The food is very good and the service is amazing. I had the William Tell which is sauteed apple crepe with whipped cream. It was delicious. Also ordered the mimosa sampler and had strawberry, pineapple and mango flavors. Also delicious! All the workers there were nice and very accommodating. You can either sit inside or outside.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes crepes !!

znKo8zvFU0jWnN0k5b0TJQ.text: Wow I plan to come to this place every time I make my way down to vegas. Excellent food. Excellent atmosphere.

TP9q4rcgLy8N-dcWyHBDCA.text: I have been wanting to try this place for a really long time! It is always busy and has great reviews, so when I finally got to try it I was excited! The food was delicious, the juice amazing and really great service! However, this place is filthy! It is in desperate need of a thorough cleaning. The bathroom was gross, tables gross, dust everywhere. It's hard to enjoy your meal when you see filth everywhere and you can't help but to wonder what condition the kitchen is in. I can't come back until I know it's been cleaned up.

txi0qPT-qx4BzARcWgARPQ.text: Lou has taken a crepe and turned it into one of the most delicious things I have ever had!! I obviously could not decide between a sweet of savory, so I chose one of both. The flavor of the steak was to die for, seriously! It was amazing!! Then I had an array of huge, delicious, quality berries in my dessert crepe, yum! On top of everything tasting so wonderful, Lou was so cool! He would walk around making sure people were happy with the food. He was super cute with the kids, and totally cool about taking a picture with my group. The whole experience was awesome. I will be coming back to this place if ever in Vegas.

nu8LbG0Xj18lV8OL_a4QiQ.text: HIGHLY recommend this spot - from sweet to savory, these crepes are amazing.  The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is the location.  It's a bit small and drafty.  The hot chocolate is a MUST.

ue7g6aekSrv7OLw6f9VB6g.text: Very nice place!   Loved the Rosarito, the Monterey, and the Marco Polo crepes.   I will definitely need to come try the other selections.

j3snUulcKNNtJgTMRlMcpQ.text: Delightful brunch ambience at this crepe bistro. Menu is divided into savory, sweet, and breakfast, each item crafted thoughtfully, however I was disappointed to find the fillings poorly proportioned--my crepelet was 95% dry ham cubes, 4% overcooked eggs, and 1% cheese, and our dessert crepe was aggressively saccharine. Barista products were fresh, and the on-site squeezed juice is a special treat. Staff is charming and outside seating comfortable. Will be giving it another go, avoiding the crepelet next time.

jhyOqf4B-l-iy8w0gSH-mw.text: Finally, I got to try out this place. I love desert crepes and had to try the 'nutty classic' which did not disappoint. I also tried the 'perfect combination' which was almost perfect if the strawberries were fresh and not too sour! Also tried the 'monterey' which was very good and just a little bit on the spicy side - but made it really good! Also tried the mimosa sampler. I picked the mango, watermelon and passion fruit. I liked the watermelon best and then passion fruit. Mango was alright but tasted off at the end. I will most likely go back next time but will think twice because of the wait time and the limited seating could lead to an awkward seat section. The guy sitting the customers seemed quick but not so attentive. The guy taking the order was nice but too fast for the crepe line. It took about 20 minutes before we got our order and that's not including the wait line. Complimentary cucumber & lemon water was a real treat!

qZzd8waOB_8-g46ugkfYRQ.text: Awesome atmosphere. Seriously, the friendliest staff in town. The crepes were amazing. I had the Monterrey. Highly recommended. The other three members of my party had sweet crepes. Generous with the ingredients, esp berries. Even the whipped cream was special!

8yOWppjJ7R1qe_enkqPmlw.text: This is a hidden gem in henderson.  There is nothing bad I can say about this place.  The place is tiny and cozy.  The customer service was the best.  The gentleman who helped us (as it was our first time there) was very kind and useful.  He talked us through the menu and suggested some crepes.  I had the special pulled pork crepe and it was absolutely amazing.  The sodas are really good there as well, and by far my favorite thing was their cole slaw with bits of blue cheese.  It was fantastic.  I hope to return very often.  Now one of my favorite places for breakfast and lunch.

4s4d3_uXL2nyZ8bmq8KFzw.text: Maybe I went to early in the morning but I didn't really like what I got the apples where very dry and the caramel sauce wasn't as sweet. The crepe was soft but I didn't feel like it was as fresh...

M1etVngRyVJ3ao8-BTrZtQ.text: Wonderful service, the food was amazing, homemade whipped cream was superb. Had a few dessert crepes, a breakfast crepe and a free savory crepes at the table as well add strawberry lemonade and mimosas. All were highly enjoyed.

MGa0wIVepI_-8wamL66eKQ.text: LOVE this place! Their crepes are delicious and the service is the best. Everyone is so nice and they are pretty fast. It's the cutest little place and even offers outdoor seating. My favorite savory crepe is the Little Italy and my favorite sweet crepe is the Ana Bananas Foster crepe. I also love that they have complimentary cucumber water as well as lemon water. They also have a great mimosa sampler.   This little gem better not go anywhere!

B4W7V0QmVEoiuMG28CBHYQ.text: The food and service is always consistently great here! Their sweet crepes and mimosas are soooo good! They do get busy on the weekends, but during the week days it's easy to find a table and you don't have to wait long for your order. This is my go-to spot for when I have visitors in town!

9nIBTO0aghCPn_DOdB-ekg.text: Best food ever. The service is great. Mike is the best ever and the food is always really fresh and delicious!! The mimosa trio is really yummy. So many flavors to choose from. We come here at least once a week.

MRvRQyi-cGmAJldYxJ4fwQ.text: First time here and it was better than expected! Food is delicious and the staff is very attentive, polite, && friendly. I will definitely come back soon. Great for being a family owned restaurant.

j2GFypA8Et9fOw45FIfYtw.text: Crepe Expectations exceeded my great expectations! The menu is great, and they would even customize it to your liking. The staff is very warm and friendly, and checks on you to make sure all is well.  Sit at the bar and watch them make your crepes, or watch the monitor above the bar.  it was such a great experience that we had to go back one more time before driving back home.  What a great way to end a vacation!

ooP3gr6JHTQEvrPt1ehCUg.text: The La Jolla is my favorite! The staff here is really great. Seriously one of my favorite spots for brunch!!!

y6twegB_8C0xHMBtEmfPuQ.text: I love crepes! And this place offers a variety of delicious crepes from sweet to savory, breakfast and lunch. I usually get the Monterey, which includes eggs, cheese, bacon, serrano peppers, tomatoes, and onions. And if one is not enough I also get the Berry Delight, a wonderful mix of strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries with fresh whipped cream. What's really cool, being a champagne drinker, is that they have all kinds of mimosa flavors. But the reason why I keep coming back is the service. Not only is their menu delicious, but the staff is always friendly. Needless to say, this place gets 5 stars from me.

32VbG_XgkZIuye0PV-BxaA.text: WOOP WOOP! RAISE THE ROOF! I just found my new favorite Sunday brunch spot. Who knew Crepes weren't just for dessert?  The wait was a little long... but it was well worth it. They make the crepes fresh when you order, right in front of you so you're sure it's hot off the griddle. The Monterey is the perfect breaskfast- bacon, scrambled egges, and cheese nicely tucked away into a moist, thin, yummy crepe blanket. That little bundle of joy was having me singing lullabies into the land of food heaven. Mmm Mmm good- no crumb went to waste, that is for sure! My fiance had The Rosarita- chorizo, scrambled eggs, guac, and cheese. Also a fine dish that tasted very much like a breakfast burrito. A little heavy for my taste, but still a winner. I'll definitely be back to try their other Crepe Creations.

bvR0ltZPERzpWeKAIzxgcg.text: Love this place!!! I always try to order something different but the Sonora is probably my top fav. But if u want something sweeter I really love the Ana Bananas Foster.. The mimosa trio... Um yes! They have a bunch of different flavors ranging from pineapple, white peach, guava, blood orange etc.. They even put out complimentary lemon AND cucumber water! I love bringing people here cuz the experience never disappoints great food, great atmosphere, friendly staff A++

hKWgd5pEU2uWwZVJmSqaQA.text: One of the unique things about Crepe Expectations is that you can see your crepe being made.  Their crepe griddles are behind a glass panel offering a perfect view.  And they have a camera mounted above the griddles so you can also see them being made on the TV.  Way cool.  My family and I ordered 4 different crepes.  It took a little while for us to receive them, but it's understandable seeing how crowded it was.  Each one was delicious.  Especially the Capresse crepe.    The employees are so nice and welcoming.  They really make sure everything is taken care of.  A nice touch: you can choose between cucumber water and lemon water.  They had 12 different mimosas.  I wish I ordered one.

MMPovpk0rWDXxD6ObmPETQ.text: Love this place. Food is great and the new Clucker is great, especially with goat cheese sub'd in.   Unfortunately, they changed the coffee and it's not as good as before. I'd be willing to even pay a little more for the good stuff....lol Anyway, lower star-rating is for the lower quality coffee. Please bring back the good coffee.  Otherwise, I look forward to going back again soon!

xd0_ndRvuAorKjc9EI56HA.text: It was my first time at crape expectations . And initially it looked packed. So the guy at the door takes your name. We went next door and he actually came next door to let us know our table was ready. (Don't worry, we'll be back to the dog place) .  We were saved a table and ordered.  The owner takes your order and he has a great personality ! Very down to early and you could tell he loves what he does!!  I ordered a white mocha on ice, and it was so good!  You can watch your crepe being made from an over head camera and TV which was very cool Now for the food ! I ordered the Ana bananas foster crepe. Presentation is great! Food tastes even better .  All in all. I would Definetely come back. Very pleased

aE0Rib3TIZ_o4SDwVDFtDg.text: Best place to eat in town!!!  Food is exceptional as is the service!  HIGHLY recommend!

dvIzauxb9e8FkvX4VmDOjQ.text: Awesome place to go on a sunday morning..  enjoy a sunday brunch while sipping on FRESHLY squeezed orange juice.. I mean that thing was super fresh! Love it! I had the marco Polo Crepe which consisted of itialian sausage and cheese and other stuff i forgot! haha This place has a great feel to it small place tho but really great servie and great food and qaulity! I would totally go back to this crepe place..  im curious to try their other crepe items.. will let you know how it goes when i go... Fyi heard the mimosas are good a friend of mine suggested it..

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marco Polo

Ik3zhQw8zDToGXwRqI6tWA.text: We are huge fans of crepes and decided to try this place after finding it on Google and reading the stellar reviews. Well my friends, this place lives up to the hype. There's seating indoors and out, the inside is gorgeous. You probably wouldn't believe it but the owner Lou decorated it all himself and he has good taste might I say. Upon entering we were greeted by the man himself, he was very pleasant, handed us a menu and wow! There were so many amazing crepe creations, sweet and savory to choose from. We decided to try 2 savory The Sunday Morning and The Monterey. For the sweet The Ana Bananas Foster. Wow! wow! wow! If you have any hesitation about trying this place please don't! The bananas foster is to die for! The food is absolutely amazing and the owner welcomes you and treats you like family. Go for the crepes, stay for the ambience and good conversation!

7g_bJ6qUZToGLWekrHFRTw.text: Definitely a nice brunch option :) Inside seating is somewhat limited. The place is a bit small, so it can get claustrophobic ish when it's crowded. But the crepes are super tasty!   We got one savory and one sweet crepe:  Greek: feta, olives, onions, chicken, spinach, plus a small side salad or soup. This one's a bit messier to eat because nothing will stay intact.   Avalon: pears, goat cheese, honey, walnuts, side of whipped cream. This one is definitely a dessert crepe and it's pretty sweet.   Both crepes were really big and had generous fillings. I'd highly recommend the avalon if you like the goat cheese combo; otherwise it has a very distinct flavor that some people aren't too fond of.

74IpwDlGVS_NPMim0TLbUQ.text: We found this place thanks to my fellow yellers - thank you!! The owner is so cool and really loves what he has created.  He had great recommendations for us and we were all so happy with our meals.  Everything was delicious.  The three of us had our own savory crepe and then split a sweet one for dessert.  We all left there extremely satisfied. Next time I'm in Vegas you can bet I will be at this place.  And I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

INP64laDexmQhkxysrWlig.text: My favorite place for breakfast in Henderson. The service is always awesome. There is a great outdoor seating area (when weather permits) and the interior design is really cool. They have a wide variety of crepes (the Sunday Morning is my favorite) and mimosas. Highly recommend!!

1mkRhd3iAVbekfiX_2rXIw.text: Best crepe I have ever had beside the Vietnamese style that my mom makes.  Love this place the service and the decors, it's a little smokey due to the place is small.  Great brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa Trio Sampler

L06ehGuMaoSST58H8POPGg.text: Yummy crepes and great service but expect to wait for at least 30 minutes to get a table if you'll be coming here for a weekend brunch. They are packed and the restaurant is small with outside seating.   Tried The Greek, Lou's Pulled Pork BBQ and The Avalon. Delicious!

_5hXAY3zZSGz2M1bK3LSCA.text: Before I begin my review, I would first like to state the most negative part of Crepe Expectations:   The fact I live in Orange County, CA and this place is all the way in Henderson, NV.  That is a real bummer to me now that I have tried this place out.  My wife and a couple of friends visited Lake Mead over the weekend and didn't want to suffer the consequences of 10 bathroom breaks on the way home by eating the hotel's breakfast buffet.  So what did I do?  I fired up Siri on my iPhone and asked it where I can eat something good for breakfast as we strolled through Henderson.  Crepe Expectations topped the recommended food restaurants with its massive amounts of positive reviews so we said screw it, lets try this place out.  Upon driving up, the store looks pretty timid and small - but was quite busy and thriving on the patio so it was pretty inviting.  When you walk through the door it reminds you of a very classy bar type of atmosphere with most of the tables packed with couples and families, and overall just a great atmosphere.  When walking up to the counter the owner, Lou, was smiling ear to ear.  This guy was one of the most enthusiastic business owners I have ever met, you could tell he cares about his customers and has a lot of passion for what he does.  He took the time to explain various items on the menu in great detail, and was very well-spoken and articulated every detail of the dish he was explaining.  It was just so refreshing to see someone that stoked about what they do and how they run their business- you don't see that too often around my neck of the woods unfortunately.   Anyway, my wife and I ordered the Sunday Morning plates and my friends ordered some other Crepe's that I do not recall.  We also ordered some Mimosa's which they had a huge menu of various flavors.  Then the food came out - granted I have never even had a Crepe in my life... AMAZING.  The food was so tasty I can't even describe it.  My dish I had them add Serrano peppers and diced ham - I couldn't believe how great it tasted.  We requested some hot sauce and Lou recommended their house salsa.. best idea ever.  The salsa was so awesome, it was better than most authentic Mexican restaurants salsa!    The food was perfect, the service was prompt and courteous, and the owner himself is there to make sure everything comes out well and to your liking.  I felt like I was in his own dining room and a guest of Lou & his wife's house and left wanting to come back again, but unfortunately that won't be able to happen until our next Lake Mead trip.. next year :(

i7_uoAM1WZTFEz6snPa0fw.text: These crepes are absolutely AMAZING! I have to eat gluten free and they were so amazing about making sure that my food didn't get mixed up with anyone else's and even took the time to ask me about my celiac disease. The owner shared with me how his friend has a very bad case of celiac disease so he understood my food concerns. I always go here and they are so friendly and food is delicious!

jjlGcetguCh-_9FWiL9wag.text: Me and my girlfriend came here on our day off. Very friendly gentleman at the door helped us out and directed us to the register to order. The food was delicious and very affordable. I usually don't like crepes at all but they have changed my mind and am looking forward to eating there regularly on our days off. Everyone was very friendly and would joke around. The only con is the place is quite small. Wouldn't be surprised if they expand due to the high amount of traffic the recieve.

ox52EbUAZyqXR_vIV7CS0A.text: I debated writing a review because I didn't want to give three stars (even if there's nothing wrong with "A-OK") to a place where a) the people are incredibly friendly, b) the soda selection is delightful, and c) the concept is cool.  But, since I'm never going back again, I guess I need not take the path of the sheepish.  Like I said, great people in the store. The customers seemed nice, too. (Although the people at the table right next to the crepe station were annoyed that I had to keep standing near them to read the menu. Not a great spot for a table.) A group of people stopped us before we went inside and raved - raved! - about how we had to try the pulled pork (I think it was) crepe. So, I get that this place has big fans, and I may just be the oddball. (My loss.)  A variety of neat bottled sodas stands ready in the big fridge, and if you aren't a member of the Secret Ginger Beer Club who already knows where to get The Very Best Ginger Beer in Town, good news: they sell it here. Ask for a stumpy brown bottle of brewed Bundaberg ginger beer and prepare to walk among the initiated.   (But, once you're hooked, I recommend buying it when it's on sale at Cost Plus World Market - as far as I know, the only other place here that sells it.)  I love that there's a selection of both sweet and savoury crepes served with your choice of soup and side salad at a reasonable price. I also think it's clever how a camera points down at the preparation area, so you can watch your crepes being prepared. Neat-o.  Where everything falls apart for me, though, is the taste.  My husband and I both ordered savoury crepes. I got the caprese, one of the two vegetarian options. (The other has hummus, which I wasn't ready to try in a crepe yet. I really wanted something kind of traditional with cheese and was disappointed that the caprese with mozzarella, a slow melter, was my only vegetarian option.)   I've eaten quite a few crepes, both sweet and savoury, since the first French Club field trip back in junior high. I've never eaten them in Paris, granted, but in 30+ years of crepe-eating around the country, I always experienced two constants until visiting Crepe Expectations:  1. The crepe itself tasted like something nice in its own right.  2. The finished crepe was not indistinguishable from a wrap sandwich.  Looking at reviews here, and judging by the other customers when I was in CE, I guess mine is the minority opinion. (My husband is also in this minority - I suppose we're lucky we found each other.) I'm happy for the rest of you that you can find joy in crepes three inches high.   (Okay, looking at photos here I can see that some people have had more sensibly sized crepes, but ours were huge. I felt like it was 1998 and I was getting a two-handed wrap at the Sonic Drive-Thru.)  But even if my crepe had been assembled with a finer touch, not only was the crepe itself completely tasteless and acting only as a wrapper, but the flavors inside were only "A-OK." I couldn't even smell the basil inside my caprese (although that could be because the pesto overwhelmed everything else).  I applaud the idea of Crepe Expectations, and they're probably a great option from the usual if you're working in the area and want something different for lunch, but the next time I'm specifically hungry for melty, herby, toasty, savoury crepes, I'll head for the Strip instead.

VIUb4VaNoo4Wd6xL8dvIPQ.text: Great variety in crepes, both sweet and savory options. Small, fast, great service. Recommend as a gold brunch spot.

06wZPFHTFORq5nlw2utwhw.text: This place is awesome!  Different food concept with exceptional staff and very very generous portions.  I got the Sunday Morning and it was too much for one person.  I also ordered the pineapple lemonade and it was delicious on a hot morning if Cars and Coffee.  Will be frequenting again!

P0Dgsv2ZhEXDQC3j15qRdQ.text: We had the Ana bananas Foster and the William Tell. Both were huge and yummy! I wish we would have had our lunch here as well since the savory crepes looked equally amazing. Worth the short drive off the strip.

cSc89MzneZHYJG6iwu_2wg.text: Amazing!!  We drove a distance to try crepe, and it did not disappoint!  A little confusing to find, would recommend looking at posted picture of exterior.  Also it IS open at 9am (looks dark from parking lot).  We have never experienced crepes with anything but syrup. I had the Monterey, my husband had one with guacamole, both fabulous. The atmosphere is different, but very cool. The gentleman hosting was very nice and professional, can't believe the quality and price (cheap). Highly recommend crepe expectations!

FT44oHpyqLpE88K_5zKUbw.text: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Las Vegas! I come every Saturday and have never been disappointed. Every item on their menu is delicious and well worth every minute of the wait. Jen, Lou, and Mike always make me feel welcome and are some of the nicest people I have ever met.

TYlSis7bBuratQ6kHJmZFw.text: We love this place! We live in Los Angeles and sometimes we can't wait for a Vegas trip because we come here every time! The crepes are so delicious you can't go wrong with any of their choices! I love the Sonora crepe and the Monkey! Worth the drive out of the strip! Everyone is always so nice! Worth the wait if it's a bit busy!

IhY2OCDhrwIs7woLTikWZA.text: I came here when it first opened and I really love it . You must try the monkey & the nutty classic :) those two are my favorites by far. The people that works there are very pleasant and very sweet.   They always have good recommendations what they think is good and hopefully you will like, too!  The decor is very simple and its kind of made for a girl (I would like to think so).  I love the color scheme since its lavender/purple and it has decorations with flowers and butterflies.

vtg6Wpc9DFBziKNH-zHYCg.text: Amazingly delicious food, fresh ingredients, welcoming friendly staff and excellent service!  What else can I say?  I can say the artwork is spectacular! Love this place!

8AUhr5gCTam_HKX6y5hnWA.text: Our first time here.  We're from San Diego.  Came recommended by a friend and we feel the crepiery in The Paris is sorta basic.  Hubby ordered the Ruben; he thought it was amazing!!  I ordered their special, a hatch chile with slow roasted pork.... my taste buds were singing!!!  We'll definitely be going back to try others on the menu.  They had a wide selection of savory and sweet crepes in addition to a couple of daily specials.

YqfDI5RLkGC-eNLGqJrnhQ.text: I've had a good track record with Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives experiences. This place hasn't ruined it.  I've passed by Crepe Expectations quite a bit in the years that I've lived in this town. I finally decided that I should try it after seeing Guy Fieri taste some crepes on his show otherwise known as Triple D, which would make it my my second official show-inspired visit (most of the others having come before Guy visited/bantered/tasted/filmed). When my friend suggested that we stop by after we picked him up from the airport, I was pretty excited.  It was just before 11am on a Sunday, so it was packed. People were already sitting outside, and all of those tables were occupied by the time we left. We waited awkwardly for not more than ten minutes in the seats lining the hallway to the restrooms before the host waved us over to place our orders at the register. Bearded dude from the show was manning the register, but he ended up talking about my hoodie before I could get in a word about the TV segment. That's alright though - it's not super fresh in memory.  However, what was fresh was The Sonora ($9.50), which I'm pretty sure was also featured on the show. It's also popular with my Yelp friends, so I had to try it. The filling was indeed excellent, with a symphony of delicious carne asada, tomato salsa, guacamole, and jack cheese. The greens on the side are dressed to the point of almost being overwhelmingly acidic, but it completes the ubiquitous carne asada flavor if you portion it correctly. I would've liked for them to just throw in in the crepe. Perhaps they'll humor me if I request that next time.  I also tried a couple bites of my friend's The Monterey ($7.85), with bacon, scrambled eggs, red onion, serrano, and jack cheese. It's just breakfast in a crepe, and it's very balanced, not salty as you might fear, and barely any heat if it was indeed at all spicy. I did find it odd that a bowl of thinly sliced banana was served with this crepe though. It doesn't match the flavor profile at all, so I suppose it's just a nice complimentary dessert. Odd though.  Finally, we agreed on sharing an interesting sweet crepe, The Avalon ($7.75). It's a not-too-sweet affair chock-full of sauteed buttered pear, which the goat cheese and honey played really off of. The whipped cream was great and really enriched the crepe. I liked the candied walnuts too, but they were fairly sparse and didn't provide enough crunch overall to balance out the soft slices of pear. That texture became a drag after a few bites.  Aside from that, what really stopped me from going for the full five stars was the crepes. The crepe texture just dies next to all the wet ingredients, and two of the three crepes were torn when served. I'm sure it's not an uncommon occurrence with crepes, but it means that these crepes don't do much except serve as a relatively low-carb vehicle for the ingredients. I came in with expectations that the crepes would be a highlight, but they aren't.  That said, I will definitely return to Crepe Expectations to try their other menu items. I like what they're doing with their flavors, and the portions are affordable if a bit modest compared to typical breakfast/lunch fare.

1dt2RbiL_TJJigyvj5ey5g.text: Mind blown!!!!! I'm going to say it 3 women +  6 giant crepes = empty plates!!  Best crepes of my life! It was so good. We waited 30 minutes for the table and then we ordered and waited 20 minutes for our food and it was worth the wait.   We each ordered a savory and sweet and here was not one we didn't like!! In order of sweetness Frisco - that lemon mixed with blueberry was  a-maz-balls! Avalon- nothing like melted goat cheese with pears, candy walnut and drizzled with honey -mercy! Anna banana - we added fresh strawberries and man alive party in the mouth.   They were all SOOOO GOOD!  Savory in order  Sunday morning. Loved the egg potatoes mix Veggie patch - we added turkey and it tasted like an awesome stir fry Caprese- the pesto was super good!  The owners were as sweet as you can image!  Bonus....the hand scrub in the ladies bathroom. What the heck they sell it at the front desk! Boom!! Bought 2 jars of it. Could not believe how soft it made our hands!

BsoNAJiVK3TiOIAcYuFNoA.text: What an AWESOME place. I heard about it a couple years ago and was waiting until the next trip to Vegas to stop by. So glad I did. I got the William Tell and it was amazing. Fresh ingredients, fast service, super friendly staff, great atmosphere....all around awesome experience. THANKS!

WyB6ZDkGFu5IuvguBsQZ4g.text: Super friendly service and gorgeous menu. This place made me fall in love with crepes!! I go once in a while, but the owner and friendly server appears to remember me regardless! I love going back because the quality of food and service are always consistently great. Cute and quaint homey atmosphere and it is so close to home. I still have to take my boyfriend down here for him to try it, but I have taken some of my best friends here! They have all learned to love crepes thanx to crepe expectations! Despite their growing success and launch on food network, they remain a humble business with great food!

An8luvM3TlXo6IR2d_ucdQ.text: The Elvis. That's all I have to say. Best Crepe I've ever had. Cheap too! Friendly owner. Friends told us about this one too. Been twice now. Same one that a Guy Fieri featured on Triple D. Can get crowded but plenty of seating. Loved their egg ones too for a complete meal haha. Will be back.

p6KAZZwO8wevUiufcJIpBA.text: If you want dessert this is the place for you. I ordered a veggie patch crepe and it was not very flavorful or yummy. The veggies were not sauteed fully and no GF options. Smh

lMVQ_DG5XUkb8UheTHafiw.text: We were recommended by someone to try this place out and it did not disappoint! Their Rosarito Crepe was flavorful and a good size portion for the price. My husband ordered the Monterrey Crepe and loved it as well. We ordered the Avalon Crepe for dessert and found it to be such an explosion of flavors.  Really enjoyed the vibe of the place. Everything from the setting of the tables, decor around and even the restrooms and music selection befitted the setting. Loved the concept of the place. The staff are friendly, welcoming and were so kind in accommodating my gluten allergy. Absolutely loved this place and will return the next time I'm in Vegas.

jbQ2TiJSywjVAdG7WvWZdA.text: Wow this place truly lived up to it's reviews!  My daughter raved about them and finally got me to drive over to Henderson to check them out.  We were pretty hungry when we got their and in the mood for something unique.  We were quickly greeted by his super nice gentlemen and given a menu.  With so any choices we sat down to decide what we were going to have.    I got the Rosarito which was delicious.  The chorizo was not greasy and was plentiful and delicious. Add it the guacamole, scrambled eggs and jack cheese and this was not only a tasty treat but quite filling also.  The daughter got the Turk which I got to try and it was also awesome.  We took home the Ana Bananas Foster for ,y ate sleeping wife and I treid it also. It was so delicious.    I decided to try the flight of Mimosas selecting the Blood Orange, Mango and Pomegranate.  The came in tall champagne glasses and were very good sized.  I was pleasantly surprised at how good they are.  What a great way to start a day!  I can't wait to try the other flavors on my next visit.    The inside is on the small side and moving around to your table can be a little tricky.  The tables and seating are very comfortable with booth type on one side and chairs on the other side.  The service was outstanding!  The gentlemen who was our server - a retired NY policeman was amazing.  They were pretty busy but he had everything under control.  This is one of Vegas's True Gems!  I can't wait to go back and take friends to experience Crepe Expectations!

v73vCzSQPWdLAl-1H1UtgA.text: I always look for places that have been on Diners Drive-Ins and Dives, and this breakfast place may be a little out of the way from the Las Vegas Strip but worth the trip. Great crepes, decent coffee. And Mimosas! And so much less expensive then those places in the big hotels!

5aMfzKQ_p0oOyjlmoZIusw.text: This place was delicious! As a huge fan of crepes, I thought they did a great job with a plethora of options. The crepes itself was tasty and the fillings (the ones I tried anyway) were delicious on itself too.   I will say it was deceiving at first when they give you your food, because the food was not plated with any garnish or any contrast of color. So eating with your eyes the plate was very monotone. Not a bad thing, but just so use to places that garnish the hell out of the dish just to make it look appetizing. Here it's simply plated and they let the food speak for itself.  The place gets crowded fast so try to come really early or maybe come after 12 when the breakfast/brunch crowd is gone.

tWI7X0NDZ7G5yHm-QsJo5w.text: The location of this is a restaurant gem as far as plazas go! This particular location offers such a wide variety of cuisine and dining options, from super casual to quaint patio dining, Italic an, Indian, Mexican, Sushi....so OF COURSE we needed CREPES!!  The menu is amazing and the service is unreal and super friendly! We haven't gone yet that it hasn't been packed so go prepared to wait a minny, but believe me when I say, it's worth the wait! They have options of such a great variety for breakfast, brunch & lunch! I never considered crepes as a lunch option, but they are indeed!!

tcVwEeFcqId4GyLPERXZJg.text: I'll be honest, 3 years back we visited this place because of Guy and his Triple T show,  but we are always find our self coming back each time we visit LV. Kids, Wife love the Monkey (add strawberries) and I go for the Sonora with 2 eggs. One tip, come after 10 as mornings are crazy busy.

-kUhHyp9A_a7u5bh3GW3cw.text: We come to Vegas a few times a year and found this two trips ago. We make it a point to eat here at least once during our trips. First off, on the weekend, they get BUSY! This proves how great they are. The selection is unbelievable. The gentleman behind the register is always pleasant has a smile and tells us to have a blessed day.  The chefs are all business and their passion comes through in the finished products.  The gentleman that serves the orders is always quick, efficient and makes sure you're taken care of. If you're in Vegas, make the quick drive out to see them. One of our favorite breakfast spots when we're in town. The kids like The monkey, I prefer The Sanora and my wife's new favorite is The Elvis. Give them a try, you won't be disappointed!

RPzw46yoxmQYYv71DfKtjA.text: Amazing evening at our friends birthday tonight. Friendly staff, great mimosas, excellent crepes!

hZIrlZ3PxNFF9ACobawQUA.text: Fantastic service and good food. Featured on Diners & Dives with Guy on Food Network.  My mom and I split the Caprese with added chicken and the William Tell. It was just the right amount of food. The caprese was very tasty with fresh basil, mozzarella and pesto. The William Tell was not too sweet, which I like. They use Granny Smith green apples, house-made caramel and whipped cream. You could cut the whipped cream with a butter knife. They offer help-yourself complimentary cucumber and lemon water. I love how they use fresh house made ingredients, and fantastic and friendly service.  Open for brunch. Closes @ 3pm.

o3ppZexHB7DKke99uJoNDQ.text: The Greek Crepe was very good! All the ingredients were fresh and delicious! The layout is really cool because you can watch the crepes being made. My only criticism is the system on how you get a table and place your order. The owner was taking the orders at the register and then seating people waiting for tables too. I think it would have been less confusing if once you placed your order and got your order number you find your seat first come first serve. I am definitely coming back to try some more things on the menu!

4YhQoTt7QJuLVFxJO2D3uw.text: Employees were great & crepes were even better. Ordered The Monterey, The Chicken Chili Verde, & we each got our own Mimosa samplers. Loved that you could pick from 13 different fruit flavors. Also, Lola, was such a sweet heart. Would definitely recommend Crepe Expectations & hope to come back on our next trip here!

KFLMWmzw9Ml-YVnfGqIisw.text: This is our 4th visit to Crepe Expectations, and as usual the food is exceptionally good and the menu is unique and fun. The flavored mimosas are fun and refreshing and the hot chocolate is delicious! So why only 2 stars? While the food is exceptional, the service and experience consistently fail to live up to the same standards. Every visit the same host/waiter seats us and is pushy, doesn't really make eye contact or connect and seems to have a different way of operating the flow of incoming customers, ordering customers and seating customers so you don't know what to expect, he doesn't explain it and he clearly loses his patience when you can't read his mind.  On past visits, we have walked in submitted our name and then ordered food prior to having a table. This resulted in our food getting to us shortly after we were seated. Today, our female friend gave him her name "Kim" and he repeatedly called her "Tim" even after multiple corrections, not a big deal just odd. Then we went to get in line to order and he rushed over with paper menus and told us we could wait over in the corner. Having been here before, we assumed he meant after we ordered and before we were seated. Evidentially, we were wrong. He rushed back over and insisted we move to the corner as we were in the way. Not politely.  We went and sat down, through somewhat offended by his tone and clear lack of patience. Once our table was ready, he allowed us to order. This meant we waited at least twice as long as normal for our food to come out.   Once the food arrived, it was so good it almost made up for the poor treatment.   Then, we completed our meal and our plates were removed. One of us was finishing a drink and he other had run to the restroom, when he appeared again in the same rude, rushed, impatient manner and insisted we leave so he could turn over the table. After tipping 20% on the $25 ticket for 2, I was not impressed in the least.  The food is good, but not good enough to deal with the host/waiter. You need someone with better communication and customer service skills to deal with customers. Just kidding

i5mAxqV7VH4GN4Cc-8r4Hw.text: I love the kind of crepe batter they make here. It has a bit of gummy texture and not dry. When I'm craving for crepes this is where I go. Portion is huge so 1 order is def enough for 2 Imo.  Highly recommended! I hope that they stop using to go plastic cup soon to reduce plastic use. Other than that perfect!  Lots of parking space.

My wife and I split 2 crepes: - Monterey (a savory breakfast crepe) - Avalon (a sweet, pear crepe)  Both crepes were very good. I especially enjoyed the heat (Seranno) of the Monterey.   We'd love to back to Crepe Expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got the monkey crepe- Nutella and bananas and he got bananas foster crepe.

-uxbGUM9ssXcicflOfre4g.text: I love crepes, so I was happy when my wife found this on Yelp while visiting family in Vegas.  Definitely did not disappoint and the servings are Vegas size!!  We wanted to try them all but settled on four savory and two sweets.  Both sweets are very good and a can't miss!  We ordered the Monkey (Nutella, banana, & chocolate) and the Perfect Combination (strawberry & chocolate).  The four savory are a hit and miss.  Out of the four, the Chicken w/green Chilli (Salsa Verde) was the best and will definitely order  again.  Try this place out when you are visiting Las Vegas and indulge yourself with one of the best sweet crepes in town!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ewx1yv65g10tY3yX5t4zfA.text: Have been back a few more times since our first visit and still leave with smiles. Since they have moved down a shop they have a much larger seating area and also have plenty of covered outdoor seating. Some very cool origami made from tips at the register. Very creative people showing appreciation.  This visit we enjoyed the Marco Polo, ground sausage with eggs and jack cheese with a side of fresh sliced bananas and The Perfect Combination topped with strawberries, powdered sugar and a drizzle of chocolate sauce. Both dishes were delicious and crepes were prepared perfectly. There might have been a Mimosa sampler had as well ;-). The White Peach, Raspberry and Guava are always great choices! If you want to try other flavors they include: Pineapple, Mango, Strawberry, Passion Fruit, Blood Orange, Watermelon, Pomegranate, Cherry, Orange and Tangerine.   Tip: 10% Military / Veteran discount available.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the Marco Polo
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marco Polo with a side of banana
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect combination

IcNFXBaA_yiCSpvNVRpvHw.text: This is one of my favorite stops when in Las Vegas! Although it's not on the strip it has made its debut on diners drive-ins and dives with guy Fieri!!!  Crepe Expectations is a creperie with all kinds of choices! Each entree is delicately folded into a crepe and served with a side of your choice.  If you have the chance to meet Louis R. at your register don't hesitate to ask him for a recommendation! I would definitely have an idea of what you like or what you're expecting when asking. (Sweet/Savory/Fruit/Eggs/Meat)  Today we did breakfast and dessert! I had the SONORA- Carne Asada Steak, Roasted Tomato Salsa, Guacamole, Jack Cheese ($9.50) and added in two eggs! My breakfast was accompanied by a flight of mimosas! (Peach, Pomegranate, Raspberry)  My companion for this mornings adventure had the SUNDAY MORNING- Seasoned Potatoes, Scrambled Eggs, Jack Cheese ($7.50)and added Chorizo. Also a mimosa flight! (Mango, BlackBerry, Strawberry)   After we finished our breakfast we moved onto dessert and shared The William Tell! - Sauted Cinnamon Apples, Carmel (Yummy!!!)  Make a pitstop to the bathroom if you want to see the poster signed by Guy Fieri!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bragging rights!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. William Tell  and 1.5 Mimosa flights
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Menu

BpTTcQatN1KcJiI2Bn7g6Q.text: I haven't been here since they moved over into the old beach hut deli spot.  Love that they've expanded but it's still crazy busy.    We ordered the chorizo crepe and a strawberry Nutella crepe.  Both crepes were made perfectly. Nice amount of filling but the star is the crepe itself.  Soft delicious and perfect.    The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars, wish they had a different side besides bananas or cottage cheese.  It would be nice as well to do a savory side for the sweet crepe and vice versa.  We are always ordering 2 crepes to get the best of both worlds.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Nutella Crêpe.  Oh yeah!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chorizo crepe.  Delicious
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QK1o3_8VoetEOwhw4_TxZA.text: Had The Monkey and added strawberries for brunch today, it was delish! The guy who took my order, I'm guessing is the owner is super sweet and nice, asked me how I was and how my day was going. He made conversation with everyone that came in there. I received my crepe very quickly and it was sooo good, it hit the spot for me this morning. Dirty plates didn't stay on the table for long, someone was coming around and promptly picked up the plates when people were done. I really enjoyed this place, I will try to make it it back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey with strawberries

v2ValIzp3FKprl9uetX5DA.text: I have been in this shopping center hundreds of times and just found Crepe Expectations, and am so glad I did! Open for breakfast and lunch they have a variety of sweet and savory crepes.   We arrived right at 9:00 am when they opened. Being our first time we ordered on sweet (the monkey) and one savory (Rosarito) crepe. They have a huge selection of mimosas and fresh juices. I had to work later so had a guava juice which you rarely see on a menu.   The crepes arrived a short time later and both were hot and delicious. The monkey was filled with fresh bananas and nutella all melted together. It was topped with chocolate sauce and whipped cream. The Rosarito was full of chorizo, scrambled eggs and cheese. The menu said it had guac but there was little to be found. Both crepes were light and cooked perfectly.   As we were leaving we ran in to the owner, Lou. He asked us how we enjoyed our crepes and was genuinely happy to have us as new customers. Lou explained to us how everything from the chorizo to the whipped cream is all made in house fresh. He seems like a great guy who cares about his customers experiences and the food he puts out.   I will definitely be returning to try some of the savory lunch crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito (chorizo, eggs, avocado, cheese)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The monkey (banana and Nutella)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet/breakfast menu

_4fyAk1YrI0-E8pODW04VQ.text: Always love coming here to eat. The owner always thanks us for coming back. I highly recommend the Monterey for breakfast, the grand Turk for savory and the Frisco for sweet. And of course I always do a mimosa flight. This place is always busy. I have never not seen it busy. But I promise it's worth the wait!

SHTaHxMnsUUfVQycTsDS3g.text: The guy in front seems to be owner and takes orders and seats you. Was very rude very controlling with seating even though it's a very casual place no high end at all. They take your order and make u wait makes no sense . I was very excited to try a crepe place but it's very unfortunate as a business owner I treat my clients / customers with respect and he was horrible they're was an open table and all he kept saying was I'm not going there (what does that even mean) ?  We left mad and disappointed. We needed to seat because my mom was with me and is handicap can't stand to long he didn't care.

-btLHMnqgizRuvzrn_xf2A.text: Taste like Mexican food in a crepe . Prices are good ... but kinda of weird taste wise as crepes should taste French .  I would go for the dessert crepe over the breakfast/ lunch ones for sure

8ziP2FmzxeRASkAkbQQzVg.text: Crepe expectations was an awesome breakfast! The restaurant has a cool vibe, you look up and the ceiling has painted clouds that look cool! There is indoor and also outdoor seating depending on what you want. They have an option for mimosa flight where you get 3 flavors & 13 flavors to pick from, my wife loved this! I got the "Sonora" Crepe it had carne asada steak and a good amount of it, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, jack cheese and it filled me up and tasted great! The crepes have sweet or savory options so they can apeal to everyone from kids to adults, great place to take your family. Will eat here again next time I visit Vegas
