Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2x mimosa flights
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora crepe YUM

1gfAkTBvL0YAQrPI91eq4Q.text: Mmm so good !! Love the mimosa flight options. Interior is pretty spacious with a nice covered outdoor area. Crepes are made in front of you. I ordered the Grand Turk, sub goat cheese . Amazing flavor. Order with a good amount of meat and filling, very soft crepe. Also came with a side salad . Pictured with my order with a couple flights of mimosas . Perfect Vegas brunch  !

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmmm so good ! The Grand Turk w/ 2 mimosa flights

xwPdTk72IRN1hovJkI_epQ.text: Something different and not same old boring breakfast. You can pick different crapes loaded with variety of ingredients. My favorite is "the Monterey"with scrambled egg, bacon, onion it is so delicious. The "berry delight" is another crape I would recommend and its from the sweet menu. This restaurant is located close to 215/eastern to be specific its on the corner of eastern and Silverado ranch. To sum up it's a great place for breakfast or brunch. My favorite spot in the morning to start your day. Before I forget Mimosa trio sampler is must also to give you that extra kick

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The monterey
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The berry delight

jhLUx8R4jF0V5KfiaMIZOQ.text: Why have I waited so long to try Crepe Expectations!? It exceeded my expectations for sure.  Last week Thursday, I left for lunch at my usual 11 am to beat the lunch crowd.  I missed Monta Chaya so much, but forgot they don't open until 11:30 when I walked into the unlocked restaurant.  Why can't they just seat me?  When I walked out, they locked the door...how rude!? :D  In any case, Crepe Expectations to the rescue since it was next door. There was a lot to choose from, so I decided on the Greek Crepe.  And since I didn't know how big the crepe was, I also thought I'd get the Del Mar.  When it was my turn to order, I asked how big was the crepe and the nice man pointed to the crepe on the griddle and said it would be folded in half.  So I ordered only the Greek Crepe with the noodle soup.  Great deal at $8.00.  It was a beautiful day, so I chose to sit on the patio. You can smell the incense from the patio dining from Thai restaurant next door.  When my order arrived, which wasn't much long after, I was surprised to see how big the crepe was, it really was and so tasty.  The only thing I didn't like about it was the olives, too salty for me. I thought the soup was ok.  Lot's of noodles but noodles reminded me of the chicken noodle soup where you add hot water, very short and very thin.  5-stars for Crepe Expectations, for great service, great food, great price, and  great atmosphere. I look forward to trying everything else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very large Greek crepe with grilled chicken, feta cheese, olives, spinach and tzaziki
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side noodle soup

n53dxgcoGCXWrvwr2mBnLw.text: This is by far the best food experience I have had in Las Vegas and the crepes are comparable to the ones I had in Paris France. The owner Lou cares and makes sure customers are happy with their meal.  I would give this restaurant 100 Stars if I could

GhDU_NejYqTmRYcW0nderA.text: My wife and I heard great things about this places via word of mouth and this place did not disappoint. She had the berry delight and I had the crepelet. Outstanding service, atmosphere, and food. Support your local small business places and definitely check these guys out.

efP_-hO5lhymVe6vTClMYQ.text: We were traveling from Utah to California and decided to make a stop in Vegas for lunch. We looked saw a lot of positive reviews for this one. We couldn't imagine what would make a crepe place in a strip mall such a popular place, so we had to check it out. We were pleasantly surprised. It's a small place, but the food and service were great. We tried The Grand Turk, The Perfect Combination and The Frisco. All were exceptional. The server was friendly and very attentive. He told us how nearly everything is homemade and fresh. It makes a difference as we really enjoyed the meal and were glad we came. Next time we stay in Vegas, we'll make a breakfast stop here. Can't wait to try some of the other crepes.

nxs2bBbD74VWZckPd5zt3w.text: Nice selection and they have a video feed of them making your crepes. Food was nice, especially for breakfast. Seating is limited.

2Gis3J9I_1Qv-8NTo7Cm0w.text: oh.my.heavens. i am so thankful for friends like Megan M. who introduce me to these wonderful places. i have had brunch here twice and both times were amazing, i am a huge fan of savory crepes over sweet ones and this place has the best ones i have had on the west coast. from the breakfast to lunch/dinner ones you cannot go wrong. I sampled the mimosa trio (10 dollars) and even that was lovely and refreshing. all the flavors were wonderful and something i would go back for. so far I have had the caprese and had to stop myself from going into a food coma. the tomatoes tasted extra fresh and the amount of pesto was perfect so it didn't take away the flavor or the tomatoes or the fresh mozzarella. it also came with a side of watermelon. yums! the rosarito was another one i had tried and holy goodness. chorizo and guacamole and scrambled eggs and cheese! be still my little foodie heart. both were under 8 dollars and again something i would make a special trip for. the service is delightful and you can even watch them make your crepes. they have seating inside and out. also very dog friendly with baskets of treats and buckets of water for those little tail waggers. i'm addicted!

mThxp5xOWnqppCrl3NDP9Q.text: I just moved to town and let me tell you I won't regret it for a second with this place right around the corner from me. The food is amazing, everything tastes so fresh. Staff is very friendly and I love the outside seating that is pet friendly!

ZrB5o7HzaPoFsI_f8qTs0A.text: Really wonderful food and service! The owners are so sweet and kind. Their crepes are a special treat, with both savory and sweet offered, and first class service.  Nice eating area.

HIIFQDyIvgmwdMSSzpzGgg.text: Very much enjoyed our visit here!  We had been looking for a creperie and am so glad we didn't just find one that was close by on the Strip.  The chef was so friendly and attentive and happy to make changes to the menu items.  Oh, and the food was delicious!  I know my family will be coming here again.

WQeJp_KtPLm9iME7sX-XCA.text: Finally! A great locally owned breakfast/lunch eatery that I'm excited about. Walking in, the first thing I noticed was the beautiful decor: dimly lit, modern wall hangings and a sophisticated, yet cozy atmosphere. What I really liked was that though it was sunny and hot outside, the windows are tinted, so the annoying and shiny sun was nowhere to be found. There are only a few tables inside, but there's covered seating outside. The menu is simple: crepes. Sweet and savory, they cater to all. My girlfriend got the bananas foster crepe and I got...well, I forget what it's called but it had chorizo, guacamole and scrambled eggs...absolutely divine. Served with a side of super sweet watermelon, the crepe itself was tender and unctuous. They're made fresh right in front of you. It's like eating a fresh flour tortilla but richer and eggier (not sure if that makes sense). Anyhoo, They have two different types of free water: lemon and cucumber. I got the cucumber, which was refreshing and a nice change of pace from the standard. We also met the owner who was out and about bussing tables and talking with guests...We could tell he was excited about his job. They also accommodate the GLUTEN FREE! That's right, a gluten free crepe! A very unique and delicious treat, check it out!

O99QIr-lC6rOv_fr3pLnKA.text: Absolutely fantastic. My wife and I each shared half of the others crepe and they were wonderful. The management and staff are beyond friendly and clearly love what they do. For dining experience you will share with your friends and want to go back to the place to eat.

NNWaQMrhkn4wUyu5LP0QSw.text: Yummy yummy for the tummy.got there when they first opened at 9 am,got very busy by the time we left at 10. Had the blueberry and lemon curd crepe, very fresh berries. Did not have the whipped cream they offered, crepe was sweet enough w/o it. Upbeat  decor, even the bathroom. Can't wait to return to try lunch crepe.

SVAgIopmvLStd5bUdlX1dw.text: crepes were sooooo good and yummy....my only problem s the place is sooooo small and they get pretty busy

RtV4MfM3PR4AGGjVCBibDw.text: This is one of my current favorite places in Vegas for breakfast/brunch/lunch. Everyone who works here is so sweet, attentive, and enthusiastic about helping customers. It's clear that every detail is addressed, from the way the owner talks with customers about where they'd prefer to sit (and then chats about their favorite items!), to the little bowl of sea salt hand scrub in the bathroom, to the cucumber- and lemon-flavored water. The crepes themselves remind me of the ones in France- very light, fluffy, slightly crispy at the edges, buttery, absolute perfection. I usually order the Caprese (tomato, mozzarella (the good kind), homemade pesto, and you can add chicken which I do), and then share a sweet crepe, like the Nutella with bananas and hazelnuts. The whipped cream must be homemade because it tastes incredibly fresh, light and fluffy, and isn't overly sweet or artificial-tasting. The iced tea sometimes takes a few extra minutes to come out, but it is worth it for a delicious cup of fresh-brewed tea poured over ice! The service isn't SUPER fast as this isn't a huge chain, everything is made fresh when you order it, and it is definitely a popular place, but it is prompt, efficient, and always friendly. And personally I'm not one to rush through brunch, so waiting 15 minutes for a fresh, delicious crepe doesn't bother me at all. A definite must for brunch in Vegas!

YyOx4RLbpYEeXtj8gFtjoQ.text: I am visiting Las Vegas for business and wanted to find brunch outside of a casino. Crepe Expectations came up with great reviews so I decided to try them...so very happy I did! I had The Rosarito breakfast crepe, it was excellent! Along with my coffee an pomegranate mimosa, breakfast was wonderful! And the owners couldn't be nicer! Great experience, I will certainly remember them next time I am in Vegas.

V9n868lwKw75v03GFJvE5g.text: After looking for  breakfast cafes on Yelp we came upon Crepe Expectations.....I took in some of the negativity as well as the glowing reviews and decided to give it a go.  It was Saturday and it was crowded. On entering the cafe we were drawn to the counter by the owner who said "Come on in!"  I must admit first timers suffer a bit of confusion on seating, ordering and being relegated to a narrow hall to wait for your name to be called. We had some trepidation on how long this process was going to take but it was perhaps 15-20 minutes and we were called. By then we had ample time to look over the menus given us on arrival and were seated at a decent sized table. The crepes were exceptional and they didn't take that long to arrive. We ordered the Rosarito and the William Tell along with the Mimosa sampler. We shared them and couldn't decide which we liked more although one was spicy and one sweet.  I've gotta say this is a hard place to bring little kids.  It's crowded, some of the seats are high and it's just too loud to be a family type dining experience.  The cafe is small and the noise level is a distraction but you get used to it.  We were so amazed at how good the food was we were planning our return before we left.  Prepare yourself to be patient and wait if coming on the weekend but it's worth it.  BRAVO! they do crepes.....and only crepes right.

89Ust7BYlCPeaBxpoHHWJg.text: This place was fantastic!  The crepes were delicious and reasonably priced.  The atmosphere was really nice.  Every employee I encountered was friendly and helpful.  I will definitely be back.

9Uo5dUwTsRpIeB_nY2O7Yw.text: What a great discovery!  (Yelp, as always, is a great help in finding new places).  This is in a nice center (BJ's Restaurant is there in the same center) on Eastern Ave.  The food was delicious.  We had The Sonora Crepe - very tasty and well presented on the plate.   (Loved being able to watch it being made on the television screen).  We stopped by for lunch and it was very popular.  Fun decor - dark purple and glitzy lights.  They served fresh cantalope on the side.  The staff was very careful how they were preparing the food (wore gloves) and were very friendly.  Anna came up and we spoke after our meal  I would recommend this place - nice for a light meal.  I understand they have been open for several months....this place is one we will go back too!  PS.  Husband really enjoyed it, as well!

VV5FgodhKdutGY8RhKbDBQ.text: Delicious!! Both savory and sweet crepes were tasty. We also loved watching them being made! Staff was super friendly too. Will go again!

xGfd-o8EtwMtgqwHN6AoVQ.text: I love this place! I seriously dream about their Frisco lemon blueberry crepe & the Sonora with steak & guacamole! Staff is also wonderful! I just wish they had a bigger place. Love it!

M5ODXeMTx69ioLT0evQ9cA.text: Ordered one sweet & one savory: -the monkey (added strawberries) -caprese  Really hit the spot. :)  Plus, they have cucumber & lemon flavored water.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Ds3etaX-bEVN3OibxfaYw.text: Fantastic crepes and fantastic service. Our favorites were the Sunday Morning and the Berry Delight. We were lucky to find this great place as we were driving through. We'll definitely remember to come again next time we're in the area. You won't be disappointed!

yAXT_LK8lJ-smp1MUZSehA.text: THIS PLACE IS UNBELIEVABLY AWESOME! Came here for brunch on a Sunday between 12-1. I was not expecting an "order at the counter and then we'll bring it to you" style, but that wasn't much of a problem.  There is an employee who kind of patrols the ordering line, asking people how many are in their party and then getting them a table. They don't take your order until you have a table to sit at.  Here lies the problem. There is ONE THING I do not like about this place: it isn't big enough. So, when it's crowded, it can be a bit stressful and an awkward wait because of how small the dining area is. We were initially seated at a small table right in the middle of the ordering line, and I didn't like it at all. I do not like it when people are standing over me while I'm eating or trying to enjoy a nice conversation/drinks/good company. But, when I asked if we could have another table, the employee happily said "No problem, it will just be a few minutes." So, we got a taller bar-stool table on the side.   When our table was ready, we ordered. The man taking orders seemed to be either the owner of the head honcho of sorts. He was very friendly and happy to make recommendations. I ordered the Rosarito (chorizo, guacamole, jack cheese, eggs) and my girlfriend ordered the Perfect Combination (strawberries, chocolate, whipped cream, powdered sugar).   I also ordered the Mimosa trio sampler. First of all, they have a chalkboard full of various mimosa flavors (mango, blood orange, orange, passion fruit, white peach, strawberry, raspberry, etc.) and you could pick THREE of them for $10. And these "sampler" size cups were not small. I thought they were the same size as any mimosa I'd order at any other brunch place. I chose blood orange, raspberry and passion fruit. The passion fruit and blood orange were my favorite!  The food took a bit to come out, which is slightly surprising because it's CREPES, but I didn't mind the wait because the decor is wonderful and I had amazing company and drinks to keep me busy.   Once our food came, I was surprised at how huge they were. I couldn't finish mine, but wow it was delicious! I have never had a better crepe in my life. My girlfriend loved hers and she also said it was the best she had ever had. The crepes aren't too thin but aren't too thick or overwhelmingly sweet. I couldn't get over how delicious and perfect everything was cooked.   So, EVEN THOUGH I think they were a bit unorganized (they need more space or a better organization of tables inside) and slightly slow with service, I CANNOT give less than 5 stars because of how delicious the food and drinks were (and cheap! $7-8 for a LARGE crepe!). Also, the staff was friendly and attentive.   Check this place out, its CREPETASTIC.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Perfect Combination crepe
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio!

Myy-HhOaEeqRMgy1j4T0LA.text: I so badly wanted to LOVE this place. I love the set up, I love the open kitchen concept, and I love crepes! Fairly cheap here, too. I came with my mother in law and my son on a Wednesday morning and it wasn't too busy - as soon as we left though it seems like it started to pick up drastically. I ordered the Marco Polo which is eggs, sausage, and pepper jack cheese(? I could be wrong on the cheese). I was not a fan of the sausage at all, just didn't taste how I was expecting it to. Also, the ratio of all the fillings was completely off making every bite a tad bit disappointing. I want to come back to this establishment and try a different crepe, maybe one of the dessert ones so that I can change my rating but for now I'm going to keep it at 3 stars. Service was amazing though! This man who was behind the cash register was so extremely nice and always checked up on us. I will back, I just won't be ordering the Marco Polo.

6Cq0ZYNOg6YvOujYrgPw5w.text: Excellent. My husband and I stopped on our way back to Arizona. The gentleman that greeted us when we walked in was very nice. Asked if it was our first time. Indeed it was!! Shared the big table with two other groups. I ordered the apple filing one and a sampler of mimosas. Cherry, mango, and passion fruit. All three were good. My husband had the perfect combination. He enjoyed my crepe better. He also tried a trio - blood orange, strawberry and white peach. My favorite of his was the white peach followed by blood orange. Was fun to watch the making of the crepes on the overhead camera viewing on the TV above the workstation. We will visit again when we are in Las Vegas area.

HpYINJtxDAGobqgpU6l51g.text: This quaint place in the middle of all the eatery came a little  surprise to me. I was visiting my sister and just looking for a place to have breakfast with my niece. I tried the savory crepe chorizo and avocado and the sweet crepes with apple, and berries (I forgot the actual names on their menu). They were all delicious!! I would definitely come back when  I'm in Las Vegas again. My sister and my niece now have another favorite place to eat.

tPg8cqxEVD72sfNGry8U4w.text: Went here for lunch and got a strawberry chocolate crepe! So good and I was craving and it def. filled the craving. People are sweet, and you can see everything that's being made. I had no idea they were on dinners drive ins and dives, but now I do and that's cool. So yeah go here and it's worth the money!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. YASSSS (7.75) Crepe
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I was watching my gift be created

uHJllbdrujTblcWYQXG5_Q.text: This place is doing everything right. The crepes were delicious and they were prepared very quickly. I got the William Tell (sweet) and my wife got the Rosarito (savory). Both were excellent. The service was great, and the owner was nice and engaging. She walks the dining room and makes sure that everyone is happy. Love the crepe cam!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The William Tell. It was prefect.

vqpziu7ANMdyzMo-T9Wysw.text: 4 stars for the atmosphere and customer service. Sat outside which was comfortable, had to wait maybe 5 minutes to get a seat. Waited about 10 mins to get our order, didn't even notice the wait since we were enjoying our beer and fresh squeezed orange juice. We got 2 crepes- classic and savory. You can never go wrong with bananas, chocolate, & whipped cream. The breakfast crepe was good- ham, cheese, & eggs with a side of cottage cheese. It was good, but nothing amazing. Think once you've had crepes in Hampstead Heath (London), it's hard to find a comparable one in the states. But it was good just not 5 stars for me.

8097tO0p-4_2vCL23UPvBA.text: So let me start off with the service. It's incredible. The owner Lou is the sweetest guy and always extremely happy and friendly! I have gone here every weekend for the past month and every one always has such a great attitude and a smile on their face! Now to the food. A M A Z I N G! I've tried almost every savory crepe and they never ever disappoint. So much flavor and a great size portion. Plus their soup is the best. You can't get anything better in the crepe industry than this place. It's a must go and I would recommend it to everyone.

8pkb80hYlc6jD9JDwuY-qw.text: If you love breast fast or brunch, I definitely recommend this place. I had the crepe with the turkey, cheese, guacamole, and tomato. It was savory and yummy. The crepe was cooked well, some places can be a little doughy. The service was great for me, a server saw me coming in afar in the parking lot with my baby - and right away he found a table for me and my friend. It's a small place, but there are places to sit outside as well. The ambience was busy, you order at the counter, and they bring it to your table. I can see this place being jam packed, but I feel we came at the right time on Super Bowl Sunday. Lol I will definitely come again, and next time try the mimosas sampler trio. ;-P

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c9jNVuddQOzzvyEaGcUQgQ.text: The reviews on this place are so great I guess I was expecting something much better. The food was just ok. The crepes were light and nice but the filling was a bit skimpy. I had the breakfast Crepelet and there wasn't much egg or cheese. Just a lot of salty ham. My friend had the William Tell with apples, caramel and whipped cream. The apples were hard and the caramel flavorless. Besides the food being just ok, the host was so rude I would never go back.  We walked in and he asked how many and sat us at a table. We were waiting on a third friend and had told him there were 3 of us. We hadn't been there more than 3-4 minutes when he told us if we didn't order right away we would have to give up our table!! I'm not sure why he sat us since he knew our friend wasn't there yet if that's how they operate. We were told there were people waiting. (I'm still not sure why their money is better than mine) However, there were 2 open tables. We did as we were told and quickly ordered and left our friend to fend for herself. She came before we finished ordering and added her order. I've never felt so poorly treated in my life. I felt they were doing me a favor by serving me a meal I was paying for. This is a strip mall, not NYC. It's a restaurant. for dining. This would be a place to visit on the way to the airport or when you are in a rush, not a place you would like to enjoy your meal and have a conversation with friends. I felt like at anytime my plate was going to be taken from me-Lucille Ball style-and I was going to be sent out the door! (Times up, get out!) I guess we didn't understand the "rules". The tables are so close together that the older couple next to us was constantly eaves dropping and commenting to us on our conversation. Also rude. I'm glad others have enjoyed this place, but I will not be going back.

a8czqmZ5R-6pczIrSFjadQ.text: Great for crepes!   Kind of confused on how the seating worked at first. You seat yourself after you order at register.  I Had the The Creplet it was great. So was Chelas Hot Chocolate. Good size portions couldn't finish mine.  Will definitely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JcZlpW0B9yx-Gc2nMZCFDQ.text: What a cool place. Saw the recent episode on DDD and what a coincidence I was already going to Vegas that week! The Reuben crepe was so juicy and delicious. They put caraway seeds on it to make it more Reuben-esque, very clever! The carne asada crepe was tasty as well but the meat was not very hot unfortunately. The William Tell crepe was amazing. Tasted like a delicious apple pie! The service was friendly and the portions were good. Cute place - may it continue to prosper!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dad posing out front
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s left of the William Tell.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Reuben crepe. So tasty!

pIM7K1C2xDJTcSKE0yzPgg.text: Great place and convenient location. I have always been a fan of crepes and it is hard to find a place that makes decent crepes with a good variety. This place has that.   My favorite is the monkey which has nutella, banana, chocolate drizzle, fresh whipped cream, and powdered sugar. From breakfast to dinner this has a good selection to satisfy your mood.   The pricing is very reasonable too, I believe I paid about $8 with tax for mine. Anyways this place is worth a shot.

RYwhH5kIFuir1MSZ01vW8g.text: Outstanding food and service and the owner is a class act. I had the Sonora today and the meat was tender and cooked perfectly. I just wish I had room left for dessert!!!

uYhgMmZCTnoExeK3ykkEjg.text: I've never had a mediocre experience here! The staff are welcoming and treat you like family. The manager makes it a point to remember who you are with each encounter. The crepes are delicious, the coffee is delicious and the mimosa's are perfect! I love this place! I also love that even though it's a small spot, they are staying True to being a "Mom and Pop" shop and not expanding. Keeping it intimate and homely is the way to go!

vbOCkipGijeKyC1LDw5lig.text: I have been here 3 mornings in a row, while being in Vegas on vaca. The service is welcoming and personable. The food is amazing and the menu offers a large variety of customizable options.

iJ1CGffuHo7MsZOsrjh2cQ.text: Really good! We wanted a good brunch place and we decided to come here thanks to the Yelp reviews. We got a table outside and enjoyed our food very much. I had the Elvis which were peanut butter, bananas and bacon. Yum! My bf had the Monte Cristo which was also very good. Their coffee was also excellent. I also got to chat a bit with the owner who was super nice and friendly! I definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a good brunch place off the tourist track.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z8aT-Cz93zwI4cKWpaqhxg.text: I had never heard of this place until a week ago when my friend said she had heard great things and we should go.  The very next day, a Saturday, we decided to meet here at noon. I sort of panicked when I arrived because there were so many people obviously waiting to be seated.  I went in to find the host, but before I could get very far in, he found ME and asked how many.  Turns out he is the owner.  I put my name down, and 30 minutes later we had a seat outside.  The outside is basically a tented area on the sidewalk right out front of the restaurant. The heat wasn't too bad until it got later in the afternoon, I started to feel it (or maybe it was the mimosas??).  The inside is very small and packed. You have to order at the counter and then take a number to your table where they will bring you your food and drinks (if you ordered any).  If you want water though, you have to go get it yourself.    It's a bit of a hassle ordering and getting water. There is a lot of jostling, and squeezing past people and tables and servers and bussers to order your food or to get water.  I wish they would at least serve you water at the table so you didn't have to get up in the middle of your meal to refill your tiny plastic water cup. Also, after we ordered and sat down, it took about 30 minutes for them to bring our food.   However, the food is so amazing that I'm willing to forgive all of that. I ordered the Sonora crepe, which is carne asada, guacamole, fire roasted salsa and cheese. Everything about this crepe was perfection. The flavors worked so incredibly well together. I could not stop eating even after I was stuffed.  I can't wait to go back and eat it again!    They also offer mimosa samplers. For $10 you get 3 flavors - my favorite was the strawberry and the guava. Yum!   I now have new-found love for crepes!

CV7JviHtha3zWWSGSzLQgQ.text: If you are not hungry, walk in this place and the smell will make you hungry :)  My girl friend and I went there, we ordered two crepes and they both were awesome. We got wine sampler, and we had a great time lol The service was excellent. Our server is friendly (hmm I believe his name is Mike,older guy.) When we went there in july, it was summer and no one wants to sit outside so inside was packed but we didn't wait to long. I have good experience here and I can't wait to go again.

fm9O1LZYYnqs3TEntV1jEA.text: Crepe expectations is an amazing establishment! The owners are hands down some of the friendliest small business owners I've met! The first time I went and Lou took my son behind the counter and let him help push the bottoms on the register. My son is picky and doesn't always eat a whole lot but he could have eaten 2 by himself I think! The coffee is another added perk. I am already craving another Sonora!! Dont change a thing!!

Fxv4edQWJrjmOJcxXSR8Pg.text: Amazing is all I can say.  Fantastic food, and great service.  You walk in and get treated like family.  Thank you Crepe Expectations!

O_kDA2pyx3Qv1-Y8ExXdIA.text: Tried this place for our first time earlier today, and it was delicious. The service was great. The food was delicious. Mimosas were good. The establishment was a bit small, but clearly it was a popular joint as the day went on. A lot of people were showing up. I definitely recommend for a good crepe and great customer service.

MI6I3xdbNqrDSCWhVPzKAQ.text: I was excited to come to Crepe Expectations after dropping my dog off for a grooming next door. It's a small restaurant on Eastern with a purple vibe.  Inside, it was a little cramped, which is why it's hard to get a reservation. However, there happened to be a table opened, so we got there by a good chance.  To order, the customer must go up to the cashier like at a traditional cafe, and then the employee gives you a number and then you sit down. The wait for us was decent, not long, but not short either. (About 15 minutes)  The crepes itself are worth the wait, though. They're huge and can easily be taken to go as well. They offer many options, savory, sweet, and breakfast. I usually have my crepes with their jasmine tea and honey. It's such a refreshing treat to have any time of the day!  I do recommend Crepe Expectations for anyone who wants to relax and chill with friends. However, it is quite cramped, so it wouldn't be suitable for going on a date. Make sure to wear comfortable clothes as well! It makes the experience a lot better.

bmy0G0VMKf3uUppBKf9ZCQ.text: Amazing food, remarkable service, totally a regular place on my list. Owners are Lou and Jen - you all rock!

b1zrN6TzJt33tH0LISwLbw.text: Fantastic! The service is wonderful and the food is great. I have been there several times and it never disappoints.   Sometimes on the weekends there can be a long wait, but it's totally worth it. The owners are very nice and make the experience that much better.

EULvjax33LANv3eJWjEjOg.text: My experience with crepes has always been of the homemade variety - en masse. I used to make and sell crepes stuffed with Nutella or jam to fund raise for the high school French Club that I was apart of. That said, I had my "commercial crepe" cherry (?) popped at Lisa L's bachelorette brunch UYE today (7/23/11.)  I was 12 minutes late because I had the fantastic idea to just walk the almost 3 miles to the restaurant, so everybody had already ordered by the time I got there. I ordered a bottle of Pelligrino ($3,) because it was hot on that walk, and the La Jolla crepe with a side of watermelon ($7.) I admit, I had looked over their menu the night before online, so I already knew what I was going to order. I wanted to go with something I couldn't/wouldn't usually make at home myself, so the chipotle mayo is what sold me.   There was a line formed at the register and it took more than 20 minutes for my crepe to come to the table after I ordered, so everybody had already finished eating by the time I got my crepe. Oh well, we had bachelorette Ad-libs to do and MIL stories to trade while I ate and everyone drank their mimosas.   After taking my first bite, I can say that the taste exceeded my crepe expectations! It was pretty good, and was like a better version of a burrito (aka, not a thick wrapper or full of beans or rice!) The watermelon was sweet and juicy, not under ripe like most restaurant watermelon.   Overall, I had a great afternoon with 3 other southern yelpettes (Misti Y, Blair B, Lisa L) and one soon-to-be yelpette. I will return!  An aside: Looking at the Web site, the menu is difficult to find in the jumble of information posted all over the page. As well, the "justification" for catering prices is off-putting and is unnecessary. Streamlining the Web site, faster turn around for making/delivering a crepe, and making sure utensils are delivered with the crepe would bump this up to 4 stars - fan worthy food!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fancy chiller for my Perrier. 7/23/11
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DELICIOUS La Jolla crepe and watermelon. 7/23/11

6gaFE25oEatAlQYflP4aew.text: Always friendly, always delicious, and always super cautious about my issue with gluten. They're gluten-free crepes are amazing. This place is a favorite of our whole family!

RIHhy5AbeSjEOtS4NKQikw.text: Great food and atmosphere! Never saw a more personable, congenial and welcoming chef/owner ever!!! Come here!!!

f1NNX9fgnxegFV-cfsPQhg.text: I used to love eating at the restaurant chain "The Magic Pan" back in the 80's, which featured crepes.  Though they were open for lunch and dinner.  I was very excited to try Crepe Expectations while I was in Las Vegas.  My big mistake was ordering breakfast crepes. They sounded better then they really were. The were not awful, they were just nothing special. Ordinary taste.    I would bet the dessert crepes have to taste better.  Though I doubt I would drive out to  Crepe Expectations the next time I am in Las Vegas.  Bottom line- dissapointed

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Morning Crepe
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monterey Breakfast with side of potatoes

BXbwC1k3MnzyOmKh_SS4rg.text: I've been here twice, had the crepes thrice, all times the food and service were excellent!   They've only been open a couple weeks, but my boss talks about it all the time...so I had to see for myself. The first time I went in, the owners were the ones that greeted me. Friendly, smiling, and welcoming. That's definitely a plus with me. :)   I told them it was my first time, and they asked me a few questions before offering suggestions on what to try. I was super hungry so I wanted a filling-dinner type of crepe. He suggested The Bomber, w/ pepperoni added. He said you can add whatever you want to the crepe. Awesome. The Bomber has meatball, mozzarella, tomato sauce...and I added pepperoni to it.   The Bomber was definitely.... da bomb! (haha lame joke. ;) )   The crepe is a good size and it comes with a side of fruit.   My first time there I chatted with the owners and (I didn't ask for it, but they did it anyways) --- they gave me a sit down type of service. Which I appreciated a lot! Maybe I seemed confused my first time there. But the way it's set up, you order at the counter, they give you a number and they bring your food to you. Even with that type of service, the owners check up on you to see if you need anything and if your enjoying your meal. I love that! That's what top notch customer service is about! :)   My 2nd crepe, my awesome bosses ordered us some from here. I had the Sonora. It includes: carne asada steak, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, jack cheese. It also came with a side of fruit, pineapple. The fruit is different each time. :) Which I enjoy. That was delish as well.   My 3rd crepe, 2nd time here: I brought my friends along with me. It was nice too see the owners remembered me. :) I ordered the Caprese crepe and Mimosa trio sampler. You can choose 3 out of the 5 flavors available. I chose the lychee, passion fruit, and pomegranate. My FAVE was the lychee mimosa!!! I love lychee.... and I was excited to try that one. It was delicious! I wasn't a fan of the other flavored mimosa, but the lychee was my fave.   The Caprese was good. Melted mozzarella, tomato and basil. I loved the drizzle of pesto sauce over the crepe.   I forgot what my friends ordered, but they enjoyed theirs as well.   By the time we scraped our plates clean, we were soooo full but still managed to order a dessert crepe or rather a "Sweet Yum." We couldn't leave here without having one of those. So the three of us shared one. Got the Nutty Classic and added banana and strawberries! It was huge, and delicious! Nutty Classic includes nutella, fresh chopped hazelnuts, whipped cream, powdered sugar...and along with that we added the banana and strawberries! It was heaven!   I'll have to try their other dessert crepes the next time I come in.   We all couldn't stop talking about the decor of the place. It's not what you would expect from the outside. Lots of purple, it's hip yet elegant. If you go, you have to check out the bathroom! the decor in there is beautiful as well!   The prices are not bad, and they have a selection of beer, wine, coffee, waters, juice, etc. Oh they also have two tvs one with the making of your crepe, and one for entertainment.   If your looking for delicious crepes, excellent customer service, beautiful decor, this is the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe expectations bathroom sign, unique!

rSrz55JyqDg9O-ECvC2rwg.text: Great morning place!  Needs to accomodate more clients and if they ever decide to upgrade their electronics they should call Mobile Masters.   Food is worth every bite.

1Cse2t_6M-jy56xtKkqqmg.text: This is the best crepe I have ever had! The crepes are so soft and fresh and all the ingredients inside are delicious. Not only is the food amazing, the service is top notch! Mike is the man! Super friendly and has some great stories, especially about his prior military service. Thanks Mike you're the best!! My husband and I were visiting Vegas and had to come to this spot twice because of how amazing it it. We both got the Sonora which is delicious! And of course we got a sweet crepe to share afterwords, equally impressive. Definitely try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora crepe! Amaaaaazing!

-ZseDeHmoExh_UaS4kcQ4w.text: This was my second time here for lunch. The restaurant is located on the back wall of a strip mall right behind Twin Peaks and BJs restaurants, so it is a bit hard to find unless you know where to look. The first time we went for lunch, we were greeted by Louis, the owner - a big man with a big beard and a bigger winning smile.  You order at the counter and they bring your crepe to your table as soon as it is ready (pretty quickly). My wife and I shared a veggie crepe. It came with either a salad or a small bowl of soup. The soup was a chicken broth base with some noodles. Good, but nothing special. The veggie crepe was very tasty, loaded with vegetables and very filling. Today, I sat outside on the patio. It is removed enough from the parking lot that it has a nice feel to it (I was the only one outside today, so it was especially nice for a quiet meal and some reading - yes, they have free WiFi). I had  the Grand Turk, a turkey crepe loaded with chunks of turkey and guacamole and some other ingredients (I had them skip the olives). This was outstanding! And the soup today was a black bean soup that was thick and loaded with black beans. YUM! All for $8 - such a deal. And it is served on real plates with real silverware - a very nice touch. Excellent for a quick lunch that is definitely not "fast food." I will be back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A Grand Turk Crepe with a small bowl of Black Bean Soup - Yum!

4a1shkOilCJ3oIb0BKxKrA.text: THIS PLACE IS AWESOME!!!!! We saw this place on Food Network's Triple D; and now we know why it was on there!! The service, the food, the cute little place are all great! I had the perfect combination (twice; you cant mess with PERFECTION). Yes, I went back two days in a row!! My sister had Anna Banana with additional strawberries and the second day she had the Sunday Morning with bacon both were delicious!!! We wish they were on the East Coast because its so hard to find anything this delicious on the East Coast! We definitely will be back when we are in Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Combination

mHVG0sTPidNpBq-iDV4OhA.text: The service and food exceeded my expectations. The restaurant is very quaint and beautifully adorned in purple hues and cute decorations.   I love how the menu is split into sweet, savory, and breakfast crepes - I had a hard time deciding what to order! I settled on the Sunday morning, a breakfast crepe with eggs, potatoes, and cheese. It was huge and just stuffed to the brim with ingredients. It was delicious and I had a hard time finishing it all!  I also got a vanilla latte. The latte was just OK, but I've been spoiled by Sunrise Coffee's lattes so it's hard to compete with those. And as an extra treat to myself, I ordered a sweet crepe, the avalon which has pears, goat cheese, and candied walnuts in it. My girlfriends and I split that one. It was light but still filling. It has a great combination of ingredients that go well together and satisfy a light sweet tooth.  Lou was our cashier and was incredibly friendly and informative. You can tell he really took pride in the restaurant and in the food, which translated in how delicious the food tasted!  There's a camera above the crepe station and TV that shows live feed of crepes being made. That was a cool touch.  I can't wait to go back and try more menu items.This place is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deliciousness in a crepe. The Monterey
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our table, watching them make our crepes
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious stuffed crepes!

j9kAZ1nNOqvAKbC8ODISoA.text: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this gem. Lou the owner is hands on, knowledgeable and has created something truly special. The cozy atmosphere and high quality food is evidence that Lou never overlooks any detail. Everything is hand made and fresh. Lou himself does it all from cooking, to cleaning andenjoying conversations with guests. This is a placed not to be missed!

kV7pU-z5Hcwz99J6LqCEwQ.text: Heard great things about this place & finally went.  Omg greatest breakfast/ dessert ever.  Ordered the berry delight & my guest ordered Monterey. Outstanding & washed it down with a peach mamosa. If looking for a light & great tasting breakfast this is the place.

771ROEw0LGognKh46741uw.text: This place is very neat and nice!! I like it very much!! The interior is unique and nice service! I will be back again with my family. Highly recommend to others to stop by..

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U3QB7WYYFj8CZeU3RD1pGA.text: Right when you walk in you are greeted with a smile and asked if you want to sit hi or low. The food is amazing and tastes even better. All the ingredients were fresh and the atmosphere was pleasant. If you like crepes or really really thin pancakes, this is the place for you.

5Gu6jeErjBWtc6UZ0IgZCg.text: Best variety of sweet and savory crepes in Vegas!   Plus the cashier and servers were friendly and helpful. Love their atmosphere with an outside seating!

l00x4vZsBopoO7ye2bUUzg.text: Referred by my husband's new hairstylist Jacqueline from Hot Box Crepes Expectation.  I enjoyed the Rosatito, it had a lot of flavor and  created with some love. Jen was very friendly

sILx6YeHp-FoaeoMUS3ISQ.text: Heard of this place on Diners Driv-ins and Dives. I was not disappointed. They have the best crepes. I had the "The Perfect combination". So freaking yummy. They also provide free cucumber and lemon water. They are only open till 9:00 am 3:00 pm. But it's so good.  You'll wanna crepe out.

cXUMQS4tBahLNQi2aJWGiA.text: So yummy! All of the food we ordered was great. I ordered the Caprese, with chicken and a side of soup. My girls had a Monday and a Perfect Combination. Everything was fresh. The fruit was sweet and perfectly ripe. The staff was friendly and seemed to be happy to be working. A great atmosphere.   We will absolutely visit again. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4t9JxVotGWX-drqCXxSc2A.text: Came here with a friend on Sunday . . . been on my list to try for awhile.  The food was sooo yummy!  Since we didn't show up till noon, we did end up waiting for like a half hour for a table, but it was well worth the wait.  I had planned on getting a savory crepe, and then get a dessert one afterwards, but I had also gotten a vanilla latte - so I was pretty full after my crepe and latte :)    I had gotten the Monterey crepe - bacon, eggs, tomato, red, serrano pepper, and cheese.  It was yummy!  And very filling.  Lots of food in that crepe!  My daughter had the Perfect Combination - being a preschooler, she picked and ate mostly the chocolate bits and the strawberries!  But I would say it was a hit with her.  The vanilla latte was also pretty good, and filling.  And the caramel latte that my friend got also looked really good - wished I had ordered that one instead.    The service was also really good.  The owner, Lou, was behind the register, and was very friendly, as was the rest of the staff - always checking on us, and interacting with my LO.    Definitely will be coming here again!  No matter what the wait is.  Definitely want to go back and try one of their dessert crepes!

VJLrUaVFTrsWmloqn80p1g.text: Not too much seating so maybe try and go at a slow time but it was Awesome!!! sO yummy and the mimosa sampler was the way to go.. iLL BE back every weekend!

xTTKwIEH6tg5ou3nUkO_DQ.text: Once again a big thanks to my fellow Yelpers for steering me to a great spot for something different.  I went to Crepe Expectations today for breakfast.  I looked at the breakfast crepe and decided on the Rosarito although I was tempted to ditch a breakfast crepe and go with sweet.  But, I was good and stayed with the breakfast one.  The Rosarito is filled with chorizo--nicely seasoned with a small kick from the spices, scrambled egg, guacamole, and jack cheese.  With it, I had a very large, tasty cup of coffee.  While waiting for the server to bring your crepe, you can watch them make it on the large flat panel above the cooking stations.  There are three crepe making griddles and the two to the left are shown on the flat panel.  My experience with the good food and with the friendly, helpful staff will assure I'll be back for a dessert crepe.  There are outdoor tables with umbrellas for eating out.  This morning was cool enough it would have been good.  However, I saw the dog water dispenser and dog treats and I opted to stay in.  I am not dog friendly when I'm eating--inside or out.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watching her make the crepe on the flat panel above the work station.

M3aS7p6dQ9t7npFCWxEmsw.text: We always make it a point to grab breakfast here before we head out of town. The Staff is amazing, the food is delicious, and my tummy is always happy.

vJcgQiEe3xqxmxFmEQbaRw.text: They serve the best crepes I've ever had. The service is always greay, no matter how busy they are. The setup is cute, but they could really use more tables. We always make sure to visit when we're in Vegas though, because the wait is worth it. They serve both sweet and savory crepes, so there's something here for everyone.

LKmGEju3nblWRGv_iDWdNA.text: My mom and I came here for breakfast today. We both got the Sunday Morning crepe, it's SO good! I also got an iced white mocha, which I highly recommend, they have really good coffee here- hot or iced. The food was delicious as always. I love that their food and service is always consistent. I've been a patron here for at least two years and the food and service are always top notch and consistent. Great food, great service, great ambience, you can't go wrong with Crepe Expectations.

nnPTKaLMPm1BYSWVAJuPxA.text: Love this place. Nice people with great food. Already tried a second time. The place is always on weekend. Love it

P1HZMMxJmRVzMVBkwI9_7g.text: We've been coming here for years and have never been disappointed. The one small issue they used to have was that seating could get a little chaotic but they have a new method in place that keeps it nice and smooth. We were given coffee while we waited and the service/food is so good that it really is worth any wait.

H--2ZpmA8Mf2FcsLVR7QgA.text: Crepes were ok.... But realistically totally not satisfying. We tried 2 savory crepes and the flavors were just lacking. Maybe the sweet ones are better, but i wont be back. While service was good, rhe tea i ordered wasnt as described and things like that bug me. Had to ask for it as described on the menu. Bummer.

zxe_NjGv7S4TaHDgjxdD2w.text: My sis and I just took our mother here for Mother's Day and it was amazing!!! Expect to wait. But the super friendly employees and mouth watering food makes it well worth the wait! We ordered a bananas foster crepe to share, some savory crepes and coffee. All was so delicious!!! I nearly licked the sauce off of the plate from the bananas fosters! I will definitely be coming back soon!!! And next time I'll save room for some mimosas!

tVQ2Z8EnDiVzAerj8UtFgw.text: Avoid Saturday brunch. Showed up Saturday at 10:30am, didn't get to order until 11:20am (while waiting in the only available area, the bathroom hallway) Got seated at 11:30. Food came out at 11:50am. Other then the excessive wait times, this place is a local gem. Super trendy and fashionable decor. Crepes are large and include a generous portion of ingredients.  Covered outside patio was a great option for a sunny brunch.  Avoid Saturday and Sunday afternoons tho unless you are ready to wait 1hr+ to get seated. Also, no heaters for outside patio which would easily double dining space in the winter months.

6QinmzZK4jr6yKYQ-B6sOQ.text: The service is incredible, the atmosphere is wonderfully friendly, and the food is nothing short of exquisite!

GpltJDKBq46z6RB-A0AaiA.text: This place is fantastic! Well priced and great service. The owners are very fun to talk to. I recommend this place to everyone I can. It can get a little crowded, and the seating is a little tough to work with, but the food is more than worth it.

JWyPB1qiTPPzL0b8weVqkw.text: Amazing food and owners! Very welcoming environment and the food was a 10! You guys rock! Even the cappuccino was tasty! Definitely a go to place!

Qydbnx7x6oI1h5qAPajL_A.text: I absolutely love this place! Employees are extremely nice. The owner is a sweet heart. She was the one that checked me out and picked up out dishes. She interacted with her guests and made me feel Comfortable. I love it so much that my girls and I go every Monday and have our mimosas and I'm also brining my team From my salon here to hang out :) great job guys! See ya soon!

D1ITB4xl5qedicbn1K-hlw.text: Staff was super friendly. The food was a really good price not to mention delicious! If you sit at the singles bar you can watch them make the crepes through the glass. Awesome, small, family feel place to grab some brunch.

8rSTiM04m52QXQwobsCYJg.text: As a gluten free couple, we struggle to find amazing places to eat that offer a wide variety of items, especially crepes! This place was AMAZING! Every item on their menu can be made gluten free except one! Their crepes were so wonderful, we even ordered a second round of dessert crepes after we ate our breakfast ones. A fabulous establishment! We thoroughly enjoyed our experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ovkmd7Yh-Km0zLjeBe0uPA.text: Everything perfect except the wait, but fun to watch them cook. Added strawberry to my monkey and turkey crepe was delicious!  Personable service. Military discount and supporter of veterans. ( Look for his flag. )

QtzrHHR0fEba-ed0MYV9OA.text: This place was a great find. Good food. Great customer service! Must try in vegas if you are tired of the buffets

KJimNL03u685pyUdFpmNWQ.text: This is a lovely place to have a brunch or lunch! Their crepes are amazing. I tried the Italian crepe, and was delighted. I feel like their portion sizes are a little small however for the prices they charge for their crepes, but as my friend pointed out, "Dane, these are human-sized portions." So perhaps that's just me being an overeating-American. Good job on the food quality-wise, but if they ever decided to give you more food per the price they charge I certainly wouldn't talk them out of it.  They also offer a wide variety of flavors for wine flights as well. I tried the blood-orange, pomegranate, and one of the rose's, a perfect compliment to just about any of the crepes they offer from their menu!

t9n6z7busZO4kx3MFB2OTA.text: Just stopped in here for the first time. Was greeted outside and welcomed like family. Ordered the Monterey and the Avalon and both were incredibly light and favorable. Crowded space but fantastic atmosphere with classic rock music and open air view of kitchen. Every face had a smile and every word was filled with kindness. An absolute pleasure to spend an hour on a delicious breakfast from Lou and his wonderful staff!

Fpr4j2plZDDAp4akqOEw-A.text: Who doesn't love crepes? Your mouth will water as you watch them prepare the food. So many cool combinations too.  The only downside is they close early :(. I highly recommend eating here!

hiMkCZXvliq5XdjLb3bSSg.text: There are seemingly two kinds of crepes that you can get.  The first is the kind that comes from the Crepe Shack - these are acceptable, in as much as they are packed to the gills with sugar (so of course they taste good) and not much else.  The consistency is bland and you will be hungry 30 minutes later.  The second kind of crepe is what you can expect at Crepe Expectations.  It's a perfect texture with fresh, filling ingredients.  To get the negatives out of the way: this place is super cramped and always busy.  It can get  crowded and confusing if you've never been.  Often times you will be helped by an awesomely nice gentleman who will secure you a seat while you go wait in line and order your food.  This is not a full service kind of restaurant - if you want to be waited on hand and foot, go elsewhere. There are servers will who bring you your food and ask you if you need anything else and that's about it.  It's very close quarters eating.  We always end up sitting at the family style table right in the middle and have very little issues with it.  On to the excellence: the food is incredible!  The crepes are cooked to perfection and the flavor is out of this world.  We've had The Monterey, The Crepelet, and the Ana Bananas Foster, among others, and they all were delicious.  Portion sizes are perfect.  You don't leave hungry and even have enough leftover for a little snack later.  The menu is varied and there's no shock value with the pricing.  The cucumber and lemon waters are a nice way to complement your meal.  If you're in the mood for a crepe, be it sweet or savory, you should check this place out.

7y9BMVfPOFLuCnqa5sPZKQ.text: GOOD crepes, decent drinks, friendly people. But place is small and wait is kind of long. little bit.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yATIy5fIS6rfpy1kZJ2rtg.text: This place is always on point. Every time I've ever eaten here, i've been endlessly impressed on all levels. The service is amazing from everyone I've interacted with. The food is FANTASTIC. Even down to the side soup (which I'm obsessed with). The selection is also amazing, more than just your typical bananas and whipped cream. My favourites are The Frisco, The Caprese, and the Ana Bananas Foster. Also-- whoever runs this joint is amazing. The hiring is so well done and the staff seems so engaged and passionate about what they're doing. Everyone is on the same page and ensures speedy (and quality) service , which is such a hard thing to rally considering how busy these guys can be.

l3XgqZr1RFue1I9JEd7m5A.text: I would have give this experience 5 stars even after waiting almost an hour however there is no where to wait. My only complaint.  The service is incredibly nice and efficient. The food was delicious. And it was a fun experience sitting at the counter watching all the different creations. We will be back!

nQftY99cP-TPSJM7E_RTFg.text: real freshly squeezed oj and the most amazing crepes ever!!...whenever I'm craving crepes this place is always my #1

xbf6360dnq7kNMKjtf8osg.text: Love this place. The interior is calm and nice, and you get to see the crepes be made in front of you! There's even a camera at a birds eye view connected to a TV to see them make the crepes from a distance! I ordered the Monterey, and it is delicious! I'll be coming back even though I live 30 minutes away!

wKkqoqUzj4TFuA8GzSmSLg.text: Great place to have breakfast, with lots of choices of both sweet and savory crepes. Service is great and the staff are friendly. Only problem now is they showed up on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and the place is packed quickly  (even on the weekdays) so come early!

r3c7aUtDm9WmlHbtzuZlZg.text: Delicious food at great prices. People working there were super friendly and very attentive. Wife had the Monkey and I had the Caprese with chicken. We drank water. Portions were sufficient. We probably should have had the Anna Banana because practically everyone ordered it. Was busy, but we got our food pretty quickly. We came around 2 pm on Saturday; closed at 3 pm. Probably gets super busy at noon. Several selections for sweet or savory.

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese

bMiYELNqYT5XAHUIHKZtiA.text: Ohhhhhhhhh sooooooo goooood  Gluten-free, soy-free, sesame-free, gum-free crepes. They cook them with butter.  They know their ingredients and can adjust accordingly. Really nice staff as well.

_lVv54y5VyZHuGztLiWUZA.text: One of my favorite "pit stops" in Vegas. Excellent gluten-free batter. The cashier was funny, calling everyone "beautiful" or "gorgeous" or "darling", and also had the good sense to let me know that their soup of the day was not gluten-free when I mentioned I would like the gluten-free crepes, and would I like a salad instead? Yes, please!  I usually get the Pirate, which is a tuna crepe. I got just that and their lemonade of the day yesterday, and was so full afterwards that I didn't eat for almost 8 more hours--and I couldn't quite finish my crepe, either!   This place is usually crowded, but they have a decent little bar area if you're by yourself, and if you're with others you will get a number and an older man up front will help you find a table (I seem to remember he's the owner, but I could be wrong.)   I really just love this place, and along with Viva Las Arepas, is one of the places I try to hit every time I'm here.

Uu6grex8GBdCZFOoOnj3sg.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast and lunch!  I just can't get enough!  The owners and staff are some of the sweetest, friendliest people I've ever met!  I love this place!

R4mKS3UI9CTD7rlV6Opzbg.text: I cannot even begin to tell you how amazing this place is! The food here is so tasty and they have healthy options or delicious sinful options . The staff are some of the friendliest I have ever met, they take great pride in their family business. Oh and have I mentioned their mimosas... YUM! Between the creativity of their menu, the outstanding personality and service from their staff, and the overall atmosphere or crepe expectations you will certainly NOT be disappointed! The only thing that may get you down is that there is only one location, and unfortunately for me it's no where near my home  but I drive the 30minutes to see the staff, devour some delicious crepes, and bond with my girlfriends over mimosas here!!

khxqN-tPIxdFI5LrwmfHQQ.text: Incredible place! The staff was great. The only downside was the wait (holiday) but they were doing everything they could so no biggie. We had the Sonoma (carne Asada steak, salsa, Guac and cheese) and the Frisco (lemon curd, blueberries and added strawberries) both were aweeeesssoommeeee. You just can't go wrong with crepes!  Oh and the mimosa sampler is great! I recommend the white peach and blood orange, strawberry was eh

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonoma and Frisco!! Awesome

V8mmR3Jz6rp5WnugBLYNBQ.text: My first time here! My husband and I ran into the owner at Smart & Final a few months ago and had a conversation while standing in line to check out. The owner was here today and actually took our order and chatted at our table. Great place, excellent service, delicious food with many options to choose from. We'll be back!!

wQ8vfRnRTMCLdcpiqwhrJA.text: I found this place on Yelp and realized they were on the TV show DDD.  I decided just to get something to-go since I was in a rush. Finding this place was pretty easy. They had some seats outside, and I really wished I wasn't in a hurry to leave so I could enjoy the nice March weather. They weren't too crowded for Sunday lunch.  I wanted the one with shrimp, since I saw it on the chalkboard menu in the restaurant. However the register dude told me there's no more shrimp and recommended the salmon lox-type crepe, which came with a side salad.  I agreed and waited for my food to be prepared.   When I finally opened my food, I was really disappointed with the salad. There was like five green leaves!  I couldn't stand all the cream cheese without the salad. The crepe itself was good; it had a lot of salmon, which is apparently smoked in house.  It was on the dry side though.  Too bad I got my food to-go.  Maybe it'll be better when you dine in.

_LHg4RVJMIhKkETOyStluw.text: Amazing batter used in these crepes. Friendly staff and good ambiance  Will def come back for round 2,3,4 etc

OMZ-Wyk3lEXq2eSiuZvkyg.text: Found this place locally. Good food. I tried the Avalon Crepe. Goat cheese buttered pears. Honey & walnuts.  Friendly staff

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xkubg7USt7RGxBu_ILSQQQ.text: Try a savory crepe you won't regret it. The Sonata was amazing! Nice mild kick flavor I added a little Tapatio hot sauce for just a touch more kick. The lemon and cucumber water are delicious and refreshing in Vegas heat.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SUq9FlqStvgz7i3ojtl0gg.text: The first thing that comes to mind when I think of Crepe Expectations is home. It's warm, inviting and I always feel like family. The owners are incredible and have created a space that exudes warmth.   Their service and food is just beyond! We know we can always expect consistency and pure YUM!   Our favorites:  The Sonora, The La Jolla, The Sunday Morning (+Bacon), and The Nutty Classic (+Strawberries)  Don't forget the bubbles, their mimosas are heaven.   Of course it gets busy, but that's how you know it's amaze. :) they're so organized that you never end up waiting too long.   Hands down. Our favorite breakfast/brunch spot

6IgAp4oE-sOgwxl99JNnkg.text: We love this place!  They have the best Gluten-free crepes.  I had the La Jolla and my kids had The monkey.  My oldest who is not gluten free says their regular crepes are the best she has ever had.  We went for lunch and breakfast.  Every time we visit Vegas this week be our go to spot.  The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and you can't beat the food.  They also have a huge mimosa list which is an added touch.  Off the strip and totally worth the drive!

vGq1c_pXCV_jzAGdEDSjjQ.text: We Found this restaurant on trip advisors as we were passing though the area. The first thing we experienced was the great welcoming atmosphere from the server (beautiful high energy black lady who I don't recall the name of) sorry. She deserves more credit than that. She made our kids small plates of whipped cream and chocolate while we waited. Great touch!  Great attention to our experience.  We've eaten at a Crepe restaurant before so we had some idea what to expect. We ordered alternative sweet and savory plates. My Sonoran was the favorite. We all cleaned our plates. I wish we lived closer because we would be regulars. Keep up the great service and experience!!

6DnOxuuDLXec3Sc7XUXqgw.text: We enjoyed this place thoroughly. We got the Monterey and the Rosarito. Both were very delicious and came with a side of cut up bananas. Cucumber water is available for free and it's delicious.  Only downside was we got a pot of tea. For $4 we expected more than just a pot of hot water with a single packet of tea and honey in tiny ketchup packets. The tea itself was good. Just expensive for what you got.  I highly recommend this place. Very friendly staff. Quick service. Good prices.

5l25XoCkRw0Vf_sZl8X_Yw.text: Wonderful find. Excellent place, atmosphere is elegant and fun. From coffee to libations, they have it covered. Breakfast crepes are yummy. Sweet crepes, heavenly, lunch and dinner crepes, so savory. Best on top of it staff, so friendly! It's fun to watch crepes made with a front row seat, or the overhead television.  You won't be dissapointed.  Seating inside and out.

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He approved

4WM3ATY442ibrQiX56AUvQ.text: Love the variety of crepes.  Get the mimosa sampler and get tipsy! Perfect place for a date!

eBjgLgn_e9Ajz23v4tHtuw.text: I ordered the Frisco Crepe, which has lemon curd, blueberries, powdered sugar and something that looks like whipped cream, but it's actually a cloud that helps the plate slowly float down from heaven so I could devour it!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

531WZ7ELY5KFjcDEWsf7Lw.text: Before coming here I thought how good could a crepe be? Now I will forever compare future crepes to the crepes here. I definitely found this spot to be a five star based great food and great service.  As soon as we arrived we were greeted and handed menus to help us make our selections. The same man that greeted us also found us a table where we could settle in after placing our orders. I believe the owner is the one that took our orders at the counter and he was very friendly as well.   I ordered a sweet crepe to take back to the office after lunch which they held off on making until I was almost ready to leave. The man that helps find the tables remembered that my co-worker and I had ordered sweet crepes and offered to get them started as he noticed us finishing up our savory crepes. I was impressed that while checking on all of the tables and greeting everyone that he was so on top of this. Sure enough our crepes arrived right as we were ready to leave. Everything was packaged well and they included silverware.   The actual crepe was the best crepe I've ever had. The taste was excellent and I loved the way it was prepared. For lunch I had the Sonora which was steak, avocado, salsa, and cheese. It was very tasty and I loved the flavor of the steak inside. My dessert pick was the Perfect Combination which was strawberries, chocolate drizzle, and whipped cream. Yum! It was probably enough for two people to share, but I ate the whole thing because it was delicious.  The restaurant isn't huge, but they offer indoor and outdoor seating. It's nice that there is someone to help find tables for you during busy times. The restaurant seemed clean and inviting. I also loved that they have cucumber water and lemon water.   This spot is definitely a winner! I'm so glad that I gave it a try and I'm already thinking about when I can make it back for more deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect Combination
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora with side salad. Soup is the other side option.

KZaukK3sA3I_1PGhHCz9xg.text: Worst service ever! We waited 30+ minutes for two items. People got served before us that got there way after us. Asked for my food and a refund for the inconvenience and the waiter told me that's not how it works and I need "to get in the real world". Owner just sat there and watched us have an unpleasant experience. No food. No apology. Big waste of time. I was late to work. Thanks Crepe Expectations! First time there and definitely my last. Needless to say I was utterly DISGUSTED with the staff.  Reply: I've been to "fresh food" restaurants and it should NEVER take that long to make an omelette and a crepe. I asked for a refund once the food was ready because it was so inconvenient for me. And that doesn't change the fact that your staff was rude and it seems like you're condoning it... nor does it dismiss the fact that people were getting served that got there way after us. If you wanna argue morals thats fine, clearly ours clash. Have a great day!

wsucELdgsnXezOdMLMxp4A.text: Best crepery ever!!!   Pineapple Lemonade.....who knew!!! Great service and interesting choices for crepes.   Worth trying.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uI-NvfrAsXvCrWCYzgsUhw.text: Absolutely amazing! The food is amazing, kid friendly! Great place to have brunch with some friends!

dNAI-lQtbnmj7azokfm5EQ.text: Love this place.  Everything about it!  Love the owner who calls you "baby" at the register.  Love the guy that finds you a table and remembers your name.  Love the origami on the register.  Love the outside seating.  Love it all.  Love finding a gluten free crepe that tastes out of this world.  Love the fast service.  Love the decor.  Miss the camera over the crepe stations so you can watch the magic happen! And love the memories it brings back of my childhood.  Once upon a time during exam week in Dallas, Texas, me and my friends found this wonderful unique restaurant in an old farmhouse painted green and fun travertine tiled tables and cheap margaritas.  It was called chilis

h-R0tdkplCw7WMnb5wbwHw.text: This is my favorite place to go for breakfast/lunch. I have been coming here for 3 or 4 years now, and i absolutely love everything about it. Now that they moved into a bigger location there's more room, and it's not so crowded anymore. The employees are amazing, they have superb customer service, awesome prices, and everyone enjoys it there.   Great atmosphere, positive vibes, and a fantastic place to hang out and eat some delicious food.

kNt9gUygE9bZfcgnEYCW-A.text: We saw Crepe Expectations on the food network and have been trying to make a trip over from California for some time now. I can happily saw that it was completely worth it! Lou (the owner) was taking orders when we arrived to a decent sized line, Lou was super fast taking orders while still being a great host with tons of energy. The crepes themselves were amazing. I highly recommend the Chicken Verde special with lime cream, it was amazing. We had the Ana foster Crepe for dessert and it was spectacular, good sweetness and nice taste of brandy. We also had iced lattes for drinks and for a crepe place the coffee was shocking amazing.   Seating was wide open and service was super fast.

gf3OBhD8Fhcg-VY3jODh6A.text: Crepes are not my favorite, there like skinny pancakes ! But I do enjoy these crepes , truly the best in town and will be returning soon !

tbCsLULI5yrXtwfdfc0edw.text: The place to go for Crepe! So far, the best I've ever had. Came yesterday with 2 friends and enjoyed it.   Service was superb, food was fresh and we sat there from 11am-3pm! So, it was a nice atmosphere to chit chat with your friends.

oe0MoUhhHUS4xnXLShoI1w.text: Sometimes old faithful just doesn't cut it.  Been here 10+ times. It was good/novel the first 4 or 5 but it's getting old pretty fast.  The food is ok and the staff is fine, just really kind of a lackluster expierience.

Z_lqyDvpThI8iiAwqHUAXg.text: Great place for brunch, every one there is very friendly and the food is great and very reasonably priced. Whether you are looking for lunch or dessert crepes, every thing there is delicious and they have huge portion sizes. Also try their lemonade of the day and fresh juices, they are very refreshing and you get free refils.   I tried the "clucker" this time, it came with chicken sausage, sun dried tomatoes, mozzarella and scrambled egg, you also get to pick a side of bananas or soup. It was AMAZING! I try to go every weekend to try their different specials. I would definitely recommend it to every one.

LE8FArj3KYCclzCAcd94Uw.text: I'll keep it short and sweet... Crepe Expectations exceeded my expectations. I had the Monterrey Crepe which was absolutely delicious. My friend had the Crepelet (ham and cheese) which was also delicious. To top it off the service was fab!  Will definitely be returning.

ZFOw4DjcwL5WpwUw6yiDXA.text: This place was amazing! Incredibly friendly and a very vast selection. Great prices! Definitely a great introduction to crepes for me and my daughter! I'll be back within a week I'm sure of it!

KWozm8MUzxiORyU6c89RAQ.text: Best crepes in Vegas! Staff is great, my wife and I love this place! Never disappoints! The monkey is my personal favorite, the Marco Polo is great as well!

m9ruSrWF5_w9e-0jvTrv_Q.text: Been here multiple times and am never disappointed.  For such a small place they organize the seating well, the staff is always friendly and they serve delicious food.  And with champagne samplers of different flavors this place is a staple for breakfast.  Try the Marco Polo with spinach added....perfect!

LIUKJ0AiXVZOJ-2wFgyvXQ.text: As a recent Vegas transplant, I am getting used to finding these great little restaurants in strip malls.  Crepe Expectations is surrounded by excellent food however, so something must be rubbing off (see: Republic, Pin Kaow, BJ's)  I am always leery of crepe shops because the crepes usually take a long time to prepare and can come out either runny gooey or too thick and firm.  Crepe Expectations makes them just right.  They are fresh and do take a considerable time to come out but are worth the wait.  They have an awesome mix of sweet and savory crepes which helps when attempting to feed a family or a group of friends.  The La Jolla was absolutely fantastic.  For dessert we switched it up with just a Nutella and strawberry.  Awesome!

HjSORyM_Xx0JLKQAsePzDA.text: Why this place would have anything less than five stars is beyond me. The food was outstanding, proportions are generous, you get warm and personalized service plus a charming decor to boot! Want to substitute an ingredient? You got it. More meat? You betcha!   I'll try any gluten free place at least once, but here I didn't feel deprived whatsoever on account of my diet. My only regret is that I can't take this gem of a creperie back home with me.

d8sEJfoUa_SywYPhVCKTkw.text: What can I say about this place one word WOW !!! Crepes are amazing this food is tasty & worth every penny, you want good food you come here !! Please stay open past 3 !! Good food good service !! A plus !

P0nw1dOcThztY7bO_U-e1A.text: I ordered the banana fosters crepe, my husband got the Monterey, kids got the peanut butter & jelly and the Sunday morning. We all ended up sharing all the crepes and they are all awesome. The mimosa trios are great to find the perfect mimosa you like. The hubby and I both lived the strawberry mimosa and had to order the full size. Overall a great experience, great food, and the staff are awesome. I don't really give 5 stars, but definitely this is a five star.

QvFjdU7PROahP2poYuHeiw.text: One of the best breakfast places in this part of town.  The decor is very chic and electic.  Very fun for a strip mall place.  The crepes are amazingly delicious.  I've had the savory and sweet and both are airy and light on the crepe side and filling and scrumptious on the inside.  I highly recommend the flight's of Mimosa.  My Wife throughly enjoyed them with her crepe.   A must try if you are in this part of time for breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio  passion fruit, guava, blood orange

s4andvA1YCGmX0SSmdPsZg.text: Oh how I love Crepe expectations. Every time I walk in I am greeted like I am a part of a family and we have known each other for years. The owner, Lou, is an awesome guy. The first time I came in we had a a long conversation about the food industry and he gave me great advice. The creeps are always DELICIOUS and I love that you can watch them be made right in front of you. This place is always packed when I'm here and service is always fast and exceptional. I seriously recommend this place for all your crepe cravings! Currently eating: The Sonora (carne asada, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, and jack cheese) I have had a few of the sweet yum and they were all amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Watching creeps being freshly made before your eyes!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sonora

BapGZMWD2m_Y5BDf9VbHYg.text: The crepes here are to die for!! So delicious and really good portion for the price! I loved coming here on a Sunday morning for brunch! Really a local gem!

rHfsfJdnc3Y97oLCjawTcQ.text: Best crepes ever!!! The owners work here and run the place and serve the food. You can't beat that. They are super firendly and have a huge variety of food on the menu. It's a small place and the food can take awhile but completely worth the wait! Go here!!

uAnTO3HE4jGLXa8jFYDnwA.text: Good crepes!  Under $60 for 7 ppl.  The place is small tho so we had to sit outside in 90 deg heat around 10 am.  Be sure to arrive early coz this place gets packed quick
