KKu2P4vMiVe486_MkI3wjg.text: Crepe Expectations serves up a delicious choice of sweet, savory or traditional breakfast (ie. eggs, bacon, etc.) crepes + beer, wine, & champagne or mimosas.  I'm a total sucker for breakfast & bubbles!  All of the crepes are priced from $5.50-10.  Upon entry you immediately notice the intimate environment.  There are not a lot of tables and they fill quickly.  Don't worry though, they make sure every guest gets a table, no work required on your part.  Their crepes are packed full of top quality ingredients, actually bursting might be a better way to say it,  Normally when I think of crepes, I think of something much smaller.  These are more like the size of a burrito.  Being the unapologetic carnivore that I am, I ordered the Sonora, which comes packed with carne asada steak, roasted tomato salsa, guac, & jack cheese that came with a cup of fideo soup.  The steak was tender & flavorful, and most importantly NOT overcooked with a generous portion equally distributed throughout.  Boyfriend opted for the Ana Bananas Foster, which is just like it sounds with powdered sugar on top and whip cream on the side.  We visited on a Sunday morning, and it was totally hopping.  Despite the rush they sat us down immediately, and served up our bottle of champagne pretty quickly.  Due to the high demand and only 2 crepe chefs, it took a little while to get our order.  But we were happy chillaxing with our champagne together.  Plus the have live crepe cameras, so you can watch them cooking up the yum.  This really gave me an appreciation for the fact that they're cooking each order totally fresh and just for you.  Super bonus points for self serve fresh cucumber and lemon waters.  So simple, yet refreshing and luxurious.  They also offer some custom sodas for order.  Boyfriend is originally from RI, so he got really excited to see Birch Beer on the menu.     I will be back very soon, and when I return I'm dying to try one of these: the Greek, Del Mar, or the Avalon.  I really don't think you can go wrong because we could hear that everyone in the surrounding tables were ecstatic over their dishes.  The girl next to us was a enthusiastic regular, and mentioned that they will do ingredient substitutions or add-ons.

ThH_a7tsMlI4yfHlw3IFHA.text: A bit of a drive from the Strip, but ohhhhh so worth it!  Amaaaazing food, especially the crepes, which are of course the main attraction.  Yum!

fdY9X4d10suV8Rzdm3cyAg.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. The crepes and services are excellent. I am impressed on how they can keep up the quality of the food and service given how busy they can be. You should be prepared to wait on a long line. But trust me, it will be worth the wait. BOTH savory and sweet crepes are EXCELLENT. You can't go wrong.

yaC0D6u2bQE3RbJSPG7Gdg.text: Super impressed!! Great food and they have tons of homemade drinks. Really cool and different. I enjoyed "the clucker", a sausage and chicken filled crepe.. could only finish half, so come hungry. We live in boulder city, and wish this place was in boulder city, but we will definitely be back again. If you haven't been yet....Go.

ed9rfwiiAJvw7Z-MErqEWg.text: After reading all about it on Yelp for months and begging my bf to try it, I finally coaxed him into it. We were not at all disappointed and couldn't believe we've been missing out for all these months. The mimosas are a must! The white peach was my favorite but the blood orange and pomegranate were so delicious. We also decided in getting 3 creeps because we couldn't really pick between them. After much deliberation we got The Sunday Morning,The Greek and, The Banana Foster one. They were all so good we were fighting for the last bites! This place is a must try! Mmmmm.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White peach, pomegranate and blood orange mimosas. Mmmm!

s4Y89KdZHXMnPI5SJvMxgA.text: Great place people and food are awesome. We will be back.  Everyone is super friendly and made sure food and service was excellent. Owner even came over to our table and spent time talking with us about how he started. Best service and crepes in Las Vegas

5kGk84ewTo_ailEtm2RK0Q.text: Absolutely LOVE this place!  The staff are super nice and the crepes are great!  The Monterrey is by far my favorite...we have made this place our weekend breakfast spot!

44hcxc2e63IFCY9J4xXgMg.text: Great variety of sweet & savory crepes. Few different flavor a of mimosas to choose from, blood orange is great. Always a wait on the weekend so be patient.

-lsmIA_XdkCuAYnf3sZCkg.text: Fantastic Crepe place. I've never liked a crepes before and now I come every week. Breakfast crepes and sweet crapes are fantastic. The owner takes pride in his work and it shows. It's no wonder tourists come from the strip to eat here.

mopo69Dx07nbB1hnP-Re2A.text: This is by far my fave crepe place! Sweet and savory is the perfect combo for me and my husband.  The service is fantastic! When we go, we sit in front of the window so my kids can watch the crepes being made, and one of the servers there hooks my girls up with unlimited amounts of whipped cream and shares his pictures of his cats with them.  This place is more than great food, they are friendly and offer great service!

TE9jRFNPoGQ-SP5hOsjuTw.text: Great and friendly service! I had their Sunday morning crepe and it was delicious! This busy place needs more room! I will definitely be coming back!

JjjCrjI7f2qy4lfVf0zaOw.text: Very fresh, tasty food had the carne sada crepe friggin awesome! Owner introduced himself, car show out front bonus afterwords. A over the counter camera allows you to view your food being created right in front of your eyes. Nice huh? Fresh squeezed juice, self serve coffee, great service as well-kind of a coffee house atmosphere which is fine outside dinning as well. So y'all come and giver a try

dr8Vz4inVKnoLHzboLM0rA.text: My family and I were visiting the Vegas area and wanted some delicious breakfast. This did not disappoint. The owner takes pride in his work and it shows through the fantastic food that he served. Everything was made to order and reasonably priced. I would definitely go there again.

U-vXiE-okQc2nCCRH0NRDg.text: If you are looking for a great brunch spot in Henderson you likely can't find any  better.  The prices are reasonable considering the great quality and portion sizes which are generous.  Good customer service, it's no surprise it pretty much unanimously gets great reviews.  Purchase the monkey with strawberries and you won't be disappointed!

OL8rbnRpj9JlVt4O1k04lw.text: The staff, food, and ownership of this gem are absolutely sublime...the Sonoma with added Serrano is amazing!  Without a doubt our new favorite!

mdPfc2ljKi_ACm6yw0geow.text: Love this place! Great food and super friendly staff! The only negative is the line to get in, especially during the weekend. I guess I am not the only one who loves this place!

Vzoon1tNoqVMdU8WAJsMlA.text: Hands down the BEST crepes I've had in a while! I went with my best friend and we shared 3!! They were that good! We started out with the caprese. I wouldn't recommend it. It was good, but it wasn't great. So we decided to get the Sonora. Carne Asada with avocado and pepper jack cheese... Oh, my gosh!! It was SO GOOD!!! Definitely recommend it! We ended it with The Monkey. Which I believe is bananas, Nutella, chocolate drizzle, whipped cream, and powdered sugar. When ordering they asked if we wanted to add fresh strawberries. I wouldn't recommend it because it's perfect without them. The service was AMAZING! Everyone was so friendly! And bonus, in the bathroom they have this sea salt scrub that is to die for! It makes your skin Soo smooth! Loved it! I definitely will be telling all my friends and returning often!

OvtrX1Fp4ccmOSxMUJjelQ.text: Great food , very cute restaurant. I had the bananas foster and Monterey creeps which were both delicious. Fresh watermelon juice was excellent . They also have a variety of flavored mimosas which looked good but didn't get a chance to try. Only problem was the service was a little slow. Would definitely come back here .

rX-vwMsOZzrBlAVENuPiDQ.text: Love everything here!  Wish it was open for dinner and late night dessert. And the mimosas are the best. It's hard to choose my favorite flavor.

ptOL6IfNaeFrGe0Y0eAKbQ.text: The only bad thing about this place is that it is 5 hours from our home! From the moment we walked in we were treated with the best customer service we have had in a restaurant for as long as we can remember. The food was excellent! I was especially impressed by the way the owner put in a special order for a PB&J crepe for my 3 year old and spent time talking to both of my kiddos. We got our food quickly and were impressed by the clean and hip ambiance of the restaurant! We will definitely be back whenever we visit Las Vegas!!

Mb0wGqcKz7We6xTH5GEHBQ.text: Stay away from this place.  The rudest staff ever!!!! I went to the counter and the man with the. Overgrown red beard was the rudest person I have ever encountered. He was a smart ass. There menu is limited and way over priced.  This is somewhere that needs to close shop.

vrtczzuF602brHVVDHi46Q.text: Our major 'difficulty' was determining whether it merits a 4 or 5 star rating. Based on everything but the dark, indoor decor, it rates 5 out of 5. Our experience was an excellent one.   1. First, we strongly recommend this crepe restaurant, Crepe Expectations.   2. We ordered Ana's Banana Fosters and one of their (many) signature dishes, the chorizo crepes, and the taste was - as I see another reviewer writing, 'spot on'. Not much in the world of food beats an original taste. Discovering a restaurant that has an entirely unique, hand-crafted, menu of dishes, is remarkable. The coffee was good, including the decaf, and it was endless.  3. The price range was excellent, unexpectedly reasonable for a small, specialized restaurant. The service - we sat outside - was very good at the ordering point and as it was brought to us in a good time frame, outside.   4. The menu has a plethora of unique items but remains 'crepe-centric'. It serves a breakfast, brunch and lunch menu, as well as coffee and liquor items.  5. When we were finished, I actually asked to speak to the owner. I had a suspicion it was the gentleman who was ordering some items - and it was. I complimented him on our enjoyable meals and began talking to him about all things crepe and cooking. It was a good conversation. One item in particular (there are several) that he is proud of is that he does not use is a freezer.   PS - I want to add that although it closes at 3 pm, we were eating and drinking our coffee at 3 pm without any pressure for us to depart. Simply another positive point to mention.

Pd7S5A59z105RDx4DNYJAA.text: Love this place! My wife and I eat there at least a couple times month. Wish it could be more! Family owned and great food and service

vewQI9TZLtNHW4WUSs0XmA.text: Oh my goodness! This place had the most delicious crepes EVER! I had never really tried crepes as a meal before, but this was so scrumptious that I may have to go back again!  I ordered the Sonora, which is filled with Carne Asada and guacamole. So flavorful and you can taste the freshness. The soup that came with it was light and a good compliment to the crepes, despite the 100+ weather outside.   What's more is I appreciate good service and friendliness from the staff, and I have to say that I felt right at home at this place. Lou, the owner, came over and asked us how everything was and made sure we were enjoying the food.  Aside from the food, it's a nice eatery. The decor was nice. The only downside, and the reason it lost a star from me, was the fact that they are not open during hours that normal working people would be able to enjoy the food. Since they're on the opposite side of town for me, I'd have to make a deliberate effort to make the trek out to eat some crepes. Regardless, it's definitely worth it!

O3kccsGvI4NhknqbAp2cQg.text: I'm not a fan of crepes, but the BFF was insistent we wait the 40 minutes and get her Sunday brunch on.  Pleasantly surprised, the place is well decorated, has really friendly staff, and a wide selection of sweets and savories.  She loved her strawberries and chocolate, and I was down with the Sonoran  -- steak cooked perfectly and guac in every bite, something other places might skimp on.  Her son is fantastically picky so he ate the shrimps and left the creme and crepe behind, but devoured three bowls of fideo soup ($1 each, yay!)  Otherwise Henderson pricing, like a can of Diet Coke is $2, and the craft sodas are $3. Luckily there's a lovely pitcher of lemon water on hand, and our meals came out under $15 each.

OGtAbEXgP7aTJc9Sfed1fg.text: The dude in charge has a pretty sweet beard. This should conclude this review because nothing else needs to be said, but Yelp asks for a longer review. I had The Rosarito and my girlfriend had The Elvis, one of the specials of the day, and a mimosa sampler. Much like the service, neither crepe disappointed. Will definitely return.

D_XQZUvDd-MKBbZK-di5Fg.text: Nice spot for brunch with my sister. We had the Sunday Morning and Crepelet then shared The Monkey for dessert - nutella, bananas, chocolate drizzle. Delicious! The portions are quite large. The mimosa sampler is a good deal and a must try. They had at least 13 different flavors on the board.

Pp9jcl6WEzmM78oM4CV3gw.text: I went to this place a couple times and took some new friends there today. However the service was unacceptable and we were asked to leave BEFORE we finish our food. The owner(older male) stated that he need to turn the table, but we could not withstand this type of treatment being there for merely 15 mins. This is quite upsetting as I thought the food was great. However, i do not recommend this place as the food just can't offset by the type of degrading treatment.   I will never go back.

kMBBSayXN5tlY-xL_REm9g.text: The foods not bad but they definitely don't want you to come and socialize while u eat! They want their customers to just shut up and eat or order to-go! Once u hit the 30 minute mark from minute u walk in the door, they are ready to pounce on you and kick you out! Therefore the environment makes u feel quite unwelcome!

ePjr5yyxcJnFalm5MgsQUQ.text: This place is great and the employees are so friendly, foods wonderful we need a place like this on Chicago

600It0s3WdhoiQGRt7eEWA.text: Went there on 11/3.  I had the Greek and my husband had the Pirate.  The portion sizes were generous, mine had a lot of chicken breast meat.  Unfortunately the chicken was very dry and the crepe needed more tzatziki sauce. I had a bite of the Pirate crepe - it tasted like a tuna salad sandwich in eggs, nothing special.  The black bean soup served on the side was awesome, however. The restaurant itself is very noisy and cramped inside so we sat outside.  Prices are very reasonable and the service was good.  If we ever go back we would probably try the sweet crepes based on other reviews.

kdmpRfcISx3osDJcWwdgKA.text: WONDERFUL place with consistently excellent, unique crepes and beverages only to be outdone by the impeccable service. (These are not your typical crepes, either). I can't wait for my next visit and wouldn't hesitate to recommend Crepe Expectations to anyone. Thus far, we've tried the Greek, Del Mar, Frisco, Caprese, Ham&Egg w/Swiss, and several others and they have ALL been fantastic! Be sure to try their great mimosas and coffee!

f-T_rpFPWnDym3cQdxss8g.text: So tried this place a couple of times and was disappointed. The crepes are okay and the sides are pretty bad. The soup as a side is not worth truing and the side salad wasn't the best. The place is pretty small and limited in seating. Each time that i go there is aleays someone looking over you while you eat waiting for the table....

Q2t87RbziQ8LawzjXe9GKw.text: Main reason you come here is for crepes, right? Well this establishment indeed hits the spot, my mom is the reason I had been looking for a crepe spot and I'm glad I did look because this place made me love crepes.... These crepes were not crap, in fact they were scrumptious and savory, hot to the taste, fresh and fluffy, decently sized, and the place is clean everyone that works there has a smile and is checking that all is well, I even added my own origami to the collection! I love the fact that you can see when they're making your food since I'm such a germaphobic I'm happy that I can see the process and how clean it is kept.  Yes you pay when you come in and then find a spot.  I like to come early, like 9:00 in the morning when they open because if you come later it's usually packed, but well worth the wait if you have the time.  Bottom line, this is the spot for crepes, breakfast crepes, lunch crepes desert crepes, pretty much anytime crepes. Did I mention I love crepes? Well only crepe expectations crepes.  And the wine stuff is cool too.

hCSRJZuxrEIk4UOV4ai7Jw.text: Happy Birthday to Me! Best Crepes but that's just the beginning the owner chef and his staff are so friendly!! Best service on Eastern in Henderson!!!!

7QduL7v_nKzFlTofXh8JUQ.text: Totally not what I expected to walk into, much better than my expectations. A cute, cozy little spot with a few tables, some counter space, and some tables outside as well. What we ordered: The Caprese, The Sunday Morning, The Avalon, a vanilla latte and a cafe caramel. Starting with the coffee: excellent! And only $3.75 for a large mug, it was delicious. Now the crepes: the pesto on the Caprese was wonderful, so much flavor. I don't eat chicken but my friend said it was flavorful and high quality. The Sunday Morning was egg, cheese, and seasoned potatoes, everything I love about breakfast wrapped up in a perfectly cooked crepe. The Avalon was sugared pears, candied walnuts, honey and goat cheese. Simply amazing. If you don't like goat cheese, I don't like you! :) The service was wonderful. We could tell the owner was walking around, greeting tables, making sure everyone was happy, and everyone definitely was! I'll be back to try more fantastic crepes soon!

QYeKcU68sg4iWkMlvFRdZA.text: My husband and I came here this morning. It's a cute little restaurant but I found it rather dark in there. My husband had the carne asada crepe (can't remember the exact name) with guacamole, tomato sauce, Monterey jack cheese, and I had the Sunday morning crepe with scrambled eggs, potatoes, and cheese. My husband's crepe was soo delicious! We both loved it! Mine was good too but lacked a bit in flavor. I kinda wished I the one my husband got, lol. He also got the watermelon juice and loved it! I got the mango mimosa which was also delicious but I thought it was going to have juice in it with the champagne. It was more of a champagne with mango flavor. Overall, it was a great little restaurant with a friendly atmosphere. The service was also excellent and the workers were friendly. We will definitely be back again!

T8_dwf7caEuJgGQyqEg4bQ.text: I went here for the first time and my mind was blown. I can't get over how friendly every single employee was. It was simply amazing and made my day. Even if the food was bad, I'd still go here just for the great atmosphere with such positive people. However, the food was just as amazing as the people! The Monkey, with fresh strawberries, was the perfect crepe and the proportion of ingredients was spot on!

a3mZFnDVu-GFHIhWyeCihg.text: Great good food and great service. Not a franchised location and one can tell by the service and quality of food. If you are in the area stop by at this place. Ordered the Greek crepe and nutty crepe.

_uzcpKVdT5lKemXgJAIWfw.text: Went here after viewing on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives.  We had a short wait, and then told to order at the counter.  Super friendly service - recommended the BBQ Pork Crepe, which was phenomenal, and to only be topped by the cole slaw...OMG - absolutely divine!  Both kids had a fruit crepe (berries and a strawberry/chocolate).  I had the bacon, egg, etc. crepe.  Everything was absolutely delish and this will be a stop every time we visit Vegas.  Loved the water choices (lemon and cucumber), and the kids had a juice blend that was great.  I love how I left full, but didn't leave feeling "blah" after the typical eggs/meat/potato breakfast.

NMXLZl1lN3HFgRdcOirgGQ.text: Picked this on a whim.  Service, food, everything was awesome!  We had one breakfast crepe, one savory.  They do sweet too.  On weekends one employee helps manage seating which keeps the whole thing delightfully civilized.

sik9yDnttDczFLxlqmRF7w.text: Super delicious!! I had the Monterrey and it was awesome!  At first when my wife told me about this place I was skeptical.  Breakfast food in a crepe?  Well I was very happy I went!! My crepe had bacon, eggs, mild serranos, jack cheese, and a tomato blend.  I paid 75 cents and had a half of a sliced avocado placed on top!  I miss my Texas breakfast tacos and this is as close as I can get (plus mimosas sampler!!) Will definitely eat here again!!

nUEF1dxa7jMwjvUrtZTjQw.text: We went for breakfast on a Saturday morning and had no wait at all. We ordered the Rosarito and the Caprese with chicken. Both were delicious! The Rosarito was full of flavor and make sure you ask for the homemade salsa! Meat lovers will love this satisfying breakfast. The Caprese was fresh and light in flavor but still very filling. The owner "Lou" stopped by at the end of our meal to make sure the food was ok and thanked us for coming in. He also informed us that everything is made in house without any additives like sulphates, etc. That small little gesture made the experience that much better!

8DEfKoCV4yWtNv9CQBuwCg.text: Wonderful customer service the sweet crepes are delicious they serve a variety of mimosas pineapple, strawberry Etc... Also I love that you can see the cooks making your crepes overall it's a great spot

L97qCsI570xh1pJSf9Ddqw.text: If you are looking for a place to have a unique and tasty breakfast, look no further! The decor is modern and warm and very, very cozy. Perfect if you are looking for a casual breakfast spot.  As far as the food is concerned, you will not be disappointed!  We had the Rosarito and the Sonora and they were both great. Oh, and please try the watermelon mimosa...it is the BEST.   Nice portions, quality ingredients, and amazing service catapult this place to the top of my breakfast restaurant list.  PS. Although the self serve coffee was not hot enough, it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora crêpe with added mushrooms and roasted tomato salsa on the side. AWESOME
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa flight. We tried  mango, passion fruit and watermelon (best one of the three)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not bad for a big breakfast with mimosas included.

BozXcbztUGctx9P3sxsLIw.text: Exceeded our expectations.  Reasonably priced.  Helpful service. So many to chose from can't wait to go back to try more! I love the savory and my husband loves the sweet.

HlOsdYoLoXdhURQ7GPY8cw.text: Love love love this place! Delicious crepes of many styles. My favorites are the dessert crepes but I also like the savory. Love the lemon water and cucumber water. I am also a huge fan of the old fashioned sodas.

mcoWJxucQhNg35qeu6ijuA.text: Service was fantastic. Food was fantastic. Variety was fantastic. Prices were fantastic. Even gave us a to go cup for our coffee. Sometimes, it's just really that simple. We were from out of town and randomly stumbling on this place. It was a delightful surprise.

Fb5SWkUNMGkq__csd80_jg.text: Recommended from a hairstylist Jacqueline from hotbox. Jen help with the ordering great awesome ppl. Would highly recommend this place

uJcsvgfZzNf_eDRS9u1e_g.text: The first time we went, I had the one with goat cheese, pear, and some other stuff inside (sorry, I forget what it was called).  The second time we went, I had the Berry Delight.  Both were delicious and filling.  I wish they had a sampler platter so I could just try them all, because it's so hard to choose!!!!

BKKbKHKWmUWrJ7emCwhAhA.text: Like place very much. Good selections especially for gluten free allergy but prices are high and portions are small.

APa4gjWtO97lCjcdzF95VQ.text: Wow! This place has awesome Crepes I had the rosarito crepe and I loved it.  My daughter had the Anna banana crepe and it was perfect for her.  The wait time was 10 minutes. I want to thank Mike for the friendly service he provided. The staff are very efficient I will come back and visit when I'm in the area again :)

626YZJsmmvHvFP122mw8Tg.text: Keep the expectations to a minimum, and you'll be fine.  A friend recommended this place.  I question his taste, or lack of.  I didn't mind waiting, but to expect a tip, while giving little or no service isn't my idea of an experience.  You have to order, and pay at a counter with a huge stack of money folded hinting at a tip.  The set up doesn't utilize space at all.  After 20 minutes, and no chocolate coffee, which was supposed to be delivered, my roommate had to go to the counter, ask, and be met with attitude.  The owner's sorry doesn't cut it!  After another 20 minutes, we finally get a crepe which Paris Buffet can make MUCH better.  It was my first time there, and it will be my last.  Do yourself a favor, and skip this place.  The owner is too cheap to staff the place properly.  Like many other places, giving the customer the service they deserve has gone out of style!

Yy5ZNw2swjXWZAHW21hB8w.text: We stopped in while wrapping up our Vegas portion of our road trip. These crepes are to die for. I had the Monkey; Nutella, bananas and added strawberries YUMMY! My husband and son had a savory crepe and said they were truly exceptional.   My youngest (3 years old) was a little cranky and tired from the previous day and was being a bit picky. The lady making the crepes made him a cheese only crepe at his request just to make him happy. Sitting at the crepe bar area (not sure what the exact name is) was fun to watch her work. She talked with us and made the experience that much more amazing. Everyone one there was super friendly.  Defiantly worth to stop!

fhriar-1HLqZCWwXUaPfdQ.text: Was planning on going to eat, but they stop serving breakfast at 11am! My wife suggested to get crepes at m.yelp.com/biz/jean-phil... I really wanted to try some place new, so we ended up here. When we walked in the door, my wife realized that it wasn't a traditional restaurant that you sit down and order, and she was at first very hesitant to eat here. We approached to counter to order, and her reservations were quickly alleviated after talking to the gentleman behind the register, who happened to be the owner. He suggested the chicken crepe special for our friend, and my wife and I split a sweet and a savory crepe. We also ordered a Mimosa trio sampler. It was hard to select between the 13 flavors! When we come back we are going to add fresh spinach to our savory crepes, especially the Marco Polo crepe that had Italian sausage. Adding the spinach will make it better. The owner did suggest that we add mushrooms, which was an excellent recommendation. Overall the three of us decided the crepes at the Belliago were slightly better, but we all would come back to this place again. The excellent service, enthusiastic owner, and supporting small businesses with great tasting food makes this place a solid four star adventure.

oQgRqWnyVWbox2XE3gBPZw.text: Not a big fan of crepes but these were pretty good. Next time I won't order the Nutella crepe for the filling tasted more like chocolate syrup than hazelnut chocolate spread. I love how the management keeps this place very clean!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella!!!

nem8EAk4L1acfjQvcDd8TQ.text: This place rocks!  Amazing crepe selection, fantastic food quality, good coffee and great customer service.  The owner obviously takes pride in his restaurant and it shows.  I will definately bookmark to return when we are back in Vegas.  Bananas Foster Crepes are the bomb!!!

uZDk3epeEJD3EKE9ldnEvQ.text: Every time we eat here the food is fantastic! I had the Monterey crepe, bacon egg and cheese and added avocado, it is savory and light, we love it here. The owners Lou and Jennifer are a kick and theyre always smiling and have a great attitude!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon, eggs,and cheese with avocado crepes, fantastic !!

YnqPT2dxO8vX1JLkYFm03g.text: I grew up eating home made crepes && was super excited to find this hidden treasure. I've been every morning for the past 4 days and can't get enough!! Great customer service and of course delicious crepes and drinks.The only down side is the fact that they close at 3pm and the wait can be a bit long at times. They should def. expand the inside as well just because the sitting area is a bit clustered.. aside from  you'll be happy you stopped in!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Berry Delight!! My favorite :)

7uJc6oqACMfuWPK-FOx9RQ.text: Great place, Great Service & the food is amazing!  I  love Crepes!  - YOU WILL TOO!  Just cannot get enough of this place!!  If your a vegas local near Henderson you better do yourself a service & try it for yourself.

JqyZ7V9x-X_BrJ4CncQNMA.text: Sweet and savory crepes. Everything was amazing! Even the coleslaw was great. And did I mention the service? Super friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely be back.

kEudHi1h-H4gm6HXIJPeDg.text: I love love love this place. Went on a Sunday around 11am and I knew they had tv's so I could watch football. There were a lot of people waiting but we got seated in about 30min which isn't too bad considering the crowd we saw out there but we were just a party of 2 so maybe that's why it went by quicker. The berry crepe with Nutella is a must. I couldn't choose between savory or sweet but since my boyfriend got a crepe with chicken eggs and sausages I went for a sweet one. The crepe itself was delicious. I could eat it by itself. It was flaky and a crispy at the ends with a super light buttery taste all throughout. I would recommend this place to anyone who's looking to get breakfast or lunch.

hdsImeNsSNn202XTZkgMVg.text: I have to say I was impressed. I'm not a big crepe or pancake person but this place was nice. We shared the monkey, our company got the berry delight and a breakfast yum (can't remember which). They all were huge! Can't imagine finishing one by myself let alone the little one and I shared and we couldn't finish  The strawberries, banana and Nutella was really a good combo without being overly sweet. We didn't want whip cream and the guy who took our order recommended adding strawberries to the monkey which was awesome. The service was excellent, there was a mess made and the guys were helpful and quick to respond. You go up and place your order and get your drinks but they are quite helpful and attentive still The only reason a star is missing as not enough seating during crowded times, we got the last table.

q8X-F5Yn3y4CNKvJf0FGsw.text: Crepes were huge & stuffed, but Soggy. Savory steak crepe was cold. I love crepes, but was disappointed. Small place. Ended up sitting outside. Service was friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

b8U3tiIH6r5TakVV8ig0gg.text: This place is amazing. Lou & Jenn are the best. And I don't know who has more personality - them or their food... the la Jolla is my favorite with a mimosa flight... love the white peach... and the cucumber water. And sitting outside on a warm sunny Saturday morning. We take all of our out of town guests here. But don't forget to check in with Mike to get a table before you order!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa flights with Auntie Debbie
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa flights!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Even more mimosa flights

xo14w0PKxVeP6Z11WeSg0w.text: Best brunch place in town. The owner is so kind he took our order and even came to our table to chat with us. come early because this place gets packed! Super awesome service and amazing food! I honestly wish I could have tried more crepes but just one filled me up all day, seriously! Also, the raspberry mimosa was my favorite you should definitely try it. I wish I could give this place more stars.

kFNAXi1ekgRNzNZbV3s2bg.text: The crepes are huge, delicious, and cooked to perfection. I had the fresh squeezed strawberry lemonade on the side which you get a free refill with. Service was on point, very friendly staff!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory - eggs, potatoes, and cheese crepe with sliced bananas on the side
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh squeezed strawberry lemonade with a free refill

C2mTcLpLqfprcabCakZk4Q.text: Beautiful local spot, although I am not a huge crepe fan, my daughter LOVES crepes and we have tried plenty of places. I ordered the reuben and she ordered a berry one. Unfortunately neither were that great. Probably won't be back.

yGdTTeGOjqGPMrtUBkCdMA.text: Oh my, YUM.  We woke up late and decided we wanted brunch.  This was a  perfect, simply decorated order yourself cafe. We ordered  at the cashier, our mimosas came fast.  We ordered the mimosa sampler, watermelon, orange and raspberry.  They have 13 different mimosa flavors.  He ordered the crepelete, and I ordered the Monterey crepe, both savory and delicious with a choice of bananas or cottage cheese on the side.  Self serve coffee for $2.65.  We both were very satisfied with this place.  DELICIOUS.

Kk3tQH9RgrbZaWxU3nEjKg.text: Incredibly friendly owner and staff. Nice interior and there is seating available outside as well.   The crepes are delicious and we would definitely go here again.  Berry delight - not too sweet with lots of whip cream to add if you want it sweeter.  Sonora - absolutely delicious with the Mexican-style favors of a steak burrito.  William Tell - amazing dessert flavor of an apple pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry delight

UjdPe8CPWL-REbtPsIenhg.text: One of the coolest environments I've seen at a restaurant! You can tell that the owner loves what he does! Also the food is very affordable and extremely tasty! Oh and my friend is a celiac  (allergic to gluten) and everything on the menu can be made gluten-free. #winning

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This picture shows the delicious Monkey Crepe.

OtCQ0HjMqykjOd_jTO5cPQ.text: Service: We were greeted right as we walked in the door by the nicest guy ever! He quickly cleaned a table at the bar so that my daughter could watch them make the crepes. Don't worry though, if you can't sit at the bar you can watch them make the crepes on a screen above the bar. Everyone working there worked with a smile, and was pleasant and delightful.   Food: I can't describe food that delicious! We had the crepe that had cheese, pepperonis, and tomato sauce of sorts. The description does not do it any justice at all... It was yummy! We then ordered the dessert crepe that has Nutella, bananas, and chocolate sauce. It was so good!!! The thing is lots of people can make a crepe, but these were a perfect texture, great flavor, and truly just delicious! There are many options to choose from! For the price and the service I will be back over and over, even though it's a 30+ minute drive for me!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert crepe!!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner crepe

AS6uI82IE1qzM5XN1mMB8g.text: Love this place! Delicious food and outstanding service--consistently! They're always so friendly and welcoming. I guess they've moved since we last visited, very spacious now!

AoQn8cUfcW-BcqIlbfJqIQ.text: Normally about a 15 min wait, amazing crepes. I always order the Marco Polo wit the mild Italian sausage.   Get the MIMOSA TRIO ! So many flavors to choose from and they're all good!  Amazing atmosphere, food and drinks.

JGWXojTUPKd7TyAGGWmPPA.text: This really could be my favorite restaurant of all time. These crepes are beyond amazing. If there was a Crepe Expectations in the L.A. area I would be going there constantly. I've tried The La Jolla, The Frisco, The Berry Delight, The Rosarito, The Monterey, and The Marco Polo, and they were all incredible. I promise you will not be disappointed no matter how high your crepe expectations are.   Also, the dudes that work here are pretty cool dudes.

iYLmP4-bQ1NVeoZGYCLVZQ.text: My husband and I arrived at 9am on Thursday and were able to order and sit immediately. The menu had so many delicious choices! The bearded cashier pointed out the daily specials and flavored water, which was delightful!   I ordered the rueban and the avalon, both of which were great! The portions were spot on, and there was even a live feed TV that allowed us to watch the crepes being made!  The service was perfect! Great attitudes, very helpful and friendly. Our waiter suggested and brought me mustard for my rueban and made sure I had everything I needed for my pot of tea!   The bathroom, you guys. They have sugar scrub. It was so lovely and really made my hands feel clean and soft. It was a fantastic surprise!  Thank you for fulfilling my Crepe Expectations!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rueban and side salad. WAS THAT CUMIN I TASTED IN THE DRESSING!? So good..

3BkILS7RIv1nsnnhjR2iwQ.text: Fantastic crepes.  Arrived at 9, quickly got a seat and checked out the menu.  We shared a savory crepe (egg, sausage), followed by a sweet (Nutella, Strawberries, Bananas).  Both were Gluten Free, and both were amazing.  Talked to the owner a bit, mainly about the bucket of Nutella they used - and she told us about how Nutella will soon be distributing their magic chocolate elixer in piping bags (in addition to jars).  The food and ambiance were so good, we went back the next day.  Got there around 10, and it was packed - we were lucky to find two available seats.  By the time we finished, there were about 12 people in line waiting for a seat.  On this trip, I had the Elvis - Bacon, Peanut Butter, Caramel, and Banana.  Yum!  For those that are gluten intolerant:  They really, really, *really* try to keep their gluten free food gluten free, and you can watch every step of the process.  However, the woman running the gluten-free bakery next door who's Celiac said that they aren't perfect, and she can't eat here.  I suspect it depends on how much gluten you can withstand - odds are, there's very, very little included, but this place wouldn't be certified gluten-free.  [I avoid gluten, but am not Celiac, so this was fantastic.]

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Monkey - nutella, banana, chocolate drizzle, whipped cream, and powdered sugar.  And strawberries.  (Gluten-free)
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Marco Polo (gluten-free)

tD1Ow2wiNFZuCBkxP9w5Ow.text: So yes the wait was long, but what do you expect when a place is good? It was def worth the wait but if it wasn't that long I would have ordered more. We had a party of 8 which did take a little longer to sit as the place isn't that big but that's expected with larger parties.   Everyone enjoyed their crepes and service was very friendly. Def worth a try if you don't mind waiting a little.

vLQmNU9vnYErScGlz_eZjg.text: Saturday morning brunch date with my sister! Was expecting this place to be a little different its actually a place where you order at the cashier and then they bring the food to you! Its rather small inside and out. I got the nutella and banana crepe and it was delicious! Definitely want to try more out! The service was also pretty great (:

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sonora and fidel soup
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Bt_XvTIAZZA370EVaakNOA.text: Pack your patience! I came here for lunch today and the whole place was packed.  We were greeted right away and our order was taken promptly.  They let us pick our seats (indoor or outdoor, the whole place was packed!). They have a variety of delicious sounding crepes that I was excited to try; today I ordered the Little Italy.  They do have drinks you can purchase or you can get fresh water for free while you wait.  Today, the wait was rather long.  It took about 45 min after ordering our food to get it.  I only have a hour to take for lunch so we couldnt sit and enjoy our food right away and had to ask for to-go boxes.  The food was delicious. It's definitely a place to go to if you aren't on a time crunch.

30fm7JeGuZyB38pHByLzcg.text: There are no better crepes anywhere. We make this spot a "must" whenever we're in Vegas. Jen and Lou are the most gracious hosts. But the wide variety of savory and sweet crepes is unparalleled. Bring a friend or 2 when you visit this establishment - you'll want to share on order or two or three just to try everything. So worth it. I'm fond of the Rosito and the Nutty Classic. Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Nutty Classic
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V9xIpTrggPcmL9Mf0hVHWg.text: Crepe Expectations definitely exceeds our expectations! The crepe are on point and F*ng delicious. Th staff is super friendly and it's great to get to order and talk with the owner. This a a must if you haven't been here and a great way to start your day.

1oWWV8x8oZlnodKa66Nf1Q.text: This place was real good.  Nice portions and quality ingredients for very reasonable prices with a bonus of folks that work here with a sense of humor.  We will definitely be back.  Had an interesting Reuben crepe.  Sons had desert crepes.  All were wonderful.  Great place to go!

JY3g32xpy8e8MRbc6sN59A.text: Then wait to be seated was 30 minutes. The wait for food was almost another 30. Seriously? No food is that good. Not even theirs. Find another breakfast spot with better service and efficiency.

v5-CqCafVypq1kwaMZpLuQ.text: Nothing fancy for the price. Crepes are tasty I will say that but a bit small again, for the price. They need to update their seating arrangement and change the lighting. It's way too dark.

PLT7DObQ98S2KKkMhfGzFg.text: Absolutely love this place.  In Vegas for a tradeshow and found them on yelp.  It will be our regular stop anytime we are in town.  Friendliest staff and the owner had a great conversation with us.  Food was great and the place was nice and clean.  Many restaurants tend to be on the bland side but not here.  The flavors were great and full.

33_HiKePg9H0hpTSMbSuAQ.text: cozy lil spot on eastern. Brunch n mimosas! Match it with your choice of crepes. reasonable prices plus they serve beers n wines !

UX3saQ5EBsJaWKjno2F2Qw.text: Best place for brunch in Anthem by far. It's a little pricey, but the William Tell and a Mango Mimosa is more than worth it.

jJVS_tgS4OwSN-m9nBfITA.text: What a cool little place! My husband and I went here for the first time this morning and LOVED it! We had the Rosarito which had chorizo, guacamole, cheese and eggs and the Frisco with fresh blueberries, homemade lemon curd and homemade whipped cream and the mimosa trio of guava, passion fruit and blood orange. This was definitely one of the best breakfasts we've had in town. The prices were great, the atmosphere is cool and the food is superb. Mike was so nice and sat and talked to us for a long time (all while taking care of every customer that came in). This place is a breakfast home run.

XTyF0JuOXtTiGmcc3zzRRg.text: Everybody that works here are very friendly. Any crepe you choose is very good, the one I like is "The Elvis"(it has peanut butter, bacon, banana, caramel on top with home made whip cream on the side) but you really can't go wrong with this place!

dP4-Md2YDHXc78ByDQW6Rw.text: I've have been to this place several times now. They have a variety of crepe to choose from. I like the pear and goat cheese combination and the lemon and blueberry. I also tried their 3 sample mimosas which are ok. Definitely get the dessert crepes. The venue is small, but they have addition seating outside on a bright, sunny day.

Eb9cJc-Kz0S-LSZlFb6ylQ.text: I'm somewhat of a crepe fanatic. This place has the most delicious crepes ever!. First off the decor and ambiance of this cute little restaurant is great! I came here with a friend for brunch and we both loved the decor. Secondly, the prices are reasonable for the quantity and quality of ingredients used for crepe making. I generally like dessert crepes better than savory. Their Nutella Hazelnut crepe definitely hits the spot. Lastly, the owners are super nice! they genuinely care about their customers. Every time I'm in the Vegas area, I make the extra effort to drive out and eat at this place. Totally worth the drive out.

_XWbRLrhuF3DG9eDlreCgQ.text: This was a bad idea. Shame on you people for leaving such glowing reviews to this totally ordinary place.   Plus: The sweet crepes were made with fresh fruit, whipped cream on the side. The dough was thin and fluffy. The savory little Italy one had watery marinara sauce inside the dough (surprising).   Minus: No taste to speak of. There was the dough on one hand, the cream on the other, etc... Just like having them next to one another on the plate. The little Italy was difficult to pick up due to watery composition.   Service: there was a waiting list (10 minutes). However the older customer manager guy forgot to mention that the outside area was open too (nobody was sitting there) so we waited in the cramped place by the restroom for a table to open. We were in a hurry and don't like drafty noisy dark places - minus one point. We ordered 5 crepes (4 sweet, 1 savory) and we got only 4. Again, hurry so we did not have time to order/have made another. Minus one point. Ordinary food - minus one point.   This place might be at the top of the list for the Henderson customers (friends or relatives of owner?) but it's a total waste of time for anyone else.  ====  Update: I just got a bully email from a user "Jonathan B". He advised that I'm a loser and I need to "stay my ass at home". Thank you, I think you are the owner? I wish I did.

JX4kzS-Z_PFN0Z5EVydvrA.text: Excellent food and service. We had an amazing meal and will go back. I had the veggie patch crape which was filled with great zucchini, mushrooms, and onions. It was amazing!!!  I highly recommend eating here. I would suggest going during the week because they are packed on the weekend.

LBqN0SzZVMFIwKjoByAfOQ.text: I was definitely skeptical about going to this restaurant only because I figured crapes were more of a sweet snack then an actual meal but I am totally just delighted with the food here I had the Greek and it was delicious it was nice and savory and it was a really big so you get a lot for your money and the service was great friendly and helpful

z_sFzTvZXHFM7mOup4Pn7A.text: Its a really nice small shop with great atmosphere. Everyone works here is really friendly and polite especially the owner. I love their fresh squeezed mixed berry lemonade, caprese crepe, and mimosa trio champagne sampler (added with fresh fruit purees) I would say its a great place for Sunday brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Sunday brunch mmmmm
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa trio champagne sampler added with fresh fruit purees
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JM0cOajvnA7VlOXg9lrbYg.text: Great food,service & value. Just wish they were open a little later,I could eat this stuff all day

zwMay0XWP1xWWzWxKOu2bg.text: The soup came with the crepe was good, and the crepes are good too.  It's a good to try it there but I am not sure if I will go back since it's so out of the way.

RrzqE-PD1S37RArMiup38Q.text: This place is amazing. Great food and great service...and their home made salsa is delicious....

5BKHUqK-8iy0LX_QnjwPyg.text: Best crepes I ever had. And very friendly service. Their hand squeeze lemonades are awesome as well and come with a refill.

lNBh7pxOfMp15ZXJs2sGmw.text: Yum! Such a fun lunch/brunch spot. Delicious food, great variety of mimosas. Love it :)

X2TojY7hIz9cVtiWbD4Kqw.text: This place was 100% amazing. Came on a whim on the way out of town, owner greeted us & gave recommendations. I had The Reuben, and do not regret it. Toward the end thought there may have been too much meat but I switched plates with a friend and balanced it out with some blueberry-lemon flavor (equally delicious). My only regret: not getting the mimosa sampler! Next time. Fast & friendly service, clean restaurant.

-zkD1WcvmRtsjOgG6VJrGQ.text: came with one of my friends for a weekend lunch- place was packed and they workers were very friendly  the overflow customers who are waiting are lined up along the hallway that leads to the bathroom until a table opens up  the seating is very close together with other guests since the place itself is super tiny  ordered two savor crepes and they were pretty good  neither of us felt like we would make a special trip down to henderson to come again but it wasn't bad just to try

2ntqyuJUXHbqeKSvrlfd3Q.text: Holy Crape!  2 words... The Avalon... Perfectly sweet from the pear, crunchy from the walnuts and savory from the goat cheese. This is my absolute favorite! When I left I talked about this crepe for like 3 days straight not missing an opportunity to tell everyone I came in contact with about it.   Today I tried the Caprese w/ chicken and it was excellen, maybe a little pesto-ie... (Still not as good as the Avalon!) My guy had the Marco Pollo for the second time so I'm assuming he really enjoyed that.   The first time we went I asked for the Mimosa trio. I thought, what could be better than an assortment of flavored Mimosa's! But sadly I was wrong. The flavors were like flavor shots which made the mimosa's entirely too sweet.  Today I opted for a traditional mimosa which was much better.   The only thing negative about this place is that it tends to get busy and you can get stuck with a 30 min wait, but... It's pretty worth it.

gxQm5YynqJwReXLhNbkHcQ.text: such a cute little restaurant! the crepes we're amazing as well. I got the Greek, it tasted very light and refreshing. my bf got the Sonora, and I'll have to admit I was a bit jealous because his was a little better than mine. we also shared the Ana banana foster crepe and that was THE BEST!   I could only give them 4 out of 5 stars because one of our knives were dirty.   but besides the dirty knife, I think we'd be back again :)

AKv5PJjrvktqCjYrV8pMbQ.text: I love this place the staff is great! Savory crepes are way better than fruit ones. I've eaten the senora, the simply delight lemon, banana foster. Honestly senora is great, simply delight lemon sucks they should add a lemon marmalade; would give it more than just "a crepe", and banana foster tastes like straight alcohol! For me I don't drink so that's a bit much! But even though some items could use improvement, I still will be back for savory so it's still 5

bt5koiqvXSU81JTSHAOMzg.text: Amazing food and awesome people! The Rosario is delicious! This is definitely my new Vegas breakfast spot. Wish it wasn't so far away from LA. See you next trip!

F0oW0UJ4Rt0LYFYrMlDQfg.text: My mom and I visited this restaurant after reading amazing reviews on yelp and we loved everything about this place! The employees were so friendly, and the food was amazing. I ordered the Greek crepe and my mom ordered the berry crepe and we loved both dishes.  The trio of mimosas were amazing too! They also have cucumber water which was also delicious. Great place for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek crepe with trio of raspberry, pineapple, and white peach mimosa

sgv9hH9sBmyfxSKuoZU86g.text: I was really excited about coming here, especially since they have vegetarian options. Unfortunately, I didn't even get the chance to eat... :( while ordering the cashier was SO rude & laughed at me while I asked a question. So I said never mind. I sat there & watched someone eat. What a pleasant experience. No apology either. Not coming back.

a_yICGzakcsqBAJe7KdA2A.text: forever one of my favorite places to eat either breakfast, lunch, or brunch! the service from each and every staff member never falls anything short of amazing! not to mention their food! personal favorite: sunday morning with chorizo added, must try. Thank you Crepe Expectations for serving amazing food with amazing service! My day is made each and every time I dine here, the owner is a wonderful man who makes sure all of his customers are taken care of!

UHdTJGAf7--Pjbw_f_zK-A.text: I'm a sucker for a crepe, I think, just because it was difficult to find good, affordable ones in Vegas in the past. To sum it up, I would say this place is like a suburban version of Jean Philippe Patisserie, complete with fancy free water infused with lemon, and water infused with cucumbers. And man, was Will Ferrell right. Those cucumbers really make the water refreshing!  The ambiance is really relaxing and has a sort of dark, romantic, date-like atmosphere. I also get that this place focuses on "traditional" French crepes, but at around $8 a crepe, I have a hard time justifying coming here when Crepe Shack is just down the street. But that's just me and my preference for handy dandy crepes in a cone. However, I will say that the Avalon crepe (I think that's what it's called) with the goat cheese and pears and all that, was A-MAH-ZING. I would totally come back just for that! I mean, it's not like the crepes are bad, in fact they're quite good here. The price is just... not my cup of tea.   Hmmm, maybe if someone else were footing the bill...

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. William tell crepe (sautéed apples and caramel)

D8636kUm0ML0BX1IwjKkvw.text: This place is so good, it keeps you coming back time and again!  Love the breakfast and fruit crepes, staff is always happy to see you  Seating is small, but staff is great about getting you seated as soon as possible, very nice decor, upbeat and clean.    Love watching the staff make the crepes, and enjoy the fresh ingredients.    Large selection of drink choices, love their spicey hot chocolate. Yummo!

FKHSu5RVrt4N74BJ-JpmtA.text: The best! Love this place. Little crowded on the weekend but the older guy who seats people makes any kind of wait go nice & smooth. You have to have 'the Elvis' special...O.M.G. I die!!!!  Bacon, banana, peanut butter & caramel. Seriously, nothing like it.

0_GUED6pu9PgZPcTQyKTjg.text: The crepes are awesome ! Sonora crepe highly recommended. Outstanding service. Every time we come to Vegas this stop is a must.

dgFAxOe13ylUfT4ssZalYQ.text: The Elvis special is one of the greatest creations ever! And I love the large coffee cups. Really nice, modern and classy design inside. Small and cozy. Insanely friendly, attentive staff and the owner is often right here to anticipate your every need. Even when you order coffee here, they offer to give you a to go cup, which is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Elvis! Sooooo good.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I believe this is the Marco Polo.

Rskftzgcr_QYxK3Pm0Ot5g.text: Love the crepes here and you have to try the fresh juice!!! It's such a cozy quaint place and the people that work here are super friendly and inviting. You also gotta try the salt scrub in the bathroom. You can purchase it!

UbqjbQm09Qhe8KoVCs5u7A.text: Been going here for a few years now. Love frequenting local, family owned places. Food is always delicious, whether you're in the mood for something sweet or savory. Great staff and quality ingredients!

N73UpNpJB8IcvVGuFGF5tw.text: Pretty nice little crepe place in South Vegas. It's in a strip mall (like most businesses here) but once you step inside you'll like the dark woods, comfy chairs, and low lighting. The service is quick and friendly and the food is good.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oUZ4mHdzdi7JCrEjUuFN3g.text: Savory, Sweet, Caffeinated drinks?!  Three things to just tickle my fancies and by fancies I mean my tummy.  The Rosarito consisted of a chorizo based crepe with salsa  The Monkey with bananas as the sweet and lots of whipped cream on the side.   My line of vision was eyeing the Vanilla Latte, but was redirected to the "specialty" lattes board where we ordered two lattes which we forgot the names of, but definitely did its job ;]  We also ordered orange juice which was a nice sweet and was not too tangy or sour.   Wonderful service, has TVs for sports, and has outside seating as well.

xKL8Ozw_7ArZ2Ro9nDdTlg.text: I was pleasently surprised. I haven't had good crepe in a while. The avalon was pretty amazing and not too heavy on the goat cheese. Somehow it was just the way I liked it.  The environment is cute and quant (Even their bathrooms)  The best part was the their service. The place is really small, but he staff will go out if their way to find a seat for you. I'll definitely be coming  back

E2fUsOU7gIRr2lhOVuoPng.text: Great patio setting, Monterey crepe was popping with flavor! And they had Tapatio, which is a must on eggs or anything Mexican or Tex-Mex.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monterey Crêpe

l7H_Nmnaqq6PDkWvUuwsEQ.text: This place is amazing! I don't think I've ever had dessert for breakfast!! The mimosa sampler is a must! Oh and the service is amazing as well; Mike was so attentive right from when we arrived! I'm definitely going back!

jv8drPHHgNVXYACRhwYdTg.text: This place is great to have a weekend brunch with the family. Staff is great and very helpful With there menu I would definitely return again!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4wsmiA1O-JcPdUMjBeMC9w.text: 4.5 stars if I could.  Happy New Year!  I wanted to try something new and this has always been on my list.  The gist of this place is crepes but with a twist.  Instead of just the "sweet" treat that you normally expect a crepe to be, this joint also offers "savory" and "breakfast" selections.  My wife and I tried the Sonora (carne asada, roasted tomato salsa, guacamole, jack cheese) from the savory menu and the Monkey (nutella, banana, chocolate drizzle, fresh whipped cream, powdered sugar and added strawberries for 50 cents more) from the sweet menu.  The portions were great.  Big enough to fill you up on your first meal.  The Sonora came with a soup or salad and I asked for some of the home made salsa on the side to dip.   The Sonora reminds me of a delicious Mexican burrito.  Just enough spicy kick to it.  The lighter crepe pancake vs. a whole tortilla wrap from a traditional burrito was a good change from the norm.   My wife who doesn't even like spicy foods enjoyed it as well.  The Monkey was obviously my wife and daughter's favorite.  Even I couldn't resist a few bites of this delicious treat.  There were ample amounts of fruit and chocolate filling inside and we found ourselves cleaning the plate of every piece.  Very enjoyable.  The reason I can't give a perfect 5 is because of the confusion I'd assume plenty of new customers would get like ourselves the moment you walk in the door.  As soon as we stepped in, we were greeted by a server.  He seated us very promptly and handed us menu's and then left.  We waited patiently for him to return to offer to take our order and maybe serve us waters to start.  He never did return and it wasn't until minutes later that we realized that we had to go up and order at the counter.  Why give us menus at the table if we have to walk up and look at the menu at the front anyways?  Unfortunately, other customers who walked in after we did had already placed their orders and the wait for our food ended up longer than it had to be.  (~20 min).  Cucumber water and lemon water were complimentary but also self-serve.  Good to have known that from the start.    With that aside, delicious food and would definitely come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot chocolate
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Building our crepes in front of us and there&#39;s also a tv above to watch it get made up close.

BaUzSdkWwZ3acXeWRoJTvQ.text: SLOW SERVICE..... but the food is good. Came in with my daughter on Nevada Day. Very busy, but after an hour and 15 minutes later to get our food, the dish was really good. I guess the best time to come is a non holiday weekday, or unless you just chilling the morning away. Good thing we were. I'll come back on a Monday or Tuesday next time.

o_Mgp_qSwkr9VxshV1pRZg.text: We are not local but we found this place for brunch on Yelp, so glad we did!  Their menu is extensive with different kinds of crepes. From savory to sweet. We ordered one from the breakfast crepe category and one from the sweet, as a dessert.  Rosarito (from the breakfast menu but is served all day): STUFFING has chorizo, scrambled egg, guacamole, and jack cheese in it. Generous amount of chorizo but NOT GREASY! Loved it, flavorful too... the crepe wrap itself has the best consistency, not too dry and not too soggy.  Nutty Classic: STUFFING nutella, fresh hazelnuts, whipped cream, sliced banana. Who doesn't like nutella and hazelnuts? With the sliced banana and yummy wrap, they can't make it a more perfect sweet crepe!  They also have mimosa trio sampler, I tried water melon, pomegranate, passion fruit, blood orange, white peach, and blackberry... my personal favorite was the water melon.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mimosa trio
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. classic nutty, yes please

SU1u1LPM6qnWYQtIrXuYfw.text: Went out of our way to visit this place while in Vegas.  Worth the extra mile.  The 4 of us each had a different crepe for lunch and they were all delicious.  Yes, they have savory crepes, not just crepes for breakfast or dessert.  We had a BBQ one, a turkey one, a chorizo one, and a carne asada one.  They were all delish!!  Fresh lemonade of the day was a great add-on.  The sides that came with each dish were a nice complement to the crepe.  Very reasonable prices, and service was very personable.  Nice beverage choices to complement the crepes.  Great setting as we sat outdoors in the shade on a patio on a 75 degree day.

AalMKuZz-rF6PwAF_5ekaw.text: The staff is wonderful! We've tried almost every crepe and they are all delicious! Complete the meal with the mimosa sampler. Soooo goooood. This is our go-to spot for our weekend brunch outings. The parking lot also has the car show on Saturdays  and the farmer's market on Sundays, so you can walk off your full bellies, and then go back for seconds :)

DWlawHSH9E-AR1AfjL2REA.text: Great food with great service from a very friendly staff. I tried to eat here on the weekend a few weeks ago but the line was out the door, I found that during the week it is much easier to get a table. They have a huge variety of crepes that will keep you coming back until you try them all.

RpY8GT6e1LxYMbnH47X45A.text: BEWARE: most of these 5 star reviews are bogus! The owner is disgustingly rude and offensive! This place is a ticking time bomb!   I came here because I saw the place mentioned on the food network. So I thought it would be a great place to go when visiting Vegas - I was wrong. As I was inside with my daughter a party of 6 arrived. They all ordered and sat down. It wasn't very busy at all. However, the cashier got one of the orders wrong and that upset the owner Lou very much. He was furious started yelling, and insisted that they never got the order wrong and said that they would have to pay again if they wanted a new order. Well that didn't sit with the party of 6 very well and the owner and the other guest got into a full blown argument. The owner and the guests were all yelling and cursing at each other. I never saw such terrible customer service ever in my life! It was like a movie! The owner came from behind the counter and walked towards the guests- 5 women and 1 man-and he charged at them as if he was going to hit one of the women. That disgusted me even more. I mean him cursing and yelling while children were in his establishment was bad enough. But once he walked towards the women and called them bitches I was done! After he told them to leave I was so scared as a bystander because the guest threw all there food on the ground and attempted to push over the table! The owner should never allow situations as small as a wrong order get that out of hand! The customer service here is beyond terrible! After the guest walked out they even broke some wine glasses that were left on the table from previous customers! When the owner came back inside he was so rude to everyone and never even apologized for the terrifying altercation that had just took place!  If you want to come here and possibly be caught in the cross fire as angry customers battle it out with this disgusting owner this is the place for you! If not I recommend going somewhere else because it's only a matter of time before he's rude to someone else and they get into another terrifying brawl. I will never be back!

UIcl95Flh11318V38BHwRw.text: This spot is amazing. The food is excellent. Crepes are the size of the plate. Served in good time. The coffee is good too. We had the Sunday Morning and the Anna Banana Foster crepes. Good choice. My white mocha coffee delicious. We sat outdoors in the beautiful 80 degree weather. Staff is super friendly too. Will definitely come back again.

IzqX8vqmcH5fFw0E28qIzg.text: We LOVED crepe Expectations, their gf rice flour option crepe, sweet and savory too! They were super sweet/kind as well. Outstanding customer service! Love these types of shops! Thank you (Shout out to Long Island)! ~Brooklyn & Seattle :)

O-kZCQe6QuWBXMz6rIoGJQ.text: Love this place! Working in Vegas here from LA and I'm obsessed!  I wish we had this place back home. I did the mimosa sampler and tried , 6 different flavors. pineapple, watermelon, blood orange, white peach, raspberry , mango, mimosas and I'm in heaven !!! The savory crepes are to die for I had the Sunday morning crepe with bacon , throw some of their fire hot sauce on top with cottage cheese and your on cloud 9. The service 'is amazing and I had an opportunity to speak with the owner and talked about future plans of expanding! This is definitely amazing they are on food network. You have to try

kR_umhrK-FNAN3mMYU9wBA.text: From California came out for the weekend. I was recommended to try this place and i have too say pretty awesome crepes . Has breakfast and lunch crepes and desert . Great people and friendly owners . Family owned . Good coffee as well .

oduorwn4-Yxgv3xodZWcLw.text: This is my favorite crepe place in the Las Vegas area. Chef Lou and the entire crew at Crepe Expectations are second to none. You feel right at home when you walk in the door. The food is second to none. You will not have a better dining experience than you will here. You owe it to yourself to try them out.

oNT8sacgsaagPtHDx05S1w.text: The MOST incredible menu, customer service and atmosphere!  The owners and team are so amazingly patient and kind. They have taken care of our family for a few years now catering to our nut/gluten free diet.  We now live across town in Centennial and still make the trip to visit them.  You cant go wrong with dining here.

923AQ4as9BUb5rUP1AyN0w.text: Came here for the first time today. OMG!  It was amazeballs!  We ordered the Monkey, The perfect Combo (with Nutella), the William Tell and the Ana Bananas Foster. The apples in the William Tell could be a little softer but still tasty. The kids loved the Perfect & Monkey. They ended up taking the rest home. I totally devoured the Ana Bananas Foster. It was soooooo good!!  I also ordered the mimosa trio. I had Pineapple, Pomegranate and Blood Orange. All of which were delicious. My personal favorite was Blood Orange...but I like any alcohol with blood orange. I could drink a carafe to myself. The only complaint and it's really minor, they don't sell the mimosas in carafes. The best thing is there was only a 15 minute wait at 11:30am. Can't complain about that. If I'm down in this area, I will return!! I only wish I came here sooner. A hidden treasure that must be discovered!!

o6SOnhhfwZctp1PR9eWDeA.text: this is one of my top favorite spots for breakfast/brunch. the crepes are fresh and delicious, and the staff are always in a great mood and ready to serve you!! their mimosa flavors are lovely as well. amazing energy, amazing food, will be coming back MANY times!! SO GOOD!

dYE0TAfn94sVk3FTVsAx8g.text: Coffee, mimosas and crepes- what more could I for?  Crepe Expectations has savory and sweet crepes. The restaurant is the perfect little place to get brunch on a Sunday morning.... as long as you're not going with a huge group of friends or planning on chit chatting for hours. The restaurant is small and busy- they'll have to kick you out if you stay too long! Sonora: With carne asada, guac, cheese and salsa this tasted like a flattened burrito. It was really good and stuffed full. It wouldn't be my idea of brunch food, but I wouldn't be opposed to ordering it again. The soup that it came with was very tomato-y. Again, it didn't go very well with my mimosa/coffee combo.  The Monkey: No one can do nutella and banana wrong. The Monkey was sweet and the perfect thing to eat for brunch.  If you're here with more than one person. Order one sweet, one savory. The savory was a lot more filling, but you won't get that satisfied feeling without the sweet crepe.  The shop is a little dark for my liking and can get pretty loud with how small it is. There are seats in the very back of the restaurant for you to sit at if they're full- order at the counter!

0wqQTEgrSOs9viUh9hEETg.text: Crepe Expectations offer is a simple menu with delicious food and drinks. Something good for breakfast or if you're looking for a nice lunch. The dessert crepes are great as well. I recommend the Marco Polo and the monkey Crepes. Two of my wife and I's favorites. Lou and his crew are very friendly and hospitable. It's a great place to dine with your significant other there or the family. We love this place so much my wife and I had our wedding reception here a year-and-a-half ago. Definitely recommend going here!

DVLNvb5Z-n_C9nmF6SrSXg.text: I go to the chiropractor that is located next door.  Every time I go there, next door is Crepe Expectations where there are a lot of people waiting.   I finally gave in and told the hubs lets try this place.  Our first time eating here, we go to sit inside in front of where the crepes are made.  After watching how they made them and being able to see all the varieties that are available, the light went off.  Now I understand why this place is always packed.  Huge crepes, lots of flavor, awesome service.   They are decently priced, have beer and mimosas on the menu...for breakfast.  Thats my combo.  I love breakfast.  Dessert for a meal and alcohol?  Thats what I'm talking 'bout.  The cons are obvious, long wait.  Oh, inside, the tables are a bit higher.  For those of us that are a bit short (I'm very short) sitting up high gets tired on the legs (HEHE).     The varieties they have on the menu is good for an indecisive person like me.  I have never been disappointed all the times I have been here.  I have to tell you, the last time we were there, it just opened and we got seated right away.  We just got out of the car and knew to seat us.  Thats awesome service for ya!

NK622nA78ceFmaryW1BM-w.text: Great service and a plus that they're dog friendly! We were able to sit outside with our two dogs and they were offered water and treats. So cute!   I can tell that this place can get packed because we came on a Monday around lunchtime and the inside was pretty full!   The crepes were yummy! We ordered the Little Italy (I think that's what it's called- there's pepperoni) and William Tell (apples and caramel). The pepperoni one came with either soup or salad- we chose to go with the soup and it was delicious! The broth was a little salty but I enjoyed it a lot!   Their menu has a lot of variety so we definitely will be coming back to try different things!

1rpK5d3Ah6dbtLPKyYHYVw.text: 4.5 / 5 STARS!   Their savory crepes make for an excellent lunch. My go-to is the Sonora. Really packed with top notch ingredients and it's fun to watch the crepe monitors as they make your order.  The BBQ crepe had great pulled pork and an awesome apple blue cheese slaw on the side but I would've liked to see more ingredients in the crepe. Always friendly staff and tons of mimosas if that's your thing!

yyWbrnnUN7ad3qbyqBm21Q.text: Mike was an amazing personality and great help. Made my day with his genuine service. Food was great, mimosas were great and I'll definitely be back!

BIkkMTnUhAU19LvkiNPk2g.text: Saw this on Diners, Drive-in, and Dives, and I was not disappointed. The crepes were delicious.

VuCoS3usaQy6lqAc717drg.text: Mimosa Trio Sampler $10: This is a good deal! You can choose 3 flavors and get a flute of each. My favorite was guava. Pineapple was ok. I didn't like watermelon because it seemed to use artificial syrup instead of fruit juice.   Avalon $7.75: The crepe itself is nice and thin. They definitely don't skimp on the fillings. I feel neutral about pear but like goat cheese so wanted to give this a try. It was pretty good, but the flavors weren't enticing enough to force myself to finish it.   They have a lot of options so I wouldn't mind coming back to try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon $7.75
