mdRTeK18z5ntLkzR8-eXSg.text: Holy crap.   People cutting line.   People allowed to cut I. Line.   Complete bs.     I waited 30 min and then 20 people were pulled in front of me.

2oa882g6AclkzMe6P6NMxw.text: My friend and I are not normally on this side of town, but we were for an appointment. She's been wanting to try Crepe Expectations for awhile now, so we had the perfect excuse. We arrived at 2:30 PM RIGHT before they were closing for the day. Unfortunately, we had to take our crepes to order, but we understood because they were closing soon so it wasn't a big deal.   We ended up ordering the William Tell crepe (sauteed apples, caramel, powered sugar and whipped cream) and the Berry Delight crepe (strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, powered sugar and whipped cream).  While waiting, I noticed some Star Wars decorations so I was taking a photo with my phone when the owner came out. He was super sweet, struck up a conversation and invited me back to see his other decorations and also his signed Guy Fieri poster from Triple D (I hadn't known this restaurant was even on the show!). So that was so neat and he was just so chill and welcoming.  We got our crepes and went on our way. They were delicious! The berries on mine were very fresh and the crepe itself was delicious. My friend tried hers and said the apples were yummy, crunchy and tart. And her not normally being a whipped cream fan, she was surprised that she liked theirs! We'll definitely be back when we are on that side of town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. William Tell crepe. Apples, caramel and powered sugar
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Berry Delight crepe. Strawberries, blueberries, blackberries w powered sugar
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome signed poster!

Lz7ZvQMX1JA-jA9Mi2zbRw.text: Simply said, this place is amazing. Great food great service, you can't go wrong here

X5nbIhJR-NT4X7QfA7sasQ.text: I've been here once before so we decided to come back since my friend likes coming here . We were placing our order and I made the mistake of asking a question that I thought was a simple curious question. I don't know about other people but when I have eggs I like to have a side of toast or tortillas ( the Mexican in me ). Big mistake. The guy taking our order answered sarcastically about this being a Crepe place, totally made me feel stupid for asking. So my friend says you didn't have to be a smartass about it , so he gets offended and turns us away. When asked if we can speak to the manager turns out he's the owner.  Long story short people don't ask any simple innocent curios questions or you'll be turned away when the owner gets offended for responding like an asshole

hicXkmiLokIvXfn-bBJSvA.text: My food was beyond amazing!!  Service was incredible.  I can't wait to go back what a great expierence.

qNKGb16DcXbX6swPzqjO6Q.text: 4.5 stars. Not the best crepe I've ever had, but there's a lot I like about this place. There's a tv above the cashier that shows the crepes being made. Pretty cool. I had the reuben, which was pretty good. I tried the one with steak and it was really good. Good flavors and the meat was tender and juicy. They have savory and sweet crepes as well as mimosa sampler flights!   Small space with some outdoor seating, but they're expanding in a few weeks. Moving a few doors down. The same guy that greeted us as we walked in and took our order ended up being the owner. Seems like a really good dude. Humble, driven and truly invested in his business.

DUU0pZ0p1btnCZoSk55aIg.text: This place is truly wonderful. I brought a few people with me and we all ordered something different, some crepes were sweet and others were the savory ones. They were truly fresh and tasty crepes. The owner here as well is super outgoing and such a people person. My food was to die for. I will definitely come back to Vegas just for this place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gBynFz5tN71kQprDfcKSBg.text: Great start to our morning! Picked up the Berry Delight myself, satisfied my need to be filled with something not too sweet. Boyfriend chose the Monkey, which he loved and satisfied his sweet tooth.  Staff is really helpful and friendly too! Try the outdoor seating if weather is promising.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y8d8H_XaYJhhTznPEmHBLw.text: I've been here more than three times. I think they have the best crepes and variety of options. You can make your own as you'd like as well. I love to come here during breakfast hours, my favorite crepe is the Rosarito. It has chorizo, egg, guacamole and cheese. Ugh, the best. I don't take any pictures because it's so good to resist. I just go right Into it. The price is amazing for the amount and size you get. I can never finish my portion. The owner is mainly the cashier, he's always in such a great mood. The wait time to order just depends on how busy they are. But I don't mind, the crepes are amazing! I had their micheladas here, not the best I'd say. But I don't come here for the micheladas. So I'm still giving this place a 5 star! The staff is awesome, they stop in the middle of what they are doing to answer your questions. Clean spot, they have an outside and inside dinning area, and they provide water for their guests due to the heat. I love their outside area, makes you feel like you are in a tourist area. LOVE IT!

sLpw_jvUaQo4uG3kKGBUEA.text: Worst customer service ever- I went to read the sign to see when they open & their automatic door opened.  The manager came out & yelled at me saying "Can't you read the sign?  We are closed!"  We had to go there because we were meeting someone but when I tried to talk to the man at the counter, he gave me attitude rather than an apology.  Avoid this place- so so food & a horrible experience.

EltGOAJaAZoFbPW3P0opwQ.text: Love to try places Guy Fieri hits on Triple D. I don't always agree with him but this place was...wait for it...off the chain! First thing you'll notice is the ambiance which really works for the place. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They even helped find us a table as it was pretty crowded. The menu offers great options but our favorite was their special, the Elvis, which was fit for the king. I had the Rosarito and would recommend it as well. Heck, it's all good so give it  shot

VlVJhEqHcB5x_z5tKy7UDA.text: When I want to treat myself, friends or guests from out of town to a special breakfast I go to Crepe Expectations.  The crepes are consistently cooked to perfection.  I recommend the savory breakfast crepes, my favorite is the Marco Polo, which has eggs and a slightly spicy Italian  sausage.  If there are 3 or more of us, I love to order a desert crepe as well.  The strawberry and blueberry crepe has a smooth lemon custard that is decadent and delicious!  I also love that they offer free flavored waters, lemon or cucumber water.  The service is friendly and the prices are a great value.  All the crepes I order are under $10.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry &amp; fresh blueberry desert crepe, with a lemon custard. Your mouth will thank you!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marco Polo breakfast crepe has eggs and a spicy Italian sausage.  Comes with sliced bananas

B1zTAQ8hYmUOuEUAoyymkw.text: We have been coming here for a while.  They just changed locations to a larger spot with a courtyard near their old location.  They needed the extra room as they get pretty crowded.  I will list the pros and cons as I see them:  Pros: -Staff is very friendly (especially Mike who works the seating and outdoor area) -Food is very good.  Crepes are delicious and they have all kinds to choose from.    -Coffee is tasty and smooth -Large outdoor courtyard is nice  Cons: -Having to order at a counter (I think full service would be better with this new location.  This worked at the old spot better, but it no longer seems to be working) -Self serve coffee area (it is not appealing and it is set up poorly.  Plus, the mugs are large and have small handles, making them hard to carry.  Plus, with lots of people and traffic it is dangerous to have people carring huge mugs of coffee around.) -Large delivery truck with loud engine running the entire time we were eating.  I realize this is not really their fault, but they should tell the driver to make deliveries in the back.  Not enjoyable to be eating your breakfast outside with a giant truck engine running and stinking up the area.) -Could be a little cleaner.  It is not bad, but I have noticed some cleanliness issues here and there.    Overall, the good outweigh the bad.  Good, unique place to eat!

crIrtGnrJ-xjIACOIq6Tjg.text: I came in here for brunch, and it was fairly busy, but not packed. My mom and I were greeted, and we were asked if we had ever been here before. Since we said no, the waitress explained that we could order at the counter, seat ourselves, and the dishes would be brought out to us. She was very friendly!  We ordered the Rosarito (chorizo, scrambled egg, cheese, and guacamole) and Berry Delight (strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries). The Rosarito came with a side of bananas or cottage cheese, which wasn't listed on the menu, so I was a bit unprepared to make a choice at the register since I was sharing it. Anyway, I ordered the cottage cheese to go with my crepe. The sweet crepe didn't come with any side. You do have an option of adding on potatoes, but I figured the portions might be too big to finish if I ordered it.  My first impression of the crepes was that it was huge, so come hungry! The Rosarito crepe was okay. I picked this because it seemed to have a bit more fillings than some of the other offerings under the breakfast crepes. The chorizo was about dry, and tasted like ground beef to me. I didn't notice the egg in his crepe too much and only really noticed the other ingredients, especially the chorizo. They gave a fair amount of guacamole so that was cool, but it wasn't really seasoned, and seemed like it was just smashed avocado. The Berry Delight was also just okay. I liked that they gave a lot of fresh berries and didn't skimp, but the strawberries were a bit sour, and for that, I wished there was more whipped cream on the side or powdered sugar. I'd probably opt to get a sweet crepe that has a bit of a filling (think other crepes with goat cheese or Nutella) than just fruit inside. If you want to try multiple crepes and are in the company of friends/family, I recommend splitting up different crepes to sample. Basically I had my main savory crepe and my dessert crepe!  Overall, the crepes were fair, I wasn't super impressed to make another trip back out. However the service was good, and this place seems pretty popular even on the weekdays.

n-345fobveBnZnXowmPusQ.text: Not only was the food amazing, but the service was even better. The waiter brought me their house hot sauce and cut up Sorrento peppers and they added the kick I was looking for in my savory rosarito crepe! I will def come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Can&#39;t temp me with a good time! 3 mimosa for $10 or 1 for $6 not even a question. Blood orange, white peach and blackberry are outstanding!
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosarita savory crepe! So yummy with chorizo, egg, guacamole, and cheese! I added potatoes, so big not even necessary.

qRuy8BRHIEq7nh8PWov3_w.text: I've been there a few times and my only complaint was the space was so small, but now they have a bigger location so it's completely perfect! These crepes are AH-MAZING! Savory & dessert, They're sooooo goodddd! I made my husband a regular too, so we both now go together frequently. Customer service is awesome, I love how the owners are hands on (my husband recognized them from a TV show they participated in) and they make sure you feel welcomed! Guys, definitely give this a try, YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT, SOOOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOOODDDDD!!! The only thing I wish is that they would stay opened longer hours, but it's cool, I still love this place!

BunQUHAYZfpQAzk1F973fA.text: I am actually angry no one told me how great this place was. Went on a Thursday during Lunchtime. Busy but not indicative of how awesome everything is. Decor was great. Patio looks super fun (not at 110 degrees though, no Patio could ever be fun at 110, but people were sitting out there) and the Crepes all sounded pretty good and were priced well.  Rolled up to the register and the bearded gentleman could not have been more charming and personable, later I found out this is the legendary "Lou" who owns the place. He was delightful. I got a Savory Pizza-ish Crepe and a Sweet (but not too sweet) peach Crepe. They were superb and really decent sized especially for the price. Fideo soup was really good too! AND THEY HAVE BOOZE.  Even the woman who just handed us our food (to go) was exceedingly pleasant. I wish I had more stars to give. I'm gonna go back this week!

8BO9UIDCRKtuCwGDtqNdAA.text: Best breakfast spot there is! Great selection of crepes savory or sweet! They also have the best mimosa selection you can choose from almost any juice you want! Great prices and great service

5xdxi4_l8IMU9aM1fk0PUg.text: I cannot explain how this place fell below my radar for over 4 years! I plan on making up for lost time. We arrived Sunday morning, very busy, but the line moved quickly and the kind man had tables ready for everyone. Lou greeted us at the counter with genuine enthusiasm and pride. He is the co-owner, along with his wife. We chatted during the transaction and felt right at home. We ordered the Avalon and the Greek, and a mimosa trio. Do yourself a favor and get the trio! You select the flavors from a large variety. And they cone filled to the rim! Personally, my favorite is mango, but they were all delicious. The Avalon is perfectly paired with pears and goat cheese, simply scrumptious. And The Greek- nothing but pre heaven in my mouth. Wow! Perfectly grilled chicken that tastes grilled and not dry, fresh spinach, kalamata olives, red onion, feta cheese and tzaziki marry perfectly into the crepe. I enjoyed it so much, I had to return Monday for another one! And for $8, it's a real bargain. Thank you for a most memorable meal and my new favorite place!

C6wOpspVj8Kb4VlRc6hUkA.text: I was delighted to find out on my recent visit to Vegas that a friend knew about this place and wanted to take me.  Yes, this is the Diners, Drive Ins and Dives place and there is some memorabilia inside to prove it.  As far as I recall, this is a family owned husband-wife combo.  First things first...the drinks.  They do a mimosa sampler with choices of like 11 flavors.  They are delicious and reasonably priced.  The crepes....well, you can see for yourself as they make them right in front of you.  They are incredible.  They have sweet/dessert ones, and more savory meat/veggies ones as well.  I believe mine was the "Monte Carlo", which was sausage egg and cheese and "The Perfect Combination" which was strawberries, chocolate and whip cream.  They were just so light and delicious that I had to try one of each!  I commented at the time this was one of my better restaurant experiences in a while.  The owner was super kind to everyone, the food and drinks were great.  I can't recommend this place enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosas ready to go, watching the crepes being made

yci1Ld0hjfLUksnbnyV_QQ.text: Definitely in my top 3 favorite brunch places in Las Vegas. Not only is their food amazing but you get it at such a great price! Their mimosa trio (they have tons of flavors) is only $10. I usually get watermelon, mango, & strawberry. The service is great and the atmosphere is very casual. They've just recently expanded as well so there's outdoor patio seating.  The savory crepes are just as good as their sweet ones! A must-try.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mimosa trios for $10!

TAArohBIYmFg4U4OwBAT3A.text: Shocked at how bland the food was. That being said, we only had four items, so I would be very open to go back and try some other items and see if they're better.  1. The latte... was a joke. It was very diluted - that is, watered down. It was very poorly done. 2. The steak crepe - the meat was horrible. What was listed on the menu was 'carne asada steak'. The real problem is expectations - they should have given a description of how it was cooked. It was essentially, braised beef. Like having under-cooked pot-roast. If I had known that, I never would have ordered it.  2. The chorizo crepe - the blandest chorizo I've ever eaten. That, and the fact that 90% of the filling was chorizo, it was very unbalanced. It needed less chorizo, more egg, cheese, etc.  3. The soup - probably the best of the day, but not all that great. Not bad, just not that good either.  Like I said, I wouldn't mind trying some of the other items, but since we don't live locally, and there's a thousand other places we haven't eaten, we won't be back. Fool me once...  BTW, the service was great, very friendly and professional people working there. Just wish I could help them adjust their recipes so they're decent. Maybe that's what passes as good food in that area... don't know.

gCooliMKy-FUg1JBa-dcmg.text: From the minute you walk in the door you are greeted with a warm hello! The owner is charismatic and so quick to seat you . The crepes are fantastic, so light and delicious! I love this place ! The crepes are just like the kind I had in Montreal Canada which I thought sat the time were the best I'd ever had.

A-v7Ms9YKY2CZQXY9tw3Yg.text: Amazing crapes! And they have gluten free batter for those who need it, and that batter was also great. And didn't make those with us who where gluten sensitive sick! Thank you!  The savory crepes were amazing! We will return next time we are in Vegas

HHf8o7St4__q0pSpdW_GvQ.text: Really love coming here! Anybody that comes into town to visit I always bring here. The service is amazing it a really good homey feel. The food is off the chains!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The vibes at the place are AMAZING!!! Love the food and service. Very yummy!!!

dtz29JUGx7j9AgggTKNh9Q.text: I didn't have the opportunity to try the food, but I did have a taste of the rude bald guy's ways as we were trying to get a copy of one of the small menus.  Being rude and snarky to customers and telling them that there is an 8' menu is not the way to keep or attract customers .

WExf_uq73Ao_awXoml5yfQ.text: I LOVE IT HERE!! Myself and most locals know this spot all too well. The staff and owners and absolutely amazing! It's has a small business, family-run feel with staff being so warm and attentive. We brought our pup last time (lots of open outdoor seating) and the one of the staff (owner maybe?) was so sweet and just loved our fur baby! He even went next door to the dog bakery and got him some free samples. Safe to say, EVERYONE had a great brunch that morning.  The food is awesome. The mimosas are so much fun. I love to do the sampler, but the guava flavor is too good to resist. My boyfriend and I always get a sweet and savory crepe to split, and I highly recommend that strategy. It's my absolute favorite place to bring visitors as well.

kjkhjloYqXDn05xJW9Zu2w.text: I've never had such amazing crepes before. Between my friend and I, we  had the veggie patch and the Avalon.   The Veggie Patch: It's probably the healthiest and most filling crepe on the menu. It's definitely something for the vegetarians who come here but don't want to eat a sugar loaded crepe. The roasted vegetables had a good smokey flavor and the hummus paired well with it. I'm not sure I'd get it again, but I'm happy a healthy option is available.   The Avalon: WOW. This crepe has pears, goat cheese, honey, and candied walnuts. Definitely not a healthy option, but amazingly delicious. The honey is incredibly fragrant -- almost like I've never had honey before. I love how savory the goat cheese and is a good combination with the sweet pears. It also comes with a side of vanilla flavored whipped cream which tastes great.   Cute interior where you can watch the crepes be made. The patio is nice shaded and provides for great options to sit outside. I would easily come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Veggie Patch (red bell peppers, portobello mushrooms, zucchini, red onions, hummus). Comes with side of salad or soup.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon (Pears, goat cheese, candied walnuts, honey, and a heaping side of whipped cream!)

go498CMZqI010Ul1LtLn-g.text: Crepes are kind of dry, the Rosario needs some kind of sauce and more cheese and the Berry Delight the same, they just throw the berries inside, no sauce or jam added. My cappuccino was good though

eF-Gg9ullhQX-pHozaD9cw.text: Whenever I think of breakfast Crepe Expectations is always number #1 on my list. For my first Mother's Day it was a great experience. Since I have a sweet tooth my always go to is The Monkey + strawberries and the mimosas. So delicious! My boyfriend also loves all of their savory crepes. So good!

isB0F8t4sxdwWYjhvsmFcQ.text: We popped in here for a last visit with a friend who was moving out of town.  Since they know the owner, we knew this would be an AWESOME Place to dine.  We caught the place at the tail end of the lunch rush so we nabbed a table outside since the weather was perfect and placed our orders.    We alerted the owner that one of our party had a Peanut Allergy and he was able and willing to accommodate us without hesitation. That was AWESOME.  I ordered the Perfection (?) crepe, basically strawberries and chocolate and my friend ordered the banana and strawberry crepe. the other part of our party ordered more savory ones including a Greek and a brisket one.   All the food was AMAZINGLY delicious. The service was impeccable and the host was gracious. If I lived in Vegas/Henderson I'd be here at the VERY least weekly.  I WISH they were in florida so I could patronize them frequently.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Ej2VMQ7LNUN5_ovqkC9sA.text: First time here. You walk in the door, place your order. A kind gentleman asks where you want to sit, inside or out. You can watch them make the Crepe .  I tried the Reuben Crepe- Excellent  It's worth a trip and have an exceptional time

Zexo9s63fDrakTgomFIfNA.text: A great place for breakfast and brunch! Make sure you come before 3pm and allot yourself enough time to eat, they close promptly at 3pm and everyone must leave at 3pm.   The sitting and ordering situation confused me a bit. You walk up and someone greets you, asks how many, and if you want to sit inside or outside. Then they tell you to order inside then come back out when you've ordered to have a seat... it just seemed unorganized to me.   The cashier was very enthusiastic and in a very happy mood, despite how busy it was. I ordered The Greek with grilled onions, feta, tatziki, red onions, olives, and tomatoes -- hold off on the olives and tomatoes. It came with the option of soup or salad. There was a lot of flavor but it probably would've been better without the humongous chunks of feta, although I do love feta!   There was self-serve water -- choice of lemon water or cucumber water. I do believe they have mimosas there, too, if you're a hardcore brunch-er! They have alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks.   I'd probably come back when I'm craving some sweet crepes, just to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek w/salad

Yoz97VY93bP1yKpxlbPY-Q.text: Came here while on vacation a while back. Having lived in Henderson for years it was always tough to pick which breakfast place to go to because there are so many. My friend took me here-- best decision! Service was amazing! Everyone was so friendly. We had almost every flavor of mimosa, which are a great deal, then split a few of the crepes, sweet an savory. Now that I live here again I'll be going back often.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jbb7aNzEiTGHMFFe9xHCxA.text: By far the best crepes I ever tasted in Nevada.  I'm from California & theres some place but never this place. I highly recommend this restaurant.

b3G1re_Ealaq6o7jITv18Q.text: Saw this place on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and was going to be in Vegas and decided to check it out. From the minute we walked we were impressed.  The kitchen was open and you could see everything going on in the back but then ... Lou came out and greeted us and introduced himself... what a warm welcome!  Made us feel like we were family coming over to his house for breakfast.   The food was fantastic and very reasonably priced. Decor was simple and unassuming with a very nice outdoor patio. Oh and Lou, thanks for that special treat before breakfast ;).  P.S. If you are staying on the strip, Crepe Expectations is only 10 min from the strip and even if you the add in the cost of an Uber out here, both you and your wallet will still be ahead of any breakfast joint on the strip

_285W-bXwNAc8jaIyF1vpw.text: If you're in the mood for crepes, this is the place! Great food and service.  Got the Frisco subbing blueberries with blackberries and it was awsome!  Will definately be back!

dfXxgOyPA6yfbAPzqXuiSA.text: One of my favorite places to recommend. Very affordable (crepes are around $7-$8). They have three categories (sweet, breakfast, lunch). I have had almost the whole menu. Sweet included like Nutella, fruit, peanut butter, whipped cream options. Breakfast included eggs, potatoes, meat. Lunch has carne asada, chicken, salads (yes! All in crepes). Might sound strange, but trust me the lunches are actually my fav. They also have 3 mimosas for only $10. Best price in town and they have like 15 flavors. Can't go wrong here. Something for everyone.

pj-JG2ON3IChdrhzOfYjZQ.text: My cousin worker brought me and unfortunately it wasn't a good crepe i had got the carnasada one and the salsa just made it really mushy and gross and unfortunately i  couldn't enjoy it. The place is cute and the staff is nice just didn't enjoy my meal.

zBeRbbge65UimjD4Fy-vDw.text: 110% worth any wait in line. The crepes here are to die for. They run ~$7 each, and the mimosas are delicious. I got the trio sampler with blood orange, pomegranate, and white peach. Highly recommend the blood orange and white peach, but get adventurous on your third one. The crepes. Dude.  We got the Avalon- omg the goat cheese makes this perfect for people who like sweets but can't have too much sugary stuff, it's to die for. Legit. The Sunday morning- ask for tapatio at your table to mix in with it, the little bit of spice is perfect. The perfect combination- omg strawberries and chocolate. YUM.  If you can get out this far from the strip, you will not regret it. SO GOOD.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon- never have I ever met a crepe I liked as much as this one. 110% bomb.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The perfect combination
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler: blood orange, pomegranate, whitepeach

Tx-3BmRON7wjI1u5EUHppw.text: This is a small place in a Strip mall. We came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning.They have an open kitchen and we got seated in front of crepe makers. It was interesting to watch them working. Here you can find everything for breakfast.They have a huge assortment of sweet and savory crepes. I had the Monkey. It comes with nutella, banana, chocolate drizzle, whipped cream, powdered sugar.It was not bad but didn't taste as good as I expected though. Don't come here if you are in hurry, cause it takes a while to get your food. I must stop by again if I am in the area I think...  A little overrated and overpriced...

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend&#39;s chocolate waffle

AEybgzOu6UjsGRoXfiyzwg.text: Never been here before, didnt know what to expect but I can say the service was phenomenal. the food was great but the staff really went above and beyond. first we were told we would have to sit by the entrance and then the host later said he can move us to a table in the back, then he noticed my husbands military ID when he went to pay and gave us a discount and then when we got our food our server was just really nice and accommodating, I really wish I would have gotten their names to give a shout out but I just left there so whoever is working this shift is amazing!! we will be back!!

Vr_5limhwaF8vGU4lXjouQ.text: This place surely beats your expectations (food wise).  I was previously a worker at a crepe shop so I understand why it takes forever for crepes to come out and maybe sometimes in different orders. Of course, this is something that can always be fixed. If you plan on eating somewhere on a short time crunch, this is not the place to go. Practice some patience, will ya?  Their crepes, both savory and sweet, are DELICIOUS. The crepe is cooked so well, it's soft and almost melts in your mouth. I have tried a bunch of different crepes, and depending on what YOU like, you will love it. My favorites were the carne asada and the nutella banana and strawberry. They always hook me up with whipped cream too!  The owners are super nice and it is quite small, yet demanding, so people just need to be aware of the wait times. You gotta wait for good stuff sometimes.  Definitely a place you should try out!  PS, Mimosa trios=excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry, Mango, &amp; Blood Orange Mimosa!

8cCaRY_dRzntrh3qhb6OVQ.text: There's a reason why this guy made it to a show like Food Network's "Guy's Grocery Games!" Lou is just the best. Hospitality met with a quality product in such a small venue. He knows how to entertain a crowd and  deliver something yummy at the same time. He gives a show while making crepes. Sounds crazy? It's not, it's great. We are in Vegas after all. Lou's crepe spot is an awesome place for locals too. I am a SUPER crepe snob and Lou delivers that batter and finished product, by far! I actually recommend the tuna crepe (I know sounds weird but I was pregnant the first time I tried it and I've been hooked since the baby popped out) and the old faithful classic crepe with lemon and sugar (a representation of how good a place's crepe really is). There are many others that are good, like the southwest and pretty much anything he offers a special.   In the words of The Smiths, "Please, please, please," try this place!!

IEqH_n_SH02uZffJwDqPig.text: Please read!!!  Do not support these rude owners. My girlfriend and I have been coming here at least twice a week since they opened, and always had a great experience. The last 2 times we came, the owners wife has been there. A couple weeks ago we were upset that they ran out of this soup we love. And we weren't belligerent, but expressed we were upset about them not having any. Instead of being caring, the owners wife became very arrogant and demeaning as if it were our fault.   Today we went for breakfast, no complaints, no issues, just wanted to get some food. The owners wife was there again, and straight up said "oh I remember you and your Asian girlfriend, my husband and I have decided that you are banned from our restaurant. Have a good day." Please take a look at the video she posted, we weren't rude, we didn't even acknowledge any problems. I tried to be nice, it's insane how a small business will do this to someone who's spent over $1,000 there over the last year. but now they will be hearing from the BBB.

3gPY3XXCbbrlELCY1pi2Aw.text: Food is amazing, my only complaint is that they don't ever make enough soup. The owner's wife handled the situation in an unfriendly manner and instead of getting loyal customers...we don't think we'll be returning.   Update: owner refused service because we were considered "rude" for telling her she could have handled the situation a lot better last time. A restaurant owner should have a much more caring personality and customer service. Grow up and learn to get along with everyone even if you have to be the adult. You're the store owner for crying out loud. Here's the video check it out yourself...

8USaVazPWcsirKv8uZ_ELA.text: Love this place. It's perfect for a brunch! This is the place we always take family to when they're in town and everyone loves it. I can never decide between sweet and savory, so my husband and I always order one of each to share!

dp3UQSrBUaFg5j0sN1zOJg.text: My sister and I been thinking about this place for quite some times, it's actually as expected the food was good and big portion and it was very busy so the wait took lil longer than expected but all and all it was a good spot to try

BM8hlHMBt-45EFbkA0RtHA.text: I LOVED this place!  Family and friends recommended this place to me previously but I had never been despite their recommendations. I finally went here (because it's off the strip so hence we don't always want to drive more) and OMG was it worth it! Let me start by saying the bf and I both liked their mimosa selections and tasting- we each got 4 different flavors. I would steer clear of the peach because it was WAY too sweet. I surprising liked the tangerine and the pineapple the most. The watermelon one was okay.   Bf had a regular savory crepe (I don't remember which one, but it had bacon) and it was delicious. There was some sauce on it and I think it would have been better if they hadn't been so heavy handed with it but it was pretty freaking good.  I had a sweet crepe with berries and I even asked for extra berries. My crepe, of course, was gluten free. It was much thicker and more like a pancake than a crepe and therefore super filling. However, if you regularly (or just have ever) eaten a gluten pancake you will know that what they have here certainly qualifies as a crepe as opposed to a pancake. If you have not eaten gluten free pancake then you will feel like this is too thick to be a crepe, but it isn't. I could not finish my crepe because it was so large. It was a little too sweet for me but it might not be for others.  Overall the service was good too, entertaining to watch them make the crepes, food came quickly, bathrooms were clean, etc. Honestly this is a 4.5-5 star rating but I feel like I haven't tasted enough to give it the full 5 stars.   Come after peak time, like after 12 or 12:30 to walk right in.

ZNA71LwseX7P6N97-Nv06Q.text: Now let me first say, the service wasn't horrible. However, we walked in I think when they were getting ready to close, and lots of the tables were dirty & not bussed. When we got the crepes, they just looked like someone literally took a bunch of ingredients, threw them in a tortilla, and folded it over. I mean I could've made this crepe in 5 minutes at home for $3.00. It was pretty bland. I didn't think they had much flavor (tried my wife's as well), or contained anything special that would make this place have a 4.5 star rating! What the heck?!

4TgdieBxi-e97EJbM8Ud1Q.text: I eat in this area all the time and had some how missed this gem! It's a great addition to the area and it makes you feel like you are elsewhere despite being so surrounded. The atmosphere is so fun and I love the option of the mimosa sampler. Being able to watch the crepes be skillfully made adds to the experience.   The staff was incredibly enthusiastic and friendly and overall seem happy to be there and serve.   The menu provides the perfect amount of options and leaves you wanting to return time and time again to try everything!   The flavors were perfect and the side salad paired nicely with the crepe.   The quaint outdoor seating is a nice touch and while some may scoff at how intimate you can get with your neighbors meeting new friends only added to the experience for us.   Little things like the tip origami, the salt scrub in the bathroom, the art, and the complimentary cucumber and lemon water are all added bonuses!   Our experience was blissful! Definitely a new favorite and a must try whether you are local or visiting!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jeVCcDeCa9zUtPha-aOVxg.text: Very difficult to find at first since they recently moved and there's no sign present anywhere. This was my first time at Crepe Expectations with my friends and it was definitely worth it. It was a Sunday afternoon so it was a little busy - we did not want to sit outside because it was too windy for us. I ordered a regular coffee (with free unlimited refills) and The Perfect Combination, which consists of a chocolate drizzle with strawberries packed inside. Great place for any occasion, and I will be back in the future.

4CkmoFt-wIMatbFXAjhTPw.text: Service was great and fast. We were in and out in no time. The food comes out in big portions. Definitely recommend the Caprese Crepe, add chicken. You can grab a savory crepe and share a dessert. The host greeted us upon arrival and made sure we had a seat. Great indoor and outdoor seating, except I wish this place was a little bigger. Such a great place to brunch... and they have multiple flavors of mimosas!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese with chicken.

OMiedtAMQHRD18Cpp9FtCQ.text: Came for the momz birthday brunch. Ordered a variety of sweet and savory crepes and (for me) a mimosa.

FzBctm3jyLAcM0ymdIpByA.text: Crepe was tasty but the restaurant is not a place to dine alone.   I love crepes and this morning I was in the mood for some - *both* savory and sweet. I went here b/c of the good reviews and it started out pleasant enough... A gentleman was standing outside and welcomed me in as he took me to my table, a nice corner table by the door which I said to him was "perfect." (I have a sensitivity condition so generally when I go out to eat, I prefer sitting away from the bustle of people). As soon as I started to sit in my chair, he changed his tune and asked me to sit in a middle table at the banquet wall on the other side of the room. Mind you, he was the one who took me to the original corner table so it was extremely disappointing to have him change his mind as I was sitting down. I don't like banquet seating - and especially not being squished between other tables so when he asked me to switch tables I decided to just take something home rather than put myself in an uncomfortable situation.   I went to the counter to place my order (a sweet crepe with pears, goat cheese and honey which had quite a decent amount of filling) but as I was standing watching the chef's create the crepes, they asked if I wanted to sit in the side corridor while I wait. It was a long, dark corridor where I'd just be staring at a dark wall three feet in front of me. Not interested!  I travel for business all around the world, and have MANY relatives in Paris, so I appreciate a good crepe when I can find one. I also find that the True test of a good restaurant is how well they treat me when I'm dining alone. Do they give me the same quality of service and attentiveness as with larger tables or do they ignore me and/or treat me different b/c they think one person will not spend as much as a larger table. I was quite hungry and had planned to eat two crepes in addition to libations but the disappointing treatment made me shorten my order and my visit. Their loss. I actually thought the crepe was quite tasty and the person who gave it to me put a dollop of whip cream in a separate container without my having to ask - so that the heat of the crepe wouldn't melt the whipped cream.  What's even more disappointing is that the person seating people put a couple at the table I was originally going to sit at - two people who could have just as easily sat at the second table he wanted to move me to... Next time I'll find somewhere else to enjoy a crepe.

yMeRl5hoklEd893zep9MLA.text: This place is amazing. Great customer service and great food. Love the new bulding too so much more room!

nuUgaS-6EkjyRjhYTCv2cA.text: New location, just a few doors down. Tons more seating, so near the same wait times for a table. Same great food.

4NByzdLNOVLuT9EN-WkZZA.text: Went there today for Sunday brunch. Arrived 10am. You go to the register if there is a table available they will take your order. If not you have to wait for an available table before they will take your order. Wait was only 5-10mins. Once you order they give you a number to take to your assigned table. There is a wide selection of savory and sweet crepes. They also have mimosas, wine and beer. Price is very reasonable. Crepes were excellent. Service was decent. Don't expect fine dining service. It's more like a deli style of service. Overall very cute little place that has great food if you love crepes. Will definitely come back!

RoyKfshw0ZwVcIesd_PNEA.text: Crepes are the new cupcake. Move over rich frosting because this lighter pastry is coming to take over. Before you would have to go to the strip to get one of these Parisian delights. Now you can get them outside of that parameter.   Crepe Expectations lures you in with a play on words, settles you in with boutique decor, and snags you with their divine crepes. My sister and I split the Frisco. A mellow crepe with a thin layer of lemon curd, handfuls of blueberries, a light dusting of powder sugar, and a side of fresh whipped cream. We accompanied this with the mimosa trio. They have five flavors to choose from; pomegranate, lychee, original, passion fruit, and  white peach. We had ordered the first two and the last. The tart acidity of the pomegranate cut the champagne nicely. The lychee had a subtle sweetness, but did not mask the flavor of the alcohol. The white peach was our least favorite. From start to finish it was bitter. I wished my sister would have been honest when the owner asked us, but after she said everything was delicious, it was too late.   I appreciated that the owner took the time to come out and talk to us. Asking how we heard about the place. Stalking Yelp sure does pay off. The atmosphere is cozy and the staff are polite. The prices are mid range compared to other crepe places. Everything is made in house except for the hummus. You can definitely taste the freshness in their ingredients. There is also a TV overhead so that you can watch them prepare your crepe.  Everything about this place warrants another visit. Next time I will try their pear and goat cheese one.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lychee, pomegranate, white peach mimosa sampler

GQARdlVRmo8xp2HqjXVsmg.text: Found this sweet spot through Yelp reviews. Didn't disappoint. Three of us ordered 2 Avalon and 1 caprese. I enjoyed a tangerine mimosa. Service very friendly.  Alcohol prices are very cheap :) Awesome.  Loved the crepe cam above the crepe stations.. You can watch the chefs in action. Kudos to the restaurant for setting this up, it's not every day that restaurants welcome guests to watch the process.

V5sOLbl6TKpsMY_nVY6Z5w.text: Saw this place on Triple D so we had to stop in while visiting from California.  Was not disappointed, the food is excellent and the owners and staff are wonderful.  Highly recommend you stop in while visiting Las Vegas.

NnxJ1V2_4hAqraGqHoC-yQ.text: Absolutely amazing! I've been here a couple of times now and each time, there was nothing to complain about, at all. The staff is extremely friendly and very attentive to every customer. The owner actually works the cash register and if you can't decide from the many excellent choices, he'll offer a suggestion.    As for food, I've tried a few and loved them all. For the savory crepes, I've tried the Sonora, the Caprese, and one of their specials, I believe it's called the Clucker. The Sonora is like a Mexican burrito, with a crepe instead of the tortilla. When I said that, the owner responded with, "Yeah, like a burrito, but better" and I totally agree. The meat and guacamole were well seasoned and the meat was still very tender. The Caprese was also very good, I loved the pesto! The Clucker was filled with chicken, chorizo, and some cheese and it was super flavorful. The chorizo gave a nice little kick and the chicken was still very moist. All of them were packed full, you definitely get your money's worth, in quality and quantity.   The one sweet crepe I tried was the Frisco and it was mm mm tasty. The lemon curd was not too sweet or too sour and there was just the perfect amount of it, not overpowering the crepe or the blueberries. Also, that bad boy was FILLED with blueberries. There had to have been at least an entire 4oz package of blueberries in that thing!  Each of the savory crepes came with a side of soup or salad, although the Clucker, since it was considered a breakfast crepe had the choice of banana too. When I first ordered, I asked for the banana, but quickly changed my mind wanting the salad, and the owner said he would just tell the staff. When my food came, it came with the banana and I said I changed it to a salad. The waiter just threw in the salad on top of the banana! Seriously, really great service here.   I can't wait to come back and try more of the crepes, if only they were open a little later. Not a big morning person, but I will make the effort to wake up earlier for this place, and so should you!

qBVkJua3QpfP7ldhN7hdYw.text: Ate here on an improvised date night. The location is great the ambiance was great. The menu is quite impressive and the food was great. I had the crepelet and loved it. The ingredients are quality and it made for a great light meal. My wife ordered a Caprice and while ordering had a pregnant craving and added ham. Upon receiving her meal she immediately wished she hadn't added ham(pregnancy messing with her) the owners noticing that she wasn't completely happy immediately offered to take it back and remade her order even though neither of us had asked for that. Both owners (Husband & wife) were very friendly and were very happy to engage in a conversation. We loved Crepe Expectations and will be back.  Oops. I guess I didnt save this. A year and a half later the place is under new ownership. The new owners are also very nice. Food is still great and fresh. The Frisco could use more curd but all in all it is all great!

0FuGSSJpSnJNtWLN-f5L0w.text: Delicious and absolutely amazing food! the mimosa's were also amazing and so many flavors to choose from.  I can't wait to go back!  The place is really small so go early or expect a little bit of a wait.

Z68HLUUAucU0kluPkCE80A.text: YUM. Prices are pretty good here considering the size of the meal! My friend and I got the Rosarito & the Clucker (daily special), but I also got to try the Greek. All were delicious! You get to choose from a variety of sides; soup, salad, bananas, & cottage cheese. Not only that, but service was fantastic. The gentleman on register was awesome at giving suggestions (if there's anything I hate, it's when the person suggesting says "everything is great". That either means you don't know or you haven't tasted any of them), but he was honest about what were some of his favorites and the crowd favorites. We were also checked on a few times to make sure everything was going well.   Parking was easy since this restaurant is located in a pretty large strip mall. Would definitely return if in the area!

0q6zKGk5J4poN87l7nf_wQ.text: Best crepe I've ever had.  Gluten free crepes available as well.  I had the Monkey - Nutella, Banana, Strawberries and chocolate drizzle!!!   Owner is friendly and knows how to manage an efficient restaurant.   A must try!!!

kL1t2cBOGd5_EBpJyvuxig.text: The service was awesome and the food was very delicious!! Highly recommended!! The only reason i gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is because my silverware was dirty and had chocolate on it other than that everything else was really great.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate on my silverware!!

fypak44BlmVEZr5h4Gr0Lg.text: Where to start!  Just fantastic people serving a surprising variety of phenomenal crepes in a cozy nook with elegant decor.  Way, way, way, underpriced for this experience in Las Vegas.  God bless you Lou.  Your passion is undeniable and greatly appreciated!  I can hardly wait to enjoy your company and amazing culinary delights again someday.

10WOYHc6ajLhIBIS3kyZVg.text: Love the place, but it was way too small.. Sample mimosa, was good for the price several flavor to choose from.
