pQKhPbQ6BsUnJAqDyCzTMA.text: I always love a good crepe place, and crepe expectations delivered. Amazingly delicious...I had the Sonora. Will be back to try the del mar!

y9SVgnQlsdiqa-vlHfAcig.text: One of THE BEST crepe restaurants in Las Vegas. Not to mention they serve hand made fideo. The Mango mimosa is phenomenal, the service impeccable, and the food incredible. Definitely a place to check out while in Vegas

mnlUkuHGrGuvFRENlh5xFw.text: This place is the best!!! Great food, amazing staff, the owner and his wife are some of the best people I've had the blessing of meeting, I can't say enough about this place! From the huge selection of delicious crepes to the fun mimosas, it's one of my favorite places to eat! They do tend to get busy for breakfast, but trust me the wait is worth it.  Please come check them out, you won't be disappointed!

5yRZeF36AzwjrfXIclhIFQ.text: No. Crepe for you....  First of all the crepe nazi that owes the place is rude and should not have a public facing job.   Second the service is awful and the crepes were like rubber.  Don't bother making the drive to Henderson to eat here!

oavtklog9s4d9C648u4UJw.text: This place is great.  The people are very friendly and the food , every time we come to Vegas this a must eat breakfast place.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rL10HBgv4p7D942COE5Eyw.text: Another wonderful place run by a small group of dedicated, hard working food lovers. The food is magnificent and was enjoyed by all, a definite change for breakfast. The only bad part was the noise! We had a table full of night shift working cocktail waitresses, card dealers, hookers or drug dealers (really was hard for me to tell which one or if there was some of all) who were extremely loud to the point of being obnoxious. They were obviously regulars so the owner didn't want to upset them and ask them to quiet down. Too bad they didn't take the hint of all the dirty looks other customers were shooting them.

TCFYOO4n-tzG__RCU4k_xQ.text: Avoid Sunday brunches here, unless you go early (they don't take reservations). It took almost an hour to get a table, and to get our orders! :-(. Food was excellent, and service was okay. We had to check on our order twice, but when it did come, food was awesome, and manager followed up to make sure we got our order.

D19Kjuf7H8-WPV0OhJeLXQ.text: Love this place for breakfast! Not only do they have great customer service but there food is so good!! And it's locally owned :)

CNtJYUQnj4kI4xTWjmzocw.text: I love sitting on the porch drinking their variety flute of mimosas. If you get your coffee inside and decide you'd like to leave, just ask for a to-go cup! Genius!

MyIWO7TWRAJAqGXY6SE1xQ.text: Pretty great place to experience crepes whether you have a sweet tooth or something that will satisfy your hunger for something a little more. The restaurant itself is a bit dark, with outside seating available for enjoying the weather on a nice day. The service wasn't necessarily the greatest, the cashier wasn't too kind and seemed like he just wanted to get the order over with but hey if it gets the job done I guess it's not too bad. The kitchen area seemed to be a bit messy and unorganized but the food came out relatively quickly, and tasted great.

BKLo38YL45gxhmOnl5qXIg.text: Can't wait to come back! This was a great Yelp search! Savory and Sweet! Delish!! I had The Monkey- Nutella, 'nuff said! My boyfriend had The Sonora- carne asada, guac, salsita! Oh man!

KrWm2ghLS9SC5lvl05daJA.text: Great place!! Ate here everyday while on vacation! We like the Sonora and the Monkey with my wife.

Xxcumw73Z2jRHUl5Ie_jsw.text: Absolutely delightful! Wife and I came here for the first time and were floored. You can see the crepes being made on a monitor, and when they arrive they're far more than you expect. I got the Sonora, and it was LOADED with carne asada and avocado. We will be returning early and often, probably to do their mimosa brunch.

TaBA1cG41XHu5tfuRYBHag.text: Here is a little secret about this place that everyone needs to know.  Gluten is what would make one avoid a place like this, but guess what?  They have a Gluten Free mixture so no one has an excuse for not trying this place.  Gluten lovers and Gluten Free needs can be met so since this is one of my favorite places for anytime of day, I hope to cross paths with all who read this.  You will not be disappointed, as I or anyone who has been here has been.  From the service to the drink to the overall family atmosphere, this is a place for all to enjoy including k9 lovers.

7Tk6EMf5zLEPzoUQJUeleA.text: I'm in love with this place!  My mom and I ended up going here on a Sunday morning.  We each had the Rosarito Breakfast Crepe with coffee.  Loved every bite of it!  I told my friend Chastine V. how awesome it was so we met for brunch....I had the Pirate with the mimosa trio (orange, white peach and passion fruit).  Once again, loved every bite and sip of this meal!  Finally, my husband agreed to go because I wouldn't stop raving about it!  He had the Sonora...awesome!  And I tried the Greek...very delicious.  Needless to say, I'm a huge fan of this place and have every intention of coming back...soon!  And I'm going to bring my dogs!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito

7GcnPTZjAJ-sOXP2_VtS9A.text: I absolutely adore this place. I feel spoiled by their crepes and can't even fathom going to Jean Phillipes or crepe shack anymore. They just don't stand a chance. I love the staff they are always so friendly and nice with attention to detail . The decor is nice and modern but still cozy They have sweet , savory , creative crepe you name it. . They allow you add or take away ingredients as you please. I love the blood orange mimosas, they also have a cool list of root beers and classic sodas. They make me feel like family coming over for lunch/ brunch. if you want a damn good crepe this is the place . This place is only open in the am and usually packed on the weekends. Now I like their new addition of canopies outside to block the sun with the outside seating. Get the monkey or Avalon, and their Fideo soup is awesome.   Now I have read the reviews online  and I will say the  putting my name on a list and standing while waiting for a table does not bother me at all. This is a mom and pop place people, it cozy and friendly with  Darn good food at reasonable prices . I don't expec, It's just crepes without the frills. Sometimes I go on weekdays and its empt and you can spend an hour or two chatting with a bottle of champagne while having your crepe. If you go on a Sunday during the  farmers market you will have a 20 o 30 min wait  to be seated then wait for your food and it will be loud from all the hustle and bustle.

SuFwcpP8DbnsSj8Ub_ojag.text: I swear, crepes are the new cupcake; for this, I am immensely grateful! Seeing this place open up recently, my brother and I decided to give it a go. Whereas down the street, they're serving Japanese-style crepes - this place is all about the traditional Parisian crepes.   My brother and I shared the Mimosa Trio and the Frisco crepe. The trio featured a white peach, pomegranate, and lychee mimosa. Lychee was simply to die-for while white peach boasted a bitter taste. On the other hand, the Frisco, adorned with lemon curd, blueberries, and powdered sugar, was orgasmic. Talking to the owner, she said she made everything in-house other than the hummus, and for this, I am impressed. Homemade lemon curd? There's nothing better.  What struck me the most was the ambiance. Enduring the brutal Vegas heat from the parking lot walk, entering Crepe Expectations is a nice, welcomed change. Intimate, dimly light, and well-decorated, Crepe Expectations is perfect transition from Vegas heat and sun.

5WSeeckiJZs5xkU94gVHWw.text: Really friendly staff. Monterey is an awesome start of any morning.

nlG0iZPJ6nlyGCEqyaxaoQ.text: After having a stessful morning I decided to go get a good meal. As oon as I walked in the staff was VERY welcoming and friendly. They absolutely turned my day around, and not to mention the crepes were DELICIOUS! I ate the berry delight and added Nutella (I'm a Nutella addict) and it was perfect. Great portions as well. I will definitely be going back soon!

R5sDFmGdbcHMaZT5bzhTDQ.text: Thank you to my fellow Yelpers for recommending this fabulous eatery.  I wanted to try the Griddle, but upon checking out their Yelp review, I decided to switch to Crepe Expectations.  My significant other and I stopped in on Saturday for a late breakfast.  The decor was modern-which I enjoyed.  They have two projection screen tv's.  Perfect for my guy since the football game was on. (He didn't miss any action)  They also had the crepe cam where you can watch them make your food.  I ordered the Rosarito which had chorizo, avocado, cheese and egg.  It was delicious! I my opinion, the crepe's thickness was perfect. There was so much food stuffed into it, and it didn't break.  The watermelon on the side was a nice fresh touch to my plate.  I also had the pomegranate mimosa which was TO DIE FOR!  I very much appreciate they use the good champagne and not the cheap one.    He ordered the crepe with egg, cheese and bacon.  It wasn't as stuffed as mine, but he swore it filled him up (which is hard to do, he eats a ton!).    Lastly, the service was impeccable.  The lady who took our order came by later and asked how our food was.  This experience was so delightful, I took my girlfriend to eat there the next day.  This time I had the Very Berry Crepe.  It was smaller than I expected.  The fruit in the crepe was fresh and not canned, which I liked, but they were rather watery.  This crepe left me still hungry once I finished.  Overall, I would definitely eat here again but most likely order the breakfast crepes unless I was just looking for a desert.

gp1coi5htbwnDld44bsGxg.text: A bit confusing when you walk in. You have to order your food, then find a place to sit, then a food runner will deliver your food. The food and service are good. Busy on Saturdays due to the car show that sets up just outside their doors.

clGS3rUlF-LtwvaAZWCYGQ.text: I went there with a friend on Sunday. We opted to sit outside and enjoy the fresh air and beautiful day. After sitting there enjoying good conversation and tasty crepes, the staff come outside and pull in tables and chairs. A short while later they start tearing down the canopy that was providing shade. Mind you, we haven't finished eating yet. Those canopies I'm sure are full of dust and we are still eating. A few minutes later we are asked if we are finished. We clearly are not because their is still food on our plates. A few minutes after that a grey hair'd man comes out and informs my friend she has 8 minutes to finish her food because they close at 3 sharp. Just when you think you've experienced the worst, out comes this big burly guy and tells both my friend and I "Your time's up." I will NEVER... Did I spell that right? Just so there is no confusion... I WILL NEVER NEVER NEVER NEVER VISIT THIS ESTABLISHMENT AGAIN NOR WILL I RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE! I cannot stand rude customer service. I have family in the food and service industry and you NEVER ask a paying customer to leave!!!

-suA26uY8sHnGY8hMUHg9A.text: Fabulous! We are from out of town and my husband and I wanted crepes but wanted somewhere off the strip. I found this place on Yelp and we couldn't be happier! I had a sweet crepe and my hubby had a savory breakfast crepe and we split half and half. They were both DELISH!! The place was constantly busy, so be prepared...you may have to wait for an inside table or sit outside. The staff is so friendly...we will definitely be back next time we are in Vegas.

PxSnpnUIhUSYTxDEcs2hfw.text: One of the first places I recommend in Las Vegas. Great food combinations and flavors, friendly staff and dedicated owner with a True love for his hometown, and delicious flavored mimosas. Give it a try and I'm sure you'll be pleased.

1CwnypOJFIFmH1h1q6KNmg.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place. The husband and wife who own it are very friendly, and their fresh-squeezed lemonades and juices are a favorite. I love their crepes. They've got super sweet, deliciously savory, and everything in between. It's one of my favorite breakfast/brunch spots.

FM6j7QcaQ6_iTPLIOIdLZg.text: This is a wonderful place to grab breakfast or brunch. Yes, it is a busy joint during the morning hours but it is worth the wait! I tried the crepe filled with fresh berries and it was delicious. Crepe Expectations exceeded mine.

5CJ_Xgds_mXgpSYJQIlIaA.text: Pretty good, waited a long time for our food and not much space to sit but food was great

QZQ4uDA53ixLhQ3KmSjXiQ.text: I really love crepes and Crepe Expectations exceeded my expectations completely.  I have been to this establishment several times and I always get the "Grand Turk", which is my favorite.  The Cappuccino was great but the first time I was given a big cup and the next time I visited I was given a small cup for the same price.  Maybe it was a glitch, since they have only been open for a short time.  I love the interior of the restaurant, different shades of purple, sooo cool.  The owners Larry & Ana are very accommodating and my favorite thing is I don't have to go to the Strip for a crepe, they are right down the street from my house.   I'm delighted to know that they now serve GLUTEN FREE crepes, big plus in my book.  New Note:  They have new owners but they are very accommodating and the food is still great!

oi9frYvQ-ygPloEvMQtI9g.text: Amazing food! Great service! Driving through on our way to New Mexico and what an amazing treat! So lucky we happened to find this place. I highly recommend the Grand Turk - very tasty. The owners were very nice and they have the place running very efficiently.

Ejo__StnvAnvWjDDvtPW9Q.text: Probably about my 5th time here. Every time we have friends in town this is our go to place. Because it's unique, and the quality for price is excellent.  It does have a long wait-expect 45 minutes for a group of 6 people on a Saturday or Sunday morning...but Lou works to get you in and updates you if there are any delays.   Mimosa sampler 10 dollars--they make all of their own pomegranate mango blood orange  -pomegranate pretty good, but wouldn't get again -mango: sort of gross wouldn't get again -blood orange! Delicious will get a full glass next time.  The Greek Good-but I'll try something else next time. Not a must have.   Smoked salmon Awesome: more expensive than others but I really enjoyed it. And will be hard pressed not to get this again.   Monterey breakfast, I get mine without bacon. I wish we had a pico de gallo to spice it up though.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greek
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon $9.5
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio platter: pomegranate, mango, blood orange

o4w4jiFdCoIjuBWI5jmoqg.text: My first time to Crepe Expectations after seeing it on Diners Drive-ins and Dives. I was surprised how small the place is but it is very organized. We had one savory and one sweet Crepe. The Frisco and the Monterey. We also had the Mimosa sampler  with white peach, blood orange and passion fruit. Everything was great. I would highly recommend going and try for yourself. the owner took our order and was very helpful and very attentive to every customer he helped. Everyone who works there works hard and looks like they love it. We will be going back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monterey &amp; Frisco Crepes with Mimosa sampler Blood Orange, Passion Fruit and White Peach.

c3TvCfcTZZXCgSRK0COO2A.text: Outstanding service and the food came out quick. More importantly the crepes are amazing!   A must stop in and try!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c37wI4cv5KNAGf0l3V-vXQ.text: Delicious crepes and not overpriced at all. Very clean inside and the staff is fun & lighthearted. I ate my entire plate, which never happens.... well, I didn't eat the actual plate. Definitely a good way to start the day!

xpeFadeoHYZle9W8I8eIrQ.text: So to be perfectly honest I've never really enjoyed crepes, until now. My gal pals Allison and Jessie had nothing but good things to say about this place, so we chose it for our weekly brunch spot one Saturday morning.   This is an order at the register, then seat yourself kinda place. The chef/owner was our cashier, and he was so welcoming and friendly. As Jessie put it "I always feel like my business is appreciated when I come here." She couldn't be more correct. All of the staff I encountered were friendly and they seemed genuinely happy to serve us. This is one of the main reasons I love supporting local businesses. We were seated outside on the patio, which was great because the weather was nice. They also have seats inside, but be prepared to wait. The place is small and always packed! This, however, is a good thing!  Onto the food. I couldn't make up my mind, there were sweet and savory crepes and they all sounded delicious. I didn't even know you could get a savory crepe! I ended up with the Reuben crepe which comes stuffed with corned beef, sauerkraut and thousand island. It even had fennel sprinkled on the outside of the crepe! It was realllllly good. My crepe came with either a side salad or a cup of soup. I chose the latter, and it was pretty good. It was a light, chickeney broth with noodles. Not too heavy, but tasty and perfect for a side dish.  Jessie and I decided to split the mimosa sampler, which comes with 3 flavors of your choice. All of the flavors sounded amazing, but we went with white peach, watermelon and blood orange. The sampler glasses are pretty small, so I would advise each person getting their own. Anyway the white peach was definitely my favorite flavor.   I really enjoyed this place and I will definitely be back. I love supporting local businesses, and they have some amazing sweet crepes that I am dying to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben crepe with soup

g425MwDjDuc6NbqYOonNIQ.text: I ordered the carne asada crepe. One of the best crepes I've ever had. Great portion size and the crepe stays hot all the way through. Good amount of meat. Would definitely eat here again.   Also ordered a fresh squeezed orange juice. Not sure if it was because of my crepe, but it tasted kind of bitter.  Service is impeccable! Very friendly, welcoming, and efficient staff and owner.

xZ0mpH8kaOWYzpxiyIRtrw.text: I've been here twice and I love cafe chocolate. It's the best one that I've ever known before. Love ittttt

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SMoHcLWeKDDhmGPulXbYMg.text: Love this small place! Delicious and creative crepe variations! My favorite is The Avalon with pears and goat cheese. Be aware - the place is small and lines are long. But totally worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon

YnXPBhzE3aQeoqPr9afWYw.text: A great surprise find, and one we'll be back to. If your experience with crepes is confined to the mall food court, this is nothing at all like that! Food was delicious with good portions, both savory, breakfast (served anytime), and sweet. Definitely a place for either a meal or just a snack. They have a great selection of wines and beers, too. Their mimosas rawk! The staff and boss were simply awesome, enthusiastic, polite and very helpful. Best of all, they are soon moving a couple doors down to a bigger space. This place is a new favorite for us!

rCPEmAbEjVlnQuWxGtBopQ.text: Been here twice and both times have been excellent.   Champagne sampler and the Rosarito.  Great start to a Sunday morning

pw6-Hd1fWGQzld5dF-m9Lw.text: Took my son here yesterday and wow!  This place is really amazing!  I ordered The Frisco and he had The Nutty Classic with a hot chocolate.  Everything tasted amazing and we will be back to try all the different options!   The place is tiny so you will have to wait to be seated but well worth the wait.  My son and I ate right in front of the crepe station so we really enjoyed that :)  The staff are very pleasant and welcoming.  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Nutty classic and Hot Chocolate
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Frisco

bAsw3GiVZt38T2Z-xD9aVw.text: We saw this place on tv and decided to stop in when we visited vegas. Maybe I'm a bit spoiled but I didn't think it was any better than our crepe place back home. They seem to do better on the savory crepe side. When it comes to sweet crepes, they tend to stick to your basic fruit, powdered sugar, whipped cream, and Nutella combinations. I was really hoping to see some with specialty jams, pudding, or homemade sauces. Overall, the crepes were good but not out-of-this world. The price was fair but the place was a bit crowded and noisy for me to want to be a regular.

IRp0_K-TPzh1pZl3GY2uWg.text: This place was on food network so I had to check it out being a foodie I went yesterday it was so dank I had to come back . I recommend the carne Asada crepe and the g

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe station

sdSRpEzPxaWwuKCwK4NIXg.text: Great local brunch spot! I love that I can be outside and enjoy the mimosa trio sampler when the weather permits. I had the berry delight crepe and the Monterey crepe. Plenty of great choices so go check it out! Staff is friendly and always welcoming.

cuqv44_hr76_nBz2pEGbHQ.text: This place did not meet our expectations. We saw this establishment on Triple D with Guy Fieri and assumed the food was great. Much to our disappointment, the crepes were average and the latte was horrible. We ordered a berry delight crepe for dessert and it was dry and tasted like something we could have made at home. The whip cream did not taste homemade. My vanilla latte was made by a nespresso machine which I paid $3.75. The place did not have milk substitutes such as soy or almond milk. We came from California with Crepe Expectations but left with disappointment. Definitely not worth the drive from the Las Vegas Strip.

4Y1zVYDaTV_NsClpP9eq2w.text: The food is phenomenal, but the staff is even better!! The crepes are light and tasty, the ingredients are fresh and delicious! This is a perfect reason to visit Vegas!!

hmxqJlFroqy2tlP86kXyQw.text: Came here for brunch, late afternoon kinda deal, on a whim. This place was pretty crowded, with the exception of the outdoor seating area. Nice and clean inside - cute interior overall.  Before even stepping into the establishment, we were greeted by someone - going to guess that it was the owner/general manager. Quite an observant guy too, since he noticed my boyfriend's UWM shirt and automatically asked "Are you a Packers fan?" Plus he noticed how green we were to the place, so he walked us through the menu, ordering procedures, etc. Having a friendly character is a given.  I think it was the head chef that took our order too, and he wasn't kidding when he told me that his chorizo crepe was awesome. Hahaha... So glad it was a True statement 'cause it was my first savory crepe!  They have friendly regulars too! Someone gave me a recommendation from their mimosa menu. The boyfriend had a Blood Orange, and I had the Mango. Pretty good! Next time I'll be sure that the flavor profile matches the dish a lot better XD Staff was friendly the entire time, and we didn't have to wait on anyone to pick up our plates when we just wanted to talk after the meal.  Definitely going to become a regular here, especially since my boyfriend finally admitted he liked the place at the first try!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Rosarito &amp; Mango Mimosa

YS3gtE8liQJKiI1qoCs0WA.text: Great service and great food.  Owner went out of his way to help serve people. He even brought a bowl if water for the dog at the next table.  They have outdoor seating which is good because the inside is small. They offer free lemon and cucumber water. Crepes are large, and they offer breakfast crepes all day.  Hope they open another location on the west side of town!

XVE25bl24Se_slvQjVOBBQ.text: Food was absolutely amazing and the owners are great. Mimosas were fantastic as well. Will definitely be back soon.

DHW-H_OHHhIjfWC04IXVNw.text: A friend took us here after she visited several months ago. We didn't know that Restaurant had been featured on TV - just followed our friend's suggestion for breakfast. The weekend is clearly a busy time, but our timing was perfect with less than a few minutes wait for 6 of us. We started with flights of mimosas for each of us. Then ordered our savory breakfast crepes. We added a couple sweet crepes for the table to share. My Marco Polo crepe was great. My wife's Sunday Morning crepe was equally good. All in our party thoroughly enjoyed. The staff was friendly and fun. People watching outside under the canopy was a great pastime. We all had seconds on the mimosa flights - $10 for 3 flavors beats the $13 for 1 standard on the strip!  We were in Vegas for the weekend and the trip from the strip to the restaurant and back was a $41 uber ride each way - factor that in if you don't have a car.

_-nNqfQ1EJDv-e4FEjvqow.text: Amazing wait staff, amazing hospitality. Mike the greeter was an an awesome person to talk to. The ruben, the monkey, the Monterey was all very delicious.   This is a must try place whether you're an out of towner lookin to get great food before you leave or live in the area. Plus, they've got a patio.   Cheers!

-uGzH_TK4wmDDH2bww9hwQ.text: Cute little crepe diner; Love that it is locally owned, clean, friendly, yummy and thriving! Best location near Anthem locale. It's nice they have gluten free and vegetarian crepes to accommodate. I always get The Little Italy crepe, yummy every visit. The dessert crepes are awesome. Very affordable too.  The diner is on the small side, it gets crowded easily, so large groups will wait awhile. They have a few tables outside, however just wish the outside would have shade and misters as the restaurant faces west.

Brr-59flM7cHwMK3mXSKgA.text: I love this place so much! The owner is amazing, so generous and friendly. The food is excellent. I love the turkey avocado and cheese crepe, served with fresh fruit and a latte or fresh juice. This place does everything on point. I have not once been disappointed here and have brought many friends here to try it out. My dad is very picky and even he loved it when I brought him here. If you want sweet crepes they have those as well, always with fresh berries and cream or chocolate and other fresh fruits. I really loved their lattes as well as their fresh juices which they squeeze right in front of you. On the weekends this place is quite popular, so get there early or after the morning rush to get a seat. The place itself is not huge, but homey and cutely decorated. I go there all the time, and now that I live abroad I am missing it terribly! A must go if in the Henderson area for breakfast or lunch, both great choices. This place is one of my secret personal favorites.

0OLcxo4vRNEbKz0m3NBgGg.text: As seen on DD&D, awesome experience and phenomenal food. We made this a destination while on vacation from Phoenix. Can't wait to return and try other dishes. Everyone was very courteous and made everyone feel welcome. The chef/owner showed how much he Truely loves what he does and cares about his restaurant. You have to go when in the area.

P8iIaMLPRHo9Ln-nY4hqHw.text: 5 Stars as usual. This place never disappoints. We come here every visit to Vegas, Best food,  best service awesome. Can get busy but you get looked after. Inside and outside seating. Great price and big crepes. Bring your appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rosario Crepe... Great start to the day.
Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa sampler - for breakfast

TgIuRTpEKvtKrUZJiXrWTg.text: I went to this place thinking that a crepe is a crepe. But this place showed me a spin off of your average French crepe. Since these are Japanese crepes, they were served like ice cream. You would hold them in your hand, and eat from the top. They even had Jenga and a bunch of other party games, which is plenty of fun for the family.

9qtN3GNbvXFgDtIe4ahNsg.text: First time going. I had the Marco Polo it hit the spot filled me up but not over stuffed. Love this place will be coming back

5ksAO287iv6PtiCyqVjM6A.text: The Avalon is amazing!! Loved the goat cheese addition to this! Loved the owner and the atmosphere! Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Avalon!

VOq75wjdDMayq2RKgNULnw.text: Excellent food with a wide variety to choose from, one favorite is The Sunday Morning crepe very filling also comes with a side of cottage cheese or bananas . They also serve mimosas several different kinds to choose from like pomegranate very nice !  So go inside place your order check out the specials get your number as they will delivery your order and take a glass of there free lemon or cucumber water and enjoy.

VpsiPsvkHX-grjP32XzQjw.text: After reading multiple yelp reviews, decided to try this place. The crepes were all delicious- although my favorite was the Monkey! The wait time to seating was only about 5-10mins when we went- although started getting longer later. We had to wait a lot longer to actually get our order- but was worth it!

NnXAWiirXU1W7-aRmWuE8A.text: Absolutely amazing!  First time in spoke with Lou.. went with his recommendations and I can't say anything more.  Gluten-free and awesome. .  I recommend this place as a mainstay.  Will be coming back often!  THANKS

0aJ4CpRklM-JWC6EAMmcvw.text: This place will embarrass French crepe lovers as this gentleman has bested their cuisine. Think i am kidding? Go and give it a whirl. You will be amazed at the deliciousness.

photos.caption: Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy yum yum Elvis crepe

ww2wC87ddWzkXMVSlsdPWQ.text: Went there with my friend visiting from out of town and they didn't disappoint. Awesome food selection and great service.

SDMWbVHkHsnblASTcDM6bg.text: I loved this place when I first tried it but I hated the second time and I've never been back. I would have given them 4 stars the first time and 2 stars after the 2nd visit. (I can't give them 5 stars because of the mimosas)   My strongly complaint is that the food was inconsistent. The flavors were great the first time and poorly done the second time. I even tried the same dish and it didn't taste the right even though the ingredients seemed the same.  They seemed to vary the amount added to the crepe.   For me personally, the mimosa suck. I couldn't drink the trio. It's filled with artificial flavors and if you like that... it's perfect. I expected fresh juices but that's not their fault. I think you just need to be aware of it so you can decide if it's what you want.   Prices are very reasonable but they seem disorganized and need a better system for seating.   They did a great job with attention to detail... The water is flavored nicely and the worked very hard on the menu.   It has potential but I was very turned off with the second visit.  I hope to come back but for now I will wait until it improves.

jwgP1W8albv-lpf6jDQEHg.text: Let me start with the posative, great friendly staff and good food. Rest of the experience not so good. Told the wait is 20-25 minutes, got seated 45 minutes later, waited in a cramped tight hallway, sold in line again to order, got seated at where they cook and people order, people were inches away having conversations that it was hard to hold my own conversation. Waited 30 minutes for food. I literally left with a headache, not relaxing or enjoyable, way to cramped and busy!!!

Q700SarTgVDZIM6mMJ7eXQ.text: Fantastic sweet crepes. Savory crepe was the italian one, and it was pretty good, but the texture was a little off. Overall really great service and great food.

neNdhAQz-4VeIfW4f_0IBA.text: Arrived during lunch hour and the place was packed. Good crowd does not always guarantee quality but this time it turned out to be the case.   We started with crepes from the savory menu, I thoroughly enjoyed The Caprese while my boyfriend had The Grand Turk, also perfectly executed. For desert we chose The Monkey with added strawberries. Yum. It did for sure cured our sweet tooth.   We also ordered the mimosa trio sampler. From the mango, pomegranate and passion fruit, the mango was my personal favorite but all of them were refreshing and tasted good.  Good food, excellent service, very clean. Thumbs up.

mTdJLHz9lqLq9z4JIjUw0g.text: Ok, so crepes are just awesome and they do them really well. There are a ton of options and all of them are great. But that's not the reason for this review. Crepe Expectations is a 5 star review because the service is great. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Go there!

tUooQ3mRQc744EzQJAPZjg.text: Oh my gosh...I seriously can't say enough good things about this place! People are incredibly friendly, the food is delicious, and the prices are great! I got the Sunday Morning crepe with cottage cheese and it was so good that I decided to get a dessert crepe as well and ordered The Avalon. My belly is stuffed and I'm a happy camper. I live on the complete other side of town, but will absolutely be back to eat here. Great food with a warm atmosphere can't be beat.

Photo of Crêpe Expectations - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sunday Morning

5W_EpRBY-wwuXbbZCLkf4w.text: From the moment we walked into Crepe Expectations, I began composing a raving review in my head for yelp. As you enter, you are greeted by chalkboards announcing beverages of all kinds - both alcoholic and non-alcoholic, from the usual to the unique. For example, if you're  a cream soda or root beer fan, don't miss ZeiberFizz, a combination of creamy soda and mild root beer flavor. Chimay for cheaper than they sell it at the bars in my hometown was quite attractive as well. As a mimosa fan, I should also note they have five flavors of mimosas, and for the indecisive, a mimosa trio sampler for $10.  Of course, you don't come here for the beverages, you come here for the crepes. Ahhh the crepes. Divided into an organization freak's dream, with categories for sweet, savory, or breakfast. Being that we were going out for the first meal of our day, we tried the Crepelet, the Sunday Morning, and the Berry Bliss. As strawberries aren't currently in season, I didn't mind that the strawberries were average, because everything else was absolutely amazing. You can watch the crepes being made on closed circuit television just above the ordering station. Everyone who knows crepes knows that if you can't see the pan through the dough, the crepe is too thick. The good news here is that the lady making the crepes has it down to a science, and fans the rake as if she is working on a piece of art. Crepes are, of course, art to the food world, and Crepe Expectations is equivalent to the Met in my foodie mind's eye. This experience was the first for my husband, who had never had crepes before. Halfway through the meal, he declared that we need to make these at home, so I see a visit to Williams-Sonoma in our future. It is bittersweet that we live thousands of miles away from this little gem, which is good for my waistline but disappointing that I can't partake every Sunday!

XDwpRk8pYDVmBjXeWAjKIw.text: Great place!! Found this gem while visiting Las Vegas a few years back. Now a local and eat here every weekend. Food delicious, everyone is friendly and Mimosas are not to be missed!

QWHEaRLrQPD0idQgC6vhJw.text: Oh man, the crepe are so good and addicting! When my friend first bought me here, I ended up going there 3 times within 4 days. It is always a pleasure to order and eat there since the employees are super nice. And and the complimentary cucumber water as well as lemon water are just another plus. I usually end up getting a breakfast crepe with a side of banana, can't wait to try every other crepe in there!

peSe7zbJ25zzHaYuPbrMfQ.text: HUGE crepes filled with perfectly constructed fresh ingredients. I got the nutella, banana, peanut butter w/ whip creme. Wife got the chorizo & egg w/ avocado (they had official names, but my old brain isn't as young as it once was). Both were fantastic. The guy that took our order (maybe the owner?) was boisterous, charming, and a little over the top - which was nice compared to the bland, expressionless zombies you'll find at most breakfast places. My 2nd favorite part (1st was the superb tastiness) of the whole experience was the big screen TV with a live feed of the griddles. From anywhere in the restaurant you can watch your crepe as it's crafted. Thanks awesome crepe dude for making our bellies so happy.

246AFz4pc1k6kFCGFbMqnw.text: After reading the other reviews I had to check this place out. Yes it is small and you do have to order at the counter, but they bring the food to you. Coffee and Water are also self serve. 3 of us went for breakfast and 2 of us ordered the Sunday Morning crepe and the other person ordered the crepe with ham & eggs. You also get a side of cottage cheese or sliced bananas with each crepe (nice touch). I loved my Sunday Morning crepe though my other guest was not that impressed with theirs. He felt there was not enough egg in the crepe and could only taste/see potatoes and cheese. Portions were large enough to fill us all up and we did not have room left over to try any of the Delicious sounding desert crepes. I will be back for those!

vhNubj_QW8jD0eVpJLgg_Q.text: It's very simple - crepes are an art form, and these guys are consummate artists....  Whether for breakfast, lunch of dinner you can't go wrong here.   Not only great staff and great food, but you get to leave sticky finger prints on the window of the exotic car dealership next door - Ferraris and crepes - is this what heaven looks like??  John.

rhXZlvGKp4qmb7c1OPFXDQ.text: Ok... As you can see, we are diggin the crepe genre.  Found this on Yelp and needless to say, we were not disappointed.  This is a new take on crepe's than we are used to.  You really can't go wrong at this place.  One important note, the staff was very friendly and personal.

Vd_eO3x37IDBgJlgfnWBPA.text: I love this place! The Monkey is my favorite "sweet" dish. Who wouldn't want nutella, chocolate, and bananas wrapped together with fluffy dough shaped with love?! This place has a great "neighborhood coffee shop" feel. This has definitely been a great addition to the community and I urge everyone to try it atleast once!

YCftxmqkl2pPLCVNyB28ZQ.text: I think the crepes are delicious. They have the best recipes. The service is incredibly friendly, and they have a wide selection of drinks which is always a plus.  If you're craving a satisfying dessert in a relaxing atmosphere, go there.

t2pfi9liClLbQfnyqGDtlQ.text: I made my husband drive me for miles just to get here. I was not disappointed. He had the crepe that tasted like pizza. It was good. I had the Caprese and the monkey.

erGInsvwqhh85FfGo8t3ug.text: We love Crepe Expectations. You get the same staff almost every time and every one goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable. And the crepes - the crepes are nothing short of amazing. We love it and our kids love it.  Plus, if you go on Saturday morning you get the added view of the car show!

zmx1Qrt_SzkAxJMM-B_zhw.text: Been here a couple times and I have to say the dessert crepes are great! My favorite is the one w pear and goat cheese, perfect savory and sweet combination. I had the crepe with the Chorizo once and it was not good at all, tasted like hamburger meat. Stick with the dessert crepes! One more star off because the guy that took our order was a bit of a smart a$$ when we had some questions about the menu.

ahF5PzyVNj7Kc3UhDidcxg.text: Cute little place but space is limited and the crepes are delicious.

HTu0Np5-uaptP-81fF1Qsw.text: Crepe expectations is absolutely fabulous!! The crepes are phenomenal.... And the mimosas!! Lou is so friendly, and you can tell he sincerely cares about your experience, service, and quality of the crepes! I have never once written a review of any venue, and it was because of crepe expectations I am writing this review :). Hats off to you Lou and crepe expectations!!

buu6gjy8BOAMPUquSYYaWQ.text: Awesome place! Sweet or Savory crepes of different variety. The Sonora (carne asada steak, tomato salsa, guacamole, jack cheese) or Marco Polo (italian sausage, eggs, jack cheese) are my faves-- for now ;-) but i'm sure all of them will make my list. Nice atmosphere and great staff...and since this place is so great, it WILL get crowded at times, but they wont take your order until there is a seat for you. I just wished they opened earlier so i can enjoy them sooner! Hahaha

iSzZInt9py9d1tjBTKkSRg.text: Delish! Charming! Friendly people...what's not to like?! Go here! You won't be disappointed!

GybzzQBRKMQq7vo31oZQjQ.text: This has been a spot we have been meaning to try for several months. We decided to go ob a Monday as Sunday's are very busy. When we walked in I was surprised as to how small the inside was. There are several seats outside and fortunately its west facing so morning sun would not be an issue. I had the Charizo Crepe. I was surprised of how full the packed this full of Charizo and eggs and cheese. I personally am not a crepe person but these were quite delicious. My have  made a new fan. Ones I have had in past lacked flavor and were doughy. These were thin and had great flavor. Service was quick. I wish they had fountain drinks as I wanted soda with my meal and its a one 12 ounce can serving. It would be great if one day they could expand so more people could enjoy at one time. Best way I suppose is to get food to go and take home and relax after a very filling Crepe. I will go again, and I recommend If you have not tried it to go and do so.

sNL0HcQdNP4zi5CVfjJJQQ.text: I found this spot on yelp. Me and my wife went there for breakfast. I couldn't believe how busy they were. It lived up to the 5-star reviews. Met and talked to the owner (very nice guy). Crepes are incredible. A little bit of a drive but well worth it. Will be back.

2fC8voYJqysY24lCRqQN2w.text: We have been here several times and the food is always delicious! Everyone there is always so friendly and amazing!! Definitely continue to go back!

K23xBiYm6o1l5OKJXpskSw.text: I found this place while shopping at the Farmers Market. It was Sunday and there was a line out the door so I didn't get a chance to eat that day. But I told my husband about it and we returned for a late lunch on Monday. The service was very friendly and personable, the food was great with lots of healthy choices...although I was bummed they had run out of bananas because the Banana foster crepe looked awesome...I guess that's what happens when you eat at the end of the day...We both ordered the Greek which was very filling and delicious and I believe they make their own hummus.You can also bring your dogs if you sit outside which is always a big bonus for us! The prices are also very reasonable. We will be back for sure!!
